+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Aura of Misfortune.name: 厄运灵光 Aura of Misfortune
Aura of Misfortune.description:
20尺。

灵光范围内所有活着的生物在所有基于d20的掷骰中必须掷骰两次，并且取较低的结果。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QoneHsjZKtGHWlam]{效果：厄运灵光}

Lurking Death.name: 暗藏杀机 Lurking Death
Lurking Death.description:
触发 一个100尺内的生物进行一次远程攻击，或进行一个带有专注、操作、移动特征的动作

效果 收割者死神传送到触发目标相邻的空间，然后对其进行一次近战打击。如果打击命中，收割者死神打断该触发动作。

Void Healing.name: 虚能治疗 Void Healing
Void Healing.description:
收割者死神可以选择是否受到命能伤害。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.NegativeHealing]

Death Strike.name: 死亡打击 Death Strike
Death Strike.description: 当一个生物遭受收割者死神任意攻击造成的重击，或对抗其法术的豁免骰大失败时，目标必须成功通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:47]豁免否则死亡。

Energy Drain.name: 能量吸取 Energy Drain
Energy Drain.description: 当收割者死神以巨镰命中目标并造成伤害，它恢复20生命值，并且目标必须通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:43]检定否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}状态。如果目标已经陷入毁灭，则毁灭的状态值增加1（最大达到@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 3}）。

Final Death.name: 最终死亡 Final Death
Final Death.description: 被收割者死神杀死的生物，除非有神力干预，否则无法通过任何手段复活。

Infuse Weapon.name: 灌注武器 Infuse Weapon
Infuse Weapon.description:
收割者死神所持用的任何巨镰都获得灵巧特性，并且无法被卸武，自动成为+3上等强击锐锋巨镰。

如果被收割者死神打击的生物拥有针对特定伤害类型的弱点，则其巨镰除了挥砍之外还视作具有该种特定的伤害类型。

Death's Grace.name: 死亡恩赐 Death's Grace
Death's Grace.description: 对于判断是否属于不死生物而产生区别的效果，收割者死神可自由选择是否作为不死生物接受。即便收割者死神不将自身视为不死生物，它亦无法被视为活物。

Status Sight.name: 状态视觉 Status Sight
Status Sight.description: 收割者死神能自动知晓视线所及的所有生物的HP、状态、苦难以及情绪。

Grim Reaper.name: 收割者死神 Grim Reaper
Grim Reaper.publicNotes:
收割者死神坚定不移的死亡化身。它沉寂如坟墓，如同时间本身一样无可避免，这个传说中的存在追捕并杀死那些逃避死亡太久的生物。有时候收割者死神会毫无预兆地降临，完成那些其他生物无法完成的任务。收割者死神不侍奉神祇，魔族（fiend），御衡者（aeon），或异界存在。招魂者（psychopomps）和天族（celestials）们既鄙视又畏惧它，但很少有人敢于阻挡它的道路。它就像某种永恒的瘟疫，杀死那些试图消除多元宇宙中它的存在的人。收割者死神绝世独立，秉持自己下达的判决。一旦收割者死神选择好的猎物，无论凡人或不朽者的恳求和辩解它都充耳不闻。它的动机从未为人所知，但无论出于何种目的，其结果都是不可动摇、无法改变的。

虽然传说认为收割者死神会在每个人死的时候出现在他们面前，但真相其实有些出入。执行这种守夜其实是招魂者的职责范围，它们是不朽的存在，负责保护和引导死后凡人的灵魂前往来世。收割者死神只是在推行天启骑士（Apocalypse Riders）所统治的末日荒原（Abaddon）的邪恶议程。的确，收割者死神和死亡骑士卡戎（Charon, the Rider of Death）之间有许多相似之处，但没有任何证据表明这两个实体合作过。相反，冷酷的死神本身就是末日荒原的具现，这方面被一些人认为是神秘的原初骑士（First Rider）的化身。当收割者死神降临到某个世界时，它并非作为仁慈的天使，而是作为一个无情的生命收割机而存在。那些落入收割者死神手中的生物不一定是注定该死的，他们也一视同仁地被选择、被追猎、被谋杀。

也许那些关于死神的传说中，最让人不寒而栗的是它作为一个唯一实体的本质。因为有些人不相信只有唯一的死神存在于世。谣传有至少九名收割者死神组成的一个议会，他们在现实中潜行，屠杀生灵，为真实之熵效力。根据一些死亡邪教的教义，收割者死神的最终目标是结束整个生死循环，成为空虚宇宙静默的主宰。
Grim Reaper.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Dragon Turtle.publicNotes:
这种巨大的水生龙类有着类似于乌龟的岩石外壳，鳍肢强大到足以打翻坚固的船只。它们被航海者当做与风暴或自然灾害同样等级的威胁来对待，而这些可怕的生物非常享受这一点。龙龟喜欢聚财，大多数龙龟更喜欢接受路过的水手的贡品，并经常把那些不愿交出贵重物品的船只的残骸当做自己的藏宝室。龙龟是独居动物，在方圆一百多平方英里的海域捕食。虽然它们通常以大鱼为食，但它们也是杂食性动物，也吃海藻，甚至包括鲁莽的猎龙者。有经验的水手会密切关注着龙龟，一旦有龙龟接近就准备船底抹油，或用时刻准备用船上的财宝来换取一线生机。

大多数龙龟至少20尺宽，50尺长，但是有些可以长到更大体型。这些巨大的古代龙龟是嗜睡的，从远处看就像一座岩石岛礁；它们惊人的储备可能是真正古代海洋知识的来源。传说坚称，有些真正巨大的龙龟一直漂流在海面上长达数个世纪之久，它远离航道或已探明的水域，它背上的壳作为岛屿能够支持整个生态系统，甚至有传言称，有的小型定居点里的居民压根就不知道自己脚下的陆地正在漂洋过海。

Shell Block.name: 龟壳格挡 Shell Block
Shell Block.description:
触发 一个与龙龟相邻的生物以龙龟作为近战攻击目标。

效果 龙龟将龟壳转向触发的生物，对触发的这次攻击，在AC上获得+2环境加值。

Capsize.name: 倾覆 Capsize
Capsize.description: 龙龟尝试让一艘相邻的、体型等于它或小于它的船只倾覆。龙龟必须尝试一次@Check[type:athletics|dc:30]检定（目标体型每比龙龟少一阶，则DC-5），或对抗驾驶员的航海学识（Sailing Lore）DC，二者以较高的为准。

Conjure Storm.description: 龙龟召唤强大的风暴围绕自身。龙龟@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围对其他飞行生物和游泳生物来说变成困难地形。龙龟能再次使用此动作来结束风暴。
Conjure Storm.name: 召唤风暴 Conjure Storm

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙龟以任意顺序进行2次尖爪打击和1次颚咬打击。

Tsunami.name: 海啸 Tsunami
Tsunami.description:
龙龟释放毁灭力量创造一道不断升高的巨浪，对@Template[type:cone|distance:60]范围造成@Damage[7d6[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true]豁免）。对于30尺之外的敌人，巨浪伤害增加10点。豁免失败的生物会被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

龙龟在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Tsunami]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用海啸。

Dragon Turtle.name: 龙龟 Dragon Turtle

Cuckoo Hag.name: Cuckoo Hag
Cuckoo Hag.publicNotes:
Cuckoo hags seek out youths who are unhappy with their lives, disguising themselves as a trusted figure such as a friend or family member. These hags then weave magical, idealized worlds out of illusions and dream stuff to trap their victims. Once they convince a mortal to stay in their magical world forever, the cuckoo hag drains their prey of life force and imprisons their soul.

A cuckoo hag's true form is a creature with the cracked pale skin of a broken porcelain doll and an almost impossibly thin neck and limbs.

Hags are malevolent predators who use magic and manipulation to lure children and young adults into their clutches. Though their true forms are eldritch and horrifying, hags spend much of their lives disguised as ordinary women. They seek out targets who are unhappy, innocent, or otherwise vulnerable, preying on their weaknesses before snatching them up. The typical hag is abusive, controlling, and narcissistic. Though less malicious hags possibly exist, they rarely reveal their true forms, making them nearly impossible to find.
Cuckoo Hag.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description:
A cuckoo hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}, and scrying to their coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Sound Imitation.name: Sound Imitation
Sound Imitation.description: A cuckoo hag who succeeds at a Deception check to Lie can mimic the sound of any feminine voice they have heard (in cases where this may be unclear, the GM is the final arbiter) and have a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

Change Shape.description:
The cuckoo hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Cuckoo’s Lair.description:
A cuckoo hag is intrinsically connected to a pocket dimension that serves as their home domain. The lair is an extradimensional space that is 40 feet wide, 40 feet deep, and 30 feet tall. It contains whatever mundane food, buildings, landscapes, and objects that the cuckoo hag desires, though anything removed from the cuckoo's lair dissolves into nothingness instantly.

In order to enter or leave the plane, the cuckoo hag must create a door in the physical world as a single action, which has the concentrate and manipulate traits. The door is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} by default, though the cuckoo hag can choose a target creature that can perceive the door normally. The cuckoo hag can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AjLSHZSWQ90exdLo]{Dismiss} this door from reality, but only if they (and no other creature) are inside of their lair and alone.
Cuckoo’s Lair.name: Cuckoo’s Lair

Soul Covenant.name: Soul Covenant
Soul Covenant.description:
Requirements The cuckoo hag can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul} at will, but only to target a creature who has agreed to stay with them forever. They typically do so as soon as the agreement is made but might hold off to gain leverage over a situation.

They typically place the soul into a construct, typically a soulbound doll if they want a companion or a more powerful construct if they want a guardian.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Ort.name: Ort
Ort.publicNotes:
These shapeless masses of quivering flesh are the least of devilkind. Pathetic creatures from Hell's first layer, orts roam alongside damned and suffering souls. Nessaris can combine the essence of a mob of orts to concentrate their collective wickedness within a single form, granting it an infernal sentience and transforming it into a more powerful devil (see the nessari's Shape Devils ability).

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks.

Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly orts perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as infantry and contract devils, while the greatest nessaris command entire infernal armies.

Asmodeus stands at the apex of the structure he created, but the layers below him are marked by a constant jockeying for position. Most diabolic plans ultimately serve to improve the schemer's place in the hierarchy.

Subservience.description:
Orts have little drive of their own, but other devils can take command of them. A non-ort devil can issue a command to all orts within 60 feet of it with a single action, which has the auditory and concentrate traits. The devil picks one of the following orders orts can understand, and the orts follow that order. The command and its effects end once the commander is out of the ort's sight, when a new command is issued by the same or another devil, or when the ort dies.

  • Kill The ort attacks one target the commander singles out and gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls against the target.
  • Defend The ort circles the commander and attacks any creature that comes near. It gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saves.
  • Fetch The ort gains a +10–foot circumstance bonus to its Speed and attempts to get an object or person the commander singles out. It attacks anyone and anything that gets in the way.
  • Work The ort performs drudge work dictated by the commander.
Subservience.name: Subservience

Devour All.name: 吞噬天地 Devour All
Devour All.description: 虫群蚕食其下方的土地。虫群行走。其移动过程中占据过的所有方格都变成困难地形。其移动穿越过的任何生物都必须成功通过一次@Check[type:reflex|dc:21]豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

Maddening Gibbers.name: 至狂急调 Maddening Gibbers
Maddening Gibbers.description:
随着虫群唱出外层裂隙那无尽的合唱，虫群空间内每个处于呆滞状态的生物必须尝试一次@Check[type:will|dc:21]豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响，且临时免疫至狂急调1分钟。

成功 目标不受影响，且免疫至狂急调1轮。

失败 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]状态，持续1轮。

大失败 目标陷入困惑状态，持续1轮，且因此法陷入困惑期间不能指定恶魔为目标。

Ravenous Bites.name: 肆虐撕咬 Ravenous Bites
Ravenous Bites.description: 虫群空间内每个敌人受到@Damage[3d6[piercing]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true]豁免）。豁免失败的敌人还将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，持续1轮。

Vescavor Swarm.name: 饕餮虫群 Vescavor Swarm
Vescavor Swarm.publicNotes:
最常见且数量众多的饕餮虫都是狂暴的虫群。许多人认为，如果放任不管，一旦附近的一切都被吃光，它们最终会把自己也吃掉。比它们的饥饿更令人讨厌的是它们的歌声。虽然一开始听起来像胡言乱语，但一旦被咬，这种歌声就会让人们陷入混乱。

这些贪吃的绿色害虫从外层裂隙（Outer Rifts）出发，无休止地寻找食物。一路上，这些刺鼻的黄蜂吞噬着眼前的一切。甚至连地面本身也不能幸免。虽然单只饕餮虫不成问题，但它们会成群结队，压倒任何试图阻止它们的东西。在真正不幸的情况下，几支虫群会聚集在一起，并由一个虫后领导。这些虫后不但自身很可怕，还能让它们的子嗣陷入前所未有的狂暴进食状态。没有虫后的虫群会失去方向感，它们会肆意破坏周围的一切。

每当饕餮虫群在进食时，就会唱着来自魔族的黑暗世界那令人头痛的歌曲。它们发出的叫声与其家园位面的嘶吼丛林相适应，迷惑并腐蚀着凡人。

思考外层裂隙的哲学家们经常会猜测是怎样的灵魂形成了饕餮虫。昆虫的灵魂被送到外层裂隙的说法常常被人嘲笑，但从未被完全否定。有些人认为它们是暴食的恶魔，简单明了。一些关于饕餮虫起源的更有创意的解释认为，所有被进攻的恶魔吞噬的灵魂碎片都凝聚成了这些无穷无尽的虫群。这种解释可以说明为什么这些无休止进食的恶魔在数量上似乎也是无穷无尽的。

Goblin Pyro.name: 地精纵火手 Goblin Pyro
Goblin Pyro.publicNotes:
一些地精将他们对火的崇拜带到了走火入魔的地步。这些纵火狂对于一群渴望点燃敌人并且造成破坏的地精突袭者来说是一个巨大的福音。然而，在更多时候，他们的存在都是一把双刃剑；在最燃的时刻，地精纵火手有时会忘记他们部族的目标，然后单纯地把所有能烧的东西都点着——包括他们自己的盟友。地精的队伍很容易分神，队员忙着围观大火导致了多次地精袭击的惨败。

这些小型类人生物通常有着绿色或是灰色的皮肤，大大的脑袋和宽大的耳朵。虽然有那么一些地精是文明的，并且努力成为类人生物社群中正直的一员，但有许多地精依旧还是鲁莽而又邪恶的生物，以制造破坏为乐。这些地精纯粹只是为了片刻的欢乐而屠杀牲畜、盗窃、或是烧毁建筑。他们沉迷于对那些被他们成为“长腿”——也就是那些比他们更高的类人生物——耍一些恶劣的把戏。

地精很迷信，对魔法有着强烈的敬畏，对火焰有着异乎寻常的迷恋；精通魔法或者火焰的地精会得到他们部族的尊敬。大多数其他类人生物都很难理解地精的观点：他们讨厌犬科动物却又热衷于和所谓的“地精犬”分享他们的巢穴，他们会无畏地攻击大型生物却又害怕马匹，他们鄙视蔬菜却又将腌菜作为美味佳肴。当然，对于一只地精而言，这些全都是极为明智的人生抉择。

Goblin Scuttle.description:
触发 一个地精盟友在与该地精相邻的位置结束其移动动作。

效果 该地精@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{快步 Steps}。
Goblin Scuttle.name: 地精小跑 Goblin Scuttle

Halfling Troublemaker.name: Halfling Troublemaker
Halfling Troublemaker.publicNotes:
A halfling's bravado can sometimes lead them into trouble. These tricksters often roam in groups trying to one-up each other's last prank. While troublemakers rarely intend to kill, occasionally their pranks get out of hand.

Despite their small stature, a halfling can prove to be a mighty foe if you find yourself on the wrong side of their frying pan.

Graffiti Egg.name: Graffiti Egg
Graffiti Egg.description: The halfling troublemaker throws an egg filled with paint, glitter, and confetti at a creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed a @Check[type:reflex|dc:17] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round (or 1 minute on a critical failure).

Keen Eyes.name: Keen Eyes
Keen Eyes.description:
The halfling gains a +2 circumstance bonus when using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to find @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or undetected creatures within 30 feet of it.

Whenever the halfling targets a creature that is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or hidden from them, reduce the DC of the flat check to 3 for a concealed target or 9 for a hidden one.

Sneak Attack.description: The troublemaker deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

Jinkin.name: Jinkin
Jinkin.publicNotes:
Jinkins are sadistic tinkers who steal and sabotage items and take great pride in their power to curse precious objects. They hold grudges and create convoluted plans for revenge when they feel slighted, such as when a creature dares to remove one of their curses. Rarely content to wreak simple mayhem, jinkins also take immense pleasure in torture and murder, though they prefer to lead victims into traps designed to capture or incapacitate rather than just kill them outright. Deep pits are a preferred method, since victims who survive their fall face a slow death from starvation and thirst while jinkins gather at the edge of pits to tease and torment them.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life in the Universe, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. Nearly all gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the slightest, carefully targeted nudge from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom stronger gremlins derisively call "baggies."

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The jinkin deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Tinker.name: Tinker
Tinker.description: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (@Check[type:flat|dc:5] check or waste any action to Interact with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.

Iron Hag.name: Iron Hag
Iron Hag.publicNotes:
Iron hags are kidnappers, targeting those too young to even remember to fight back. They most often snatch babies from their cradles, though they sometimes target fearful children or youths who suffer from anxiety. They then imprison their new wards in towers or enchanted dungeons, terrifying their victims with stories of the outside world to discourage them from even trying to escape. If these methods fail to be effective, iron hags become more straightforward in their methods of imprisonment, insisting it's for their captives' own good.

An iron hag's true form has unnaturally long arms. True to their name, they have teeth made of iron, as well as long iron toenails and claws.

Hags are malevolent predators who use magic and manipulation to lure children and young adults into their clutches. Though their true forms are eldritch and horrifying, hags spend much of their lives disguised as ordinary women. They seek out targets who are unhappy, innocent, or otherwise vulnerable, preying on their weaknesses before snatching them up. The typical hag is abusive, controlling, and narcissistic. Though less malicious hags possibly exist, they rarely reveal their true forms, making them nearly impossible to find.

Coven.description:
An iron hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.oXeEbcUdgJGWHGEJ]{Impaling Spike}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Spellwrack} to their coven's spells. Their spell DC when leading a coven is 24.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]
Coven.name: Coven

Bonds of Iron.name: Bonds of Iron
Bonds of Iron.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The hag causes a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring out of nothingness around one creature within 30 feet, attempting an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude|traits:action:grapple] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, the iron hag gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check.

On a success, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the magical fingernails (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} on a critical success). If the creature successfully [[/act escape dc=24]]{Escapes (DC 24)}, the cage crumbles into rust.

Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it. It has an AC of 19, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points.

Change Shape.description:
The iron hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Embrace of Iron.description:
Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the iron hag's claw

Effect The hag's nails tear into their captured victim, dealing @Damage[2d8[piercing]|traits:cold-iron] damage (the nails are cold iron). Then the hag can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition} the creature. If the creature is adjacent to the hag, they can then attempt a jaws Strike against it.
Embrace of Iron.name: Embrace of Iron

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Iron Hag.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Rhinoceros.name: 犀牛 Rhinoceros
Rhinoceros.publicNotes:
犀牛脾气暴躁，有地盘意识，很容易受到惊吓，这些特征加上凶猛的天性意味着它们受到骚扰时会本能地进行反击。当入侵者打扰或惊动犀牛时，它们的反应是直接冲向入侵者，然后用它们强大的角猛力突击。

这种身形巨大的动物很容易就能通过鼻子上独特的角来辨认。犀牛是食草动物，尽管体型庞大，但奔跑速度相当快。犀牛有良好的听觉和敏锐的嗅觉，但视力相对较差。

Rhinoceros Charge.name: 犀牛冲锋 Rhinoceros Charge
Rhinoceros Charge.description: 犀牛行走两次，然后进行一次犀角打击。只要犀牛移动至少20尺，打击的伤害增加到@Damage[(3d8+6)[piercing]] 。被此攻击击中的中型或更小体型的生物必须通过@Check[type:reflex|dc:21]豁免，否则自动被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]后退5尺，并因为这一击的力量陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

Larval Ofalth.name: 残渣怪幼虫 Larval Ofalth
Larval Ofalth.publicNotes:
残渣怪无性生殖。残渣怪幼虫刚从皮质的卵中孵化出来时，就像一团由细长的腿支撑的肉卷， 但它们很快就会在垃圾中结茧，将其作为护甲和伪装。

在城堡粪堆、城市垃圾场和下水道中发现的残渣怪是活的湿垃圾、污水和垃圾的混合物。它们携带一种名为悲恸脓血症的疾病，能导致受害者的血液从毛孔中渗出。

Hide in Filth.description: 残渣怪幼虫可以躲藏在任何不小于其体型的污物或垃圾中，允许它使用隐秘掷骰先攻。如果它以隐秘掷骰先攻，在战斗的第一轮内，还没有行动的生物对它视作@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。
Hide in Filth.name: 隐于污秽 Hide in Filth

Wretched Weeps.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

阶段1 携带疾病但无效果 (1天)

阶段2 @Damage[2d4[bleed]]每小时且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1} (1天)

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[bleed]]每小时且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2} (1天)
Wretched Weeps.name: 悲恸脓血症 Wretched Weeps

Warsworn.name: 战殁巨虫 Warsworn
Warsworn.publicNotes: 战殁巨虫是由数十有时候甚至数百具战斗牺牲者所组成的活化尸群。它们由司掌不死或战争领域的神祇创造，或者在某些罕见的情况下，由某场特别血腥残酷的战争所造成的毁灭中自发诞生。
Warsworn.allSaves: 对抗命能的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality.name: 对抗命能的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

Absorb.name: 吸收 Absorb
Absorb.description:
触发 战殁巨虫移动进一个濒死生物占据的空间

效果 战殁巨虫把濒死的生物吸收进自己体内，立即杀死该生物并且自身回复等同于生物等级的HP。只要战殁巨虫一直存活，被吸收的生物就无法复活，除非使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]或类似的强大的效果。

Animated Weapons.description:
100尺

战殁巨虫自动控制灵光范围内的无主武器，迫使它们漂浮在战殁巨虫周围。战殁巨虫可以用念动持用这些武器以100尺触及范围进行近战打击。这些打击造成四个武器伤害骰+9，并使用武器的伤害类型。
Animated Weapons.name: 活化武器 Animated Weapons

Energy Drain.description: 当战殁巨虫以尸潮打击或践踏伤害一个生物，目标必须成功通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:35]检定，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}状态。如果目标豁免大成功，则24小时内对能量吸取能力临时免疫。
Energy Drain.name: 能量吸取 Energy Drain

Plummet.name: 骤然下落 Plummet
Plummet.description: 一个被战殁巨虫残骸球打击命中的生物必须通过@Check[type:reflex|dc:37]豁免。如果失败，目标@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]；如果目标是飞行生物，它坠落120尺，如果它坠落至地面，则受到坠落伤害并倒地。如果大失败，目标还会被压在一堆残骸下面（[[/act escape dc=37]]）。

Ghost Mage.name: Ghost Mage
Ghost Mage.publicNotes:
A wizard who died with work incomplete might become a ghost mage.

When some mortals die through tragic circumstances or without closure, their souls can linger and haunt a locale significant to them in life.

Site Bound.name: Site Bound
Site Bound.description: A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
Completing the ghost mage’s project allows it to move on to the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

Frightful Moan.name: Frightful Moan
Frightful Moan.description: The ghost laments its fate, forcing each living creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} to attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's frightful moan for 1 minute.

Telekinetic Assault.description: The ghost cries out in pain and anguish as small objects and debris fly about in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage, subject to a @Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true] save.
Telekinetic Assault.name: Telekinetic Assault

Woolly Rhinoceros.name: 披毛犀 Woolly Rhinoceros
Woolly Rhinoceros.publicNotes:
这些犀牛的体型比他们无毛的表亲更加高大。它们全身复盖着又厚又长的蓬松毛皮，头上长着巨大的新月形角。披毛犀生活在干旱的苔原和寒冷的冻原地区，每天大部分时间都在吃草以满足食物需求。

这种身形巨大的动物很容易就能通过鼻子上独特的角来辨认。犀牛是食草动物，尽管体型庞大，但奔跑速度相当快。犀牛有良好的听觉和敏锐的嗅觉，但视力相对较差。
Woolly Rhinoceros.allSaves: 对抗寒冷的豁免+2状态加值

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Cold.name: 对抗寒冷的豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Cold

Cold Adaptation.name: 寒冷适应 Cold Adaptation
Cold Adaptation.description: 披毛犀所遭受的寒冷环境效果的极端程度会下降一级。

Rhinoceros Charge.name: 犀牛冲锋 Rhinoceros Charge
Rhinoceros Charge.description: 披毛犀行走两次，然后进行一次犀角打击。只要披毛犀移动至少20尺，打击的伤害增加到@Damage[(3d12+6)[piercing]]。被此攻击击中的中型或更小体型的生物必须通过@Check[type:reflex|dc:24]豁免，否则自动被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]后退5尺，并因为这一击的力量陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

Vicharamuni.publicNotes:
Awakener nagas are benevolent and wise teachers of people and places. They seek to guide and nurture the world around them, sensing mortals or locales with potential supernatural significance. Once located, these nagas provide instruction and divine trials to forge their wards toward strength and to impart a deeper understanding of right and wrong. Though considered stern and intimidating taskmasters by their students, those taught by a vicharamuni often go on to become great heroes.

Awakener nagas are similarly attentive in guiding their young. Upon reaching adulthood, a naga is provided a final trial before being encouraged to depart the nest and seek out their own natural wonders or promising mortals. Sometimes generations of nagas might guard the same place or family line, passing the honor of such care from parent to child. In such cases, the parent nagas aim to have at least one of their children elect to stay behind and become the guardian of their ancestral ward, giving the parents peace of mind that the site they protect will continue to be guarded by their descendants.

Nagas are serpentine beings with magical powers and keen intellects. Physically, they resemble massive snakes, though they often wear jewelry and other ornaments that clearly separate them from their animal kin. Nagas use their innate magic and poisonous fangs to keep all but the most stalwart foes at bay. They keep their own counsel, viewing their cosmic role to be sacrosanct and beyond the understanding of outside scholars. Their unwillingness to explain themselves or entertain the suggestion of alliances has led to a long history of conflict with their neighbors, who read them as aloof, arrogant, or duplicitous.

Nagas often have a powerful sense of duty to their perceived role within the universe, even if this role leads them to violent or tragic ends. Many see them as harsh and stern due to their devotion, terrifying in their majesty yet possessed of an aura of transcendence.

Coils of Knowledge.name: Coils of Knowledge
Coils of Knowledge.description:
The naga's grip is more spiritual than physical. A creature hit by a vicharamuni's tail must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the tail until they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}, the naga releases them with an Interact action, or the naga dies.

A captive takes a –4 status penalty to Escape, but can choose to attempt an Occultism or Religion check to Escape instead of the usual options without taking this penalty

Vicharamuni Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:29]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[spirit]] (1 round)

Stage 2 3d6 spirit and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)
Vicharamuni Venom.name: Vicharamuni Venom

Spiritual Venom.name: Spiritual Venom
Spiritual Venom.description: A vicharamuni can choose to negate any damage that its venom does to a creature. In addition, the naga can cast any of its divine spells on a creature that is affected by its venom, regardless of range or line of effect.

Vicharamuni.name: Vicharamuni

Sprite.publicNotes:
Common sprites, sometimes called firefly sprites, are primeval guardians that latch onto a person, place, or object and defend it for their own inscrutable reasons. Their dispositions vary from kind to spiteful, but all sprites have a capricious streak. Being only about 9 inches tall, they are wary of animals that might hunt them, particularly house cats, and prefer flight to a fight. On the other hand, sprites are incredibly curious about all forms of magic and heedlessly gather around ley line nexuses or other places of power.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

Luminous Fire.description: A sprite naturally sheds light like a torch. The sprite can extinguish, rekindle, or change the color of this light by using an action with the concentrate trait. While this light is extinguished, the sprite's Strikes don't deal fire damage, and they can't use their luminous spark Strike.
Luminous Fire.name: Luminous Fire

Sprite.name: Sprite

Unicorn.name: 独角兽 Unicorn
Unicorn.publicNotes:
独角兽是优雅纯洁的象征，外表像一匹高贵而骄傲的马。他们一般通体纯白，但最著名的部分是从前额伸出的精致的独角。虽然独角兽常常作为自然荒野和圣地的保护者，但它们也因为所拥有的的独角而备受追捧，据说角里蕴含着强大的魔法力量。对许多人来说，仅仅为了要割断它的角而猎杀如此宏伟的生物的想法是完全应受谴责的。的确，失去角的独角兽是一幕令人遗憾的图景，很少有这样的独角兽能在野外继续存活下去。

独角兽几乎只存在于偏远的、未受污染的荒野地区。有时人们把独角兽与善良的神灵联系在一起，有时则与自然和精类联系在一起，独角兽总以他们的正义和高贵而为人所知。面对大多数类人生物的时候，独角兽都是小心翼翼的，很大程度上是因为偷猎者会猎取它们的角。尽管有一些传说，但独角兽同样有可能在所有性别的人身上发现纯洁。
Unicorn.allSaves: 对心灵的意志豁免+2加值

Animal Empathy.name: 荒野共情 Animal Empathy
Animal Empathy.description: 独角兽和自然界的生物之间存在一种纽带，使它能与之交流。独角兽能向动物提出问题、回答动物的问题、也可以对动物使用交涉技能。

+2 to Will Saves vs. Mental.name: 对心灵的意志豁免+2加值 +2 to Will Saves vs. Mental

Ghost Touch.name: 幽冥 Ghost Touch
Ghost Touch.description: 独角兽的打击带有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]性能符文效果。

Powerful Charge.name: 猛力冲锋 Powerful Charge
Powerful Charge.description: 独角兽用最多两倍速度进行直线行走，然后进行一次角打击。若独角兽移动至少20尺，则命中后能造成额外2d6伤害。

Giant Gecko.name: 巨壁虎 Giant Gecko
Giant Gecko.publicNotes:
这些和人类差不多大小的爬行动物有让人觉得不可思议的脚，能够紧紧抓住任何表面。巨壁虎通常温顺害羞，但当被逼急或保卫领地时，它们会变得好斗。这些大眼睛的蜥蜴生活在各种各样的栖息地，从雨林、沙漠到丘陵，甚至地下洞穴。他们大部分时间都待在树上或在岩石峭壁上，寻找小型猎物或躲避捕食者。巨壁虎的鳞片通常色彩鲜艳或装饰着复杂的图案，体长约8英尺，体重约120磅。

巨壁虎有时被体型较小的人形生物当作守卫或坐骑，因为它们温顺的天性使它们相对容易驯养和训练。巨壁虎高超的攀爬技能使得它们在位于地下或悬崖附近的社群中特别受欢迎，比如地精和狗头人。它们鲜艳的颜色也使它们成为上流社会中最受欢迎的异域宠物。

蜥蜴们外表和能力各异，但大多数都具有爬行动物的基本形状——长长的尾巴，多齿的嘴和四条腿。虽然有一些蜥蜴种类能够在短时间内用两条腿运动，但大多数都是严格意义上的四足动物。这里列举了大型蜥蜴中最常见和最著名的三个物种。

Uncanny Climber.name: 不可思议的攀爬者 Uncanny Climber
Uncanny Climber.description: 巨壁虎的脚能让它爬上任何表面，无论多么光滑或陡峭。如果巨壁虎在一次尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]的运动检定中丢出大失败，则只承受失败的结果。

Graveknight.publicNotes: Graveknights are undead warriors granted unlife by a cursed suit of armor.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, their armor rebuilds their body over the course of [[/br 1d10]] days—or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating their armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
Sacrilegious Aura.description:
30 feet.

When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+17 #Counteract]]{+17}.

Devastating Blast.name: Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description:
The graveknight unleashes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of energy. Creatures in the area take @Damage[11d6[cold]] with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true].

The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/br 1d4 #Rounds]] rounds.

Graveknight's Curse.name: Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour

Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:33] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't remove armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, –10-foot status penalty to Speeds, and can't remove armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

Phantom Mount.description:
HP 58; AC 27, Fort +17, Ref +15, Will +14

The graveknight summons a supernatural mount, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Marvelous Mount} heightened to a rank equal to half the graveknight's level. Unlike marvelous mount, the steed's AC and saving throw bonuses are all 4 lower than the graveknight's, and the steed has one-third the graveknight's Hit Points (rounded down).

If the steed is destroyed, the graveknight must wait 1 hour before using this ability again.
Phantom Mount.name: Phantom Mount

Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
Weapon Master.description: The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.

Graveknight.name: Graveknight

Succubus.publicNotes:
Succubi are manifestations of the sin of destructive lust, and they are the most attractive of all demons—as befits their role in seducing mortals to fall to sin. The concept of gender is fluid to a succubus, as they can adopt countless humanoid forms of any gender to aid in their goals. Most succubi have a feminine true form (incubi, which usually have a masculine true form, are a different kind of demon), but regardless of gender, a lust demon is supernaturally beautiful or handsome, but with curving horns, bat wings, sharp claws, and a sinuous tail.

When disguised as a mortal humanoid in the Universe, a succubus whispers into the ears of mortals, urging them to pursue their darkest and most destructive desires and pushing them into depravity, using magic only if persuasion fails. While mortals often fixate on succubi's application of sexual lust, these demons are can easily exploit lust for power, knowledge, fame, or any other desire as easily as more carnal appetites. Their ability to infiltrate societies makes them excellent spies, assassins, and political saboteurs as well. Ultimately, the succubus enjoys all means of upending mortal culture.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Rejection Vulnerability.name: Rejection Vulnerability
Rejection Vulnerability.description:
As succubi are beings of pure lust, creatures that reject their lust can metaphysically harm them. When a succubus fails a Diplomacy check to Embrace or Request, or when a creature succeeds at its save against a succubus's mental spell or ability, the succubus takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage.

For 1 hour after causing mental damage to a succubus in this way, a creature can deal @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage to the succubus with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} action incorporating its rejection.

Seductive Presence.name: Seductive Presence
Seductive Presence.description:
10 feet.

Any creature in the aura that could be sexually attracted to a succubus takes a –2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to oppose the succubus’s mental spells, Deception, and Diplomacy.

Change Shape.description:
The succubus can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Embrace.description: The succubus attempts to [[/act grapple skill=diplomacy]]{Grapple} a creature using their Diplomacy bonus instead of Athletics. If the creature is willing, the succubus automatically succeeds.
Embrace.name: Embrace

Passionate Kiss.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The succubus engages a creature they have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in an embrace or other act of passion to drain its vital essence.

The kiss makes the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} or increases its drained value by 1, to a maximum of 4. The creature takes @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and the succubus regains Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save or be affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} to submit to more actions of passion rather than trying to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.
Passionate Kiss.name: Passionate Kiss

Profane Gift.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The succubus gives a willing humanoid a profane gift. That creature gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, skill checks, and saving throws. As long as the gift persists, the succubus can communicate telepathically with the target at any distance, see through the creature's senses, and target the creature with suggestion through the telepathic link. In addition, the creature uses an outcome one degree of success worse than it rolls on saving throws against the succubus's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} spells.

A humanoid can't have more than one profane gift at a time, and a succubus can't grant more than one profane gift at a time. Removing the gift requires an atone ritual. The succubus can remove the gift as a free action to give the recipient a curse, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} with an unlimited duration.

A summoned succubus can't grant a profane gift.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.g5Yen1FhEMCzCJkv]{Effect: Profane Gift}
Profane Gift.name: Profane Gift

Succubus.name: Succubus
Succubus.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Thulgant.publicNotes:
Thulgants are powerful and intelligent qlippoths created from the cannibalistic feeding frenzies of augnagars. Although they spend most of their time hunting and battling demons for control of the Outer Rifts, thulgants amuse themselves with a variety of diversions, such as maintaining galleries of petrified mortals or building massive, hive-like lairs filled with enslaved minions. Each thulgant is a horrific tangle of limbs, with spiderlike legs, writhing tentacles emerging from the top of its head, and three scorpion-like stingers.

Long before the creatures known as demons came to be the dominant force in the Outer Rifts, qlippoth ruled the innumerable cracks of the Outer Sphere. These inimical creatures are a form of primordial and alien evil that predates mortal life, and most immortal life as well. Since the rise of mortal sin and the associated expansion of demonic life through the Outer Rifts, qlippoth have been driven to their deepest reaches, and they seethe with rancor at the loss of their realms. Yet, rather than directly oppose demons, qlippoth instead turn to the source—mortal sin—and wage an endless war to eradicate all creatures capable of sinful acts so that the demonic tide might be turned back. To ensure they do not bolster their foe's ranks, they enact horrific transformations on their targets, converting their victims into beings incapable of discerning right from wrong; this renders them unable to be judged by Pharasma's courts and thus incapable of becoming fiends. Most mortals consider the ministrations of a qlippoth to be far worse than any fate awaiting them in the afterlife.

Demon Hunter.description: The thulgant causes a demon within 30 feet to suffer the effect of its sinful vulnerability.
Demon Hunter.name: Demon Hunter

Mind-Rending Sting.name: Mind-Rending Sting
Mind-Rending Sting.description:
Requirements The thulgant hits the same enemy with two consecutive sting Strikes in the same round

Effect The thulgant deals @Damage[(3d12+17)[mental]] damage to the enemy. If the enemy is affected by thulgant venom, that poison gains the virulent trait.

Stunning Display.description:
The thulgant rises up on its twitching limbs and presents its numerous tentacles and stingers in a horrifying display of awfulness. Creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:40] save, after which they are temporarily immune to further Stunning Displays for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 4}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 8}.
Stunning Display.name: Stunning Display

Thulgant Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:40]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and the victim gains one of the following at random: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and the victim gains two of the following at random: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[9d6[poison]] damage and the victim gains all three of the following: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} (1 round)
Thulgant Venom.name: Thulgant Venom

Thulgant.name: Thulgant

Soulbound Doll (Careful).publicNotes:
缚魂娃娃是怪诞的人体模型或娃娃，被灌注了一小片已故凡人的灵魂。这些小小的构装体是由于各种各样的原因被创造出来的——比如说作为同伴或仆人——但是他们的自由意志意味着它们对于他们的创造者并非必然服从。法莱斯玛的信徒常常憎恶缚魂娃娃，认为这是对灵魂自然循环的扭曲，而墓穴女士的崇拜者乐意看到缚魂娃娃的破灭，而不考虑其行为，会将覆灭缚魂偶作为对伟大彼岸的重要服务。

在一系列缚魂构装体中，缚魂娃娃的制造是最简单的，这些构装体包括人形的缚魂人偶，强大的缚魂躯壳，和作为卫兵的缚魂兵马俑。用非自愿的活物创造娃娃是残忍的，非自愿的供体可以抵抗这个过程，通过一次意志检定来对抗创造者的手艺 DC，如果不能阻止灵魂供体的死亡，则会毁掉娃娃。如果某人生前同意使用，也可以用其灵魂制作娃娃。

冒险者遇到的缚魂娃娃通常都是某种守卫；尽管娃娃体型娇小，但灵魂碎片的力量让娃娃的拳头比旁人想象的更加危险。此外，鉴于娃娃的身材，灵魂碎片还能赋予娃娃一个威力巨大的法术。由于具有自主性和非凡的智慧，缚魂娃娃偶尔会被它们的制作者用作强大得多但无意识的构装体的管理者，使这些娃娃能够控制远远超出其自身能力的防御系统。

虽然缚魂娃娃包包含一名刚死不久的人的一小部分灵魂，但其实这不影响死者复活，或直接前往来世。这种灵魂提取的过程对活着的灵魂供体来说则是致命的。

灵魂碎片通常会注入一个镶嵌在娃娃胸部或脖子的灵魂聚焦宝石（硬度10）。灵魂碎片一般会保留原灵魂的强烈个性特征，但娃娃会从初始状态开始不断学习，这意味着它的性格和能力可以改变，可能会变得更像灵魂供体，也可能在自己的道路上越走越远。即使缚魂娃娃被摧毁，它的灵魂聚焦宝石也能保留娃娃的记忆。如果被摧毁的缚魂娃娃的灵魂聚焦宝石是完好的，那么它可以被一些精于缚魂操作的人重新放置到一个新娃娃的身体里，通过这种方法可以很有效的让缚魂娃娃重生。

Personality Fragments.name: 人格碎片 Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: 缚魂娃娃拥有一部分灵魂提供者的人格碎片，尽管它没有任何生前的记忆。这使得缚魂娃娃与供体灵魂的强烈个性特征相匹配。由于它的灵魂碎片，因此缚魂娃娃拥有无法像大多数构装体一样对精魂免疫。

Soulbound Doll (Careful).name: 缚魂娃娃（谨慎） Soulbound Doll (Careful)

Giant Ant.name: 巨蚁 Giant Ant
Giant Ant.publicNotes:
巨蚁勤劳的天性与常见的小蚂蚁非常相似，尽管马一般的体型让它们更加致命。

蚂蚁是勤劳的昆虫，是大自然进行生态循环的重要帮手。

Giant Ant Venom.name: 巨蚁毒 Giant Ant Venom
Giant Ant Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

最大持续时间 4轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d8[poison]]且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1} (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[1d10[poison]]且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2} (1轮)

阶段 3 @Damage[1d12[poison]]且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 3} (1轮)

Haul Away.description:
需求 巨蚁已经擒获一个大型或更小体型的生物

效果 巨蚁以满速度带着受擒的生物行走。如果生物是中型或大型，则它陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]。
Haul Away.name: 搬走 Haul Away

Giant Stag Beetle.publicNotes:
这种巨大的巨锹甲虫比马还大，而且看到它用巨大嗡嗡作响的翅膀飞行（虽然速度缓慢且有些笨拙）时会让人感到不安。它巨大的虫颚可以用来吸引配偶，恐吓对手，吓阻捕食者，因为这对颚可以进行致命攻击。虽然巨楸甲虫是致命的食肉动物，但是可以被有经验的牧人驯养。在这种情形之下，甲虫可以很好地充当驮兽甚至坐骑。

在沼泽、洞穴和茂密的森林中，巨楸甲虫则是一种严重威胁，不止一个伐木营地发生过巨楸甲虫攻击事件，不得不被彻底遗弃，最终所有的木材都被这些巨大的昆虫啃光了。

并不是所有的甲虫都是可以轻易被踩碎的无害生物。在世界各地的温带和热带地区，都可以发现硕大而贪婪的甲虫。它们通常是温和的生物，然而当受到威胁或被激怒时，这些巨型甲虫是相当危险的。它们有力的虫颚和坚硬的外壳让它们成为了具有挑战性的对手。
Giant Stag Beetle.name: 巨锹甲虫 Giant Stag Beetle

Vescavor Queen.name: 饕餮虫后 Vescavor Queen
Vescavor Queen.publicNotes:
饕餮虫后是一道可怕的景象。和她们的虫群一样，她们也像一只只刺鼻的绿色黄蜂，但腹部却异常臃肿，上面布满了渗酸的尖刺；她们的嘴巴占了脸部的大部分，上面长满了参差不齐的大牙，每颗都有人类手指那么大。她们只有一双手臂，每只手臂都有整个身体那么长，但却不正常地折叠起来，紧贴在一起，五对翅膀不自然地叠放在一起，任何自然生物都无法用这样的翅膀飞行。这些虫后确保虫群永不停歇地向有食物的地方进发。她们不仅会逐渐创造出饕餮虫群，而且还能让现有虫群的数量在一瞬间翻倍。这些得到强化的虫群还具有更强的生命力和更快的速度。此外，虫后的酸性唾液中含有信息素，能让她的虫群陷入狂暴，她会利用信息素将虫群引向优先目标。

一个强大的恶魔偶尔会捕获一只虫后，并利用她在受控环境中制造虫群。不过，这种做法很快就被放弃了。这些虫群可能会对其魔族主人的敌人造成伤害，但很少值得花费这么大的代价来饲养虫后和她那无穷无尽的虫群。即使只是把虫后关在一个地方也是既昂贵又困难的，因为只要有足够的时间，几乎不可能找到一个虫后吃不完的笼子。

这些贪吃的绿色害虫从外层裂隙（Outer Rifts）出发，无休止地寻找食物。一路上，这些刺鼻的黄蜂吞噬着眼前的一切。甚至连地面本身也不能幸免。虽然单只饕餮虫不成问题，但它们会成群结队，压倒任何试图阻止它们的东西。在真正不幸的情况下，几支虫群会聚集在一起，并由一个虫后领导。这些虫后不但自身很可怕，还能让它们的子嗣陷入前所未有的狂暴进食状态。没有虫后的虫群会失去方向感，它们会肆意破坏周围的一切。

每当饕餮虫群在进食时，就会唱着来自魔族的黑暗世界那令人头痛的歌曲。它们发出的叫声与其家园位面的嘶吼丛林相适应，迷惑并腐蚀着凡人。

思考外层裂隙的哲学家们经常会猜测是怎样的灵魂形成了饕餮虫。昆虫的灵魂被送到外层裂隙的说法常常被人嘲笑，但从未被完全否定。有些人认为它们是暴食的恶魔，简单明了。一些关于饕餮虫起源的更有创意的解释认为，所有被进攻的恶魔吞噬的灵魂碎片都凝聚成了这些无穷无尽的虫群。这种解释可以说明为什么这些无休止进食的恶魔在数量上似乎也是无穷无尽的。

Chaotic Spawning.name: 播种混乱 Chaotic Spawning
Chaotic Spawning.description: 饕餮虫后强化其虫群。100尺内所有饕餮虫群变为超大型，并获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]状态1分钟。饕餮虫群每轮只能使用此额外动作执行肆虐撕咬动作。

Feeding Time.name: 大啖之刻 Feeding Time
Feeding Time.description: 饕餮虫后使100尺内任意数量的饕餮虫群立即使用其反应动作来执行肆虐撕咬动作。

Opportune Snack.name: 借机加餐 Opportune Snack
Opportune Snack.description: 饕餮虫后拉拽被其@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]的生物到与其相邻的一个空间内，并以+2环境加值进行一次颚打击。

Rage Pheromones.name: 狂暴信息素 Rage Pheromones
Rage Pheromones.description: 如果饕餮虫后的唾液打击对某个生物造成伤害，则该生物在对抗饕餮虫群所引起的所有豁免骰上承受–2状态减值，持续1分钟。

Xoarian.name: 索尔人 Xoarian
Xoarian.publicNotes:
有五条触须的的索尔人渗透到许多社会中，但目前还不清楚它们的活动有多少是受到黑色支配者的指使，又有多少是为了自己变态的爱好。这些被格拉里昂学者称作驭尸者的存在，除了怀疑它们名为“索尔”（Xoar）的遥远星球外，人们对它们的来历知之甚少。

当索尔人渗透进一个聚落中时，它的首要任务是获得一具宿主的身体。它们通常会选择刚死不久的人作为宿主，因为谋杀活的宿主会引起不必要的注意。当异怪将自己挤进宿主的颅腔内，它就能把宿主的身体当做自己的一样移动。与此同时，它还能获得平时缺乏的各种复杂感官。

每具新的身体都回带来新的味道，声音，视野，甚至疼痛。当索尔人聚集在一起时，他们会努力提高自己的地位，品尝在低阶级时无法体验的经历。控制着尸的索尔人除了害怕被发现之外，几乎不会恐惧。对宿主的伤害只是另一种需要体验的感觉，而替代的身体也很容易找到。

黑色支配者是一个深空征服者的联合体，在格拉里昂恒星系最偏远的行星阿克腾（Aucturn）上拥有强大的势力。支配者的秘密前哨遍布整个格拉里昂；它们在这颗星球上大部分成员都是斥候，利用自己的技能来窃取大脑和身份，搜集情报，完全不顾及所有渗透世界的居民。

Stolen Identity.description: 当索尔人使用盗窃躯体，它获得理解与说出宿主知晓的所有语言的能力，同样包括宿主的能力，身份，社会地位，以及性格的知识。但是，它无法获得宿主尸体的特定记忆或知识。
Stolen Identity.name: 偷窃身份 Stolen Identity

Thoughtsense 60 feet.name: 心灵感应60尺 Thoughtsense 60 feet
Thoughtsense 60 feet.description: 索尔人能用所列范围的精确感官感知到生物的心灵要素；它不能用思维感知来感知到无心智的生物。

Body Thief.name: 盗窃躯体 Body Thief
Body Thief.description: 索尔人挤入一个生物的头部，吞噬并取代该生物的大脑。在索尔人下个回合开始时，尸体恢复到最大生命值，并被索尔人控制。索尔人可以意识和感知到被占据尸体所能感知的一切。任何能够结束占据的效果会杀死宿主尸体，与离开躯体具有相同效果。索尔人不能以盗窃躯体来使用宿主生物的法术但可以使用自己的内在法术。

Exit Body.name: 离开躯体 Exit Body
Exit Body.description:
需求 索尔人正使用盗窃躯体控制着一具尸体

效果 索尔人离开宿主尸体，尸体将立即死亡，且不再适合作为盗窃躯体能力的宿主。索尔人以完整体型出现在一个相邻空间中。

Ravage.name: 夺舍 Ravage
Ravage.description: 索尔人对一个处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]的生物进行两次触须打击。如果目标在被使用夺舍后减至0生命值，索尔人可以立即使用一个带有死亡特征的自由动作来杀死目标并用盗窃躯体占据它。

Phoenix.name: 凤凰 Phoenix
Phoenix.publicNotes:
凤凰是一种由热量和火焰构成的原初鸟类，居住在沙漠中最荒无人烟的地区。虽然凤凰具有极高的智慧且充满怜悯之心，但是它最为人所熟知的特性是死后从灰烬中浴火重生的能力。人们常常寻找凤凰，祈求它们的知识和治疗能力，因为凤凰往往不忍目睹痛苦的惨状，并且只会拒绝最肮脏和最不可救药的生物的求助。

凤凰喜欢与和平的巨龙为伴，当它们做邻居的时候能结下终生的友谊，分享它们的资源和智慧，让对方了解当地的最新情报。

虽然大部分凤凰都很仁慈，但它们并非不会犯错。当凤凰迷失了自己的道路时，它们依然保持着强烈的求知欲。恶毒的凤凰会为了追求力量攻击大学或图书馆——不仅是为了获取新信息，还会焚烧书籍，从而将知识据为己有。
Phoenix.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值
Phoenix.hp: 再生20（寒冷或邪秽使其无效），浴火重生

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Cold or.name: 再生20（寒冷或邪秽使其无效） Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Cold or Unholy)

Self-Resurrection.name: 浴火重生 Self-Resurrection
Self-Resurrection.description:
凤凰死亡时，它会崩解成一堆闷烧的灰烬，然后在[[/br 1d4 #Self-Resurrection Time]]{1d4轮}之后复活，完全恢复生命值，就如同受到7环级的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]仪式效果一样。只有在剩余一部分遗骸时，浴火重生才能生效。例如，被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]杀死的凤凰不能使用此能力复活。

如果凤凰的遗骸被放置在一片由@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dbd5W6G8U2vzWolN]献给邪神的区域中，则不能浴火重生，直到它的遗骸离开那个区域。凤凰每年只能浴火重生一次。

Shroud of Flame.name: 烈焰护身 Shroud of Flame
Shroud of Flame.description:
20尺。@Damage[4d6[fire]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true]豁免。

当此灵光启动时，一个相邻生物如果以近战攻击命中凤凰，或用其他方式接触凤凰则受到@Damage[2d6[fire]]伤害。凤凰能用一个具有专注特征的单动作启动或关闭此灵光。

Flaming Strafe.name: 炽焰飞掠 Flaming Strafe
Flaming Strafe.description: 凤凰周身燃起炽热的火焰，以至多其速度飞行。它移动穿过的每个方格周围20尺内的所有生物都会到@Damage[6d6[fire]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true]豁免）。

Empyreal Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
The three major celestial planes—Heaven, Nirvana, and Elysium—each have their own respective dragons. Empyreal dragons have a direct connection to Heaven. Using the blessings of Heaven, empyreal dragons protect others and intercede against wickedness. Empyreal dragons are wise, considerate, and compassionate. When speaking with others, empyreal dragons are patient and understanding.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Divine Deflection.name: Divine Deflection
Divine Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect Divine power intercedes, preventing some of the damage. The dragon gains resistance 10 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Inspiring Presence.description:
60 feet.

The mere sight of an empyreal dragon motivates other creatures. Creatures within the aura gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws and skill checks. The empyreal dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.
Inspiring Presence.name: Inspiring Presence

Direct Halo.name: Direct Halo
Direct Halo.description: The dragon tosses their halo to a square within 90 feet. While the halo is deployed in this way, the dragon loses their inspiring presence aura, and the aura instead emanates from the halo with the same emanation radius. The dragon can Sustain to recall the halo from any distance. The halo is made of pure light—it doesn't occupy space and can't be targeted or destroyed in any way.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Spirit Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Halo Pulse.description:
The dragon chooses one effect to impose on creatures in their inspiring presence aura.

The dragon can't use Halo Pulse again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Halo Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Repulsion Each creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41] save or be pushed until it's no longer in the aura.
  • Restoration (healing, vitality) Each creature recovers @Damage[9d8[healing]]{9d8 Hit Points}.
  • Restriction (incapacitation, mental) Creatures must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) while they remain within the aura. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to restriction for 1 minute.
Halo Pulse.name: Halo Pulse

Spirit Breath.name: Spirit Breath
Spirit Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of holy fire that deals @Damage[16d8[spirit]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:41|basic:true] save).

The dragon can't use Spirit Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Empyreal Dragon (Ancient).name: Empyreal Dragon (Ancient)
Empyreal Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Cockatrice.publicNotes:
可怕的鸡蛇兽丑陋而好斗，它们盘踞在垃圾场和山丘上的垃圾坑里寻找猎物，用他们能石化的喙把目标变成石头，然后一块块地吞食。鸡蛇兽像长着蝙蝠翅膀、蛇形尾巴的病态公鸡，它们很少能长到比2尺高、4尺长更大的体型。它们平时心不在焉的咯咯声能给与聪明的猎物足够的警告，但当它们愤怒时，会发出像公鸡一样的打鸣声。它们的喙含有一种魔法唾液，能让肉质迅速钙质化。被暴躁的鸡蛇兽反复啄过的生物最终都会变成石像。

据说第一只鸡蛇兽是一只蛤蟆在粪堆上孵公鸡蛋而变出来的。不管传说是否属实，鸡蛇兽畸形的外观倒是和它光怪陆离的起源传说相当吻合。鸡蛇兽繁殖能力非常强，一窝可能有一打数量。一群鸡蛇兽一般只有少数是雌性。雄性鸡蛇兽的外表与雌性很不相同，雄性有长满疣的垂肉和粗大的鸡冠。雄性鸡蛇兽常常互相争斗，落败的一方会被赶走，寻找自己的巢穴，或和其他族群竞争。大多数会和独居鸡蛇兽发生冲突的生物遭遇的都是些乖戾的弃儿中的一只。

鸡蛇兽的窝里通常散落着受害者的石雕碎片——尽管这可能是青蛙、蜥蜴和昆虫的残骸，也可能是人类的。奇怪的是，黄鼠狼和雪貂常常会潜入鸡蛇兽的巢穴偷他们的蛋，但它们却对这种可怕的啄伤免疫。出于未知的原因，鸡蛇兽对普通的公鸡既害怕又愤怒。当遇到公鸡时，它可能逃走也可能发起攻击。

特别勇敢（或者说有勇无谋）的人会把鸡蛇兽当做宠物或守卫。鸡蛇兽在平原、森林或人形生物殖民地的下水道中，以害虫和垃圾维生，但它们最喜欢的还是新鲜的肉食，例如刚被石化的生物的温暖肉体。

Calcification.name: 钙化 Calcification
Calcification.description:
鸡蛇兽的喙能把血肉变成石头。目标必须成功通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]检定否则@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}（大失败@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2}）。目标更多次对此能力豁免失败会累加缓慢状态的状态值。一旦目标生物的可用动作减少为0，则目标被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]。如果生物未被石化，那么在生物针对钙化豁免失败的1分钟之后，缓慢状态结束。

被石化之后每过24小时，受害者可以尝试通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]检定来恢复。一旦成功，解除石化状态，但是在接下来的24小时内获得缓慢1。如果大成功，则解除石化且不受缓慢。如果失败，则继续被石化，24小时之后再次进行尝试。如果大失败，则永久石化，被害者无法再尝试任何豁免。

Cockatrice.name: 鸡蛇兽 Cockatrice

Change Shape.description:
• Human
    • Melee fist +10 Damage 1d4+2 bludgeoning
  • Rat
    • Size small
    • Speed 30 feet, climb 10 feet

The werecreature changes into its humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true werecreature's natural form is its hybrid shape.

In humanoid shape, the werecreature uses its original humanoid size, loses its jaws and claws Strikes, and gains a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by its claw.

In animal shape, its Speed and size change to that of the animal, it gains any special Strike effects of the animal that it didn't already have (such as Grab), and it loses its weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Curse of the Wererat.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.
Curse of the Wererat.name: Curse of the Wererat

Moon Frenzy.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}
Moon Frenzy.name: Moon Frenzy

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The wererat deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Rat Empathy.name: Rat Empathy
Rat Empathy.description:
The wererat can communicate with rodents.

The werecreature can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals of its general kind.

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature targets the wererat with an attack and the wererat can see the attacker;

Effect The wererat gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Wererat.name: Wererat
Wererat.publicNotes:
Wererats tend to be selfishly opportunistic, avaricious, and paranoid as a result of their curse. Because wererats typically dwell in metropolitan areas where they can hide in plain sight, practically any city goer could be a wererat in disguise—from the quiet shopkeep to the city's criminal mastermind. The bustle of crowds and countless rat holes make ghettos and shantytowns favored homes for wererats, especially since in these poorer districts the wererat can kill out of greed or fear with little chance of the authorities noticing. In some cities, wererats operate entire thieves' guilds or organized crime rings, and membership requires willfully submitting to the wererat's cursed bite. Wererats look very similar to ratfolk when in hybrid form, apart from potential differences in size, but ratfolk have no love for wererats.

Werecreatures are humanoids doomed to transform into animals and animalhumanoid hybrids under the light of the full moon. These shapechanging creatures are the result of an ancient primal curse that they can, in turn, transmit through their own bites. Their ability to lurk unseen in the wilds as well as among people, combined with the contagiousness of their condition, makes werecreatures a perennial cause of panicked suspicion.

Ghoul Soldier.name: 食尸鬼士兵 Ghoul Soldier
Ghoul Soldier.publicNotes:
由于保留了生前的武艺，这些食尸鬼不惧正面迎敌，它们以陨落敌人的血肉为食，学习他们的战斗能力。

在孤独的墓地和破败的墓穴等阴森之地，没什么生物能比食尸鬼这种肉食性不死生物更常见的了。

Consume Flesh.name: 啃食尸体 Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
需求 食尸鬼与刚死亡1小时内的生物尸体相邻

效果 食尸鬼吞食一大块尸体并恢复[[/r 2d6[healing]]]生命值。

食尸鬼从每具尸体上只能获取1次生命值恢复。

Ghoul Whispers.name: 食尸鬼低语 Ghoul Whispers
Ghoul Whispers.description:
需求 一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]的生物正处于食尸鬼的触及内

效果 食尸鬼在生物耳畔低语着黑暗的念头与卑劣的渴望。该生物必须进行豁免来对抗禁忌渴望诅咒。

禁忌渴望 Forbidden Cravings (诅咒)

豁免骰 @Check[type:will|dc:18|traits:curse]

阶段1 携带诅咒但没有不良效果 (1天)

阶段2 @Damage[2d6[void]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}直至他吃下生肉 (1天)

阶段3 同阶段2

阶段4 同阶段2，除非该生物在过去24小时内吃过生肉，那样他会转而受到@Damage[4d6[void]]伤害且获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}直至他吃下生肉

阶段5 如果该生物在过去24小时内吃过生肉，他死亡并复活为食尸鬼，否则诅咒退回阶段4

Grave Knowledge.description:
[[/r 1d20+8]]{+8}技能调整值

频率 每小时一次

效果 食尸鬼调用过去7天内它吞食的一个生物所拥有的知识。食尸鬼使用那个被吃的生物受训的技能来进行一次技能检定（如果不确定该生物有哪些技能受训，则由GM决定）。此检定所需的动作或时间如常。

食尸鬼也可以选择自动得知它7天内吞食的一个生物所知道的特定信息，比如@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]藏宝地点或所爱之人的名字。不论食尸鬼吃下了多少肉，对一个生物也只能这么做一次。
Grave Knowledge.name: 坟墓知识 Grave Knowledge

Swift Leap.name: 迅捷跳跃 Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: 食尸鬼跳跃至多自身速度一半的距离。这次移动不会触发反应动作。

Air Scamp.publicNotes:
淡蓝色的头和纸一样薄的翅膀从依附在空中的云中探出头来。气魔蝠相对于他们的近亲更加反复无常且轻浮；它们可能盲目地飞进战场，也可能因为一声巨响而恐惧地哀鸣。

魔蝠是一种类似蝙蝠的生物，具有元素之力。魔蝠会被更强大的居民从元素位面驱逐出去，或者被新手召唤师召唤到物质宇宙。所有的魔蝠有魔法力量，因为他们与家乡位面有一种挥之不去的联系，它们主要用它来搞一些简单的恶作剧。

魔蝠迅速构成了智力导向的等级制度。当类人生物第一次遇到这种生物时，它们常常会让魔蝠感到困惑。这些困惑的魔蝠通常会采取一系列不断升级的恶作剧，看看这些类人生物能从哪种情境中逃脱，以便在等级制度中给他们安排合适的地位。

Fog Vision.description: 气魔蝠无视云和雾造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。
Fog Vision.name: 云雾视觉 Fog Vision

Fast Healing 2 (In Open Air).name: 快速治疗2（在开阔的空中） Fast Healing 2 (In Open Air)

Sirocco Breath.name: 热风吐息 Sirocco Breath
Sirocco Breath.description:
气魔蝠对@Template[type:cone|distance:15]范围吐出切割之风，对范围内所有生物造成@Damage[2d6[slashing]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true]豁免）。

气魔蝠在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Sirocco Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次进行热风吐息。

Air Scamp.name: 气魔蝠 Air Scamp
Air Scamp.hp: 快速治疗2（在开阔的空中）

Firewyrm.publicNotes:
Firewyrms live in tubes of molten lava found throughout the Plane of Fire. These strange environments often connect to volcanoes on mortal worlds, giving firewyrms access to a wide variety of prey.

Fire elementals are destructive manifestations of the scorching Plane of Fire. Although most fire elementals revel in the chance to experience new kinds of fires away from their home plane, even the most considerate fire elemental can be a danger to humanoids and their property.

Breath Fire.name: Breath Fire
Breath Fire.description:
The firewyrm breathes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of fire dealing @Damage[7d6[fire],2d8[persistent,fire]] damage to every creature within the cone (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

The firewyrm can't Breathe Fire again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Fire]]{1d4 rounds}.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The firewyrm ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Explosion.name: Explosion
Explosion.description: When the firewyrm dies, it explodes, dealing @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage to each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10|traits:fire,damaging-effect] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

Firewyrm.name: Firewyrm

Elemental Hurricane.publicNotes:
Elemental hurricanes embody the ferocity of violent windstorms.

Hailing from the Plane of Air, these beings appear in a variety of sizes and shapes. They're noted for being elusive, swift, and often difficult to detect due to being composed primarily of air.

Disperse.name: Disperse
Disperse.description:
Trigger The elemental hurricane takes damage from a hostile action.

Effect The elemental hurricane disperses.

Until the end of the current turn, it can't be attacked or targeted, doesn't take up space, and any auras or emanations it has are suppressed. At the end of the turn, the elemental hurricane reforms in any space in which it can fit within 100 feet of where it dispersed and any auras or emanations it has are restored as long as their duration didn't run out while it was dispersed.

Gale Breath.name: Gale Breath
Gale Breath.description:
The elemental exhales a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of air. Creatures in the cone must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save or be knocked away from the elemental.

A creature knocked into a solid object stops moving and takes @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage (roll the damage once for all creatures).

The elemental hurricane can't use Gale Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Gale Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is pushed 20 feet.

Failure The creature is pushed 40 feet.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed 40 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

High Winds.name: High Winds
High Winds.description:
40 feet.

Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures that don't have the air trait.

Elemental Hurricane.name: Elemental Hurricane

Basilisk.publicNotes:
蛇怪是性情恶劣，可以用凝视把生物变成石头的爬行动物。民间传说认为，蛇怪类似鸡蛇兽，是由公鸡孵化的蛇蛋里生出来的。但是蛇怪的生理学构造并不怎么能支持这种说法。

蛇怪喜欢吃被石化的肉体。一旦受害者变成石头，蛇怪便会用它强有力的下颚咬碎石化的尸体，然后用它强大的胃酸来完成剩下的工作。消化过程极其缓慢，效率极低，导致蛇怪动作迟缓，看起来像极了处于石化过程中的样子。这造就了一句谚语：“像吃饱的蛇怪一样慢。”当然蛇怪以其缓慢的移动和懒惰的天性而闻名，然而一个一瞪眼眼就把猎物变成石头的掠食者几乎不需要速度。

成年蛇怪从头到尾长13尺，重约300磅。这些爬行动物在走动时会发出嘶嘶的声音，当它们激动时就会变成喉咙的咕噜声。

虽然它们通常是独行生物，只有交配和产卵时才会群居，但有定期报告称，在某些地区聚集了大量的蛇怪。目前还不清楚是什么原因导致了这种不寻常的聚集行为。

由于未知的原因，黄鼠狼和雪貂对蛇怪的瞪视免疫，它们有时会在蛇怪捕猎时溜进巢穴，吃掉蛇怪的蛋或刚孵化出的幼崽。一些传说表明蛇怪的血可以把普通石头变成其他材料，但这可能是目击者误解了用蛇怪血让被石化的生物恢复肉身的过程。

Petrifying Glance.name: 石化瞥视 Petrifying Glance
Petrifying Glance.description:
30尺。

触发 一个蛇怪能看见的、位于蛇怪30尺范围内的生物开始它的回合

效果 该生物必须通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]豁免。如果失败，它的身体慢慢变硬，获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}效果，持续1分钟。

Petrifying Gaze.name: 石化凝视 Petrifying Gaze
Petrifying Gaze.description:
蛇怪瞪视它30尺内的一个能被它看见的生物。目标必须通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]检定，如果失败且没有被石化瞥视能力及本能力影响，则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。如果目标已经被石化瞥视或此能力影响过，则目标被永久石化。

通过这种方式被石化的生物，可以通过往表面涂满新鲜的蛇怪血（从死亡不超过1小时的蛇怪身体里提取）可以立即恢复肉身。一只蛇怪的血足够使[[/r 1d4 #中型生物]]只中型生物恢复肉身。

Basilisk.name: 蛇怪 Basilisk

Aapoph Granitescale.name: Aapoph Granitescale
Aapoph Granitescale.publicNotes:
The mutated aapophs dubbed granitescales have bulky frames covered in hard gray plates. These scales offer protection but shed when struck with too much force. Granitescales like to carve their shed scales into small chips and attach them as rattles to their spears.

Many an unsuspecting victim has heard the hiss of a granitescale's rattle too late.

Before their ancient clash with humanity devastated their civilization, serpentfolk were masters of a sprawling underground empire. Their power was shattered and their god Ydersius decapitated (although not quite slain). The cunning, intelligence, and magical abilities of serpentfolk have diminished from their ancient heights, and most are born without these boons. This is partially the result of cruel genetic meddling among serpentfolk—though the ruling class, zyss, are born with an innate spellcasting ability, their blood runs thin, making them susceptible to wounds. Seen as the failures of the serpentfolk's experiments are the aapophs, who are strong but prone to mutation and lack innate spellcasting.

Today, the central realm of the Darklands retains the old name of the serpentfolk empire that once dominated this region—Sekamina. This name is also the source of the serpentfolk's Aklo title, sekmin, which they are often called in ancient texts. Serpentfolk dominion had declined before ghouls, gugs, umbral gnomes, and other forces. Yet their recent ventures have brought them back to a stronger place in the Darklands. Many serpentfolk sleeping in torpor in secluded vaults have awakened.

Zyss serpentfolk tend toward megalomania, with dreams of returning to their place of dominance. Many of their plans hinge on resurrecting Ydersius, their decapitated god. His headless body still thrashes about, mindless, in the Darklands, waiting to be reunited with his lost skull. Serpentfolk numbers are so small that reclaiming their dominance seems a distant dream, especially since their reproduction is slow. Though a parent can birth a dozen young at once, the gestation period lasts up to a decade, and the likelihood that even one will be zyss is low. There's no telling whether a child will be zyss or aapoph, regardless of parentage. A coveted zyss child is just as likely to arise from aapoph parents as from two zyss, and every serpentfolk colony has someone in charge of sorting the young, identifying the earliest signs of magic in them.

+2 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental.name: +2 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental

Chipping Scales.name: Chipping Scales
Chipping Scales.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The granitescale is about to take piercing or slashing damage

Effect The granitescale twists to take the blow on their hardest scales, which they shed to reduce the incoming force. The granitescale gains resistance 15 to the damage, but their AC is reduced by 2 for 1 day, when the shed scales regrow.

Rattling Spear.name: Rattling Spear
Rattling Spear.description:
Requirements The granitescale's last action was a successful longspear Strike

Effect The granitescale rattles the base of their spear, attempting an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} all enemies within 30 feet (compare the check result to the targets' Will DCs individually).

Serpentfolk Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22|basic:true]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)
Serpentfolk Venom.name: Serpentfolk Venom

Vampire Bat Swarm.name: 吸血蝙蝠群 Vampire Bat Swarm

Echolocation (Precise) 20 feet.name: 回声定位（精确）20尺 Echolocation (Precise) 20 feet
Echolocation (Precise) 20 feet.description: 吸血蝙蝠群的听觉在列出的范围内是精确感官。

Blood Feast.description: 每个处于吸血蝙蝠群占据方格内的敌人受到@Damage[1d4[piercing]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:16|basic:true]豁免）。检定失败的生物还要受到@Damage[1[bleed]]伤害。
Blood Feast.name: 血宴 Blood Feast

Vampire Bat Swarm.publicNotes:
虽然常见的吸血蝙蝠有大约7寸左右的翼展，而且不会对单独的大型猎物构成威胁（事实上，这些吸血蝙蝠可以在猎物睡着的时候偷偷吸血），但是一些不常见的特别有攻击性的蝙蝠种类会成群捕食。一大群翻腾的吸血蝙蝠比单独一只加起来要危险的多，它们能在令人恐惧的短时间内造成大量的流血伤口。

种类繁多的蝙蝠生活在世界各个角落。这些夜行动物大多是无害的食虫动物，但致命品种的吸血蝙蝠和体型像马一样大的巨型蝙蝠对冒险者们来说是较大的威胁。

Yamaraj.name: Yamaraj
Yamaraj.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Final Judgment.name: Final Judgment
Final Judgment.description: A yamaraj's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.AuIiqc7jjiy1GZ75]{Manifestation} spells are used only to pronounce judgment, typically either to restore a dead or destroyed creature to life, bind a creature to the Boneyard, or banish a creature from the Boneyard.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Lightning Drinker.name: Lightning Drinker
Lightning Drinker.description:
Whenever a yamaraj would take electricity damage if not for its immunity, its fast healing increases to 40 on its next turn.

During that turn, if it uses Beetle Breath, the beetles deal @Damage[2d12[electricity]]{2d12 additional electricity damage}.

Beetle Breath.name: Beetle Breath
Beetle Breath.description:
The yamaraj breathes a blast of beetles in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] that deals @Damage[14d8[slashing],4d8[persistent,slashing]]{14d8 slashing damage and 4d8 persistent slashing damage} to creatures in the area with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:42|traits:damaging-effect] save.

It can't use Beetle Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Beetle Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature takes unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

Shepherd’s Touch.name: Shepherd’s Touch
Shepherd’s Touch.description: A yamaraj's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal @Damage[3d6[void]] damage to living creatures and @Damage[3d6[vitality]] damage to undead.

Yamaraj Venom.name: Yamaraj Venom
Yamaraj Venom.description:
While a creature is clumsy from this poison, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed} with the same value;

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[5d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[7d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} (1 round)

Yamaraj.publicNotes:
The greatest judges among the psychopomps are yamarajes, whose wisdom is legendary and whose edicts are unappealable except to ushers or Pharasma herself. A yamaraj resembles an immense dragon with dark, feathery scales and an emotionless, dispassionate gaze behind a feathered mask. When not serving as the senior magistrates, lords, and generals of the Boneyard, yamarajes pursue highly individualistic hobbies, such as gardening or literature.

Psychopomps are guardians and shepherds of the dead in the Boneyard, the vast plane of graves where mortal souls are judged and sent on to their eternal rewards or damnations. Psychopomps ensure that the dead come to terms with their transition from mortality and are properly sorted into the appropriate afterlife. They also protect souls from being preyed upon by supernatural predators. Nearly all psychopomps wear masks, especially when they're likely to be interacting with mortals, although the types of masks they wear are as varied as the psychopomps themselves. The courts of the Boneyard preside in Requian, a somber yet melodic language spoken slowly with various tonal shifts.

Many psychopomps are intimately involved with the Boneyard's massive bureaucracy. Few pursue mercy, justice, or personal gain; their duties to Pharasma and her Boneyard are supreme. Nevertheless, individual psychopomps interpret their duties in different ways, which might put them in conflict with mortals or even with each other.

Diabolic Dragon (Ancient).name: Diabolic Dragon (Ancient)
Diabolic Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
Hell, according to some theologians, is a living entity in and of itself. Diabolic dragons, these scholars argue, are just extensions of the plane, living creatures that break off from Hell to enact its will. Whether this is true or whether diabolical dragons are simply the reborn souls of dragons sent to Hell, the fact remains that these dragons are powerful, cunning, and tyrannical. Every diabolic dragon's goal is to further Hell's will, though how this happens can vary. Regardless of their goals, these dragons always approach newcomers with an unsettling calmness.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Diabolic Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair the dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Hell's Sting.name: Hell's Sting
Hell's Sting.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon channels the rancor of Hell back through the body of their foe, overwhelming it with an infernal assault on the mind. The triggering creature takes @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[type:will|dc:42|basic:true] save. Holy creatures use an outcome one degree of success worse than they roll on their saving throw.

Diabolic Fire.name: Diabolic Fire
Diabolic Fire.description: Any fire damage that a diabolic dragon deals, including fire damage from spells, is imbued with the unholy power of Hell to scorch the spirit as well. A creature takes spirit damage instead of fire damage if that would be more detrimental to the creature (as determined by the GM). A diabolic dragon is immune to the diabolic fire of other diabolic dragons, the fire from divine immolation, and similar effects.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Hellfire Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of infernal fire that deals @Damage[21d6[fire]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true] save).

The dragon can't use Hellfire Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Akhana.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Envisioning.name: Envisioning
Envisioning.description:
100 feet

An akhana can communicate mentally with any creatures in the aura using wordless psychic projections. They don't need to share a language, though the aeon's meaning to non-aeons can be vague and is often mysterious. An aeon can use this ability to communicate flawlessly with any other aeon on the same plane as itself.

Sprout Life.description: A @Template[type:burst|distance:5] within 100 feet fills with simple life appropriate to the environment. The newly forged animals bite those in the area for @Damage[7d6[piercing]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true] save. The akhana can also have fungus or plants choke the area, even floating ones in the sky, creating difficult terrain. The created life lives or dies normally after its creation.
Sprout Life.name: Sprout Life

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Balance Life.name: Balance Life
Balance Life.description:
Trigger A creature within 100 feet is about to attempt a recovery check

Effect The akhana chooses to make the result a success or failure (but not a critical success or failure). This effect gains the fortune trait if the akhana chooses success or misfortune for failure.

Flying Fists.name: Flying Fists
Flying Fists.description: The akhana Flies and makes up to four fist Strikes against different targets at any points during this movement. The attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty normally, but the penalty does not increase until after Flying Fists is complete.

Reclaim Life.name: Reclaim Life
Reclaim Life.description:
Requirements The akhana has a living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} with its tail

Effect The creature takes 4d10 void damage with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32|basic:true] save. On a failed save, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. If the creature dies while doomed and held in the akhana's tail, its soul is trapped in the akhana (as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul}), and its remains are preserved as peaceful rest. The soul returns to the body with 1 Hit Point if the akhana @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AjLSHZSWQ90exdLo]{Dismisses} the effect, if the akhana is slain, or if a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual or similarly powerful magic frees it.

Akhana.name: Akhana
Akhana.publicNotes:
Akhanas are massive eyes formed of cosmic matter that monitor the balance of birth and death.
