They understand the profound influence living things have on the cosmos and silently perform their duties of supporting and pruning life. Akhanas seem utterly unconcerned by the fate of souls after death, often leaving undead in their wake or attracting daemon scavengers. Psychopomps often despair over akhanas' cryptic actions, forced to clear out sudden backlogs of souls or even battle the aeons directly. Their "tail" is a twisting column of cosmic energy that can drain vitality from creatures and seal their fate.

Aeons have always been the caretakers of reality and defenders of the natural order of balance. Each type of aeon takes on some form of duality in its manifestation and works either to shape the multiverse within the aspects of this duality in some way, or to correct imbalances to the perfect order of existence. Aeons' machinations can raise a nation, raze it, or restore it from ruin. Their reasons are their own, and they rarely share their motivations with others—through their strange envisioning mode of communication, they simply create the results they insist are necessary to maintain the balance of the multiverse.

As a result of recent shifts in reality, aeons have begun to reassert a presence in the perfect planar city of Axis. To aeons, this is merely the latest in a recurring cycle, albeit one that mortals have not yet borne witness to. Aeons have a name for this cyclic return, in which they welcome their industrious axiomite brethren back to their fold: the Convergence. At the onset of the Convergence, a council of pleroma aeons appeared in the Eternal City of Axis, where they revealed that axiomites were wayward aeons, split off long ago to pursue the act of creation. With the latest cycle of change, it was time for axiomites—and their mortal creations and kin—to rejoin the aeon cause. While most axiomites fell in line, realizing perhaps on a fundamental level of reality that what the aeons said was the truth, some refused to heed the call and waited for the wrath of the aeons. That wrath has yet to come. The dual-natured aeons have responded to those who have declined in confusing ways. With some they treat and even bargain, while a handful of others they have destroyed, and a few have been exterminated by the axiomites. But most of these quiet insurgents they leave alone, allowing these axiomites to continue to create in peace. How—or if—this Convergence will end is as little understood as aeons themselves.

Awakened Tree.name: 觉醒树木 Awakened Tree
Awakened Tree.publicNotes:
树精王和其他强大的原能施法者为了保护森林，会暂时让树木具有自我意识。这些觉醒的树木具有生物本能，并且有移动和攻击的能力，它们听从主人的命令，并为保护家园而战。这里的数据同样适用于用其他方式活化的植物，例如来自其他维度的神秘影响，或是一个任性的精类生物的灵魂，诸如此类。

树精是森林的守护者和树木的代言者。树精和他们照料的树木寿命几乎一样长，它们把自己当做树木的父母和牧者，而非园丁。虽然树精们平时慢条斯理，但当它们被迫为保护森林而战时，他们能展现出惊人的敏捷。树精们很少会和短命种族做朋友——在它们眼中连精灵都很短命——而且对于新事物有一种与生俱来的偏见。但是树精可以容忍那些前来从它们冗长繁杂的闲言碎语中寻求知识的学习者，尤其是那些明确表示想保护森林的人。对于威胁它们领土的人，比如渴望收获木材的伐木者或旨在开垦树林建立农地、城镇的殖民者，树精的愤怒则是坚定而具有毁灭性的。具有讽刺意味的是，树精具有摧毁建筑的天赋——这一特点对于它们充满复仇欲望的同胞来说非常实用。

Tor Linnorm.name: Tor Linnorm
Tor Linnorm.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值
Tor Linnorm.publicNotes:
Tor linnorms dwell in the tallest volcanic mountains, either within naturally formed caverns or molten craters. A tor linnorm's temper can be as hot and destructive as the magma the creature resembles.

Immense, primeval dragons of the northern reaches of the world, linnorms hate those they deem to be lesser creatures and seek to inflict as much suffering as possible upon their unfortunate victims. While these serpentine monstrosities might not be the powerful winged dragons most imagine, they nonetheless possess incredible strength and deadly powers that often rival more notorious dragons' brutality.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Curse of Boiling Blood.name: Curse of Boiling Blood
Curse of Boiling Blood.description:
When a creature slays the linnorm, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:48] save or gain weakness to fire 20 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} from the agonizing pain it now endures at all times, with an unlimited duration.

As long as a character continues to suffer this curse, its slowed condition can never be reduced below slowed 1.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.CUgmb7g65vYNT2hn]{Effect: Curse of Boiling Blood}

Lava Affinity.name: Lava Affinity
Lava Affinity.description: A tor linnorm can breathe and swim freely while submerged in lava and magma.

Pyroclastic Breath.name: Pyroclastic Breath
Pyroclastic Breath.description:
The tor linnorm expels a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of flame and ash dealing @Damage[20d6[fire]] damage to creatures within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:46|basic:true] save).

The linnorm can't use Pyroclastic Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Pyroclastic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

At the start of the tor linnorm's next turn, the area of the Pyroclastic Breath is covered in thick, scorching smoke that burns both the lungs and eyes, dealing an additional @Damage[10d6[fire]] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:46|basic:true] save). A creature that spends an entire round in the smoke with open eyes must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:44] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute.

The smoke dissipates after 1 minute; in strong winds, the smoke dissipates in 5 rounds, and in more powerful winds, it may clear even more quickly.

Slashing Claws.name: Slashing Claws
Slashing Claws.description: The tor linnorm makes four Strikes with their claws, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the tor linnorm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the tor linnorm makes all their attacks.

Tor Linnorm Venom.name: Tor Linnorm Venom
Tor Linnorm Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:44];

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[8d6[fire]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Zyss Serpentfolk.name: Zyss Serpentfolk
Zyss Serpentfolk.allSaves: +4 status to will saves vs. mental, +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Thin of Blood.name: Thin of Blood
Thin of Blood.description: Zyss serpentfolk recover slowly from injuries. When they take physical damage from a critical hit, they gain @Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]] damage. They take a –2 circumstance penalty to flat checks to recover from persistent damage and saving throws against afflictions.

+4 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental.name: +4 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental

Serpentfolk Venom.name: Serpentfolk Venom
Serpentfolk Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Zyss Serpentfolk.publicNotes:
Even the least among zyss serpentfolk consider themselves greater than any mammal. Their magical abilities, most notably their telepathy, are all the reason they need to hold this view. And it's true enough that the instinctual skill and magic of any zyss is enough to best the average human.

Before their ancient clash with humanity devastated their civilization, serpentfolk were masters of a sprawling underground empire. Their power was shattered and their god Ydersius decapitated (although not quite slain). The cunning, intelligence, and magical abilities of serpentfolk have diminished from their ancient heights, and most are born without these boons. This is partially the result of cruel genetic meddling among serpentfolk—though the ruling class, zyss, are born with an innate spellcasting ability, their blood runs thin, making them susceptible to wounds. Seen as the failures of the serpentfolk's experiments are the aapophs, who are strong but prone to mutation and lack innate spellcasting.

Today, the central realm of the Darklands retains the old name of the serpentfolk empire that once dominated this region—Sekamina. This name is also the source of the serpentfolk's Aklo title, sekmin, which they are often called in ancient texts. Serpentfolk dominion had declined before ghouls, gugs, umbral gnomes, and other forces. Yet their recent ventures have brought them back to a stronger place in the Darklands. Many serpentfolk sleeping in torpor in secluded vaults have awakened.

Zyss serpentfolk tend toward megalomania, with dreams of returning to their place of dominance. Many of their plans hinge on resurrecting Ydersius, their decapitated god. His headless body still thrashes about, mindless, in the Darklands, waiting to be reunited with his lost skull. Serpentfolk numbers are so small that reclaiming their dominance seems a distant dream, especially since their reproduction is slow. Though a parent can birth a dozen young at once, the gestation period lasts up to a decade, and the likelihood that even one will be zyss is low. There's no telling whether a child will be zyss or aapoph, regardless of parentage. A coveted zyss child is just as likely to arise from aapoph parents as from two zyss, and every serpentfolk colony has someone in charge of sorting the young, identifying the earliest signs of magic in them.

Ghost Commoner.name: Ghost Commoner
Ghost Commoner.publicNotes:
The ghost commoner is an ordinary person who believes they died unjustly.

When some mortals die through tragic circumstances or without closure, their souls can linger and haunt a locale significant to them in life.

Site Bound.name: Site Bound
Site Bound.description: A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
Setting right the injustice that led to the commoner’s death allows it to move on to the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

Frightful Moan.name: Frightful Moan
Frightful Moan.description: The ghost laments its fate, forcing each living creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} to attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's frightful moan for 1 minute.

Sedacthy Speaker.publicNotes:
High-ranking sedacthies are expected to both plan campaigns and wade into battle. These speakers achieve their rank by accumulating several large servants or a single massive creature like a megalodon.

Sedacthies are amphibious, fish-like humanoids who lurk in Golarion's oceans and are known for leading their animal servants ashore to devour air breathers. When an entire fishing village disappears overnight, sedacthies are the first suspects. Sedacthies pride themselves as natural leaders, with ambition limited only by their strict adherence to hierarchy. A sedacthy's station is determined by the strength of the animal servants they press into service, and the mettle they prove during hunts and in battles against outsiders.

Sea Speech.description: A sedacthy speaking Thalassic can be understood by any animal that has a swim Speed or the amphibious or aquatic trait. By spending a week regularly interacting with such an animal, the sedacthy can make it permanently helpful.
Sea Speech.name: Sea Speech

Animal Shield.description:
Requirements The sedacthy speaker is adjacent to a Large or larger animal ally

Effect The speaker gains cover until the start of their next turn or when they're no longer adjacent to the animal, whichever comes first.
Animal Shield.name: Animal Shield

Exploit Weakness.name: Exploit Weakness
Exploit Weakness.description: The speaker's Strikes deal 1d6 additional damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}.

Painful Cry.name: Painful Cry
Painful Cry.description: The sedacthy shrieks across a range of painfully high tones, dealing @Damage[3d6[sonic],1d6[mental]]{3d6 sonic damage and 1d6 mental damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23|basic:true] save. A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Shared Feast.name: Shared Feast
Shared Feast.description: The sedacthy makes a jaws Strike. If it hits, an ally of their choice can spend a reaction to make a jaws Strike against the same target. Allies with beaks or similar attacks can use those instead of jaws.

Swim Together.name: Swim Together
Swim Together.description:
Requirements The speaker is adjacent to an animal ally

Effect The speaker and the animal both Swim, ending their movement adjacent to one another.

Speaker's Privilege.name: Speaker's Privilege
Speaker's Privilege.description:
Trigger The sedacthy speaker takes damage

Requirements The sedacthy speaker has cover from an animal ally

Effect The animal takes the damage instead.

Sedacthy Speaker.name: Sedacthy Speaker

Soulbound Doll (Calm).name: 缚魂娃娃（冷静） Soulbound Doll (Calm)
Soulbound Doll (Calm).publicNotes:
缚魂娃娃是怪诞的人体模型或娃娃，被灌注了一小片已故凡人的灵魂。这些小小的构装体是由于各种各样的原因被创造出来的——比如说作为同伴或仆人——但是他们的自由意志意味着它们对于他们的创造者并非必然服从。法莱斯玛的信徒常常憎恶缚魂娃娃，认为这是对灵魂自然循环的扭曲，而墓穴女士的崇拜者乐意看到缚魂娃娃的破灭，而不考虑其行为，会将覆灭缚魂偶作为对伟大彼岸的重要服务。

在一系列缚魂构装体中，缚魂娃娃的制造是最简单的，这些构装体包括人形的缚魂人偶，强大的缚魂躯壳，和作为卫兵的缚魂兵马俑。用非自愿的活物创造娃娃是残忍的，非自愿的供体可以抵抗这个过程，通过一次意志检定来对抗创造者的手艺 DC，如果不能阻止灵魂供体的死亡，则会毁掉娃娃。如果某人生前同意使用，也可以用其灵魂制作娃娃。

冒险者遇到的缚魂娃娃通常都是某种守卫；尽管娃娃体型娇小，但灵魂碎片的力量让娃娃的拳头比旁人想象的更加危险。此外，鉴于娃娃的身材，灵魂碎片还能赋予娃娃一个威力巨大的法术。由于具有自主性和非凡的智慧，缚魂娃娃偶尔会被它们的制作者用作强大得多但无意识的构装体的管理者，使这些娃娃能够控制远远超出其自身能力的防御系统。

虽然缚魂娃娃包包含一名刚死不久的人的一小部分灵魂，但其实这不影响死者复活，或直接前往来世。这种灵魂提取的过程对活着的灵魂供体来说则是致命的。

灵魂碎片通常会注入一个镶嵌在娃娃胸部或脖子的灵魂聚焦宝石（硬度10）。灵魂碎片一般会保留原灵魂的强烈个性特征，但娃娃会从初始状态开始不断学习，这意味着它的性格和能力可以改变，可能会变得更像灵魂供体，也可能在自己的道路上越走越远。即使缚魂娃娃被摧毁，它的灵魂聚焦宝石也能保留娃娃的记忆。如果被摧毁的缚魂娃娃的灵魂聚焦宝石是完好的，那么它可以被一些精于缚魂操作的人重新放置到一个新娃娃的身体里，通过这种方法可以很有效的让缚魂娃娃重生。

Personality Fragments.name: 人格碎片 Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: 缚魂娃娃拥有一部分灵魂提供者的人格碎片，尽管它没有任何生前的记忆。这使得缚魂娃娃与供体灵魂的强烈个性特征相匹配。由于它的灵魂碎片，因此缚魂娃娃拥有无法像大多数构装体一样对精魂免疫。

Spider Swarm.publicNotes:
一顿丰盛的食物、突然孵化的一窝蜘蛛卵、或魔法导致的结果，都能让一大群小蜘蛛聚集成可怕而致命的集群。

很少有害虫能像声名狼藉的蜘蛛那样让人如此恐惧。

Web Sense.name: 蛛网感知 Web Sense
Web Sense.description:
蜘蛛群可以通过震颤感知（模糊）来感知到生物触碰它们蛛网时产生的振动。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Tremorsense]

Spider Swarm Venom.name: 蜘蛛群毒 Spider Swarm Venom
Spider Swarm Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14]

最大持续时间 4轮

阶段1 @Damage[1[poison]]伤害且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1} (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[1d4[poison]]伤害且力竭1 (1轮)

Swarming Bites.name: 虫群噬咬 Swarming Bites
Swarming Bites.description:
每个处于蜘蛛群占据方格内的敌人受到@Damage[1d4[piercing]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:14|basic:true]豁免）。

检定失败的生物还会暴露在蜘蛛群毒的影响下。

Spider Swarm.name: 蜘蛛群 Spider Swarm

Dwarf Stonecaster.name: 矮人岩咒师 Dwarf Stonecaster
Dwarf Stonecaster.publicNotes:
所有矮人都与土地具有联系，但岩咒师专注于打磨这种联系。长年的冥想赋予他们创造巨石和撼动地面的能力。这些元素专家通常在其社区内备受尊崇，其地卜技艺也因此而受到重视。年轻矮人展现出的与土地的联系如果比常规情况更强的话，那么他在儿时很可能经受过岩咒师的训练。

矮人的力量来源于他们那坚毅的决心、高质量的装备以及将怨恨之心延续数个世纪的能力。

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 10 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊）10尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 10 feet

Boulder Roll.name: 巨岩翻滚 Boulder Roll
Boulder Roll.description:
矮人岩咒师呼唤一块翻滚的巨岩，对@Template[type:line|distance:60]区域的每个生物造成@Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true]豁免）。

矮人岩咒师在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Boulder Roll]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用巨岩翻滚。

Dwarven Doughtiness.name: 矮人顽勇 Dwarven Doughtiness
Dwarven Doughtiness.description: 矮人通常能够沉着冷静地面对迫在眉睫的危险。在此矮人回合结束时，其惊惧状态会降低2点而非正常的1点。

Tremor.name: 大地震颤 Tremor
Tremor.description: 矮人岩咒师让脚下的大地震动。@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]区域内的地面上的每个生物承受@Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|basic:true]豁免）。大失败的生物还会被击倒@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

Raktavarna.name: 化物罗刹 Raktavarna
Raktavarna.publicNotes:
化物罗刹是背叛与暗杀的普通罗刹化身，存在往往是为了考研那些前世奸诈毒辣者的胆量。它们通常以蛇的形象出现，有着血红的眼睛与特大的尖牙，不过它们也经常化身成剑或珠宝。

罗刹是原始的神性神物，是造物之中一切邪恶化身，他们诞生于善恶概念产生之初。他们的神性使命便是作为亵渎的典范——通过屠杀亲族，吞食知性存在的肉，犯下无数其他暴行，他们将这些行为定义为淫秽与禁忌，因此凡人知晓了这些行为在圣洁眼中便是罪恶。这是他们必须扮演的角色，就像舞台上必须有演员来扮演反派一样，所有罗刹在诞生那一刻就注定了身负罪孽。

大多数罗刹享受他们的角色，就像演员享受精湛的表演一样，不过他们的存在中仍有悲剧成分。他们注定了只能充当他人的陪衬，腐蚀卑劣者，倒在英雄脚下，永远无法开辟自己的道路。他们注定要做出最令人法治的行为，哪怕这会让他们的情感与良知受到伤害。否则就会违背他们的本性与目的：这是罗刹所能犯下的最大的罪过。
Raktavarna.allSaves: 对抗神术魔法的豁免+2状态加值

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine Magic.name: 对抗神术魔法的豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine Magic

Knowledge of Delusion.name: 妄想知识 Knowledge of Delusion
Knowledge of Delusion.description: 在对化物罗刹的回忆知识检定或用于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]的察觉检定失败的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]直到其下回合结束。

Betraying Bite.description: 化物罗刹对任何持握它的生物在打击上获得+2加值。
Betraying Bite.name: 背叛噬咬 Betraying Bite

Change Shape.description:
化物罗刹变形成为超小型活化物体。如果在变化期间，化物罗刹使用任何纯心灵（例如回忆知识）以外的动作，它就会立即变回原形。在此之前，它可以使用欺骗来乔装成物品。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Designate Master.name: 认主 Designate Master
Designate Master.description:
化物罗刹花费10分钟来认另一名生物为主。该生物成为化物罗刹的主人，直到化物罗刹死亡或解消该效果。只要羁绊存在，主人就会获得主人之眼行动。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.1obHWaFiFI1pnC3R]

Raktavarna Venom.name: 化物罗刹毒 Raktavarna Venom
Raktavarna Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d4[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1} (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[1d4[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2} (1轮)

Arboreal Warden.name: 树精卫士 Arboreal Warden
Arboreal Warden.publicNotes:
树精卫士是树精社会中的护林员。这些在领地内不断巡逻的生物对他们所居住的森林有一种天生的好奇心，导致他们很少停下来在森林的同一区域扎根和休息。这种“漫游癖”让它们成为了理想的巡林客和侦察员。虽然他们是强大的战士，但是也知道单靠自己无法抗衡危险的敌人。因此他们会向树精王报告任何威胁。在极少数情况下，树精卫士们会聚在一起形成一片“树丛”。这片“树丛”会越过森林的边界，前往内陆其他地区进行调查，收集潜在威胁的情报，并报告他们的发现。树精卫士不会假装理解其他生物的目的——就像自然界的大多数力量一样，它们对不涉及他们森林的凡人事务持着矛盾的态度。

树精是森林的守护者和树木的代言者。树精和他们照料的树木寿命几乎一样长，它们把自己当做树木的父母和牧者，而非园丁。虽然树精们平时慢条斯理，但当它们被迫为保护森林而战时，他们能展现出惊人的敏捷。树精们很少会和短命种族做朋友——在它们眼中连精灵都很短命——而且对于新事物有一种与生俱来的偏见。但是树精可以容忍那些前来从它们冗长繁杂的闲言碎语中寻求知识的学习者，尤其是那些明确表示想保护森林的人。对于威胁它们领土的人，比如渴望收获木材的伐木者或旨在开垦树林建立农地、城镇的殖民者，树精的愤怒则是坚定而具有毁灭性的。具有讽刺意味的是，树精具有摧毁建筑的天赋——这一特点对于它们充满复仇欲望的同胞来说非常实用。

Shield Push.name: 举盾猛推 Shield Push
Shield Push.description: 树精卫士行走并进行一次盾击打击。如果攻击命中，则目标被推离10尺。

Hellish Revenge.name: Hellish Revenge
Hellish Revenge.description:
Trigger The greater hell hound is critically hit by any Strike

Effect The greater hell hound's Hellfire Breath recharges. They can immediately use it as part of this reaction.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description:
The hell hound breathes flames that deal @Damage[10d6[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save.)

The hell hound can't use Hellfire Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. If the greater hell hound would take fire damage or be targeted by a fire effect, their Hellfire Breath recharges.

Pack Attack.description: The greater hell hound's Strikes deal 1d8 extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of their allies.
Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack

Greater Hell Hound.name: Greater Hell Hound
Greater Hell Hound.publicNotes:
Believed to be bred by the Kings of Hell themselves within vast kennels, greater hell hounds are the favored guards and hunting hounds of powerful fiends and, rarely, mortals who worship them and have earned their favor.

Hell hounds are fiendish, extraplanar canines hailing from the Pit that can hunt down quarry and breathe supernatural gouts of flame. They are temperamental and quick to exhibit aggressive behavior.

Cauthooj.name: 迷音鸟 Cauthooj

Thoughtsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 思维感知（模糊感官）60尺 Thoughtsense
Thoughtsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description: 迷音鸟能感知到所列出的范围内的非无心智生物。

Hop-Dodge.name: 跳跃闪避 Hop-Dodge
Hop-Dodge.description:
触发 迷音鸟是近战打击的目标，且与另一个同样位于该近战打击触及范围内的敌人相邻。

效果 迷音鸟敏捷地跳跃，使得触发此能力的近战打击的目标变成与迷音鸟相邻的敌人。迷音鸟以半速行走，并且此移动不触发任何反应动作。

Warbling Song.name: 颤音之歌 Warbling Song
Warbling Song.description:
迷音鸟发出一种奇怪的悲泣，导致附近的生物变得狂躁和失控。@Template[type:emanation|distance:120]范围内的所有生物都必须进行@Check[type:will|dc:32]豁免来抵抗该效果。

大成功 目标不受影响且临时免疫该能力一分钟。

成功 目标不受影响。

失败 目标@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}1轮。

大失败 目标@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}1轮并立即攻击目标自己（采用困惑状态时通常的攻击方式）。这次攻击并不能让目标因为受伤而尝试用纯骰检定来从混乱状态恢复。

Staccato Strike.name: 颤音打击 Staccato Strike
Staccato Strike.description: 迷音鸟通过微妙声调变化，可以指挥一个因为颤音之歌而@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}的生物进行一次打击。这参照一般陷入困惑的生物进行的打击，只是迷音鸟可以指定打击的目标。如果目标的触及范围内没有目标，或目标因为其他原因无法进行打击，则此能力无效。

Cauthooj.publicNotes:
这些巨大的、不会飞的鸟类虽然身体高长、步态滑稽，但其实出人意料的灵活。他们是独行的掠食者，用他们具有迷惑性的鸟鸣让猎物陷入疯狂，操纵他们互相攻击，这样它们就能尽情享用它们的遗骸了。

一些学者将它们成为“人偶师鸟”，另一些人则称其为“尖叫伯劳”。迷音鸟为大多数聪明的类人生物所唾骂，部分原因是因为这些鸟更喜欢狩猎类人生物。当地人目击到迷音鸟之后通常会组织一个捕猎队，在它再次杀戮之前追踪他的行踪，猎人们通常会把耳朵塞满蜡，以免被它的叫声所影响。那些有幸从这种叫声中幸存下来的人表示，这种声音特别让人紧张不安，甚至没有什么声音比它更为可怕。

虽然人们可能会认为迷音鸟是一种愚蠢的动物，但这些生物实际上比它们看起来要聪明的多。迷音鸟会在偏远的定居点外围跟踪孤独的旅行者，以让自己能饱餐一顿。这些有耐心的生物直到填饱肚子之前能一直埋伏很久。他们甚至能理解一些基本的木族语，尽管它们无法清晰地说话，但这不能阻止迷音鸟试图模仿它听到的声音，当它这么做的时候，它的野蛮的原始天性增强了这种行为，这让它拥有了能控制思维并造成混乱的能力，迷音鸟的智力让它足以理解自身这种特性，并乐在其中。

Alce.name: Alce
Alce.publicNotes:
Wingless griffons, known as alces, result from a rare mutation. Among a clutch of winged griffons, the alce is typically considered the runt, so alces are rarely seen on their own in the wild, though they're often intentionally bred in captivity as relatively affordable exotic mounts.

Griffons are regal beasts revered as symbols of freedom and strength in many cultures. They are physically striking, with the hindquarters of a lion and the head, wings, and forelimbs of a great bird of prey—typically an eagle, but some instead bear the features of a hawk, falcon, or even an osprey or vulture. In rare cases, the griffon's hindquarters may resemble those of a different great cat, such as a leopard or tiger. The variations seem to conform to the griffon's environment—for instance, especially rare griffons of northern Avistan have the hindquarters of a Grungir lynx and the upper body of a snowy owl.

Wild griffons rely on their powerful wings to hold them aloft and their keen eyesight to spy out prey. The speed with which they plunge toward the ground and snatch up victims is astonishing. They often tear apart a kill's flesh with razor-sharp beaks but not before alighting to secluded location where they can enjoy their meal without interruption. Griffons hunting to feed their chicks are more cautious, tearing apart prey rather than risking bringing a living creature back to their nests.

Skilled animal trainers long ago learned how to raise griffons as mounts for military forces or powerful individuals. Such mounts are known for their strength, bravery, and unfailing loyalty. They are among the smartest of animals, and many griffon variants are considered intelligent beasts instead; it's thought that a griffon chooses its rider as much as a rider chooses the griffon. The process of training a griffon to accept and carry a rider in flight is a long and expensive ordeal. Griffon trainers charge rich sums for their services, and a ruler who can boast of owning a stable of griffons is the subject of great respect and envy.

Pounce.description: The alce Strides and makes a talon Strike at the end of that movement. If the alce began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the attack.
Pounce.name: Pounce

Regal Shriek.name: Regal Shriek
Regal Shriek.description:
The alce unleashes a shriek that transitions into a terrifying roar. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:20] save. Regardless of the result, creatures are temporarily immune to all griffons' Regal Shrieks for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. Animals are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as they're frightened.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}. Animals are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} as long as they're frightened.

Waterbound.name: 受缚于水 Waterbound
Waterbound.description: 当活体瀑布没有接触到水时，它会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}并无法使用反应动作。

Vortex.name: 涡流 Vortex
Vortex.description:
30尺。

灵光范围内的，且与活体瀑布位于同一水体内的水，对于正在游泳且没有水（Water）特征的生物来说，视为困难地形。

Drench.name: 浸湿 Drench
Drench.description:
元素尝试浇灭@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]范围内的所有火焰。

它能自动熄灭所有非魔法火焰，并且尝试反制魔法火焰（反制调整值[[/r 1d20+14 #Drench]]{+14}）。

Push or Pull 5 feet.name: 推离或拉拽5尺 Push or Pull 5 feet
Push or Pull 5 feet.description:
当活体瀑布成功击中一个生物时可以选择将该生物推离或拉拽5尺。

推离1

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Push]

拉拽1

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Pull]

Living Waterfall.name: 活体瀑布 Living Waterfall
Living Waterfall.publicNotes:
活体瀑布是一个看起来像翻腾的人形水柱。他们视水为自己的天然领地，甚至视水生动物为闯入者。当被召唤时，它们脾气暴躁，但会不情愿地守护各种形式的水中场所。

水元素可能具有非凡的破坏力，但这往往并非出于本心；就像水可以给主物质位面带来生命一样，它的波浪可以冲击海岸，雨水也能淹没城市。水元素同样如此难以捉摸。

Pack Attack.name: 群起攻之 Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: 鬣齿兽的敌人如果处于鬣齿兽的另外两个盟友的触及范围内，则造成1d6额外伤害。

Bonecrunching Bite.name: 挤压噬咬 Bonecrunching Bite
Bonecrunching Bite.description: 被鬣齿兽重击的生物必须通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]豁免，否则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{受伤 Wounded 1}因为该生物的骨头或软骨组织被鬣齿兽强有力的噬咬压碎了。

Drag.name: 拉拽 Drag
Drag.description: 鬣齿兽对倒地目标进行一次@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]打击。如果命中，除了正常造成伤害之外，鬣齿兽能拖着猎物行走最多10尺。

Hyaenodon.name: 鬣齿兽 Hyaenodon
Hyaenodon.publicNotes:
鬣齿兽是体型较小的鬣狗的凶残而原始的表亲。这种缓缓逼近、毛发弄粗杂乱的生物体型几乎有马那么大。从它们的体型和能咬碎骨头的下颚来看，它们确实是不可小觑的可怕掠食者。豺狼人氏族发现，这种生物特别适合作为坐骑或守卫。

鬣狗是群居捕食的食腐动物，以它们令人不安的笑声般的叫声而闻名。最著名的鬣狗是群居的斑鬣狗，它们成群结队，一起狩猎或驱赶大型动物。鬣狗是典型的夜行动物，以肉、昆虫和水果为食，不过它们除了食腐，也会狩猎新鲜猎物。

Slink.name: 偷溜 Slink
Slink.description:
触发 一个生物在临近蝰蛇或者蝰蛇所在方格结束移动。

效果 蝰蛇移动、攀爬或游泳至多10尺（如果相应的速度小于10尺，则使用该速度）。它必须停留在离敌人5尺以外的位置。这次移动不会触发反应动作。

Viper Venom.name: 蝰蛇毒液 Viper Venom
Viper Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

最大持续时间 4轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d8[poison]] (1轮)

Viper.name: 蝰蛇 Viper
Viper.publicNotes:
每种蝰蛇科属的毒蛇都有着长长绞合的毒牙，能将剧毒注入猎物的体内。不同的蝰蛇会注入不同类型的毒液，这可能会导致麻痹、极度疼痛和肿胀，血液凝结，甚至会导致受害者的心脏骤停。

蛇的种类多样，从盘踞密林缠卷猎物的蟒蛇，到有着致命啮咬的剧毒蝰蛇。不管怎样，所有的蛇都是通过张开其双颚整个吞咽猎物，再利用充满力量的肌肉将食物从喉腔转移至胃部消化。

Pukwudgie Poison.name: Pukwudgie Poison
Pukwudgie Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and stupefied 2 (1 round)

Defensive Quills.name: Defensive Quills
Defensive Quills.description:
A creature that hits a pukwudgie with an unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike takes @Damage[3d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true] save). On a critical failure, the creature also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]] from the poisoned quills.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the GM Core creature building Tables

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The pukwudgie takes on the physical form of a giant porcupine or resumes their natural form. In porcupine form, their size changes to Medium, they lose their weapon Strikes, and they gain a quill Strike (+18 for 2d8+6 piercing plus 1d8 persistent poison).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Pukwudgie.name: Pukwudgie
Pukwudgie.publicNotes:
Pukwudgies go by many names in many regions, but those who know of them agree that defying their mischievous nature provokes their wrath.

In ancient times, pukwudgies traveled to the Universe from the First World, perhaps in the wake of the gnome emigration. These proud fey are obsessed with displays of respect, and while they first attempted to befriend mortals, each attempt ended in tragedy as the pukwudgies perceived any potential slight as a grave insult. Mortals, fearing these reactions, began to view pukwudgies as dangerous nuisances. Pukwudgies, in turn, began to resent mortals and the gods that favored them.

At their best, pukwudgies play cruel jokes on mortals they encounter. At their worst, they've been known to kidnap and even kill those who don't treat them with proper respect. Violent fey like twigjacks and redcaps often gather under pukwudgie leadership, much to the pukwudgies' glee.

Pukwudgies make their villages in the oldest forests, concealed under @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} spells. They travel freely between the Universe and the First World through tiny portals beneath hills, trees, or stones. No strangers to violence, pukwudgies rarely travel alone and often anoint their quills or weapons with a custom-brewed poison before entering hostile situations.

Standing about 2 feet tall, a pukwudgie sports sharp quills growing from their head that extends down their back. Their skin tone varies by the region in which they live, ranging from pale gray to brown.

Ofalth.name: 残渣怪 Ofalth

Filth Wallow.name: 粪坑打滚 Filth Wallow
Filth Wallow.description: 当位于垃圾或粪便高度集中的环境，例如垃圾堆或下水道，残渣怪获得快速治疗2。

Wretched Weeps.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

阶段1 携带疾病但无效果 (1天)

阶段2 @Damage[2d4[bleed]]每小时且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1} (1天)

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[bleed]]每小时且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2} (1天)
Wretched Weeps.name: 悲恸脓血症 Wretched Weeps

Refuse Pile.name: 垃圾堆 Refuse Pile
Refuse Pile.description:
当不处于危险中时，残渣怪能花费1分钟时间把自己埋在10尺见方的垃圾堆里，看起来和垃圾融为一体。直到它下次使用动作前，残渣怪在AC上获得+2环境加值。

进入垃圾堆区域或与垃圾堆交互的生物，必须尝试一次豁免对抗残渣怪的恶臭。

Ofalth.publicNotes:
完全成熟的残渣怪会捕捉受害者，然后缓慢地将其生吞活剥。

在城堡粪堆、城市垃圾场和下水道中发现的残渣怪是活的湿垃圾、污水和垃圾的混合物。它们携带一种名为悲恸脓血症的疾病，能导致受害者的血液从毛孔中渗出。

Scarecrow.name: 稻草人 Scarecrow
Scarecrow.publicNotes:
稻草人是被一堆材料捆扎成人形的构装体，外表看起来和普通的稻草人无异，直到它一边吱嘎作响一边缓缓地行动起来。当它开始活动时，它的南瓜头或麻布脑袋会迸发出魔焰，让恐惧蔓在周围的空气中绵延。每个稻草人都是手工绑扎的，具有独特的外观，但大多数都有5到6尺高，由木头、麻布、绳子、稻草、锯末、丢弃的谷壳和玉米棒子、以及类似的材料组合而成，并且都穿着破旧的农夫外衣。这种简陋的结构让稻草人有些脆弱，在战斗中容易折断四肢。然而，它的结构具有很强的适应性，这让它能够将自己的一部分重新塑造成爪子状的肢体，或者干脆抓住自己断裂的身体来攻击敌人。

在创造稻草人时，创造者必须将自己的血滴入它的每只眼睛里。血液会渗透到材料中，这会剥离创造者的一小部分灵魂——这不足以伤害创造者，但足以让稻草人拥有基本的心智。使它能够像一只训练有素（脾气暴躁）的守卫犬一样急切地服从主人的命令。当稻草人被摧毁时，眼睛里会流出血来，但创造者被剥离的那一小部分灵魂就一去不返了。

Scarecrow's Leer.description:
40尺。

稻草人的双眼中飘忽着令人不安的光芒。陷入惊惧的生物只要处于灵光范围内，就无法将@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]状态值减少到1以下。当生物进入灵光范围或在灵光范围内开始它的回合，它必须通过@Check[type:will|dc:18]豁免。鸟和其他鸟类生物在此豁免中有-2环境减值。

大成功 该生物不受影响且在24小时内对此能力临时免疫

成功 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}

失败 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}并且被稻草人@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]，直到它的下一回合结束

大失败 类似失败，但是陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}
Scarecrow's Leer.name: 稻草人的目光 Scarecrow's Leer

Baleful Glow.name: 恶意之光 Baleful Glow
Baleful Glow.description: 稻草人的头顶燃起冰冷且明亮的幽火，在@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]范围内提供明亮光照（在之外20尺范围提供昏暗光照）。如果稻草人在战斗第一轮中使用此能力，任何尚未行动的生物会受到惊吓，对稻草人@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]1轮。它能再次使用此动作来熄灭光照。

Clawing Fear.name: 恐惧之爪 Clawing Fear
Clawing Fear.description: 稻草人的打击对陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]的生物额外造成@Damage[1d6[mental]]伤害。

Mundane Appearance.name: 平平无奇 Mundane Appearance
Mundane Appearance.description: 直到行动之前，稻草人能让自己看起来就像一个普通的稻草人。当它伪装成普通稻草人时，它的欺骗检定结果和欺骗DC自动取32。

Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
Tail Lash.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the river drake's tail uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check.

Effect The river drake attempts to Strike the triggering creature with its tail. If it hits, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash (Attack Roll)}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4HJJdogS751Z04lD]{Effect: Tail Lash (Skill Check)}

Caustic Mucus.name: Caustic Mucus
Caustic Mucus.description:
The river drake spits a ball of caustic mucus up to a range of 50 feet that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true] save). Those that fail this save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,acid]] damage and take a –5-foot status penalty to their Speed. This Speed reduction ends with the persistent acid damage.

The river drake can't use Caustic Mucus again for [[/br 1d6 #Recharge Caustic Mucus]]{1d6 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TbmkcfpKIs558skY]{Effect: Caustic Mucus}

Draconic Frenzy.description: The river drake makes one Fangs Strike and two Tail Strikes in any order.
Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy

Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
Speed Surge.description:
Frequency three times per day;

Effect The river drake Strides or Flies twice.

River Drake.name: River Drake
River Drake.publicNotes:
Although the glistening scales and sleek, fin-like wings on these drakes give them an appearance reminiscent of river fish, they are actually distant relatives of the dragons that rule the oceans. While smaller than most drakes, river drakes are more than capable of plaguing river travelers and are equally at home above and below the water's surface. This flexibility allows them to catch a wide variety of prey, from fish and boggards to deer and the occasional ferry passenger.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct, drakes are draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of the primal dragons they share evolutionary roots with. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties—small social groups fittingly called "rampages"—makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them with their formidable jaws and thickscaled tails to use in close combat. Most drakes would rather avoid this, however, preferring to use their magical breath to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

Different species of drakes rarely come into conflict. Part of this is their distinct habitats, but drakes are open to negotiating simple agreements between rampages. This courtesy does not extend to dragonets, which drakes happily take as prey. Solitary tamed drakes are also excluded from such agreements and considered free game if their tamer isn't strong enough to protect them.

Drake Eggs

While drake hides aren't any more valuable than those of similarly sized creatures, drake eggs are prized commodities. They are used as components in powerful spells as well as eaten by various cultures, but the most common use for drake eggs is hatching and rearing drakes to serve as mounts and guardians.

A typical drake lays a clutch of 2d4 eggs every 5 years. Eggs hatch within 3 to 6 weeks, during which time they must be kept in conditions appropriate to their natural environment, perhaps the most difficult aspect of drake husbandry. While it is generally easy for breeders to incubate the eggs of desert or jungle drakes (which require mildly warm temperatures to hatch) or river drakes (which must be submerged in running water), the eggs of flame and frost drakes require extreme temperatures in order to hatch, which can be difficult to replicate safely.

A drake egg is an object with Hardness 3, 5 HP, and no Broken Threshold. The coloration of drake eggs varies only slightly from one species to the next. A creature must succeed at a @Check[type:nature|dc:20] check, or a relevant DC 20 Lore check, to identify the drake species of a specific egg.

Once a drake hatches, they imprint on the first creature that they see. A creature imprinted on in this way can use Nature to Train and Command that drake. The market price of a drake egg varies depending on the type of drake and the exact legal situation. Because drakes are dangerous and intelligent creatures, many societies do not condone the trade of drake eggs and criminalize those who engage in it.

It takes 2 years for a drake hatchling to grow to full size. A well-trained drake can make a fearsome mount or guardian, but many careless would-be drake trainers are devoured by their charges.

Ice Linnorm.name: Ice Linnorm
Ice Linnorm.publicNotes:
The ice linnorm dwells amid glacial crevasses, atop wind-blasted mountain peaks, or within glittering caverns carved from the hearts of the mightiest of icebergs.

Immense, primeval dragons of the northern reaches of the world, linnorms hate those they deem to be lesser creatures and seek to inflict as much suffering as possible upon their unfortunate victims. While these serpentine monstrosities might not be the powerful winged dragons most imagine, they nonetheless possess incredible strength and deadly powers that often rival authentic dragon brutality.
Ice Linnorm.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Curse of Frost.name: Curse of Frost
Curse of Frost.description:
When a creature slays the ice linnorm, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:40] save or gain weakness to cold 15 with an unlimited duration.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.sI73mEP9wZRvMpWw]{Effect: Curse of Frost}

Ice Linnorm Venom.name: Ice Linnorm Venom
Ice Linnorm Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[5d6[cold]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round);

Stage 2 @Damage[7d6[cold]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Icemire Breath.description:
The ice linnorm spews out a blast of freezing, viscous ooze in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] that deals @Damage[15d6[cold]] damage to creatures within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:38|basic:true] save).

The freezing ooze clings to those struck and hardens into thick sheets of ice. A creature that fails the saving throw is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the ice until it succeeds at a check to [[/act escape dc=34]] or it or an ally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Forces Open} the ice (DC 34 for either case). At the start of its turn, a creature still immobilized by the ice takes @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage. Another creature can free a frozen target by dealing a total of 20 fire damage to the frozen target. Left unattended, the ice crumbles away in 1 minute on its own.

Creatures with the fire trait can't be frozen in place by Icemire Breath. Flying creatures fall if frozen, and swimming creatures that are frozen rise toward the surface of the water at a speed of 60 feet per round.

The linnorm can't use Icemire Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Icemire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Icemire Breath.name: Icemire Breath

Omen Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Omen Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)

Destiny Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a translucent mist of potentialities that overwhelms creatures with visions of possible features, dealing @Damage[15d6[mental]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:will|dc:39] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) as it struggles with the visions.

The dragon can't use Destiny Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Destiny Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Destiny Breath.name: Destiny Breath

Impending Fate.description: The dragon's attacks bring their foes closer to their eventual fates. When the dragon critically hits with a Strike or a creature critically fails against the dragon's Destiny Breath, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}, or increases its doomed value by 1 if it was already doomed.
Impending Fate.name: Impending Fate

Prophetic Wings.description:
The dragon or any ally can glimpse into the future through the dragon's wings in a process that requires 10 minutes of concentration. This casts a 8th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} spell, except that the wings can predict results up to 1 year into the future and the dragon always speaks a few cryptic words related to the result of the prediction.

The dragon can use their wings in this way only once per day, and a given creature can seek a future in the wings only once per week.
Prophetic Wings.name: Prophetic Wings

Walk the Timelines.name: Walk the Timelines
Walk the Timelines.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The dragon splits themself into two versions with different fates. Each copy Strides or Flies from the dragon's current space, then takes a single action. If the actions are both attacks, they use the same multiple attack penalty and count as one attack toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty.

After both actions, the dragon chooses one of the two locations as their actual destination and the other version of themself disappears.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Challenge Fate.name: Challenge Fate
Challenge Fate.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack;

Effect This fate is not set in stone. The attacker rolls the triggering attack twice and uses the worse result.

Untethered to Fate.name: Untethered to Fate
Untethered to Fate.description: The dragon can choose to negate any fortune or misfortune effects that would affect them; other creatures remain affected normally.

Omen Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Fate is a fickle matter on Golarion. Even with prophecy broken on the world, there are ways to look to the immediate future or acquire a vague sense of long-term events. Omen dragons are bound to see the future—nebulous though it might be—at all times. Visions of the future hound them like a quiet song that never stops playing in their minds. While an omen dragon can focus on or ignore the music of fate at any time, the song plays all the same. At a glance, omen dragons resemble other occult dragons in appearance, save for the mirror-like interior membrane of their wings. An omen dragon's wings offer glimpses into the future. These glimpses are cloudy and vague, but generally correct, if only technically. Omen dragons have a natural compulsion to share the futures they see. These dragons have no compunctions about what the visions show and share their knowledge equally with innocent villagers as they do with wicked tyrants.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Omen Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

Crocodile.name: 鳄鱼 Crocodile

Death Roll.description:
需求 目标生物已经被鳄鱼@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]

效果 鳄鱼翻转全身，试图把目标扭断，对受擒的目标进行1次颚咬打击，此打击的攻击检定有+2环境加值。如果打击命中，则目标@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。如果失败，则放开目标。
Death Roll.name: 死亡翻滚 Death Roll

Deep Breath.name: 闭气 Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: 鳄鱼能屏住呼吸长达2小时之久。

Crocodile.publicNotes:
人们常发现鳄鱼在河岸上晒太阳，在沼泽潜伏，或者在湖里漂着。从远处看，它们通常与浮木没有区别——至少在它们发起攻击之前是这样的。短吻鳄也用类似的数据，但是因为它们通常生活在温带气候中，能更好地忍受低温。与短吻鳄不同的是，鳄鱼能忍受咸水。它们都是可怕的食肉动物，很可能会吞食那些粗心大意、没有注意脚下的冒险者。

鳄鱼强大且具有原始的外表，是危险的天然掠食者，栖息在沼泽、河流、池塘和其他湿地。

Iron Warden.publicNotes:
传统上来说，铁卫士是精湛技艺的产物，它们会被打造为巨大盔甲或强大动物的外形。它们的铰链关节和坚固的装甲外壳都需要精密的制造工艺，并且还需要定期清洗和上油来确保它们不会生锈。只要不被多事的冒险者破坏的话，铁卫士可以保持良好的状态数千年，并被世代相传。除了难以置信的力量之外，铁卫士还拥有强大的毒气吐息，通常足以消灭整支队伍。

虽然铁卫士令人印象深刻的身躯使它们无法不显眼，但它们经常被放置在容易被误认为是装饰品的地方。铁卫士可能隐藏在装饰性的盔甲中，也可能伪装成城市广场上的雕像。有时，当地人会感到震惊，因为他们以为是历史地标的东西，在某个未知神秘指令的召唤下变成了铁卫士。

传说中例如吉斯提卡帝国（Jistka Imperium）这样的古代文明，曾创造出巨大体型的铁卫士。这些构装体大多已被熔化以获取资源，但魔法师和历史学家仍在追寻这些失落巨像的传闻。

Shield Arm.description: 铁卫士的手臂上有一面盾牌，它可以被当作钢盾（+2AC，硬度5）使用。因为其是铁卫士的一部分，所有超过硬度的伤害只会造成给铁卫士。
Shield Arm.name: 盾臂 Shield Arm

Breath Poison.name: 喷毒 Breath Poison
Breath Poison.description:
铁卫士以占据方格的一角为中心，向@Template[type:burst|distance:10]范围喷出毒气。毒气持续到铁卫士下回合开始。任何在区域内（或之后进入区域）的生物将暴露在铁卫士毒中。

铁卫士不能在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Poison]]{1d4轮}内再次使用喷毒。

Inexorable March.name: 无阻行军 Inexorable March
Inexorable March.description: 铁卫士以至多其速度行走，向后推离路径空间上的所有生物，如果他们试图阻止其移动，就会受到伤害。一个生物可以尝试通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:37]豁免来阻挡其前进。如果豁免大成功，则阻挡的生物不受伤害；在其他情况下该生物受到如同铁卫士拳头命中的伤害。

Iron Warden Poison.name: 铁卫士毒 Iron Warden Poison
Iron Warden Poison.description:
此毒素造成的流失状态值每小时减少1点。

豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:33]

最大持续时间 4轮

阶段1 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1} (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[4d6[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2} (1轮)

阶段3 @Damage[8d6[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 3} (1轮)

Iron Warden.name: 铁卫士 Iron Warden

Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair a frost drake's vision; they ignore @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} from snowfall.

Retaliatory Strike.name: Retaliatory Strike
Retaliatory Strike.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the frost drake's tail successfully damages the frost drake with a Strike

Effect The frost drake attempts to Strike with their tail. If the Strike hits, it deals an additional 1d6 damage.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The frost drake makes two Fangs Strikes and one Tail Strike in any order.

Freezing Mist Breath.name: Freezing Mist Breath
Freezing Mist Breath.description:
The frost drake spits a ball of liquid up to 60 feet that explodes into a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] cloud of freezing mist. Those in the burst take @Damage[8d6[cold]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true] save).

The frost drake can't use Freezing Mist Breath again for [[/br 1d6 #Recharge Freezing Mist Breath]]{1d6 rounds}, during which the mist cakes all surfaces in the area with a sheet of slippery ice that turns the area into difficult terrain.

Ice Climb.name: Ice Climb
Ice Climb.description: A frost drake isn't impeded by difficult terrain caused by snow or ice, nor do they need to attempt Acrobatics checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.

Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
Speed Surge.description:
Frequency three times per day;

Effect The frost drake Strides or Flies twice.

Frost Drake.name: Frost Drake
Frost Drake.publicNotes:
Frost drakes pose an immense danger in the frozen reaches they call home, where they roam far and wide to hunt for prey such as caribou, wolves, small bears, tundra-dwelling people, and even lone frost giants. These drakes take advantage of long distances to hide from the repercussions of their actions, as they are usually among the most depraved and openly malicious of the drakes. They are also especially insolent and are less likely to back down from a fight compared to other drakes. Many frost drakes have met their ends trying to enact cruelties beyond their means, such as singly taking on a frost giant clan or well-fortified township.

Frost drakes hunt alone more often than other drakes, due to a scarcity of prey and simple temperament. Although a single frost drake can wreak much destruction on their own, tales of village-dwelling northerners banding together to defend their homes from these rogue menaces are fairly common.

A frost drake's hunting grounds are quite large. Those frost drakes that live upon the permanently frozen peaks of high mountains have been known to swoop down to snatch up prey from the lowlands, leaving frozen swaths of earth from their breath as the only sign of their passing. Their frostcovered scales range from deep royal blue to crisp cyan and sometimes feature sporadic patches of violet. Their hides are thinner than most drakes'; when a frost drake is inhaling in preparation to launch their signature frozen breath, the monster's ice-blue blood can be seen beneath their scales.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct, drakes are draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of the primal dragons they share evolutionary roots with. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties—small social groups fittingly called "rampages"—makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them with their formidable jaws and thickscaled tails to use in close combat. Most drakes would rather avoid this, however, preferring to use their magical breath to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

Different species of drakes rarely come into conflict. Part of this is their distinct habitats, but drakes are open to negotiating simple agreements between rampages. This courtesy does not extend to dragonets, which drakes happily take as prey. Solitary tamed drakes are also excluded from such agreements and considered free game if their tamer isn't strong enough to protect them.

Drake Eggs

While drake hides aren't any more valuable than those of similarly sized creatures, drake eggs are prized commodities. They are used as components in powerful spells as well as eaten by various cultures, but the most common use for drake eggs is hatching and rearing drakes to serve as mounts and guardians.

A typical drake lays a clutch of 2d4 eggs every 5 years. Eggs hatch within 3 to 6 weeks, during which time they must be kept in conditions appropriate to their natural environment, perhaps the most difficult aspect of drake husbandry. While it is generally easy for breeders to incubate the eggs of desert or jungle drakes (which require mildly warm temperatures to hatch) or river drakes (which must be submerged in running water), the eggs of flame and frost drakes require extreme temperatures in order to hatch, which can be difficult to replicate safely.

A drake egg is an object with Hardness 3, 5 HP, and no Broken Threshold. The coloration of drake eggs varies only slightly from one species to the next. A creature must succeed at a @Check[type:nature|dc:20] check, or a relevant DC 20 Lore check, to identify the drake species of a specific egg.

Once a drake hatches, they imprint on the first creature that they see. A creature imprinted on in this way can use Nature to Train and Command that drake. The market price of a drake egg varies depending on the type of drake and the exact legal situation. Because drakes are dangerous and intelligent creatures, many societies do not condone the trade of drake eggs and criminalize those who engage in it.

It takes 2 years for a drake hatchling to grow to full size. A well-trained drake can make a fearsome mount or guardian, but many careless would-be drake trainers are devoured by their charges.

Giant Centipede.publicNotes:
巨蜈蚣（在城市里发现时被称为下水道蜈蚣）会组成小群，但狩猎的时候会单独行动。驯化巨型蜈蚣作为守护者或宠物的尝试通常都会以失败告终，但一些地精、狗头人和螨精部落已经有方法利用这些害虫来守卫家园。其他部落和一些人形生物会把蜈蚣烤来吃，佐以巨量的辣椒作为美味佳肴。不过在准备这一餐的时候必须小心，不能让蜈蚣的毒液污染它的肉。

作为猎手和食腐动物，蜈蚣生活在粪便和碎石中，它们冒险家们经常面对的威胁。蜈蚣长而多节的身体上长着数十条腿，它们以惊人的速度四处乱窜，用有毒的虫颚攻击猎物，用恶毒的毒素折磨猎物，然后慢慢地用令人作呕的动作进食。

Giant Centipede Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d4[poison]]伤害 (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[1d4[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] (1轮)

阶段3 @Damage[1d4[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw] (1轮)
Giant Centipede Venom.name: 巨蜈蚣毒 Giant Centipede Venom

Giant Centipede.name: 巨蜈蚣 Giant Centipede

Hobgoblin Soldier.name: Hobgoblin Soldier
Hobgoblin Soldier.publicNotes:
Soldiers make up the bulk of hobgoblin society, whether that society is a village or a military unit.

Hobgoblins may appear to outsiders to be the most civilized of goblinkind, but their civilization is hardly one of kindness and equality-instead, they revel in all that is militaristic, tyrannical, cruel, and destructive. Hobgoblins are singularly devoted to war, and their entire culture is built upon fostering and maintaining conflict while simultaneously proving their superiority in battle. Hobgoblins are highly organized, and they work efficiently and effectively in groups, whether that group is a small raiding party, a roving war band, or a fully regimented army. Hobgoblin rulers require little provocation before declaring war, and more often than not, such wars are waged to gain slaves or territory. Physically, hobgoblins stand about as tall as humans and have gray, ashen skin.

Hobgoblin society is organized along military lines, and every hobgoblin is effectively a member of the army. Each hobgoblin in a community has a rank in the military hierarchy, and individuals are naturally ambitious and obsessed with advancement. Hobgoblins are constantly expected to prove that they're fearless, ruthless, cunning, and strong. Demonstrating such aptitudes is an individual hobgoblin's best hope for promotion through the ranks, but failure leads only to cruel exploitation at the hands of their superiors. Though brutal, hobgoblin society is a true meritocracy, and all hobgoblins, regardless of age, gender, or birth, wield authority and earn respect from their peers based on their skill in battle. Even those individuals who serve in non-combat roles in hobgoblin society-blacksmiths, builders, cooks, messengers, quartermasters, and the like-know that they perform vital jobs that support the larger hobgoblin army, though they rarely rise above the rank of common soldier. Everyone contributes to the larger whole, ensuring that hobgoblin society is the strongest and most efficient it can be, and anyone who fails to do so is culled from the army and this hobgoblin society as dead weight. Hobgoblins don't usually engage in trade with other races, or even with other hobgoblin tribes, preferring to take what they want by force.

Formation.name: Formation
Formation.description: When it's adjacent to at least two other allies, the hobgoblin soldier gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.

Vilderavn.name: 黑鸦爵 Vilderavn
Vilderavn.publicNotes: 黑鸦爵的真实形态是一只翼展达6-8尺的巨大渡鸦。他们是变化多端的变形者，可以变身为咆哮的狼，狼和渡鸦的混合种，以及身着黑色护甲，手持巨剑的高大类人生物作为战斗形态。更可怕的是，他们还能变成类人伪装，以便混入自大的凡人统治者的随从中。他们利用历史知识和巧妙的谣言将骄傲的统治者们引向争吵，仇恨，最终引发战争。黑鸦爵留在统治者身边，直到胜利在望，然后进行残忍的背叛。他们的魔法能让凡人自相残杀，而黑鸦爵的剑也会迅速斩下。

Aura of Disquietude.name: 不安灵光 Aura of Disquietude
Aura of Disquietude.description:
30尺。@Check[type:will|dc:35]豁免。

如同恐怖威压，外加被该灵光惊惧的生物会变得疑神疑鬼；他不将任何其他生物视为盟友，并且也不能协助或者夹击。在大失败时，该生物还不能成为无害或者有益法术的自愿目标。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Bloodbird.name: 嗜血之鸟 Bloodbird
Bloodbird.description:
被黑鸦爵的近战攻击命中的生物将会被诅咒。它受到@Damage[2d6[bleed]]伤害，并且难以止血。

用于停止流血的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]DC为35，并且将该生物治疗至满生命值并不能自动结束流血。

移除该诅咒将结束流血。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
黑鸦爵变为小型或中性类人生物，狼，恐狼，兼具狼与渡鸦的混合种。黑鸦爵在有狼头的形态下只能使用颚攻击，在具有渡鸦特征的形态下只能使用鸟攻击。它可以改为伪装成渡鸦骑士形态：一个穿着黑色全身甲，携带巨剑的中型类人生物。它只能在具有相应身体部分的形态下使用颚或鸟爪打击，只能在骑士形态下使用巨剑打击。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Souleater.description:
如果黑鸦爵使用其颚打击重击杀死了一个类人生物，作为此次攻击的一部分，它会撕裂并且吞噬目标的心与魂。

当目标死亡时，黑鸦爵可以变身成目标的形态，在乔装成目标的欺骗检定中获得+4状态加值。

如果魔法将使该目标复活，施法者必须成功通过一个DC 34的反制检定来将目标的灵魂从黑鸦爵那抽取出来；否则法术失败。
Souleater.name: 噬魂者 Souleater

Arbiter.publicNotes:
These spherical aeons are scouts and diplomats. Found throughout the multiverse, they have traditionally kept watch over chaos and its agents. With the announcement of the Convergence, many arbiters now serve as go-betweens among the aeon alliance and its mortal associates.

Aeons have always been the caretakers of reality and defenders of the natural order of balance. Each type of aeon takes on some form of duality in its manifestation and works either to shape the multiverse within the aspects of this duality in some way, or to correct imbalances to the perfect order of existence. Aeons' machinations can raise a nation, raze it, or restore it from ruin. Their reasons are their own, and they rarely share their motivations with others—through their strange envisioning mode of communication, they simply create the results they insist are necessary to maintain the balance of the multiverse.

As a result of recent shifts in reality, aeons have begun to reassert a presence in the perfect planar city of Axis. To aeons, this is merely the latest in a recurring cycle, albeit one that mortals have not yet borne witness to. Aeons have a name for this cyclic return, in which they welcome their industrious axiomite brethren back to their fold: the Convergence. At the onset of the Convergence, a council of pleroma aeons appeared in the Eternal City of Axis, where they revealed that axiomites were wayward aeons, split off long ago to pursue the act of creation. With the latest cycle of change, it was time for axiomites—and their mortal creations and kin—to rejoin the aeon cause. While most axiomites fell in line, realizing perhaps on a fundamental level of reality that what the aeons said was the truth, some refused to heed the call and waited for the wrath of the aeons. That wrath has yet to come. The dual-natured aeons have responded to those who have declined in confusing ways. With some they treat and even bargain, while a handful of others they have destroyed, and a few have been exterminated by the axiomites. But most of these quiet insurgents they leave alone, allowing these axiomites to continue to create in peace. How—or if—this Convergence will end is as little understood as aeons themselves.
Arbiter.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Locate Aeon.name: Locate Aeon
Locate Aeon.description: An arbiter can always sense the direction of the nearest non-arbiter aeon on the plane, but it can't sense the range to the aeon.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Electrical Burst.name: Electrical Burst
Electrical Burst.description: The arbiter releases an electrical burst from its body that deals @Damage[3d6[electricity]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save. The arbiter is then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} for 24 hours.

Arbiter.name: Arbiter

Jaathoom.name: 气巨灵 Jaathoom
Jaathoom.publicNotes:
拥有着气元素本身的所有精妙与高雅，气元素位面的气巨灵在梦境，噩梦和时间中行动。

在凡人有史之前，巨灵是物质宇宙中最早拥有自由意志的造物之一。他们由元素物质组成，他们行遍物质宇宙和六大元素位面：气、土、火、金、水还有木。随着时间的推移，留在每个元素位面的巨灵发现他们的物质被这些元素所取代。金元素的金巨灵和木元素的木巨灵则见元素之怒。

巨灵长老 Genie Shuyookhs

更年长、更睿智、更强大的巨灵拥有更大的权力，被尊称为长老（通常而言，如果巨灵是女性，被称为“女长老”，如果巨灵是男性，则被称为“男长老”）。一般来说，长老至少比同族典型范例高5级，并且可以获得额外的法术。长老的基本知识见边栏，并在元素之怒中有进一步的详细介绍。

他们最神奇的力量是每年实现三次愿望的能力。这并非与生俱来的能力，而是通过流传已久的仪式作法来尝试复现小巨灵那实现愿望的能力。

Cloud of Visions.description:
60尺。

气巨灵拥有60尺的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]，但只能展示图像而不能说话。
Cloud of Visions.name: 幻象之云 Cloud of Visions

Naturally Invisible.description: 气巨灵总是@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]的，而当他采取任何敌对动作时，他会从无踪变为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]状态直到下回合开始，因为他的的模糊轮廓短时间内变得隐约可见。
Naturally Invisible.name: 天生隐形 Naturally Invisible

Turbulent Skies.description:
20尺。

旋风使得弥漫范围内所有方格对于行走和飞行中的生物视作困难地形。具有气特征的生物免疫此效果。

气巨灵可以使用一个具有专注特征的单动作来启动或停用此灵光。
Turbulent Skies.name: 气旋之空 Turbulent Skies

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
气巨灵变形成为一个小型或中型气元素或飞行动物，例如猫头鹰。这不会影响气巨灵的数据，但会改变其打击的伤害类型。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Hurricane Blast.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 气巨灵将处于其喧哗之空灵光内所有没有气特征的生物直线远离，顺时针或逆时针移动20尺。如果生物成功通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]豁免可以避免被移动。
Hurricane Blast.name: 飓风冲击 Hurricane Blast

Ominous Dreams.name: 预兆之梦 Ominous Dreams
Ominous Dreams.description:
气巨灵将一个预知梦送入10尺内一个睡眠中生物的心智中。非自愿生物如果成功通过一次@Check[type:will|dc:23]豁免可以避免此幻象。

气巨灵选择梦的主题，但不能是明确的事件。目标可以看到一场与该主题相关的未来幻象，具有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]的效果。如果结果为凶或吉且凶，生物会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}，且直到醒来前惊惧效果才会开始恢复。

Ifrit.name: 火巨灵 Ifrit
Ifrit.publicNotes:
火巨灵是来自火元素位面的可憎无情的巨灵，在火元素位面他们建造了大都会和巨型贸易中心，吸引来了多元宇宙各处的跨位面旅客。许多火巨灵暴虐好战，他们大多使用强大的力量来实现自己的目标。

在凡人有史之前，巨灵是物质宇宙中最早拥有自由意志的造物之一。他们由元素物质组成，他们行遍物质宇宙和六大元素位面：气、土、火、金、水还有木。随着时间的推移，留在每个元素位面的巨灵发现他们的物质被这些元素所取代。金元素的金巨灵和木元素的木巨灵则见元素之怒。

巨灵长老 Genie Shuyookhs

更年长、更睿智、更强大的巨灵拥有更大的权力，被尊称为长老（通常而言，如果巨灵是女性，被称为“女长老”，如果巨灵是男性，则被称为“男长老”）。一般来说，长老至少比同族典型范例高5级，并且可以获得额外的法术。长老的基本知识见边栏，并在元素之怒中有进一步的详细介绍。

他们最神奇的力量是每年实现三次愿望的能力。这并非与生俱来的能力，而是通过流传已久的仪式作法来尝试复现小巨灵那实现愿望的能力。

Burning Grasp.name: 燃烧之握 Burning Grasp
Burning Grasp.description: 当火巨灵@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]一个生物时，该生物受到@Damage[2d6[fire]]伤害，并在其每个回合结束时受到2d6火焰伤害直到其逃脱。

Combat Grab.name: 战斗擒获 Combat Grab
Combat Grab.description:
需求 火巨灵有一只空手

效果 火巨灵进行一次近战打击。如果打击命中，目标@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于火巨灵的空手。

Wings of Flame.description:
火巨灵背后长出燃烧的巨翼。他获得35尺飞行速度，持续1分钟。火焰也在火巨灵@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]范围内创造一道灵光。

任何在灵光范围内结束回合的生物承受@Damage[2d6[fire]]伤害，进行@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true]豁免。
Wings of Flame.name: 火焰之翼 Wings of Flame

Final Blasphemy.description:
当叛教尸被摧毁时，它爆裂成一股虚能，效果等同于3动作版的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]）。

因叛教尸已被摧毁，所以它不会从这个伤害术的效果中获得任何生命值，也不需要保有任何可用的伤害术来发动该技能。
Final Blasphemy.name: 最后的亵渎 Final Blasphemy

Heretic's Smite.name: 异端斩 Heretic's Smite
Heretic's Smite.description: 当它携带着生前信奉神祇的偏好武器时（对于前法莱斯玛叛教尸来说，是匕首），叛教尸的打击会对具有圣洁（Holy）特征的生物造成额外1d6精魂伤害。

Herexen.name: 叛教尸 Herexen
Herexen.publicNotes:
当一位牧师背叛了他的神明并在渎神之怒的控制下死去时，他们在生前犯下的亵渎之罪会促使他们转变成不死生物叛教尸。叛教尸们试图向他们曾经崇拜的神复仇，玷污庙宇，杀死信徒，聚集次级不死生物和崇拜死亡的邪教徒来协助它们进行不洁的任务。虽然叛教尸的神赐能力大部分都被腐化为卑劣的不死形态，但它们仍然顽固地依靠着它们先前力量的残余，仍然施展并挥舞着他们如此鄙视的神所青睐的魔法和武器。

一群亵渎了同一个神祇的叛教尸有时会联合起来组成一个以嘲弄为目的圣会，以近乎狂喜的方式进行亵渎仪式。这些圣会通常是由一个亵渎神明的邪教（中的成员们）组成，他们生前一起践行他们的异端邪说，并一同赴死。但也有一些是由先前的信仰相同的落单叛教尸聚集到了一起所组成。

Ogre Boss.name: Ogre Boss
Ogre Boss.publicNotes:
In ogre society, might makes more than right—it makes the rules. The strongest or most violent ogre in a family (in most cases, this is the same ogre) is invariably that family's boss. Quick to hook fallen foes on their weapons, even other ogres fear the repercussions of displeasing an ogre boss. When an ogre boss barks out commands, the other members of the family move quickly to obey.

For many societies, ogres embody brutish, amoral violence and greedy cruelty. Standing 10 feet tall and densely muscled, ogres are usually as strong as they are vicious. The worst ogres are sadists, enjoying remorseless murder, torture, and violence in all of its forms. Although they prefer to vent their violent urges on other humanoids—the smaller the better—ogre captivity can end in a horrifying fate for anyone unlucky enough to fall within their meaty grasp: becoming dinner. But for all their creativity in inflicting pain, ogres often forget that their playthings lack their own robust fortitude and high pain tolerance, and many of their captives die sooner than the ogres might prefer. Meanwhile, those who manage to survive captivity in an ogre's larder often emerge with lasting mental scars. A captive able to keep their wits about them, however, can sometimes trick the brutes by promising treasure, more plentiful food sources, or other crude amusements, taking advantage of an ogre's often-limited intellect to engineer opportunities to escape or gain revenge.

Ogres are social creatures only in the most debased sense. They gather together in groups called families, though members are not always related by blood. The most powerful ogre in any family is the "boss"—usually the family's patriarch or matriarch—whom the other ogres in the family learn to quickly obey or risk being brutalized by the boss's loyal kin. Ogres lair in caves, crumbling ruins, or dilapidated shacks close enough to humanoid settlements or animal trails to make raiding easy. Their lairs are filthy and frequently contain all-too-recognizable evidence of their depravity, along with assorted treasures stolen from past captives.

Bellowing Command.name: Bellowing Command
Bellowing Command.description: The ogre boss issues a command to hasten their fellows. Each ogre ally who hears and understands this command becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of that ally's next turn but can use the extra action only to Step or Stride.

Sweeping Hook.name: Sweeping Hook
Sweeping Hook.description:
Trigger The ogre boss successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trips} a creature using an ogre hook

Effect The ogre boss makes an ogre hook Strike against the creature they tripped.

Terotricus.name: 枯萎黏菌 Terotricus
Terotricus.publicNotes:
传说中的枯萎黏菌是一种巨大的黏菌，自外层裂隙（the Outer Rifts）降临。它们的集体意识会随着不断增长的孢子云，逐渐扩散并覆盖整个区域。一旦从外层裂隙来到物质宇宙，枯萎黏菌会试图把所有活物变成养料，让它们感染其孢子，它的存在可以给任何挡路的生物带来灭顶之灾。

枯萎黏菌通过快速伸缩它们粘滑的“身体”来移动，它们能在土壤里掘洞，在水中滑行，在陡峭的斜坡上攀爬。这些腐烂的庞然大物并不需要通过这种旅行方式来实现它们吞噬一切的计划；它们的孢子很容易附着在恶魔和其他外层裂隙的居民身上，当这些魔族被召唤时，孢子就很容易被带到物质宇宙。

当枯萎黏菌感染一个生物时，网状的真菌会在受害者的皮肤上生长，并直至覆盖整个身体。此时连受害者的思想也会屈服于枯萎黏菌的意志。枯萎黏菌偏爱的受害者包括动物、精灵和精类，尽管其实它很乐意感染任何它能感染的生物。毁木者教派（Cults of Treerazer）偶尔会尝试和枯萎黏菌接触，这种行为几乎总是会产生一个新的崇拜孢子枯萎的奴隶教派。
Terotricus.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 120 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊） 120尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 120 feet

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Regeneration 25 (Deactivated by Cold).name: 再生25（寒冷使其失效） Regeneration 25 (Deactivated by Cold)

Spore Cloud.name: 孢子云 Spore Cloud
Spore Cloud.description:
30尺。

一个生物进入灵光范围或在灵光中开始它的回合则暴露在孢子枯萎的效果下。

Infest Environs.name: 感染周围 Infest Environs
Infest Environs.description:
频率 每天一次

需求 枯萎黏菌位于沼泽或森林区域

效果 枯萎黏菌从附近的树木和灌木中吸取养分，同时用真菌感染它们。@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]范围内的所有非魔法植物（不包括植物生物）都会枯萎，取而代之的是大量恶心的霉菌和粘滑的蘑菇，并且移除树木和灌木丛提供的任何掩蔽和隐蔽。枯萎黏菌治疗自身@Damage[200[healing]]生命值（这是一个治疗命能效果）。

Spore Blight.name: 孢子枯萎 Spore Blight
Spore Blight.description:
植物和真菌免疫此能力。

豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:40]

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2} (1天)

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 4}且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} (1天)

阶段3 被枯萎黏菌@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]控制 (如同@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]；[[/br 5d8 #Duration Controlled]]{5d8天})

阶段4 死亡

Improved Push 20 feet.name: 精通推离20尺 Improved Push 20 feet

Sticky Spores.name: 粘性孢子 Sticky Spores
Sticky Spores.description:
被枯萎黏菌的孢子击中的生物，其所有速度会承受-10尺状态减值，持续一分钟。如果该打击造成重击，则生物还将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]状态直到[[/act escape dc=40]]{逃脱（DC 40）}。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.g4CRjb2zS1pkVDbk]{效果：粘性孢子}

Pusk.name: Pusk
Pusk.publicNotes:
Among the lowest and least powerful of all demons, the wretched pusks are just as vicious and cruel as their more powerful brethren. They happily vent their frustrations on anything weaker than themselves.

Born from the souls of the slothful, these demons appear vaguely humanoid in appearance with awkward limbs and slack lumps of skin hanging from their frames. Supposedly, a single slothful soul of sufficient depravity and strength can spawn an entire horde of these creatures. However, as weaker demons, their lot in life is to suffer at the hands of more powerful Abyssal predators, and only a tiny number of pusks ever manage to become something more. For this reason, pusks are quite accommodating when summoned by mortals. They're usually content to work under conditions few other fiends would accept, although they'll still gladly turn on even the kindest of masters who show even the slightest hint of weakness.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.

Sloth.name: Sloth
Sloth.description:
When a pusk regains their actions, roll [[/br 1d4 #Actions Regained]]{1d4}. The pusk regains that many actions for the turn (to a maximum of 3, or 2 if the pusk is a minion).

Effects like the slowed condition can further reduce their number of actions.

Vicious Criticals.description: A pusk makes the most of any weakness it finds. Whenever a pusk scores a critical hit with its claw Strike, the target takes an additional @Damage[1d6[bleed]]{1d6 persistent bleed} damage.
Vicious Criticals.name: Vicious Criticals

Cower.name: Cower
Cower.description: The pusk makes itself as small as possible, protecting its vital organs with its limbs. It gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC but takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls. This lasts until the pusk moves from its current space, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or ends the effect as a free action.

Frenzied Slashes.name: Frenzied Slashes
Frenzied Slashes.description: The pusk makes three claw Strikes, each at a –2 penalty, all targeting the same creature. The pusk's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it has made all three attacks. The pusk gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} condition until the beginning of its next turn.

Elemental Avalanche.name: Elemental Avalanche
Elemental Avalanche.publicNotes:
Stubborn and ponderous, elemental avalanches are massive beings of living rock and dirt. Once their ire is raised, they will take the shortest route to resolving the problem, usually by burying it in rock.

Earth elementals make excellent bodyguards for adventuresome spelunkers and are ideal protectors of important subterranean locations such as vaults and treasuries.

Earthbound.name: Earthbound
Earthbound.description: When not touching solid ground, the elemental avalanche is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, can't use reactions, and can't Trample.

Crumble.description:
Trigger The elemental avalanche takes damage from a hostile source while atop rock or earth

Effect The elemental avalanche crumbles into the ground, Burrowing down 20 feet. This Burrowing does not trigger reactions.

The elemental avalanche can't Crumble again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Crumble]]{1d4 rounds}.
Crumble.name: Crumble

Spike Stones.name: Spike Stones
Spike Stones.description:
10 feet.

Spikes of rock rise up from all stone surfaces in the emanation, creating difficult terrain. A creature moving in the terrain takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage for each square of spikes it moves into (a Large or larger creature takes damage only once for each square it moves, even if its space covers multiple squares of spikes). Creatures with the earth trait ignore all effects within the area.

The elemental avalanche can disable or activate this aura using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The elemental avalanche can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the elemental avalanche moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Grinding Stones.name: Grinding Stones
Grinding Stones.description: The elemental avalanche deals @Damage[4d12[bludgeoning]] damage to each @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} creature within the elemental's melee reach with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true] save.

Envyspawn.name: Envyspawn

Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.description:
A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Scent]

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Sinful Bite.name: Sinful Bite
Sinful Bite.description:
A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

Critical Success Unaffected

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure sickened 2 plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute

Envyspawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords—each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today, sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind.

Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, with slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue.

Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold, while envyspawn appear even more gaunt than the rest of their kin.
Envyspawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental

Empyreal Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
The three major celestial planes—Heaven, Nirvana, and Elysium—each have their own respective dragons. Empyreal dragons have a direct connection to Heaven. Using the blessings of Heaven, empyreal dragons protect others and intercede against wickedness. Empyreal dragons are wise, considerate, and compassionate. When speaking with others, empyreal dragons are patient and understanding.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.
Empyreal Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Divine Deflection.name: Divine Deflection
Divine Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect Divine power intercedes, preventing some of the damage. The dragon gains resistance 10 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Inspiring Presence.name: Inspiring Presence
