Inspiring Presence.description:
60 feet.

The mere sight of an empyreal dragon motivates other creatures. Creatures within the aura gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws and skill checks. The empyreal dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.

Direct Halo.name: Direct Halo
Direct Halo.description: The dragon tosses their halo to a square within 90 feet. While the halo is deployed in this way, the dragon loses their inspiring presence aura, and the aura instead emanates from the halo with the same emanation radius. The dragon can Sustain to recall the halo from any distance. The halo is made of pure light—it doesn't occupy space and can't be targeted or destroyed in any way.

Halo Pulse.description:
The dragon chooses one effect to impose on creatures in their inspiring presence aura.

The dragon can't use Halo Pulse again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Halo Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Repulsion Each creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41] save or be pushed until it's no longer in the aura.
  • Restoration (healing, vitality) Each creature recovers @Damage[9d8[healing]]{9d8 Hit Points}.
  • Restriction (incapacitation, mental) Creatures must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) while they remain within the aura. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to restriction for 1 minute.
Halo Pulse.name: Halo Pulse

Spirit Breath.name: Spirit Breath
Spirit Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of holy fire that deals @Damage[16d8[spirit]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:41|basic:true] save).

The dragon can't use Spirit Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Empyreal Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Empyreal Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)

Draft Contract.name: Draft Contract
Draft Contract.description:
The contract devil produces an infernal contract for a single living mortal. This contract can grant a wide range of abilities and effects, akin to the power of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual but fulfilled to the letter by the contract devil. To receive any of those benefits, the mortal must willingly sign its true name to the contract. At that point, the mortal's soul is bound to the contract devil and Hell.

While the contract is in effect, the victim can't be restored to life except by wish or similar magic. If the mortal is restored to life by those means, the contract devil knows which mortal came to life and can locate the creature or creatures who restored the mortal to life for 1 year, gaining the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LQzlKbYjZSMFQawP]{Locate} spell with unlimited range. Avoiding the terms of an infernal contract is difficult and often dangerous.

Infernal Wound.name: Infernal Wound
Infernal Wound.description:
The wounds from a contract devil's Strikes resist healing.

A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering first attempts to counteract infernal wound (DC 29). If it is not counteracted, the healing has no effect.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Ward Contract.name: Ward Contract
Ward Contract.description: A signed contract carried by a living contract devil (including draped over its horns) is immune to damage from all creatures other than that contract devil. A contract devil is immune to mental effects that would make it destroy, nullify, or alter a contract.

Infernal Investment.name: Infernal Investment
Infernal Investment.description:
A contract devil can cast a 10th-rank innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r784cIz17eWujtQj]{Scrying} spell at will, but only to target a creature with which they have a contract.

The target automatically critically fails its save.

Phistophilus.name: Phistophilus
Phistophilus.publicNotes:
Contract devils are clerks, scribes, and bureaucrats of Hell rarely found outside the infernal courts, and then almost always to pursue potential contracts, tempting mortals to sell their souls in exchange for achieving their worldly desires. If a target is desirable enough, a phistophilus can offer contracts for prices seemingly lesser than their soul all at once, though in this case, the devil carefully manipulates the price to drive the signatory toward the forces of Hell anyway. Contract devils are tall creatures with skin tones that range from bronze to crimson and large curving horns extending from their bodies, over which they often drape favored or important contracts.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks.

Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly orts perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as infantry and contract devils, while the greatest nessaris command entire infernal armies.

Asmodeus stands at the apex of the structure he created, but the layers below him are marked by a constant jockeying for position. Most diabolic plans ultimately serve to improve the schemer's place in the hierarchy.
Phistophilus.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Giant Monitor Lizard.name: 巨蜥 Giant Monitor Lizard
Giant Monitor Lizard.publicNotes:
巨蜥体型庞大，看上去笨重，其实是一种令人难以置信的敏捷而无情的掠食者。它从隐蔽处冲出来，用有力的双颚咬住目标，用这种方式伏击猎物。巨蜥的唾液有毒，这使它能够捕获大到无法轻易用嘴拉走的猎物。巨蜥可以长到14英尺长（包括尾巴），体重约350磅。巨蜥的身体通常是深棕色，带有黄色或绿色的斑点。

筑巢时，巨蜥会挖一个深洞。洞穴既是安全的避难所，也是巨蜥伏击大型猎物的地方，比如鹿、野猪，甚至人形生物。一只巨蜥一顿可以吃掉几乎和自己体重相等的食物，它衔接地不太紧密的双颚允许它吞下大得惊人的猎物。

蜥蜴们外表和能力各异，但大多数都具有爬行动物的基本形状——长长的尾巴，多齿的嘴和四条腿。虽然有一些蜥蜴种类能够在短时间内用两条腿运动，但大多数都是严格意义上的四足动物。这里列举了大型蜥蜴中最常见和最著名的三个物种。

Gnashing Grip.name: 咬牙切齿 Gnashing Grip
Gnashing Grip.description:
触发 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于巨蜥颚部生物尝试受擒于巨蜥颚部生物尝试逃脱失败

效果 巨蜥的颚部对触发目标造成@Damage[1d6[piercing]]伤害并且对其注入巨蜥毒液。

Lurching Charge.name: 摇摆冲锋 Lurching Charge
Lurching Charge.description: 巨蜥行走两次并进行一次颚咬打击。如果巨蜥距离初始位置至少20尺远，则这次攻击掷骰获得+2环境加值。

Monitor Lizard Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

最大持续时间 6 rounds

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1} (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2} (1轮)
Monitor Lizard Venom.name: 巨蜥毒液 Monitor Lizard Venom

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Death Effects.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Death Effects

Ghost Dodge.name: Ghost Dodge
Ghost Dodge.description:
Trigger The duskwalker is targeted by a Strike or spell

Effect The duskwalker gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC, resistance 5 to spirit damage, and increases their resistance to void damage to 5, all against the triggering attack.

Ghost Hunter.name: Ghost Hunter
Ghost Hunter.description: The duskwalker's weapons have the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune on attacks against incorporeal undead.

Spirit Hunter.name: Spirit Hunter
Spirit Hunter.description:
The duskwalker designates a single creature they can observe as their prey.

The duskwalker gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks, Intimidation checks, and Stealth checks against their prey and to any check to Recall Knowledge about it, and deal an additional @Damage[2[spirit]] damage with all weapon Strikes against their prey.

These effects last until the duskwalker uses Spirit Hunter again.

Spirit Shot.name: Spirit Shot
Spirit Shot.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The duskwalker has designated a creature as their prey using Spirit Hunter

Effect The duskwalker makes two ranged Strikes against their prey. If both Strikes hit, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

Duskwalker Ghost Hunter.name: Duskwalker Ghost Hunter
Duskwalker Ghost Hunter.publicNotes:
Duskwalkers are infused with the same energies as psychopomps. These ashen scions are reborn in the mortal Universe to guard the cycle of life and death.

Many immortals dwell upon the other planes of the Great Beyond. Some are benevolent and kind, like angels. Others are cruel and destructive, like demons. And some fit roles outside of morality, like psychopomps. It's far from unheard of for mortals and immortals alike to become entangled romantically, and the children of such engagements carry a supernatural element in their bloodlines for generations to follow. After the first generation, this otherworldly influence usually lies dormant, but now and then, the influence can manifest strongly in descendants many years later. These inheritors of extraplanar legacies are known collectively as planar scions.
Duskwalker Ghost Hunter.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. death effects

Shemhazian.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Paralyzing Gaze.name: Paralyzing Gaze
Paralyzing Gaze.description:
30 feet.

A non-demon creature that ends its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35] save. If it fails, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round, and if it critically fails, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Tail Whip.name: Tail Whip
Tail Whip.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the shemhazian's tail leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The shemhazian attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the triggering creature. On a success, the creature also takes damage as if the shemhazian had hit with a tail Strike, and if the creature was flying, it falls 30 feet.

Succor Vulnerability.name: Succor Vulnerability
Succor Vulnerability.description: A shemhazian's mutilation is a part of them, and they can't bear to see it reversed. The first time each round that a creature heals from damage the shemhazian dealt on their last turn, the demon takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

Enfeebling Bite.name: Enfeebling Bite
Enfeebling Bite.description: If the shemhazian's jaws Strike damages a creature, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} for 24 hours. The target can attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37] save to reduce this to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (or be unaffected on a critical success).

Focused Gaze.name: Focused Gaze
Focused Gaze.description:
The shemhazian focuses their gaze on a non-demon creature they can see within 30 feet. If that creature isn't already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} by the shemhazian's paralyzing gaze, it must attempt a save against the shemhazian's paralyzing gaze. If that creature is slowed, it must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

A shemhazian can't use this ability against the same creature more than once per round.

Shemhazian.name: Shemhazian
Shemhazian.publicNotes:
Shemhazians rise from the souls of torturers and those who reveled in mutilating the physical bodies of their victims. Standing 35 feet tall, a shemhazian is well equipped with a wide range of claws, pincers, and fangs to continue inflicting such torments on those they encounter.

Shemhazians delight in tormenting mortals, of course, but more than most demons, they revel in sharing the pain with their own kind. Other demons fear and hate shemhazians for this reason, with only the most powerful willing to work with a shemhazian to achieve a shared goal. Even then, the shemhazian is always on the watch for an opportunity to bring pain and suffering to their allies along with any foe.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.

Cyclops.name: Cyclops

Flash of Insight.name: Flash of Insight
Flash of Insight.description:
Frequency once per day.

Trigger The cyclops is about to roll a d20.

Effect The cyclops peers into an occluded spectrum of possible futures. It gets a success (but not a critical success) on the roll instead of rolling.

Swipe.name: Swipe
Swipe.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The cyclops makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within their melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the cyclops's multiple attack penalty.

Cyclops.publicNotes:
The kingdoms of the cyclopes date to an age before the rise of humanity, when dragons and giants and serpentfolk ruled the world. The cyclopes built enormous stone cities and prayed to ancient gods of brutality and wrath, but their power to foresee the future failed them and their civilization collapsed. Today, most cyclopes have virtually no knowledge of the former glory of their kind, even though it is not uncommon for them to dwell among the ruins of their greatness. Cyclops cities include monuments and imposing murals which depict their peoples' history, but few now among them can read or interpret these relics of the past.

In addition to their single eye, cyclopes are also famous for their neverending hunger, an appetite so all-consuming that some scholars theorize it may in fact be some kind of curse. The ever-present hunger of the cyclopes seems to have some connection to the death of their civilization—though whether this voracity was the cause or a side-effect of their people's downfall is likely destined to remain a mystery.

Although details of the cyclopes' gods have largely been lost to the annals of time, what little is known about these deities suggests they were vindictive and petty enough to curse their own people if they felt neglected or badly served.

The cyclopes are violent giants with a tragic past. Although they possess only one eye, they could once see far more than most, possessing occult wisdom and divinatory magic that gave them the mystic ability of foresight. But their legendary oracular powers failed to prevent the fall of their society, and the vast kingdoms of the cyclops long ago collapsed into ruin. Today, cyclopes have forgotten much of what they once knew, and they skulk among the crumbling remains of their fallen cities like forgotten kings and queens of their own fallen kingdoms.

Treerazer.name: 毁木者 Treerazer
Treerazer.publicNotes:
自封为爆潭公爵（Lord of the Blasted Tarn）的毁木者是一名强大的恶魔，他正处于向着统治外层裂隙（the Outer Rifts ）本身的真正力量攀登的前列——恶魔领主。即便现在在恶魔领主中只算是新人，毁木者也是一名危险的敌人。

毁木者很少离开他那名为扭曲棘林（Tanglebriar）的沼泽王国——位于奇奥尼（Kyonin）的菲拉妮森林（Fierani Forest）南部的一大片由扭曲植物和腐败泥土构成的地区——但这片有毒泥沼的任何地区都有可能碰到他，他通常会带着小股由恶魔、堕落精类和其他致命盟友所组成的军队。某些异能仪式也能把他从扭曲棘林中召唤出来，让他有机会离开被流放之地兴风作浪。不过有些人认为其实并没有什么骇人力量把毁木者封印在那里，只要他愿意，他就可以横行于格拉利昂（Golarion），传播他的触摸所带来的扭曲祝福以及他的存在所散布的腐败，不过爆潭公爵的精明与狡诈正如他的致命性一般，这让他更倾向于在自己的噩梦领域中安全地向着这个世界散布邪恶。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Aura of Corruption.name: 腐化灵光 Aura of Corruption
Aura of Corruption.description:
120尺

毁木者周边的植物会扭曲畸形并转化，成为由荆棘或真菌构成并模仿其原始形态的样子。此区域内的活物必须每轮成功通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:47]豁免，失败则会有部分转化为形似植物的物质。对于那些相较其他生物，对植物生物能造成更多伤害或麻烦的效果来说，那些在豁免检定中失败的生物会被上述效果视为植物，但这些生物不会由于被视同为植物生物而获得任何好处。

只要生物位于腐化灵光范围内，就会持续受到该效果的影响，即便离开灵光范围此效果也会持续1分钟。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.3MIZf42EhhKbIwLQ]{效果：腐化灵光}

Blackaxe - Owner’s Authority.description:
需求 你并未持用黑斧，你是它真正的拥有者

效果 你能感知黑斧周遭的世界，就如同你正处于黑斧所在的位置一般，而且可以通过这种链接使用任何你的内在法术，就好像它是法术的源头一般。若有其他生物持用黑斧，他就必须成功通过@Check[type:will|dc:50]豁免，失败则会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2}，直至放弃该武器为止。
Blackaxe - Owner’s Authority.name: 黑斧-主人权威 Blackaxe - Owner’s Authority

Blackaxe - Owner’s Reclamation.description:
需求 你并未持用黑斧，你是它真正的拥有者

Effect 黑斧立即从它原本的位置传送出去，出现在你手中。
Blackaxe - Owner’s Reclamation.name: 黑斧-主人召回 Blackaxe - Owner’s Reclamation

Blackaxe - Rejuvenating Deforestation.description:
频率 每分钟一次

效果 使用黑斧作出1次打击对抗活着的树木。若命中，树木枯萎并化为灰烬，而你恢复@Damage[250[healing]]生命值，获得6环级@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Et8RSCLx8w7uOLvo]的增益效果。
Blackaxe - Rejuvenating Deforestation.name: 黑斧-恢复砍劈 Blackaxe - Rejuvenating Deforestation

Defoliation.name: 腐叶脉冲 Defoliation
Defoliation.description:
毁木者对半径30尺弥漫范围散发出一种恶心的绿光脉冲。区域内的所有植物（包括受到腐化灵光效果影响的生物）开始变黑并枯萎。

非生物植物立即枯萎并死亡。植物生物承受@Damage[20d8[void]]伤害，@Check[type:fortitude|dc:49|basic:true]豁免。豁免失败的生物会陷入持续1分钟的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doom 1}以及@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 3}。

毁木者能选择将区域内任意数量的植物排除在此效果的影响之外，这么做通常是为了保存扭曲和腐败的植物或真菌，或者与其结盟的植物或真菌生物。

毁木者在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Defoliation]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用腐叶脉冲。

Dispelling Strike.description:
频率 每轮一次

触发 毁木者用武器打击或腐叶脉冲攻击命中1个生物、物体或法术效果

效果 毁木者施放他的内在@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]，以他的打击命中的生物为目标或者影响该生物的1个法术效果为目标。
Dispelling Strike.name: 驱散打击 Dispelling Strike

Staggering Strike.name: 惊异打击 Staggering Strike
Staggering Strike.description: 毁木者在一次近战攻击确认造成重击时，目标会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}。

Treerazer.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+2状态加值
Treerazer.hp: 再生50（圣洁使其无效） Regeneration 50 (deactivated by holy)

Spirit Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of holy fire that deals @Damage[9d8[spirit]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true] save).

The dragon can't use Spirit Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
Spirit Breath.name: Spirit Breath

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Divine Deflection.name: Divine Deflection
Divine Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect Divine power intercedes, preventing some of the damage. The dragon gains resistance 10 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Inspiring Presence.name: Inspiring Presence
Inspiring Presence.description:
20 feet.

The mere sight of an empyreal dragon motivates other creatures. Creatures within the aura gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws and skill checks. The empyreal dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.

Direct Halo.name: Direct Halo
Direct Halo.description: The dragon tosses their halo to a square within 90 feet. While the halo is deployed in this way, the dragon loses their inspiring presence aura, and the aura instead emanates from the halo with the same emanation radius. The dragon can Sustain to recall the halo from any distance. The halo is made of pure light—it doesn't occupy space and can't be targeted or destroyed in any way.

Halo Pulse.name: Halo Pulse
Halo Pulse.description:
The dragon chooses one effect to impose on creatures in their inspiring presence aura.

The dragon can't use Halo Pulse again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Halo Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Repulsion Each creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save or be pushed until it's no longer in the aura.
  • Restoration (healing, vitality) Each creature recovers @Damage[5d8[healing]]{5d8 Hit Points}.

Empyreal Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Empyreal Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Empyreal Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
The three major celestial planes—Heaven, Nirvana, and Elysium—each have their own respective dragons. Empyreal dragons have a direct connection to Heaven. Using the blessings of Heaven, empyreal dragons protect others and intercede against wickedness. Empyreal dragons are wise, considerate, and compassionate. When speaking with others, empyreal dragons are patient and understanding.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.
Empyreal Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Sprint.name: 冲刺 Sprint
Sprint.description:
频率 每分钟一次

效果 鸭嘴龙行走2次，在此期间，它的速度获得+20尺环境加值。

Hadrosaurid.name: 鸭嘴龙 Hadrosaurid
Hadrosaurid.publicNotes:
鸭嘴龙是一种分布广泛的食草恐龙，它们有着扁平的口鼻，上面布满了适合啃咬植物为食的磨齿。鸭嘴龙也被称为“鸭嘴恐龙（duck-billed dinosaurs）”，因为它们的吻部的形状非同寻常。鸭嘴龙是一种笨拙的生物，在体型上可以与大象匹敌，尽管它们往往攻击性较弱，遇到危险时倾向于逃跑，而不是顽固地坚守阵地。许多种类的鸭嘴龙头上都有独特形状的羽冠，这使得每种鸭嘴龙都有自己独特外形，即使是业余的恐龙观察者也很容易辨认出它们。

众所周知，巨人和许多其他大型生物会驯养鸭嘴龙作为家畜。尽管它们有快速冲刺的能力，但由于胆小的天性，它们适合成为坐骑，但一大群陷入恐慌的鸭嘴龙可以通过践踏造成巨大的破坏。

这些巨大的爬行动物是世界原始时代的遗留物，现在仍然大量存在于偏僻的荒野中，或者在幽暗地域的地下魔法洞穴中。蜥蜴人、半兽人、巨人和其他人形生物有时会把恐龙当作坐骑、守卫或猎兽。众所周知，人类和其他族裔也收集恐龙，把它们放在动物园里展出，或把它们当作异域宠物或守卫。这通常是富人或怪咖喜欢干的事情，但确实也有一些德鲁伊和其他自然的守护者能与恐龙亲密相处，甚至把它们作为动物伙伴。当恐龙在它们正常栖息地以外的地区安家时，通常可能是因为被圈养的恐龙逃进荒野造成的。

Raja-Krodha.publicNotes:
最具代表性的罗刹便是忿怒罗刹，有着虎头的凡人猎手。它们是所有试图推辞自身责任，将错误归咎于野外致命的掠食者的邪恶之人的化身。它们的力量与技巧令人恐惧，但也让人敬畏，一些人将此种罗刹视作守护者也并不少见，如果它们被极其谨慎地对待的话。

尽管罗刹本性是残忍的肉食者，但在它们愿意时，却能言善辩，极富哲理。这只是另一种形式的伪装，就像它们身上的条纹能让它们融入丛林一样。这往往会让学者与知识分子陷入虚假的安全感中。虽然忿怒罗刹的本性并非是社会阴谋家或幕后主脑，但当别人以为它们是的时，它们也乐见。

罗刹是原始的神性神物，是造物之中一切邪恶化身，他们诞生于善恶概念产生之初。他们的神性使命便是作为亵渎的典范——通过屠杀亲族，吞食知性存在的肉，犯下无数其他暴行，他们将这些行为定义为淫秽与禁忌，因此凡人知晓了这些行为在圣洁眼中便是罪恶。这是他们必须扮演的角色，就像舞台上必须有演员来扮演反派一样，所有罗刹在诞生那一刻就注定了身负罪孽。

大多数罗刹享受他们的角色，就像演员享受精湛的表演一样，不过他们的存在中仍有悲剧成分。他们注定了只能充当他人的陪衬，腐蚀卑劣者，倒在英雄脚下，永远无法开辟自己的道路。他们注定要做出最令人法治的行为，哪怕这会让他们的情感与良知受到伤害。否则就会违背他们的本性与目的：这是罗刹所能犯下的最大的罪过。.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Knowledge of Delusion.name: 妄想知识 Knowledge of Delusion
Knowledge of Delusion.description: 在对忿怒罗刹的回忆知识检定或用于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]的察觉检定失败的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]直到其下回合结束。

Reassert Fate.name: 重申命运 Reassert Fate
Reassert Fate.description:
触发 30尺内生物使用幸运或厄运效果

效果 忿怒罗刹重申命运的起伏，让那些试图欺骗自身命运的人深感恐惧。它打断触发效果，触发生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}，且对忿怒罗刹@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]，直到其下回合结束。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
忿怒罗刹变形成为中型类人生物。这不会改变忿怒罗刹的速度和打击的攻击与伤害调整，但可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常变为钝击）。它失去獠牙打击，除非该类人生物形态具有獠牙或类似无武装攻击。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Cruel Majesty.description:
需求 罗刹不处于其真实形态

效果 罗刹变身成真实形态，展现出其可怕又威严的一面。罗刹30尺内的生物必须成功通过一次@Check[type:will|dc:29]豁免，否则随着他们被惊住，将对罗刹@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]，直到罗刹的下回合开始。
Cruel Majesty.name: 残酷威严 Cruel Majesty

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 忿怒罗刹对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]的生物造成2d6额外精准伤害。

Raja-Krodha.name: 忿怒罗刹 Raja-Krodha
Raja-Krodha.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+2状态加值

Earthbound.name: Earthbound
Earthbound.description: When not touching solid ground, the living landslide is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Crumble.name: Crumble
Crumble.description:
Trigger The living landslide takes damage from a hostile source while atop rock or earth

Effect The living landslide crumbles into the ground, Burrowing down 10 feet. This Burrowing does not trigger reactions.

The living landslide can't Crumble again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Crumble]]{1d4 rounds}.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The living landslide can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the living landslide moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Sliding Earth.name: Sliding Earth
Sliding Earth.description: The living landslide Strides up to twice its normal Speed in a straight line, then attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} a creature in its reach. If a creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} from this Trip, it takes @Damage[1d4[bludgeoning]] damage for every 10 feet the living landslide moved.

Living Landslide.name: Living Landslide
Living Landslide.publicNotes:
Living landslides resemble humanoids made of earth and gravel. They find moving across the many surfaces of the mortal Universe strangely liberating.

Earth elementals make excellent bodyguards for adventuresome spelunkers and are ideal protectors of important subterranean locations such as vaults and treasuries.

Gigantopithecus.name: 巨猿 Gigantopithecus
Gigantopithecus.publicNotes:
这些凶猛的巨型猩猩们往往重量是一般大猩猩的三倍以上。

虽然许多猿类平时表现出温和或的行为，但是大猩猩可能表现出强烈的领地意识，而大金刚尤其具有攻击性和危险性。

Frightening Display.name: 惊惧示威 Frightening Display
Frightening Display.description:
巨猿捶打自己的胸肌来示威。在@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]内的生物必须经过@Check[type:will|dc:22]检定。

如果一个生物受到该能力影响而获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]状态，则视为对巨猿@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

大成功 该生物不受影响且在一分钟之内临时免疫该能力。

成功 该生物不受影响。

失败 该生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

大失败 该生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。

Hair Barrage.name: 刚毛弹幕 Hair Barrage
Hair Barrage.description: 巨狼蛛甩动它的腿，向@Template[type:cone|distance:15]范围内射出腿上的尖毛，造成@Damage[4d6[piercing]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true]豁免。

Giant Tarantula Venom.name: 巨狼蛛毒 Giant Tarantula Venom
Giant Tarantula Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

最大持续时间 8轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d10[poison]]伤害 (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[1d12[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] (1轮)

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}且措手不及 (1轮)

阶段4 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF] (1轮)

Giant Tarantula.name: 巨狼蛛 Giant Tarantula
Giant Tarantula.publicNotes:
狼蛛是伏击型掠食者，但是会在洞穴外的开阔地攻击猎物。

很少有害虫能像声名狼藉的蜘蛛那样让人如此恐惧。

Dryad.name: Dryad

Tree Meld.name: Tree Meld
Tree Meld.description:
A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants} spell cast by a dryad has an unlimited duration.

In addition, if the dryad merges with her bonded tree, she can choose to instead enter an extradimensional living space within the tree, and can bring up to two adjacent, willing creatures with her; the spell gains the extradimensional trait. The dryad can still be expelled from this space.

Nature Empathy.name: Nature Empathy
Nature Empathy.description: The dryad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals and plants.

Tree Dependent.name: Tree Dependent
Tree Dependent.description: A naiad is bonded to a great tree. If she is more than 300 feet away from it for 24 hours or more, she gains the weak adjustments until she returns. She can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond herself to a new great tree.

Dryad.publicNotes:
Dryads are fey guardians of the trees and creatures who dwell in wooded areas. They prefer using indirect methods to dissuade those who would harm their sacred groves and beloved forests, but they are not above using enchantments to enlist the aid of allies when evil threats cannot be dissuaded with words alone. In times of peace, dryads happily live secluded lives inside their trees, and a community at harmony with nature might not even realize a dryad lives nearby.

Though they watch over all the woods around them, dryads are inextricably tied to a specific tree, usually an oak. Dryads who are bonded to another type of tree are fundamentally the same, but they may differ in temperament and appearance to match their ward. For instance, kraneiai, or cherry-tree dryads, have beautiful pink coloration and concern themselves with the fragile beauty of life.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

Kobold Scout.name: Kobold Scout
Kobold Scout.publicNotes:
Most kobolds encountered outside of a well-defended warren or lair are kobold scouts, those trained for stalking and hunting. They’re also often in the thick of the fighting when a warren is invaded, buying time for their comrades to set up various traps and deadfalls.

Kobolds are small reptilian humanoids. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniacal leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power they generally lack. Notably, kobold eggs left in the proximity of magical creatures or places tend to absorb similar traits from the exposure. The resulting physical changes mark the appearance of each tribe, but a few lucky kobolds are also born with magical power that reflects their tribe's patron.
Kobold Scout.allSaves: +1 circumstance to all defenses vs. traps

+1 Circumstance to All Defenses vs. Trap.name: +1 Circumstance to All Defenses vs. Traps

Construct Trap.description:
The kobold scout creates a rudimentary trap on any square adjacent to it. This must be on a surface, such as a floor, wall, or ceiling. The trap activates the next time a creature moves adjacent to it.

The creature takes @Damage[(1d6)[piercing],(1)[bleed]]{1d6 piercing damage and 1 persistent bleed damage} with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:16|basic:true] save. The trap is destroyed when activated or after 1 hour, whichever comes first.

The scout typically carries enough raw materials to make one trap.
Construct Trap.name: Construct Trap

Scamper.name: Scamper
Scamper.description:
Requirements The kobold scout is adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect The kobold scout Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The kobold scout deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Gimmerling.name: Gimmerling
Gimmerling.publicNotes:
Gimmerlings are small, shapeshifting fey who stage ambushes to sate their endless hunger and childish greed. These cruelly curious fey obsess over finding and making unusual traps and sadistic weapons, and their favorite amusement is seeing these traps sprung or the weapons wielded. When residing on Golarion, they're frequently found in urban areas, particularly slums or other parts of town, where they can either go unnoticed or be easily forgotten—and have plenty of victims to choose from.

A typical gimmerling disguises themself as an endangered child, hoping to draw creatures close enough to rob. The gimmerling puts themself in apparent danger using a trap, construct, a bribed ally, or even a coerced monster.

Because gimmerlings sometimes trade obscure smithing or trapping techniques in exchange for gifts that sate their curiosity, their greed, or their hunger, they have at times been worshipped as minor gods of the forge. Some disciplined gimmerlings work as honored artisans, elite guards, or spies for the demigods known as the Eldest, who dwell in the depths of the First World.

Hungersense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Hungersense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Hungersense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: Hungersense allows the gimmerling to sense creatures that require food to live.

Treacherous Aura.description:
15 feet.

Tangled roots, jagged divots, sharp rocks and other hazards appear on surfaces in the aura, creating difficult terrain.
Treacherous Aura.name: Treacherous Aura

Trip Up.description:
Trigger A creature critically fails a melee attack to hit the gimmerling or moves into a space within the gimmerling's treacherous aura

Effect The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:32] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of its next turn.

Failure The target takes @Damage[2d10[bludgeoning]] damage and is offguard until the start of its next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, and the target is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
Trip Up.name: Trip Up

Change Shape.description:
The gimmerling takes on the appearance of any humanoid. In humanoid form, They lose their treacherous aura, and their equipment appears to be trinkets or toys. If the chosen form lacks claws or fangs, they lose the matching Strike. If they lose their claw Strike, they gain a fist Strike that is identical except that it deals bludgeoning damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Sly Disarm.description:
Requirements The gimmerling's last action was a successful claw Strike;

Effect The gimmerling attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the creature they hit. They gain a +4 status bonus on the Athletics check. This attempt neither applies nor counts toward the gimmerling's multiple attack penalty.
Sly Disarm.name: Sly Disarm

Sneak Attack.description: The gimmerling deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

Trickster's Step.name: Trickster's Step
Trickster's Step.description: The gimmerling ignores difficult terrain and doesn't trigger traps with its movement.

Earth Scamp.name: 土魔蝠 Earth Scamp

Scree Breath.description:
土魔蝠对@Template[type:cone|distance:15]范围喷出石子，对范围内所有生物造成@Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true]豁免）。

土魔蝠在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Scree Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次进行石子吐息。
Scree Breath.name: 石子吐息 Scree Breath

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊） 30尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet

Fast Healing 2 (While Underground).name: 快速治疗2（当位于地下时） Fast Healing 2 (While Underground)

Earth Scamp.publicNotes:
如果不是因为它们的大眼睛和蝙蝠一样的翅膀，它们的岩石外表可以很好地伪装在松散的岩石中。土魔蝠会飞，但飞行的行为让它们感到不舒服和不安——如果它们能控制自己的话，它们很少离开地面。事实上，大多数土魔蝠愿永远也不去位面地表，而是深深依偎在与它们相似的岩石里。

魔蝠是一种类似蝙蝠的生物，具有元素之力。魔蝠会被更强大的居民从元素位面驱逐出去，或者被新手召唤师召唤到物质宇宙。所有的魔蝠有魔法力量，因为他们与家乡位面有一种挥之不去的联系，它们主要用它来搞一些简单的恶作剧。

魔蝠迅速构成了智力导向的等级制度。当类人生物第一次遇到这种生物时，它们常常会让魔蝠感到困惑。这些困惑的魔蝠通常会采取一系列不断升级的恶作剧，看看这些类人生物能从哪种情境中逃脱，以便在等级制度中给他们安排合适的地位。
Earth Scamp.hp: 快速治疗2（当位于地下时）

Soulbound Doll (Timid).name: 缚魂娃娃（胆小） Soulbound Doll (Timid)
Soulbound Doll (Timid).publicNotes:
缚魂娃娃是怪诞的人体模型或娃娃，被灌注了一小片已故凡人的灵魂。这些小小的构装体是由于各种各样的原因被创造出来的——比如说作为同伴或仆人——但是他们的自由意志意味着它们对于他们的创造者并非必然服从。法莱斯玛的信徒常常憎恶缚魂娃娃，认为这是对灵魂自然循环的扭曲，而墓穴女士的崇拜者乐意看到缚魂娃娃的破灭，而不考虑其行为，会将覆灭缚魂偶作为对伟大彼岸的重要服务。

在一系列缚魂构装体中，缚魂娃娃的制造是最简单的，这些构装体包括人形的缚魂人偶，强大的缚魂躯壳，和作为卫兵的缚魂兵马俑。用非自愿的活物创造娃娃是残忍的，非自愿的供体可以抵抗这个过程，通过一次意志检定来对抗创造者的手艺 DC，如果不能阻止灵魂供体的死亡，则会毁掉娃娃。如果某人生前同意使用，也可以用其灵魂制作娃娃。

冒险者遇到的缚魂娃娃通常都是某种守卫；尽管娃娃体型娇小，但灵魂碎片的力量让娃娃的拳头比旁人想象的更加危险。此外，鉴于娃娃的身材，灵魂碎片还能赋予娃娃一个威力巨大的法术。由于具有自主性和非凡的智慧，缚魂娃娃偶尔会被它们的制作者用作强大得多但无意识的构装体的管理者，使这些娃娃能够控制远远超出其自身能力的防御系统。

虽然缚魂娃娃包包含一名刚死不久的人的一小部分灵魂，但其实这不影响死者复活，或直接前往来世。这种灵魂提取的过程对活着的灵魂供体来说则是致命的。

灵魂碎片通常会注入一个镶嵌在娃娃胸部或脖子的灵魂聚焦宝石（硬度10）。灵魂碎片一般会保留原灵魂的强烈个性特征，但娃娃会从初始状态开始不断学习，这意味着它的性格和能力可以改变，可能会变得更像灵魂供体，也可能在自己的道路上越走越远。即使缚魂娃娃被摧毁，它的灵魂聚焦宝石也能保留娃娃的记忆。如果被摧毁的缚魂娃娃的灵魂聚焦宝石是完好的，那么它可以被一些精于缚魂操作的人重新放置到一个新娃娃的身体里，通过这种方法可以很有效的让缚魂娃娃重生。

Personality Fragments.name: 人格碎片 Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: 缚魂娃娃拥有一部分灵魂提供者的人格碎片，尽管它没有任何生前的记忆。这使得缚魂娃娃与供体灵魂的强烈个性特征相匹配。由于它的灵魂碎片，因此缚魂娃娃拥有无法像大多数构装体一样对精魂免疫。

Haunting Melody.name: Haunting Melody
Haunting Melody.description:
The nosoi croons an entrancing song. Each living or undead creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save. The effect lasts until the end of the nosoi's next turn, but the nosoi can Sustain it. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours. Despite being a mental effect, this ability affects mindless undead.

Psychopomps are immune to this ability.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the nosoi.

Critical Failure The creature is fascinated with the nosoi and must spend each of its actions on its turn to move closer to the nosoi as expediently as possible while avoiding obvious dangers. If a fascinated creature is adjacent to the nosoi, it stays still and doesn't act. If the creature is attacked, the fascination ends.

Shepherd's Touch.name: Shepherd's Touch
Shepherd's Touch.description: A nosoi's Strikes have the benefit of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal an additional @Damage[1d6[void]] damage to living creatures or @Damage[1d6[vitality]] damage to undead.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The nosoi takes the appearance of a raven or songbird. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage modifiers with its Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Nosoi.name: Nosoi
Nosoi.publicNotes:
A nosoi resembles a whippoorwill, sparrow, or other small bird wearing a heavy leather plague doctor's mask. They are the clerks, messengers, and scribes of the Boneyard, witnessing judgments, directing souls, and generally performing the administrative grunt work that keeps the Boneyard functioning. Most nosois are particularly chatty and eager to discuss how important they consider their individual assignments to be.

Psychopomps are guardians and shepherds of the dead in the Boneyard, the vast plane of graves where mortal souls are judged and sent on to their eternal rewards or damnations. Psychopomps ensure that the dead come to terms with their transition from mortality and are properly sorted into the appropriate afterlife. They also protect souls from being preyed upon by supernatural predators. Nearly all psychopomps wear masks, especially when they're likely to be interacting with mortals, although the types of masks they wear are as varied as the psychopomps themselves. The courts of the Boneyard preside in Requian, a somber yet melodic language spoken slowly with various tonal shifts.

Many psychopomps are intimately involved with the Boneyard's massive bureaucracy. Few pursue mercy, justice, or personal gain; their duties to Pharasma and her Boneyard are supreme. Nevertheless, individual psychopomps interpret their duties in different ways, which might put them in conflict with mortals or even with each other.

Twisting Tail.name: Twisting Tail
Twisting Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the dragon disrupts the creature's action.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Poison Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Forest Passage.name: Forest Passage
Forest Passage.description: The horned dragon ignores any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don’t impede their progress.

Impaling Charge.name: Impaling Charge
Impaling Charge.description:
Requirements The dragon doesn't have a creature impaled on their horn

Effect The dragon attempts to gore a foe. They Stride, then attempt a horn Strike. On a hit, the target becomes impaled on the dragon's horn. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} while on the horn (and can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} as normal). The dragon doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the impaled creature grabbed. If the dragon moves, they bring the grabbed creature along with them.

Poison Breath.name: Poison Breath
Poison Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[9d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true] save).

They can't use Poison Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Poison Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Horned Dragon (Young).name: Horned Dragon (Young)
Horned Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
The magic that flows through primal dragons can manifest more animalistic or bestial features in a given type of dragon. Notably among these are the massive paired horns of the horned dragon. While their bulky frames, natural coloration, and prominent ridged scales are all remarkable in their own way, it's the horns that are most obvious and striking at first glance. Horned dragons use their horns to impale their prey in a quick and brutal display of their might. They are generally contemplative and have a fixation on knowledge and self-discipline, traits belied by their bestial appearance. As a result, horned dragons are generally more open to speaking with outsiders.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Shadow Spawn.name: Shadow Spawn
Shadow Spawn.description: When a creature's shadow is pulled free by Steal Shadow, it becomes a shadow spawn under the command of the shadow that created it. This @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.clzHAfegb9Rn6DOe]{Shadow Spawn} doesn't have Steal Shadow. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous shadow. If the creature recovers from its enfeeblement, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.

Slink in Shadows.name: Slink in Shadows
Slink in Shadows.description: The shadow can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

Light Vulnerability.name: Light Vulnerability
Light Vulnerability.description: Attacks against the shadow are treated as magical if made by a creature who is in magical light or with an object that is in magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell).

Steal Shadow.name: Steal Shadow
Steal Shadow.description:
Requirements The shadow hit a living creature with a shadow hand Strike on its previous action

Effect The shadow pulls at the target's shadow, making the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} on a critical hit). This is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from shadows, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}. If this increases a creature's enfeebled value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is separated from its body (see shadow spawn). The enfeebled value from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} Shadow decreases by 1 every hour.

Greater Shadow.name: Greater Shadow
Greater Shadow.publicNotes:
Shadows that spend long amounts of time on the Netherworld and absorb its magic become greater shadows.

The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light.

Personality Fragments.name: 人格碎片 Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: 缚魂娃娃拥有一部分灵魂提供者的人格碎片，尽管它没有任何生前的记忆。这使得缚魂娃娃与供体灵魂的强烈个性特征相匹配。由于它的灵魂碎片，因此缚魂娃娃拥有无法像大多数构装体一样对精魂免疫。

Soulbound Doll (Impish).name: 缚魂娃娃（冲动） Soulbound Doll (Impish)
Soulbound Doll (Impish).publicNotes:

Scorpion Venom.name: 蝎毒 Scorpion Venom
Scorpion Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害 (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1} (1轮)

Swarming Stings.name: 虫群叮刺 Swarming Stings
Swarming Stings.description: 每个处于蝎群占据方格内的敌人受到@Damage[2d8[piercing]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true]豁免）。检定失败的生物还会暴露在蝎毒之下。

Scorpion Swarm.name: 蝎群 Scorpion Swarm
Scorpion Swarm.publicNotes:
虽然普通蝎子本身就是具有危险，但成群的这种害虫可能会造成彻底的毁灭。这些横扫而过的死亡动物会迅速将猎物击倒，然后吃得只剩骨头。

蝎子是生活在沙漠、森林、热带稀树大草原和荒地的包复着甲壳的虫害，它们是致命的蛛形纲动物，有着强大的钳子和令人痛苦的尾刺。蝎子在几乎所有的气候带中出没，它们以耐心的潜行和原始的蛮力捕食猎物。大多数蝎子生活在地下洞穴里，要么作为独行猎手，要么组成蝎群。这些蛛形纲动物是如此可怕和危险，以至于在许多文化中，它们被视为神或死亡和防卫的二元论象征。

Umbral Gnome Scout.name: Umbral Gnome Scout

Hidden Movement.name: Hidden Movement
Hidden Movement.description: If the umbral gnome scout starts its turn @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to a creature, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the umbral gnome scout's attacks until the end of the turn.

Umbral Gnome Scout.publicNotes:
Umbral gnome scouts patrol the tunnels that lead into their settlements.

Gnomes are known for being creative and curious. They stand at around 3 feet tall, and their vivid personalities match their naturally vivid hair and eye color. Gnomes possess a natural connection to their ancestral home, the First World. They crave adventure and new experiences to fight off an ancestry-wide affliction known as the Bleaching. Gnomes who fail to dream and innovate begin to slowly lose their color and fall into a deep depression.

A notable subgroup of gnomes called umbral gnomes typically have gray or brown skin with a stony texture, and thin, pale hair or bald pates. Umbral gnomes are most numerous in the Darklands, where they go by the name drathnelar. Umbral gnomes often attribute these physical changes to the gnome deity regarded as the first of their kind, Nivi Rhombodazzle. Nivi was a surface gnome who traveled deep into the Darklands and was ultimately rewarded with demigodhood when she exchanged a particular gemstone with the dwarven deity, Torag. Nivi is immune to the Bleaching, and umbral gnomes are often immune or resistant to it as well.

Giant Wasp.name: 巨黄蜂 Giant Wasp
Giant Wasp.publicNotes:
巨黄蜂比他们小体型的亲戚要更加危险但稀有。让那些遭遇它们的人感到宽慰的是，巨黄蜂往往是独居的。

普通的黄蜂对勇敢的冒险家来说除了令人不舒服的刺外几乎没有什么威胁，但一大群具有侵略性的这些昆虫——更不用说它们超大的同类了——可以让整个队伍的英雄们倒下。这里的黄蜂一般而言指的是常见品种如胡蜂，但是也存在其他危险的品种，例如迦伦德（Garundi）的变种蜂群，能以超大的数量瞬间毁掉整个村庄。

Giant Wasp Venom.name: 巨黄蜂毒 Giant Wasp Venom
Giant Wasp Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 没有效果 (1轮)

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2} (1轮)

阶段3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF] (1轮)

Implant Eggs.name: 寄生虫卵 Implant Eggs
Implant Eggs.description: 巨黄蜂可以对相邻的一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]的生物注射黄蜂卵。受影响的生物会遭受黄蜂幼虫疾病。

Wasp Larva.name: 黄蜂幼虫寄生 Wasp Larva
Wasp Larva.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]

阶段1 携带者无症状（[[/br 1d6 #days]]{1d6天}）

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1} （[[/br 1d3 #days]]{1d3天}）

阶段3 [[/r {5d6}]]{5d6伤害}, 幼虫出现 （疾病结束）

Smilodon.name: 剑齿虎 Smilodon

Pierce Armor.name: 穿刺护甲 Pierce Armor
Pierce Armor.description:
剑齿虎对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]于他的生物进行1次剑齿打击。

如果此打击命中，则目标被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。如果目标所穿的护甲硬度为10或更低，此护甲@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]。

如果此打击造成目标护甲破损，或命中无甲、穿着破损护甲的目标，则对目标造成@Damage[2d6[bleed]]伤害。此打击不会对已经破损的护甲造成更多伤害。

Pounce.name: 猛扑 Pounce
Pounce.description: 剑齿虎行走，在行动结束后衔接1次打击。如果剑齿虎在执行此行动前处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]状态，则它保持藏匿直到该次打击结束。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 剑齿虎对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]的生物造成额外1d6精准伤害。

Smilodon.publicNotes:
剑齿虎是一种大型剑齿虎猫科动物，是顶级掠食者，比其他种类的大型猫科动物肌肉更发达，体型更宽。它们通常迅速刺向猎物的喉咙或其他脆弱的部位来杀死猎物。剑齿虎超大的剑齿是受到人们特别青睐的战利品。

自然界中很少有掠食者能与猫的潜行能力相匹敌。大型猫科动物分部于任何环境，它们通常会与居住地保持距离。当文明人侵入大型猫科动物的猎场时，这些动物往往会不顾一切地对粗心的旅行者进行攻击。

Inexorable March.name: 无阻行军 Inexorable March
Inexorable March.description: 石垒像以满速度行走，向后推离路径空间上的所有生物，如果他们试图阻止其移动，就会受到伤害。一个生物可以尝试通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:34]豁免来阻挡其前进。如果豁免大成功，则阻挡的生物不受伤害；在其他情况下该生物受到如同石垒像拳头命中的伤害。

Statuary Aura.name: 雕像灵光 Statuary Aura
Statuary Aura.description:
20尺。

大理石魔法般从灵光范围内的地面上升起。它们保护着石垒像的盟友，为他们中每个提供标准@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]。这些石头可以被用于投石（Throw Rock）。

灵光在石垒像的战斗中第一个回合开始时自动启动，并在战斗结束时失效。

Binding Stone.name: 地缚之石 Binding Stone
Binding Stone.description: 被石垒像拳头或岩石打击命中的任何生物都将受到@Check[type:fortitude|dc:30]豁免的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]效果。

Stone Bulwark.name: 石垒像 Stone Bulwark
Stone Bulwark.publicNotes: 石垒像是缓慢而坚固的构装体，通常由大理石或花岗岩雕刻而成。它们通常在静止时被当做艺术品，因此一些魔法工匠会雇佣雕刻大师来确保将这些构装体造成美丽的雕塑。年代久远的石垒像可能已经饱经风霜，表面有磨损或裂纹，或者断鼻断指，但这种风化主要是外观层面，并不会影响石垒像的功能。

Empyreal Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Divine Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect Divine power intercedes, preventing some of the damage. The dragon gains resistance 10 to all damage against the triggering attack.
Divine Deflection.name: Divine Deflection

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Halo Pulse.description:
The dragon chooses one effect to impose on creatures in their inspiring presence aura.

The dragon can't use Halo Pulse again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Halo Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Repulsion Each creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save or be pushed until it's no longer in the aura.
  • Restoration (healing, vitality) Each creature recovers @Damage[5d8[healing]]{5d8 Hit Points}.
Halo Pulse.name: Halo Pulse

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Inspiring Presence.name: Inspiring Presence
Inspiring Presence.description:
20 feet.

The mere sight of an empyreal dragon motivates other creatures. Creatures within the aura gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws and skill checks. The empyreal dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.

Direct Halo.name: Direct Halo
Direct Halo.description: The dragon tosses their halo to a square within 90 feet. While the halo is deployed in this way, the dragon loses their inspiring presence aura, and the aura instead emanates from the halo with the same emanation radius. The dragon can Sustain to recall the halo from any distance. The halo is made of pure light—it doesn't occupy space and can't be targeted or destroyed in any way.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Spirit Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Spirit Breath.name: Spirit Breath
Spirit Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of holy fire that deals @Damage[9d8[spirit]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true] save).

The dragon can't use Spirit Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Empyreal Dragon (Young).name: Empyreal Dragon (Young)
Empyreal Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
The three major celestial planes—Heaven, Nirvana, and Elysium—each have their own respective dragons. Empyreal dragons have a direct connection to Heaven. Using the blessings of Heaven, empyreal dragons protect others and intercede against wickedness. Empyreal dragons are wise, considerate, and compassionate. When speaking with others, empyreal dragons are patient and understanding.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Greedspawn.name: Greedspawn
Greedspawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords—each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today, sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind.

Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, with slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue.

Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold, while envyspawn appear even more gaunt than the rest of their kin.
Greedspawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental

Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.description:
A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Scent]

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Sinful Bite.name: Sinful Bite
Sinful Bite.description:
A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

Critical Success Unaffected

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure sickened 2 plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 minute

Mauler.name: 猛捶 Mauler
Mauler.description: 灰熊攻击被它@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]的目标时，伤害掷骰有+2环境加值。

Rush.name: 冲锋 Rush
Rush.description: 灰熊在行走动作之后衔接一次打击动作。在这次行走期间，灰熊的速度获得+10尺环境加值。

Grizzly Bear.name: 灰熊 Grizzly Bear
Grizzly Bear.publicNotes:
这种巨大而强壮的杂食动物生活在森林覆盖的山丘地区。虽然它通常靠坚果、浆果、鱼和小型哺乳动物为食，但它的领地意识很强，会赶走或杀死任何被它视为竞争对手的生物。当有幼熊在附近时，灰熊的脾气尤其喜怒无常。在战斗中，灰熊常展现出惊人的凶猛，会抱住并用熊掌猛捶对手。它会一直持续攻击直到对手丧失抵抗能力。如果灰熊饿了，则它会毫不犹豫地吃掉对方。

熊是凶猛的食肉动物，通常生活在寒冷或温带的林地和山丘上。除了下面介绍的两种之外，还有许多种类的熊，比如体型较小（但危险程度并不低）的黑熊，或者住在极地的白熊。

Boiling Blood.name: Boiling Blood
Boiling Blood.description: Each time an adjacent creature deals slashing or piercing damage to the brimorak, the attacker is sprayed with the brimorak's boiling blood, which deals @Damage[2d4[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true] save).

Extinguishing Aversion.name: Extinguishing Aversion
Extinguishing Aversion.description: Dousing a brimorak with water, either ordinary water or from a water effect, causes no physical harm to the fiend but deals @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage. Fully immersing the brimorak in water deals @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage per round.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a brimorak's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Flaming Weapon.name: Flaming Weapon
Flaming Weapon.description: A brimorak's hooves and any weapon they wield burst into flame. They can also Interact to create a sword of fire and steel, which dissolves if it leaves their grip.

Frothing Spew.name: Frothing Spew
Frothing Spew.description:
The brimorak spits their boiling blood in a @Template[type:line|distance:20] that deals @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage (DC 21 basic Reflex save). Creatures that fail the save also fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} as they slip in the greasy blood.

The brimorak can't use Frothing Spew again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Frothing Spew]]{1d4 rounds}.

Fume.name: Fume
Fume.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The brimorak emits a cloud of thick black smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] adjacent to them. The cloud remains for 1 minute. All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it.

A creature that enters or begins its turn within the smoke it must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

Brimorak.name: Brimorak
Brimorak.publicNotes:
These goat-headed demons have glowing red eyes and flaming hooves but measure only about 4 feet in height. Born from the souls of arsonists, the fiery brimoraks continue the work they pursued in life, as everything they touch quickly burns.

Brimoraks are ill-tempered even for demons, although their spite turns to glee in the face of a growing fire. Those who have survived encounters with these fiends report that they remember the braying sound of the brimoraks' laughter as clearly as the heat of the flames or the choking scent of smoke.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.

Statue.name: Statue
Statue.description: Until the next time they act, the aeolaeka appears to be a statue. They have an automatic result of 45 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a statue.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: An aeolaeka can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When they do so, the aeolaeka moves at their full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of their passing.

Liberate the Earth.name: Liberate the Earth
Liberate the Earth.description:
The aeolaeka conjures churning stones, creating a @Template[type:line|distance:60] of rolling boulders. Creatures in the line take @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:35] save. The area is difficult terrain for 24 hours before the leftover stone crumbles to dust. The aeolaeka can't Liberate the Earth for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Liberate the Earth]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage. Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the rubble (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 32).

Aeolaeka.name: Aeolaeka
Aeolaeka.publicNotes:
Aeolaekas, also known as stone azatas, embody the joy of stone carved by artists' hands or natural forces. Stone is often thought to be steadfast and unchanging, but, when viewed on a grander scale over vast periods of time, it can transform into things as diverse as intricate crystals and fine powder. Aeolaekas are fascinated by the gradual changes found within stone, from sand to diamonds to fossils to towering mountains.

As a result of their stone affinity, aeolaekas appear less capricious than other azatas—though this is mainly due to them acting on a different geological scale—and some have willingly forged lasting accords or agreements with mortals. Aeolaekas often visit the Plane of Earth, fighting against evil earth elementals, joining jabali festivals, or simply wandering the veins and tunnels of that realm as they bask in its stony wonders. Their stone skin means aeolaekas are sometimes mistaken for statues; they use this fact to hide in plain sight when they don't want their presence known.

Azatas are manifestations of freedom and unestrained joy—kindly celestials with a penchant for curious exploration, spontaneous revelry, and whimsical quests. Born of good dreams and heartfelt wishes for a better world, they reside in the untamable wilds of Elysium. Azatas are passionate and mercurial, as beautiful and bright as a child's fantasy, but also fiercely loyal to those they hold dear. They act quickly and directly against fiendish and foul influences, but they tend to avoid guiding mortal affairs otherwise, allowing people to choose their own destiny without the meddling of otherworldly forces.

Azatas reject the dual chains of both duty and tyranny, but also the heavy chains of despair that reality so often inflicts upon those who live in it. This can give them a dubious reputation with other celestials, who consider azatas to be flighty and unreliable, but azatas know that unrelenting self-sacrifice can be just as destructive to the soul as evil. Azatas refuse to compromise the beauty of the world with such banality, instead living without regret and savoring every triumph and agony they encounter upon the way.

Soulbound Doll (Kind).name: 缚魂娃娃（善良） Soulbound Doll (Kind)
Soulbound Doll (Kind).publicNotes:
缚魂娃娃是怪诞的人体模型或娃娃，被灌注了一小片已故凡人的灵魂。这些小小的构装体是由于各种各样的原因被创造出来的——比如说作为同伴或仆人——但是他们的自由意志意味着它们对于他们的创造者并非必然服从。法莱斯玛的信徒常常憎恶缚魂娃娃，认为这是对灵魂自然循环的扭曲，而墓穴女士的崇拜者乐意看到缚魂娃娃的破灭，而不考虑其行为，会将覆灭缚魂偶作为对伟大彼岸的重要服务。

在一系列缚魂构装体中，缚魂娃娃的制造是最简单的，这些构装体包括人形的缚魂人偶，强大的缚魂躯壳，和作为卫兵的缚魂兵马俑。用非自愿的活物创造娃娃是残忍的，非自愿的供体可以抵抗这个过程，通过一次意志检定来对抗创造者的手艺 DC，如果不能阻止灵魂供体的死亡，则会毁掉娃娃。如果某人生前同意使用，也可以用其灵魂制作娃娃。

冒险者遇到的缚魂娃娃通常都是某种守卫；尽管娃娃体型娇小，但灵魂碎片的力量让娃娃的拳头比旁人想象的更加危险。此外，鉴于娃娃的身材，灵魂碎片还能赋予娃娃一个威力巨大的法术。由于具有自主性和非凡的智慧，缚魂娃娃偶尔会被它们的制作者用作强大得多但无意识的构装体的管理者，使这些娃娃能够控制远远超出其自身能力的防御系统。

虽然缚魂娃娃包包含一名刚死不久的人的一小部分灵魂，但其实这不影响死者复活，或直接前往来世。这种灵魂提取的过程对活着的灵魂供体来说则是致命的。

灵魂碎片通常会注入一个镶嵌在娃娃胸部或脖子的灵魂聚焦宝石（硬度10）。灵魂碎片一般会保留原灵魂的强烈个性特征，但娃娃会从初始状态开始不断学习，这意味着它的性格和能力可以改变，可能会变得更像灵魂供体，也可能在自己的道路上越走越远。即使缚魂娃娃被摧毁，它的灵魂聚焦宝石也能保留娃娃的记忆。如果被摧毁的缚魂娃娃的灵魂聚焦宝石是完好的，那么它可以被一些精于缚魂操作的人重新放置到一个新娃娃的身体里，通过这种方法可以很有效的让缚魂娃娃重生。

Personality Fragments.name: 人格碎片 Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: 缚魂娃娃拥有一部分灵魂提供者的人格碎片，尽管它没有任何生前的记忆。这使得缚魂娃娃与供体灵魂的强烈个性特征相匹配。由于它的灵魂碎片，因此缚魂娃娃拥有无法像大多数构装体一样对精魂免疫。

Putrid Plague.name: 斑疹伤寒 Putrid Plague
Putrid Plague.description:
斑疹伤寒造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]状态不会自行改善，一直持续直到疾病被治愈。

豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14]

阶段1 携带但无感染症状 ([[/br 1d4 #hours]]{1d4小时})

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (1天)

阶段3 恶心1且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} (1天)

阶段4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf] (1天)

阶段5 死亡

Swarming Bites.name: 鼠群噬咬 Swarming Bites
Swarming Bites.description: 每个处于鼠群占据方格内的敌人受到@Damage[1d6[piercing]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true]豁免）。检定失败的生物还会感染斑疹伤寒。

Rat Swarm.name: 鼠群 Rat Swarm
Rat Swarm.publicNotes:
鼠群可能会导致一个家族或一个行业完全陷入混乱。当数十只这些烦躁或饥饿的害虫聚集在一起叮咬受害者时，腐热症的传播速度非常之快。因此在世界许多地方，当绝望的镇民们深受传染病传播之困时，捕鼠成为了一项有前途的职业。

老鼠是一种无处不在的威胁，在世界上几乎每一个定居点的下水道和街道上窜来窜去。虽然普通的老鼠在脚下飞奔只可能会吓到一般的行人，但是巨鼠和鼠群要危险得多。

Frightening Display.description:
大猩猩捶打自己的胸肌来示威。在@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]内的生物必须经过@Check[type:will|dc:20]检定。

如果一个生物受到该能力影响而获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]状态，则视为对大猩猩@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

大成功 该生物不受影响且在一分钟之内临时免疫该能力。

成功 该生物不受影响。

失败 该生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

大失败 该生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。
Frightening Display.name: 惊惧示威 Frightening Display

Gorilla.name: 大猩猩 Gorilla
Gorilla.publicNotes:
大猩猩是一种具有领地意识的动物，尤其是在被猎人或更危险的怪物激怒时。大猩猩会用它的尖牙和有力的手臂疯狂地撕咬和猛击入侵者。

虽然许多猿类平时表现出温和或的行为，但是大猩猩可能表现出强烈的领地意识，而大金刚尤其具有攻击性和危险性。

Orc Commander.name: Orc Commander
Orc Commander.publicNotes:
When orcs raid, the strongest is chosen as the leader, backed up by their siblings and other immediate family. If leadership is contested, candidates vie for control with displays of physical prowess or stirring speeches.

Many orcs are forged in the fires of violence and conflict, often from the moment they're born. As they live lives that are frequently cut brutally short, orcs revel in testing their strength against worthy foes, whether by challenging a higher-ranking member of their community for dominance, taming a powerful beast, or slaying a fearsome monster.

Tall and powerful, with long arms and thickly muscled legs, many orcs top 7 feet in height. Their heavy limbs and broad, almost bow-legged stances combine with a tendency to slouch forward to create an almost contradictory set of circumstances where an orc can tower over other humanoids while simultaneously staring them in the eye. These features, alongside a tendency to scar easily, can make them seem quite intimidating.

The half-orc dromaars, most commonly born of unions between orcs and humans, are often tested even more harshly than their full orc kin, but those who endure these tests can rise to positions of authority. "An orc can have what an orc can hold" is a saying that not only applies to an individual's ability to secure their own destiny and position, but is also likely the root of orcs referring to their communities as holds.

Battle Cry.name: Battle Cry
Battle Cry.description:
Bellowing mightily, the orc commander gives themself and all orc allies within @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the start of the orc commander's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Yqq4AkZ9lrm4CcID]{Effect: Battle Cry}

Grikkitog.name: Grikkitog

Implant Core.name: Implant Core
Implant Core.description: The grikkitog implants its core into an adjacent section of earth or stone, melding seamlessly and changing its visual appearance to match the surrounding rock. It's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} but automatically succeeds at its Deception check to Impersonate the stone around it; creatures actively searching for it can still attempt Perception checks against its Deception DC as normal. A grikkitog can release its implantation as a free action, which has the manipulate trait. A grikkitog's infestation aura and manifold vision are only active while implanted.

Manifold Vision.name: Manifold Vision
Manifold Vision.description: While its core is implanted, the grikkitog can see through the eyes it creates throughout the area of its infestation aura, gaining the benefits of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.9qV49KjZujZnSp6w]{All-Around Vision}.

Infestation Aura.name: Infestation Aura
Infestation Aura.description:
120 feet.

While its core is implanted, a grikkitog infests all earth and stone within 120 feet, as long as there is a contiguous physical connection between the earth, including stone objects touching the ground. This effect spreads even if the grikkitog does not have line of effect, though it can affect earth or stone on the surface and exposed to the air only if at least part of its core is exposed as well.

Within the aura, it can grow maws and eyes everywhere. It can make jaws attacks against any creature, originating from any earth or stone in the aura adjacent to that creature. Determine cover from the origin point of the attack, not from the grikkitog's core.

Barbed Maw.name: Barbed Maw
Barbed Maw.description:
Trigger The grikkitog hits a creature with a jaws Strike

Effect The grikkitog sinks its barbed teeth into the target, which must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:34] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. While immobilized, the victim takes @Damage[3d8[persistent,bleed]] damage and the grikkitog feeds upon its flesh. The creature is immobilized until the grikkitog ends the effect as a free action or the target succeeds at a DC 38 check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

The grikkitog can immobilize any number of creatures with these maws.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The grikkitog can Burrow through dirt and stone at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Grikkitog.publicNotes: Grikkitogs, also known as the "hungry earth," are strange parasites from the Plane of Earth that infest earth, rock, and stone in order to feed their endless hunger. A young grikkitog is a formless apparition until it corrupts an earth elemental host, forming the grikkitog's core. A grikkitog can then possess the earth and stone nearby with its voracious essence, forming maws and eyes all around it. These creatures can be particularly dangerous to small creatures that lair within gaps among rocks, as well as mountain climbers searching for the perfect handhold.

Infuse Weapon.name: Infuse Weapon
Infuse Weapon.description: A vanth's scythe is its symbol of office and gains a measure of its personal power. This scythe becomes a +1 scythe and is treated as if it were adamantine while the vanth wields it. A vanth whose scythe is taken or destroyed can infuse a new one with an hour of work.

Shepherd’s Touch.name: Shepherd’s Touch
Shepherd’s Touch.description: A vanth's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal @Damage[2d6[void]] damage to living creatures and @Damage[2d6[vitality]] damage to undead.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Vanth's Curse.name: Vanth's Curse
Vanth's Curse.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The vanth bestows a curse on a creature by touching it with its scythe. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Vanth's Curse for 24 hours.

Success The target feels a momentary shudder of doom and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute by the distracting sensation.

Failure The target becomes morose and glum as it accepts its own inevitable fate. For 1 hour, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}. Each time the target gains the dying condition, the stupefied condition value increases by 1, to a maximum value of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect is permanent.

Vanth.name: Vanth
Vanth.publicNotes:
Protectors of the Boneyard, the stern and resolute guardians of the dead, vanths are psychopomps who resemble skeletons with raven-like wings and a mask resembling a vulture's skull. Vanths carry black scythes to fight against those who would disturb the natural progression of souls, and they consider any visitor to the Boneyard a potential troublemaker. They rarely speak and even more rarely show any emotion other than a grim adherence to duty.

When the psychopomp armies go to war, vanths serve as front-line soldiers. In particular, daemons continually stage raids on the River of Souls, requiring constant patrol. Implacable warriors, vanths fly in perfect formation. This can backfire, as they often suppress any adaptability they possess as they wage war.

Psychopomps are guardians and shepherds of the dead in the Boneyard, the vast plane of graves where mortal souls are judged and sent on to their eternal rewards or damnations. Psychopomps ensure that the dead come to terms with their transition from mortality and are properly sorted into the appropriate afterlife. They also protect souls from being preyed upon by supernatural predators. Nearly all psychopomps wear masks, especially when they're likely to be interacting with mortals, although the types of masks they wear are as varied as the psychopomps themselves. The courts of the Boneyard preside in Requian, a somber yet melodic language spoken slowly with various tonal shifts.

Many psychopomps are intimately involved with the Boneyard's massive bureaucracy. Few pursue mercy, justice, or personal gain; their duties to Pharasma and her Boneyard are supreme. Nevertheless, individual psychopomps interpret their duties in different ways, which might put them in conflict with mortals or even with each other.
Vanth.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Vampire Count.name: Vampire Count
Vampire Count.publicNotes:
Vampire counts rule their demesnes and subjects through a mix of fear and cruelty.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
Vampire Count.hp: coffin restoration, fast healing 7, void healing

Children of the Night.name: Children of the Night
Children of the Night.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.6wPW2dvpt86Ou6bL]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.BN5Lb6IsQ9Wyu3rL]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

Mist Escape.name: Mist Escape
Mist Escape.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.
