Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. They can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

They automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if they reaches their coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

Vampire Vulnerabilities.name: Vampire Vulnerabilities
Vampire Vulnerabilities.description:
All vampires possess the following vulnerabilities.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures with strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless they're transported while they hide within their coffin, nor can they enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions—a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome their compulsion just as they do their revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a deity with a holy sanctification option. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so, and it remains brandished for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of their revulsion, they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of their revulsion until they end an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of their revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, they overcome their revulsions for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents them from healing above 0 HP, even in their coffin. Staking a vampire requires 3 actions and works only if the vampire is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if they're in their coffin, the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with holy water while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends their turn in sunlight, and the condition ends when they're no longer in sunlight. If the vampire loses all their actions in this way, they're destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors

Change Shape.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

  • Giant Bat
    • Senses echolocation 40 feet,
    • Speed 20 feet, fly 30 feet,
    • Melee fangs +15 Damage 1d8+9 piercing

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Create Servitor.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire servitor by donating some of their own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

A vampiric servitor is compelled to obey its creator, but if a vampire controls too many vampiric servitors at once (as determined by the GM), or if the servitor is a higher level than the vampire that created it, strongwilled servitors can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[type:will|defense:will] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.
Create Servitor.name: Create Servitor

Dominate.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait (@Check[type:will|dc:22]). The save DC uses the high spell DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.
Dominate.name: Dominate

Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[10[healing]]{10 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drained value by 1, killing the victim when it reaches drained 5. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[type:medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.
Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood

Turn to Mist.name: Turn to Mist
Turn to Mist.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses fast healing while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

Conspirator Dragon (Ancient).name: Conspirator Dragon (Ancient)

Conjure Disguise.name: Conjure Disguise
Conjure Disguise.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon conjures a perfect flesh-suit replica of a humanoid they've seen of their size or smaller and compresses themself into it, along with generating appropriate clothing for the humanoid. This process takes 1 minute to complete, during which the dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. If the dragon stops or is interrupted in this process, the suit is destroyed. Once the process is complete, the dragon can remain in this disguise indefinitely.

The transformation has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]{Change Shape}, except that the disguise is not actively magical in nature and doesn't register as magical to detect magic and similar effects. The dragon loses Retract Body while transformed.

If the dragon is critically hit while wearing the disguise, the suit is destroyed and immediately explodes. This has the effects of Detonate Disguise, except that creatures use the outcome one degree of success better than they rolled on their save.

Detonate Disguise.name: Detonate Disguise
Detonate Disguise.description:
Requirements The dragon is wearing their conjured disguise

Effect The dragon erupts from the disguise, destroying it. The explosive revelation deals @Damage[18d6[bludgeoning]] damage to creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:39|basic:true] save. A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round as it becomes covered in scraps from the disguise.

Any creature sharing a space with the dragon after they erupt is pushed into the nearest empty space.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge Smoke Breath.

Smoke Breath.name: Smoke Breath
Smoke Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a noxious cloud of smoke that deals @Damage[16d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:39|basic:true] save). The smoke remains for 1 minute. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist}, except it fills the cone's area.

The dragon can't use Smoke Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Retract Body.name: Retract Body
Retract Body.description:
Trigger The dragon is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature the dragon can see

Effect The dragon retracts the targeted body part or twists away to avoid the attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Rushed Transformation.name: Rushed Transformation
Rushed Transformation.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect Using the aid of magic and an exhausting amount of effort, the dragon quickly reshapes their body into the form of a generic humanoid figure. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form} except that it lasts only 1 minute, and the dragon doesn't gain the +4 status bonus to Deception as the transformation makes use of the dragon's body to crudely mimic a humanoid form. The dragon can Dismiss the effect.

Whenever the effect ends, the dragon leaves behind scraps of magically conjured flesh, which could give away the dragon's presence.

Conspirator Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
Hidden among the shadows and upper echelons of society are the conspirator dragons. These dragons are schemers, always looking to manipulate and control others, either for personal gain or simply for the thrill of watching their machinations play out. Conspirator dragons see themselves above others and typically speak with infantilizing tones and words. However, as most conspirator dragons meet others while in disguise, they do their best to maintain their disguise.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Conspirator Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

Twisting Tail.name: Twisting Tail
Twisting Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the dragon disrupts the creature's action.

Forest Passage.name: Forest Passage
Forest Passage.description: The horned dragon ignores any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don’t impede their progress.

Trackless Journey.description: The horned dragon always gains the benefits of Cover Tracks in natural surroundings, even while moving at full speed.
Trackless Journey.name: Trackless Journey

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Impaling Charge.name: Impaling Charge
Impaling Charge.description:
Requirements The dragon doesn't have a creature impaled on their horn

Effect The dragon attempts to gore a foe. They Stride, then attempt a horn Strike. On a hit, the target becomes impaled on the dragon's horn. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} while on the horn (and can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} as normal). The dragon doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the impaled creature grabbed. If the dragon moves, they bring the grabbed creature along with them.

Poison Breath.name: Poison Breath
Poison Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[13d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:31|basic:true] save).

They can't use Poison Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Poison Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Horned Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Horned Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Horned Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
The magic that flows through primal dragons can manifest more animalistic or bestial features in a given type of dragon. Notably among these are the massive paired horns of the horned dragon. While their bulky frames, natural coloration, and prominent ridged scales are all remarkable in their own way, it's the horns that are most obvious and striking at first glance. Horned dragons use their horns to impale their prey in a quick and brutal display of their might. They are generally contemplative and have a fixation on knowledge and self-discipline, traits belied by their bestial appearance. As a result, horned dragons are generally more open to speaking with outsiders.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.
Horned Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Omen Dragon (Young).name: Omen Dragon (Young)
Omen Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Challenge Fate.name: Challenge Fate
Challenge Fate.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack;

Effect This fate is not set in stone. The attacker rolls the triggering attack twice and uses the worse result.

Untethered to Fate.name: Untethered to Fate
Untethered to Fate.description: The dragon can choose to negate any fortune or misfortune effects that would affect them; other creatures remain affected normally.

Destiny Breath.name: Destiny Breath
Destiny Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a translucent mist of potentialities that overwhelms creatures with visions of possible features, dealing @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:20] (@Check[type:will|dc:25] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) as it struggles with the visions.

The dragon can't use Destiny Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Destiny Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Destiny Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Prophetic Wings.name: Prophetic Wings
Prophetic Wings.description:
The dragon or any ally can glimpse into the future through the dragon's wings in a process that requires 10 minutes of concentration. This casts a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} spell, except that the wings can predict results up to 1 day into the future and the dragon always speaks a few cryptic words related to the result of the prediction.

The dragon can use their wings in this way only once per hour, and a given creature can seek a future in the wings only once per week.

Omen Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Fate is a fickle matter on Golarion. Even with prophecy broken on the world, there are ways to look to the immediate future or acquire a vague sense of long-term events. Omen dragons are bound to see the future—nebulous though it might be—at all times. Visions of the future hound them like a quiet song that never stops playing in their minds. While an omen dragon can focus on or ignore the music of fate at any time, the song plays all the same. At a glance, omen dragons resemble other occult dragons in appearance, save for the mirror-like interior membrane of their wings. An omen dragon's wings offer glimpses into the future. These glimpses are cloudy and vague, but generally correct, if only technically. Omen dragons have a natural compulsion to share the futures they see. These dragons have no compunctions about what the visions show and share their knowledge equally with innocent villagers as they do with wicked tyrants.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Axiomite.name: Axiomite
Axiomite.publicNotes:
According to axiomites, their kind rose from the raw mathematical underpinnings of the universe, manifesting as great builders who created the ancient, colossal cities of the Outer Planes. According to aeons, axiomites are part of the Monad, having both risen from and rebelled against it long ago. Since the Convergence, most axiomites have recognized this as a fundamental truth, particularly after the aeons showed the axiomites how the Utopian language has formed as an amalgam of aeon envisioning and formulaic mathematical expression. Most axiomites live in the perfect city of Axis, which they continually act to improve, thus refining the concept of perfection itself.

A particular axiomite may look like any humanoid creature, though the particular form it takes on does not affect its abilities. Beneath this assumed form, all axiomites are the same—clouds of glowing, crystalline dust that constantly swirl and congeal into complex tangles of symbols and equations, evincing axiomite existence as literal creatures of pure mathematical law.

Axiomites arise from the souls of mortals fascinated with the underpinnings of their Universe, particularly those who were, in life, mathematicians, architects, crafters, or philosophers. While these souls do not retain any memories of their lives in the transition into axiomites, their life skills and experiences nevertheless serve as a valuable metaphysical resource during formation.

Aeons have always been the caretakers of reality and defenders of the natural order of balance. Each type of aeon takes on some form of duality in its manifestation and works either to shape the multiverse within the aspects of this duality in some way, or to correct imbalances to the perfect order of existence. Aeons' machinations can raise a nation, raze it, or restore it from ruin. Their reasons are their own, and they rarely share their motivations with others—through their strange envisioning mode of communication, they simply create the results they insist are necessary to maintain the balance of the multiverse.

As a result of recent shifts in reality, aeons have begun to reassert a presence in the perfect planar city of Axis. To aeons, this is merely the latest in a recurring cycle, albeit one that mortals have not yet borne witness to. Aeons have a name for this cyclic return, in which they welcome their industrious axiomite brethren back to their fold: the Convergence. At the onset of the Convergence, a council of pleroma aeons appeared in the Eternal City of Axis, where they revealed that axiomites were wayward aeons, split off long ago to pursue the act of creation. With the latest cycle of change, it was time for axiomites—and their mortal creations and kin—to rejoin the aeon cause. While most axiomites fell in line, realizing perhaps on a fundamental level of reality that what the aeons said was the truth, some refused to heed the call and waited for the wrath of the aeons. That wrath has yet to come. The dual-natured aeons have responded to those who have declined in confusing ways. With some they treat and even bargain, while a handful of others they have destroyed, and a few have been exterminated by the axiomites. But most of these quiet insurgents they leave alone, allowing these axiomites to continue to create in peace. How—or if—this Convergence will end is as little understood as aeons themselves.
Axiomite.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Crystalline Dust Form.name: Crystalline Dust Form
Crystalline Dust Form.description:
The axiomite shifts their form to a cloud of crystalline dust in which strange symbols and equations flash.

They gain a fly Speed of 40 feet and can fit through even tiny apertures, similar to vapor form. They can cast spells but can't make melee or ranged attacks.

The axiomite can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AjLSHZSWQ90exdLo]{Dismiss} this form to return to humanoid form.

Xulgath Leader.name: Xulgath Leader

Weakening Strike.name: Weakening Strike
Weakening Strike.description: A creature hit by a xulgath leader's jaws or claw Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical hit) for 1 round.

Xulgath Leader.publicNotes:
Xulgath leaders are usually the strongest, most violent members of a community—although in some cases, particularly in larger groups, xulgath clutches are led by powerful demon cultists or other monsters who seek to use the xulgaths as servants or sacrifices.

Reptilian humanoids who live in the uppermost reaches of the Darklands, xulgaths (known as troglodytes to many surface-dwelling folk) often attack intruders in their territory on sight. They live in simple familial communities called clutches, battling rival groups and other aggressive Darklands inhabitants in order to survive. They occasionally raid surface settlements, usually at the behest of cruel, bloodthirsty leaders who are often themselves in the thrall of more powerful creatures like nagas or demons. A typical xulgath has dull gray, dark gray, or ashen scales, with a long tail and bony protrusions that run the length of their spine. A typical xulgath is 5 feet tall and weighs 150 pounds.

Although today the xulgaths are brutal and scattered, they were one of the first intelligent humanoids to rise in the primeval world, once ruling over a mighty empire that stretched throughout the Darklands. Today, all that remains of this era are ruins of massive stone ziggurats and crumbling cities found within some of the larger caverns. Some groups of xulgaths continue to live among these ruins, venerating their ancestors' accomplishments, while others consider these areas taboo and leave them to become infested with Darklands vermin. Sages don't agree on why the ancient xulgath civilization fell. Some suspect it was the result of losing several wars waged against serpentfolk, while others suggest that the corruptive influence of demon worship rotted their culture from within.

Certainly, many xulgath settlements continue to worship demons to this day, paying homage and offering live sacrifices to demons or other terrible creatures from the Outer Rifts. Occasionally, a xulgath mystic can call forth and bind a lesser demon to help serve the group, but one who delves too deep into occultism might summon a more powerful fiend that either tears the xulgaths to pieces or seizes control of the settlement.

Ice Stride.name: Ice Stride
Ice Stride.description: A frost giant isn’t impeded by difficult terrain caused by snow or ice, nor do they need to attempt Acrobatics checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.

Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing
Wide Swing.description: The frost giant makes a single greataxe Strike and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within their reach. This counts as two attacks for the frost giant’s multiple attack penalty.

Chill Breath.name: Chill Breath
Chill Breath.description:
The frost giant breathes out a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] of freezing moisture that quickly condenses into ice, dealing @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage. Each creature in the cone must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save. A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and takes @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage at the end of each of its turns until it gets free (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 28).

The giant can't use Chill Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Chill Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Frost Giant.name: Frost Giant
Frost Giant.publicNotes:
Frost giants are remorseless marauders who pillage and plunder from those who dare to live near them in desolate, frigid lands. Their clans range from extremely territorial hunters who ferociously defend their expanse of tundra to nomadic families that roam icy slopes in search of settlements to conquer. Frost giant clans are ruled by the family member who exhibits the greatest ferocity and prowess in battle—often a massive bully who demands absolute obedience from the rest.

Frost giants' appearance is reflective of their icy homes, with flesh ranging from a translucent glacial blue to a slushy gray. A typical frost giant stands about 15 feet tall and weighs approximately 2,800 pounds. They often wear metal armor adorned with the furs, skin, teeth, and tusks of slain beasts and heft weapons as long as dining tables. A well-stocked frost giant clan will raise mammoth mounts or press witchwargs into service as hunting companions, but consider their environment too hostile for a soft concept like pets.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

Barghest.name: 犬魔 Barghest
Barghest.publicNotes:
犬魔是一种犬类怪物，它们非常享受狩猎，经常潜伏在类人生物聚居地附近寻找能够提供适当挑战的猎物。即使在最深的荒野中，犬魔也会选择最聪明或最难捕获的猎物，不断寻找像巨人、宁芙和独角兽这样的挑战。

对犬魔来说，胜利甚至最终获得食物的可能性并不是最重要的，它们享受追逐的刺激和在猎物中制造的恐惧。特别害怕的猎物有时甚至会被允许逃脱，以传播恐怖并吸引其他可能成为犬魔下一个受害者的猎人。少数犬魔会学习直接造成恐惧的魔法，但是它们发现这种恐惧空虚且不令人满意。

虽然犬魔很少容忍另一个犬魔的存在竞争，但它们愿意与任何能帮助它们找到猎物的生物合作。这通常涉及执行鬼婆或特别残忍的精类的意志，但无聊的犬魔也可能强迫一个弱小的类人家族充当侦察员和诱饵。

典型的犬魔经常利用它们的变身能力来隐藏在显眼的地方，只有在吓唬猎物和庆祝狩猎时才采取真实形态。然而，即使在他们的人类形态下，他们往往仍然因为在受害者身上留下的痕迹或他们造成的奇特不愈合的伤口而被揭露。关于拥有隐形头部的强大犬魔的故事有时会在偏远而衰落的村庄中被讲述。这些犬魔通常不再隐藏作为人类或狗，而是对整个社区散播恐惧，并且公开地猎杀越来越危险的猎物。有些犬魔也已自己的智力为傲，坚持与他们的猎物甚至是那些被认为是在追捕犬魔的人进行智力较量。

Primal Hunt.name: 原始猎杀 Primal Hunt
Primal Hunt.description:
触发 犬魔触及范围内的生物进行了移动或传送动作

效果 在触发动作之后，犬魔能尝试传送最多60尺远，移动到目标相邻的空间。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
犬魔能变成类人生物、狗、或变回自己的真实形态。它们的体型会自动匹配新形态。当犬魔变为类人生物时，它的爪打击造成钝击伤害，并且失去颚打击。当犬魔变为狗时，它的速度变为35尺。每个犬魔个体都只能有一种类人生物形态和一种狗形态。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Unhealing Wound.name: 不愈之伤 Unhealing Wound
Unhealing Wound.description: 被犬魔的利爪伤害的生物必须通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]豁免，否则会被诅咒。被诅咒的生物只能通过魔法恢复生命值，直到它恢复到最大生命值。该生物可以每24小时对诅咒进行一次新的豁免。

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Hallucinatory Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The dragon can Hide in natural environments even if they don't have cover.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Scintillating Defense.name: Scintillating Defense
Scintillating Defense.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon flashes their iridescent scales at the triggering creature to throw off the attack. The dragon gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} against the triggering attack.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

Hallucinatory Breath.name: Hallucinatory Breath
Hallucinatory Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a cloud that assaults the senses and deals @Damage[7d6[mental]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:will|dc:27] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure) and is then temporarily immune to being confused by Hallucinatory Breath for 1 hour.

The dragon can't use Hallucinatory Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hallucinatory Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Lunging Bite.name: Lunging Bite
Lunging Bite.description: The dragon lunges their head forward, making a jaws Strike with an extended reach of 20 feet.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Mirage Dragon (Young).name: Mirage Dragon (Young)
Mirage Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Mirage dragons are masters of illusion magic and use their powers to deceive others and further their own agendas. In addition to their magical prowess, mirage dragons possess a number of additional features to help them on hunts or mislead attackers, such as their camouflaging scales and a hallucinatory breath that can confound multiple foes at once. Mirage dragons are vain and egotistical figures. They ultimately care more about themselves than others.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Mirage Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Sense Fate.description: 纺命女在先攻骰中自动骰出20。
Sense Fate.name: 感知命运 Sense Fate

Triumvirate.name: 三司命 Triumvirate
Triumvirate.description: 该功能如同@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.52CdldlWMiVTZk1F]能力，除了只有纺命女能够加入三司命，并且有且仅有三名纺命女在该三司命中才可生效。一组三司命能够获得下列法术：@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wLIvH0AT1u7oa64N]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qsNeG9KZpODSACMq]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.AuIiqc7jjiy1GZ75]（每天一次），@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.CeSh8QcVnqP5OlLj]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HpIJTVqgXorH9X0L]。

Sever Fate.name: 切断命运 Sever Fate
Sever Fate.description:
当纺命女使用打击造成虚能伤害时，她恢复@Damage[10[healing]]HP。该目标必须通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:39]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}（在大失败时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2}）。

此后由纺命女造成的虚能伤害会使得流失状态值在豁免失败时增加1（在大失败时增加2），直至达到最大值@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 4}。

Shift Fate.name: 改命换运 Shift Fate
Shift Fate.description:
触发 120尺内的一名生物尝试一次豁免骰

效果 该生物投掷两次豁免骰，而后由纺命女决定采用哪个结果。如果纺命女选择了较低的骰值，则此为厄运效果；如果她选择了较高的骰值，则此为幸运效果；如果骰值相同，则由她决定采用哪个特征。

Snip Thread.name: 剪断纺线 Snip Thread
Snip Thread.description:
频率 每天三次

效果 纺命女制造出一条联系着她100尺内一名生物命运的金线，而后用剪刀将其剪短。该目标受到@Damage[100[void]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:42|basic:true]豁免）。如果目标的生命值因此伤害降低到0点，该纺线被完全切断，该生物立刻死亡。

被剪断纺线杀死的生物无法被复活，除非使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]仪式或类似强大的魔法；或则通过神力干预。无论豁免结果如何，剪断纺线的目标生物都会临时免疫24小时。

纺命女在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Snip Thread]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用剪断纺线。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Cold Iro.name: 再生20（寒铁使其无效） Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Cold Iron)

Fated.name: 命中注定 Fated
Fated.description: 当一个生物受到一个来自纺命女的幸运效果和一个来自纺命女之外任意源头的厄运效果时（反之亦然），源自纺命女的效果自动反制其他的效果后如常生效，而非两个效果互相抵消。如果幸运效果和厄运效果都源自于一名纺命女，则两者会如常相互抵消。根据GM的判断，与命运或者运气相关的强大实体，例如黛丝娜、玛芙、或是法莱斯玛，不会被此能力抵消其效果。

Norn.name: 纺命女 Norn
Norn.publicNotes:
纺命女是古老到超乎想象的强大的妖精女士，天命定数呈现为金色纺线的物理形态被她们握着手中。她们守望着所有的生命，通常只会勉为其难地回应召唤——或是在命运之线被低等生物扭曲和滥用时施以怒火。她们身材高大，站立时有14尺高，重800磅。

纺命女与第一世界（First World）的始祖（Eldest）有着复杂的关联。许多纺命女侍奉着三相玛芙（Magdh the Three）。因为玛芙拥有少女、母亲、主母这三具躯壳，一些纺命女相信这名三位一体的始祖是第一位由纺命三司命合而为一的存在。玛芙声称她正在观察某些被不详预言所昭示的灾厄的命运之线，除了协助她的占卜以外，玛芙也期待着侍奉她的纺命女能够遵从她隐晦的命令，帮助推动未来远离危险的边缘。然而，纺命女本身就是强大的存在，她们自身就拥有赋予神术的力量，故而也有不少拒绝为这名神秘莫测的半神服务。这些纺命女发现其他的始祖甚至更为陌生、更为难以交流，而她们也相信，即使这些始祖行使着伟大的权能，但就算是这些强大的存在也不应被准许随心所欲地干涉命运。

即使是最弱小的始祖也能轻易地摧毁一个无所属的纺命女，然而当被谈及时，他们依然倾向于听从纺命女的宣言和判断。这些纺命女们明智地维持着她们所表现出的中立，她们知道最好不要向始祖们要求太多，以免让这些反复无常的半神对纺命女的干涉心生沮丧和厌倦。因此，就如亘古以来的那样，无所属的纺命女与始祖之间的力量平衡依旧异常脆弱。然而，纺命女们也知道，尽管她们已经尽了最大的努力来抑制他们最具破坏性的行为，这些始祖们却迟早都将不再尊重这一传统并且开始完全的随心所欲，而这也只不过是时间问题。

命运追随者 Followers of Fate

在凡人的物质宇宙中，一些凡人将纺命女尊崇为神祇，而另一些人，尤其是女巫和吟游诗人，则将她们奉为庇护主或缪斯。那些将纺命女尊奉为神祇的人们被称为命运追随者。纺命女不会阻止这种敬奉，但也不会特意去支持这种崇拜。信奉纺命女的牧师可能会崇拜一个特定的纺命女或纺命三司命，亦或是将所有纺命女作为整体崇拜，但无论他们的选择为何，都会获得相同的增益。命运追随者的圣徽是一把剪短金线的剪刀，他们所关注的范畴为命运和衰老的过程。
Norn.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Cacodaemon.name: Cacodaemon

Cacodaemonia.name: Cacodaemonia
Cacodaemonia.description:
The cacodaemon can telepathically communicate with the afflicted creature at any distance on the same plane.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Stage 1 carrier (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 day)

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
• Lizard
    • Speed 20 feet;
    • Melee jaws +8 (agile, finesse), Damage 1d8+1 piercing
  • Octopus
    • Size Small;
    • Speed 20 feet, swim 30 feet;
    • Skills Athletics +6;
    • Melee tentacle +8 (finesse), Damage 1d8+1 bludgeoning plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab};
    • Melee beak +8 (agile, finesse), Damage 1d6 piercing plus 2 poison
  • Scorpion
    • Size Small;
    • Speed 30 feet;
    • Melee pincer +8 (agile, finesse), Damage 1d6+1 bludgeoning plus Grab;
    • Melee stinger +8 (agile, finesse), Damage 1d6+1 piercing plus 1d4 poison

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Soul Lock.name: Soul Lock
Soul Lock.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The cacodaemon ingests the soul of a sentient creature within 30 feet that died within the last minute. When they do, the cacodaemon grows a fist-sized soul gem (Hardness 2, HP 8) in their gut and can regurgitate it at any time as an Interact action. Destroying the gem frees the soul within but doesn't return the deceased creature to life. If a caster attempts to return to life a creature whose soul is trapped within a soul gem, they fail unless they succeed at a @Check[type:religion|dc:30] check. A success causes the soul gem to shatter so the creature is returned to life as normal for the spell.

A fiend can Interact to ingest a soul gem it is holding, condemning the soul to the fiend's home plane. The fiend gains fast healing 5 for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.JgJ4Iw8BvJ4tWkah]{Effect: Soul Lock (Healing)}

Cacodaemon.publicNotes:
These twisted embodiments of violence and spite are spawned from eddies of angry and warped souls amid Abaddon's mists. Cacodaemons constantly hunger for mortal souls and yearn to create suffering. As gnashing spheres of teeth, fins, and spines, they are the weakest of daemonkind, an amalgam of various petty forms of death without the strength that comes from focusing on a single cause of demise.

Denizens of the bleak and terrible plane of Abaddon, daemons are shaped by and devoted to the destruction of life in all its forms. They seek the death of every mortal being by the most painful and horrible means possible, in service to the Apocalypse Riders. Each kind of daemon represents a different way to die, and their powers are nearly always aimed at spreading that particular form of death. Through the use of these powers, they seek to drag all existence down into a pit of hopelessness and despair, and to commit all souls to oblivion.

While mortals who summon daemons usually seek to use the creatures' destructive and corrupting powers for their own ends, daemons always look for ways to spread fear, doubt, and despair wherever they go. Often, daemons disguise their plots as the workings of other fiends, knowing that such confusion compounds mortals' fear and keeps those mortals from bringing the most effective weapons. As a result, learned mortals sometimes refer to daemons as "riders" after their leaders or "soul mongers" after their largest industry.

While many fiends seek to tempt mortals into lives of nihilistic evil to increase their own numbers and power on their native planes, daemons are further driven by a supernatural hunger for mortal souls and use a variety of methods—not least of which is the cacodaemons' soul gems—to entrap them. On Abaddon and in other forbidding places across the multiverse, souls are simultaneously a delicacy, a trade good, and a source of magical power, and the daemons are among the greatest gluttons, merchants, and abusers of this spiritual "resource."

Motion Sense 60 feet.description: 阴沟泥怪能通过震动以及气流来感受周遭事物的运动。
Motion Sense 60 feet.name: 感知运动60尺 Motion Sense 60 feet

Filth Wave.name: 污物涌动 Filth Wave
Filth Wave.description:
频率 每分钟一次

效果 阴沟泥怪释放出一股污物，覆盖@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]区域内的所有生物。区域内的每个生物必须成功通过@Check[type:reflex|dc:17]豁免，失败则会承受@Damage[1d4[acid]]伤害并且其速度在1分钟内承受-10尺减值（大失败时，该生物还会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]）。

生物能耗费交互动作清洁某个对象，每个动作能使得速度减值降低5尺。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Qomp2EujVCbzJb4X]{效果：污物涌动}

Sewer Ooze.name: 阴沟泥怪 Sewer Ooze
Sewer Ooze.publicNotes:
这些由污物和其他垃圾构成的不定型团块在城市下方大大小小的肮脏排水道中不停穿行。

阴湿的地下城与阴影遮蔽的树林中生活着胶质怪、黏菌、以及其他泥怪。尽管这些生物可能并无恶意，但部分泥怪能长成硕大的身躯并具有无法满足的食欲。

+1 Status to AC vs. Unholy Creatures.name: +1 Status to AC vs. Unholy Creatures

Transfer Protection.name: Transfer Protection
Transfer Protection.description:
A creature can wear a willing cassisian as a helmet. While it does, the cassisian can't act, but the cassisian extends their +1 status bonus to AC and saves against unholy creatures to their wearer. At any time, the cassisian can detach themself from their wearer as a single action.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.kHRbOHKEedKaBFH5]{Effect: Transfer Protection}

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
A cassisian can take the appearance of a dove, a winged humanoid, a dog, or a fish. Normally, this doesn't change their Speed or the attack and damage bonuses for their Strikes, but it might change the damage type Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning). Any further changes for specific forms are noted below.

  • Dog
    • Size Small;
    • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.rqfnQ5VHT5hxm25r]{Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet},
    • Speed 40 feet;
    • Skills Athletics [[/r 1d20+6]]{+6};
    • Melee jaws +7, Damage 1d6+2 piercing plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown}
  • Fish
    • Speed Swim 30 feet

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Eye Beams.name: Eye Beams
Eye Beams.description: The cassisian releases beams of heat or cold from their eyes, dealing 2d6 @Damage[2d6[cold]]{cold} or @Damage[2d6[fire]]{fire} damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save) to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:15]. They can't use Eye Beams again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Eye Beams]]{1d4 rounds}.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Unholy Creatu.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Unholy Creatures

Repository of Lore.name: Repository of Lore
Repository of Lore.description: While the cassisian isn't particularly intelligent, they have perfect memory and can remember everything they see or hear. This allows them to attempt Lore checks on any topic, provided (at the GM's discretion) they've encountered the topic in question before. The cassisian's limited intellect often prevents them from acting upon their knowledge, making them a better resource than agent in using information.

Cassisian.name: Cassisian
Cassisian.publicNotes:
The weakest of angels, cassisians usually serve as lackey messengers for more powerful angels or as spiritual guides for mortals. Despite their limited intellect, cassisians have a knack for precise recollection, particularly with scripture. Most cassisians are formed from the souls of trustworthy mortals, but some arise from fragments of greater angels destroyed in service to the celestial realms.

The celestial hosts of angels are messengers and warriors, divided into choirs based on their abilities and purviews. Angels were one of the first creations of the gods, and many still assist their righteous creators throughout the cosmos. Most angels in modern times are not direct creations of the divine, however, instead consisting of ascended mortal souls drawn from the celestial planes.

The majority of unaffiliated angels live in Nirvana, the plane of virtue and enlightenment. Angels who are affiliated with deities dwell in those deities' domains or other areas where that god holds influence. Regardless of residence or service, angels remain benevolent messengers possessed with magical auras to aid their allies.
Cassisian.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. unholy creatures

Doldrums Heap.name: 无风带藻簇 Doldrums Heap

Wavesense (Precise) 120 feet.name: 水波感知（精确）120尺 Wavesense (Precise) 120 feet

Mirage Spores.name: 蜃景孢子 Mirage Spores
Mirage Spores.description:
300尺

无风带藻簇会不断产生致幻孢子，使受影响的人将怪物视为他们最渴望的东西。弥漫范围内的每个生物都必须成功通过一次@Check[type:will|dc:27]豁免，否则就会被无风带藻簇@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]，并在该生物的回合中被迫向其移动。陷入迷魂的生物还将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。如果无风带藻簇发动攻击，迷魂状态只会在被攻击的生物身上结束。如果豁免成功，生物会临时免疫蜃景孢子24小时。

Draw In.name: 卷入 Draw In
Draw In.description:
无风带藻簇尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]至多三个受其@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]的生物。这些尝试既不应用也不累积藻簇的多重攻击减值。

它可以将这些生物移位到自己所处空间，造成@Damage[(1d12+10)[bludgeoning]]伤害。

Doldrums Heap.publicNotes:
虽然大部分马尾藻簇在生长得过大之后便会分裂，但偶尔也会有马尾藻簇会持续无限生长下去。这些“无风带藻簇”会缠绕禁锢船只，将其撕成碎片，或是用无助的乘客饱餐一顿。

马尾藻簇是一团漂浮在大洋上的半智慧海藻，它用致幻孢子引诱受害者。受其影响的人被孢子吸引到马尾藻簇前，憧憬着心中的愿望。可能是失去的爱人，需要帮助的孩子，魅惑的人鱼，干燥陆地的愿景，等等。一旦猎物靠近，马尾藻簇就会用它的海藻卷须将其扑倒并将其压死。

Adamantine Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
The powerful adamantine dragons are one of several dragons known as skymetal dragons. The innate magic that flows through these dragons causes them to draw particular metals to their bodies like magnets or, in some cases, naturally grow these skymetals on their bodies. Adamantine dragons begin their lives with tough scales that are naturally replaced with thicker and even tougher adamantine plating as they grow older. Adamantine dragons are typically steadfast and loyal. Once they commit to a certain purpose, changing their minds is nigh impossible.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.
Adamantine Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs primal

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Abandon Armor.name: Abandon Armor
Abandon Armor.description: Once the adamantine dragon is reduced to fewer than half their Hit Points, their resistance is reduced by 10 and they gain a +10 circumstance bonus to their Speeds.

Resilient Form.name: Resilient Form
Resilient Form.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a weapon or unarmed attack;

Effect The dragon's tough scales ward off deadly attacks. The dragon attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:17]. On a success, the triggering attack becomes a normal hit.

Adamantine Body.name: Adamantine Body
Adamantine Body.description: The dragon’s unarmed melee Strikes are adamantine.

Avalanche Breath.name: Avalanche Breath
Avalanche Breath.description:
The dragon belches a mass of boulders that deals @Damage[15d8[bludgeoning]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save).

They can't use Avalanche Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge use Avalanche Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Burrowing Pounce.name: Burrowing Pounce
Burrowing Pounce.description:
Requirements The dragon is burrowed

Effect The dragon Burrows, then Leaps out of the ground, landing at a point within 25 feet. The dragon makes a melee Strike against a creature within reach when they land. If the Strike is a critical hit, the target is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: The dragon can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. They can leave a tunnel if they desire, and they usually don’t.

Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The dragon Grabs a creature

Effect The dragon uses Swallow Whole.

Adamantine Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Adamantine Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Harmonizing Aura.name: Harmonizing Aura
Harmonizing Aura.description:
20 feet.

Allies in the aura gain a +2 status bonus to sonic damage rolls and a +1 status bonus to AC and all saves against effects with the auditory or sonic trait. Enemies in the aura take a –2 status penalty to sonic damage rolls and a –1 status penalty to AC and all saves against sonic and auditory effects.

Deafening Aria.name: Deafening Aria
Deafening Aria.description: On a critical hit with piercing hymn, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for one minute.

Harmonize.name: Harmonize
Harmonize.description:
The choral angel lends their harmony to a choral angel ally within their harmonizing aura.

The ally can, on their next turn, expend their 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzLkNU3AAqOSKFPR]{Noise Blast} to instead cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KqvqNAfGIE5a9wSv]{Heroism}, or 4th-rank noise blast.

If the ally is benefiting from 5 or more chorals' Harmonize actions, they can instead choose @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree}.

Choral.name: Choral
Choral.publicNotes:
Choral angels are incredible singers who fill the halls of Nirvana with pious chants and sacred hymns. Most form from the souls of talented bards and other performers, though anyone who takes superlative joy in music might ascend to their ranks. Though their duties are typically to spread peace and joy through their music, their holy incantations also brim with mystic purpose, their songs bolstering angelic wards and strengthening the very fabric of the celestial planes themselves.

While choral angels shy away from conflict, they will brave the mortal realm to deliver good omens and auspicious messages. Choral angels often serve the goddess Shelyn, but they can also serve other good deities and empyreal lords.

The celestial hosts of angels are messengers and warriors, divided into choirs based on their abilities and purviews. Angels were one of the first creations of the gods, and many still assist their righteous creators throughout the cosmos. Most angels in modern times are not direct creations of the divine, however, instead consisting of ascended mortal souls drawn from the celestial planes.

The majority of unaffiliated angels live in Nirvana, the plane of virtue and enlightenment. Angels who are affiliated with deities dwell in those deities' domains or other areas where that god holds influence. Regardless of residence or service, angels remain benevolent messengers possessed with magical auras to aid their allies.
Choral.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Susceptible to Death.name: 易于死亡 Susceptible to Death
Susceptible to Death.description:
尽管魅影并非生者，但他们也并非亡灵，而且他们还特别容易受到死亡效果的影响。

一个因死亡效果（如@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Z9OrRXKgAPv6Hn5l]{处死一指 Execute}法术) 导致生命值降低到0的魅影会立即被带到灵魂之河，在那里他们的灵魂会回归至通往来世的正常路径。

Walk the Ethereal Line.name: 游于两界 Walk the Ethereal Line
Walk the Ethereal Line.description:
魅影游走在物质宇宙和灵界间那细薄的分界线上，从而同时存在于两个位面。

他们能通过再次使用此能力来转换回仅存在于灵界（的状态）。

-1 Status to All Saves vs. Death Effects.name: 对抗死亡效果-1状态减值

Phantom Touch.name: 魅影之触 Phantom Touch
Phantom Touch.description: 每次发动打击时，魅影都可以选择造成精魂伤害，而非普通的物理伤害。

Phantom Knight.name: 魅影骑士 Phantom Knight
Phantom Knight.publicNotes:
为自己的事业而献身的骑兵和骑士会成为意志特别顽强的魅影。虽然它们的目的各不相同，但这些魅影大都寻求继续他们的终生使命，哪怕倍受磨难。即使身为虚体，他们强大的意志力也令他们成为可怕的战士。一个魅影骑士可能会努力寻找他们所属教会或骑士团中还活着的追随者，或者寻找他们在世时认识的其他凡人，以坚定意志，避免不死的腐化。

根据大多数神学家的说法，一个灵魂步入来世的轨迹通常相当简单。当一位凡人死亡，他的灵魂抵达灵魂之河并最终到达骨园，它们在那由法莱斯玛审判。经审判的灵魂进入适合它最后安息的领域——天堂、地狱、末日荒原等等——在那里它成为一个残影。

然而，当一个等待判决的灵魂过早地离开灵魂之河并被引入灵界时，麻烦就发生了。不论是如邪魔或鬼婆等穷凶极恶的干预者、还是恶毒的位面魔法、甚至是命运，这些灵魂被逐出生与死的天然秩序，并徘徊在近乎于炼狱的状态中。不像祈并者，这些缥缈/灵质组成的魅影保留着他们生前的回忆；而且，不像一些和幽灵类似的魂魄，魅影并没有染上不死的邪恶影响——至少，最开始没有，但只要魅影还存在着，腐化的威胁就一直是它们的心头大患。一些魅影最终屈服于这种命运，另一些则终能重新加入灵魂之河。在那之前，这些流浪的灵魂孤苦无依——一群没有真正的家、规划或目的之人。

许多魅影都不想留在这古怪如炼狱般的状态中，要么是因为他们想继续在灵魂之河的旅程，要么是因为他们害怕不死的腐化。为了完成这天然的灵魂循环并成为被审判的对象从而抵达来世，一个魅影必须找到回到灵魂之河的方法。然而，这样的探索并非易事——即使是最有经验的旅行者也会被灵界的薄雾所迷惑，无数的捕食者在这一领域徘徊，寻找可以束缚或吞噬的迷途灵魂。
Phantom Knight.allSaves: 对抗死亡效果-1状态减值

Homunculus.name: Homunculus

Master Link.name: Master Link
Master Link.description:
A homunculus can't speak, but it is telepathically linked to its creator. It can share information back and forth, including its master's knowledge and everything the homunculus hears. The range of this link is 1,500 feet. The homunculus typically has a similar attitude to its creator and is utterly faithful.

If the homunculus is destroyed, the master takes @Damage[2d10[mental]] damage. If the master is slain, the homunculus becomes mindless, claims its current location as its lair, and instinctively attacks anyone who comes near.

Homunculus Poison.name: Homunculus Poison
Homunculus Poison.description:
A homunculus has one dose of poison in a reservoir in its head. It can refill this poison from its reserves with an Interact action

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round).

Homunculus.publicNotes:
A homunculus is a tiny servitor construct created by a crafter to serve as a spy, scout, messenger, or assistant. When a crafter first begins to study the art of creating constructs, they often craft a homunculus first, since the creation process is simple and inexpensive due to a magical shortcut: the use of the creator's own blood. This forges a link between the homunculus and its master, causing the homunculus to gain a spark of the creator's intellect, as well as the same moral values and some of the creator's basic personality traits. Homunculi left to their own devices never stray far from their masters.

In most cases, a homunculus doesn't survive the death of its master for long. Deprived of its creator, a homunculus loses focus and grows increasingly selfdestructive, and some even end up battering themselves to annihilation. Rarely, a homunculus with a slain master survives the trauma with its mind intact, often seeing itself as its deceased creator's child or successor and attempting to further its creator's legacy as best it can. In such cases, and if the homunculus was in close proximity to its master upon that creature's death, a portion of the dead master's soul "infects" the surviving homunculus as they pass on to the afterlife.

This doesn't result in a truly soulbound homunculus, since only a fragment of the soul is left behind, but this is still enough to grant the homunculus a greater personality, free will of its own, and perhaps most importantly, the ability to speak. Over time, a few of these "awakened" homunculi even go so far as to become convinced that they are the reincarnation of their prior masters, although their actual personalities never quite reach the depth and complexity of a truly living creature. They are, at best, caricatures of the master, and at worst, they become awful, bitter-minded parodies of life itself. Still, a free-willed homunculus might pursue studies in its creator's class, becoming a unique creature with the abilities of that class if time and fortune permit.

Homunculi are created from a mixture of clay, ash, mandrake root, spring water, and a pint of the creator's own blood. It is possible for a separate donor to provide the blood, but the process is more difficult.

Gnomish Shift.name: Gnomish Shift
Gnomish Shift.description:
Trigger The gnome bard would take damage

Effect The gnome bard gains resistance 2 to the triggering damage and teleports to an adjacent space.

Do a Jig!.name: Do a Jig!
Do a Jig!.description:
The gnome bard plays a ditty that inspires dance. One creature within 30 feet must make a @Check[type:will|dc:19] saving throw.

Success the target is unaffected.

Failure The target must waste 1 action on its next turn dancing.

Critical Failure The target must waste 2 actions on its next turn dancing.

Gnome Bard.name: Gnome Bard
Gnome Bard.publicNotes:
Being a bard allows a gnome a wonderful excuse to constantly travel and see new places while simultaneously creating wonderful things. Occasionally, these bards have a reputation for inappropriate or socially critical performances.

Gnomes are known for being creative and curious. They stand at around 3 feet tall, and their vivid personalities match their naturally vivid hair and eye color. Gnomes possess a natural connection to their ancestral home, the First World. They crave adventure and new experiences to fight off an ancestry-wide affliction known as the Bleaching. Gnomes who fail to dream and innovate begin to slowly lose their color and fall into a deep depression.

A notable subgroup of gnomes called umbral gnomes typically have gray or brown skin with a stony texture, and thin, pale hair or bald pates. Umbral gnomes are most numerous in the Darklands, where they go by the name drathnelar. Umbral gnomes often attribute these physical changes to the gnome deity regarded as the first of their kind, Nivi Rhombodazzle. Nivi was a surface gnome who traveled deep into the Darklands and was ultimately rewarded with demigodhood when she exchanged a particular gemstone with the dwarven deity, Torag. Nivi is immune to the Bleaching, and umbral gnomes are often immune or resistant to it as well.

Sneak Attack.description: The caligni skulker deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

Tumble Behind.name: Tumble Behind
Tumble Behind.description: When the caligni skulker Tumbles Through a creature's space, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the next attack the skulker makes against it before the end of its turn.

Final Night.name: Final Night
Final Night.description:
When the caligni skulker dies, their remains dissolve into a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] of inky darkness before dissipating. The darkness extinguishes non-magical light sources and attempts to counteract magical light as a 1st-rank effect with a [[/r 1d20+10 #Counteract]]{+10} counteract modifier.

The skulker's possessions are left in a pile where they died.

Caligni Skulker.name: Caligni Skulker
Caligni Skulker.publicNotes:
Most often found on the surface are caligni skulkers, stealing staple goods and luxuries alike. When pressed into combat by more powerful caligni, skulkers will often be sacrificed in waves to wear down the enemy. Otherwise, skulkers are fairly cautious and prefer to flee unwinnable situations.

Calignis lurk in subterranean cities, with each caligni growing into a specific role and form determined by supernatural influences in caligni society. Regardless of their size or role, all calignis are gaunt, with pale flesh and white eyes. Many relish the chance to creep above ground at night to steal resources, shadow their surface counterparts, or simply make mischief.

Carry.name: 抓握 Carry
Carry.description: 当一个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]于风神翼龙尖爪时，风神翼龙能以半速飞行。当它如此做的时候，它的两只脚爪都被占据。

Swoop.name: 飞扑 Swoop
Swoop.description: 风神翼龙最多以满速飞行，并在这一行动中的任何时刻进行一次长喙或脚爪打击。

Quetzalcoatlus.name: 风神翼龙 Quetzalcoatlus
Quetzalcoatlus.publicNotes:
风神翼龙是翼龙家族中最大的飞行成员，由于其巨大的体型和40尺的翼展，经常被误认为是龙。

风神翼龙是肉食动物，以各种爬行动物、哺乳动物、大型鱼类、两栖动物和其他无脊椎动物为食。它们不是天生具有攻击性的生物，只是乐于寻找食物，当他们遇到任何比自己小的猎物时几乎会毫不犹豫地攻击。

翼龙是一种原始的飞行生物。虽然它们中的很多都比人类小，但下面介绍的这两种要大得多，每一种都可能对人构成严重威胁。

这些会飞的爬行动物在许多地区都能找到，但它们往往在温暖或温带气候的天空之上翱翔。它们有时会扩散到自然活动范围之外，成为蜥蜴人或巨人的宠物和狩猎伙伴。生活在与世隔绝的山谷里的云巨人也训练最大的翼龙把它们的信息传递到外面的世界。

Web Sense.description:
猎蛛可以通过震颤感知（模糊）来感知到生物触碰它们蛛网时产生的振动。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Tremorsense]
Web Sense.name: 蛛网感知 Web Sense

Web Trap.name: 网捕 Web Trap
Web Trap.description: 被猎蛛蛛网打击命中的生物被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]，并且被困在距离最近的表面上，直到@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]（DC17）。

Spring Upon Prey.name: 饿蛛扑食 Spring Upon Prey
Spring Upon Prey.description:
需求 尚未投掷先攻

触发 当猎蛛位于它的蛛网上时，一个生物触碰到蛛网。

效果 猎蛛自动注意到该生物，并在投掷先攻前，可以在蛛网上进行行走、攀爬或蛛网垂降（Descend on a Web）动作。

Descend on a Web.name: 蛛网垂降 Descend on a Web
Descend on a Web.description:
猎蛛用网绳把自己吊在空中，可以垂直下降最多40尺。它可以挂在蛛网上，也可以从蛛网上坠落。它从蛛网上下降的距离不计入坠落伤害。

如果一个生物成功击中蛛网（AC20，硬度3，5HP）时，可以砍断蜘蛛网，导致蜘蛛坠落。

Hunting Spider Venom.name: 猎蛛毒 Hunting Spider Venom
Hunting Spider Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d10[poison]]伤害且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[1d12[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}且措手不及 (1轮)

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}且措手不及 (1轮)

Hunting Spider.name: 猎蛛 Hunting Spider
Hunting Spider.publicNotes:
猎蛛不是巨蜘蛛中最大的，但确是最常见的种类。

很少有害虫能像声名狼藉的蜘蛛那样让人如此恐惧。

Con Rit Venom.name: 海蜈蚣毒 Con Rit Venom
Con Rit Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25];

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[2d10[poison]]且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] (1轮)

阶段3 @Damage[2d10[poison]]，措手不及且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} (1轮)

Spit Venom.name: 喷射毒液 Spit Venom
Spit Venom.description:
海蜈蚣喷出一道推力十足的毒液波，对@Template[type:line|distance:30]范围内造成@Damage[2d10[poison],2d10[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还将被推离10尺。

海蜈蚣无法在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Spit Venom]]{1d4轮}内再次使用喷射毒液。

Undulate.name: 乘波 Undulate
Undulate.description: 海蜈蚣游泳。在此移动期间，它可以不进行挤入空间而穿过5尺宽的狭缝。

Con Rit.name: 海蜈蚣 Con Rit
Con Rit.publicNotes:
海蜈蚣是一种体型庞大的水生蜈蚣，它用数百条腿换来了同样多的鳍。这种海生昆虫游动起来十分优雅，既威风凛凛，又令人不寒而栗。这种蜈蚣的背部呈深褐色，腹面呈恶心的黄色。因此，无论从上面还是从下面看，都很难发现它。它的外骨骼坚硬如铁，当它游动时，外骨骼板的移动会发出拉长的、令人毛骨悚然的响声。

许多人曾一度认为海蜈蚣是某种龙。这不仅是因为它体型巨大，还因为它能够将毒液射成一道聚集的波。它可以用这种方法把鸟儿从天上打下来，或者把水手从船上打下来。它们在水中的行动也与龙并无二致。那些为了寻找宝藏而前往海蜈蚣巢穴的人通常都会失望（如果他们没有被这只巨大的昆虫生吞活剥的话）。

传说中，海蜈蚣和凤凰一样，死后会重生。但事实并非如此。海蜈蚣会在其领地地表以下的地方筑巢，通常是在水下洞穴中。海蜈蚣一生中会在洞穴里产下成千上万颗永远不会孵化的蛋。海蜈蚣会吃掉所有太老的蛋，但总有大量的蛋存留下来。海蜈蚣死后，会向空气和水中释放一种气味强烈的化学物质，从而触发孵化过程。卵会在一个月内慢慢裂开，成百上千的小海蜈蚣开始互相争夺领地。到了年底，其中一只将获胜并完全成熟。这种循环导致了无尽重生的传说。还有一些故事说，每一代的海蜈蚣体型都会略微变小，因此传说中的古代海蜈蚣有数百尺长。不过，这种传说中的昆虫的大小还有待研究此类事物的学者证实。

Double Slice.name: Double Slice
Double Slice.description: The caligni hunter makes two Strikes against the same target, one with each of their shortswords. The hunter combines the damage of any attacks that hit and applies precision damage, resistances, and weaknesses only once. Both attacks count toward the hunter's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks.

Encircling Command.name: Encircling Command
Encircling Command.description: Each caligni skulker within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} of the skulker can Step. Each creeper can benefit from Encircling Command only once per round.

Final Fate.name: Final Fate
Final Fate.description:
When the hunter dies, their soul leaves their body in an explosion of spiritual energy. All creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] take @Damage[5d6[spirit]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:19|basic:true] save).

The hunter's possessions are left in a pile where they died.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The caligni hunter deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Caligni Hunter.name: Caligni Hunter
Caligni Hunter.publicNotes:
Although caligni hunters are often pressed into leading their skulker kin, most hunters prefer to wander the Darklands or raid the surface free from those responsibilities. Their preferred assaults are usually done by solo caligni hunters or in small groups of two or three.

Calignis lurk in subterranean cities, with each caligni growing into a specific role and form determined by supernatural influences in caligni society. Regardless of their size or role, all calignis are gaunt, with pale flesh and white eyes. Many relish the chance to creep above ground at night to steal resources, shadow their surface counterparts, or simply make mischief.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair the dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Hell's Sting.name: Hell's Sting
Hell's Sting.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon channels the rancor of Hell back through the body of their foe, overwhelming it with an infernal assault on the mind. The triggering creature takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[type:will|dc:30|basic:true] save. Holy creatures use an outcome one degree of success worse than they roll on their saving throw.

Diabolic Fire.name: Diabolic Fire
Diabolic Fire.description: Any fire damage that a diabolic dragon deals, including fire damage from spells, is imbued with the unholy power of Hell to scorch the spirit as well. A creature takes spirit damage instead of fire damage if that would be more detrimental to the creature (as determined by the GM). A diabolic dragon is immune to the diabolic fire of other diabolic dragons, the fire from divine immolation, and similar effects.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Hellfire Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of infernal fire that deals @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true] save).

The dragon can't use Hellfire Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Diabolic Dragon (Young).name: Diabolic Dragon (Young)
Diabolic Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Hell, according to some theologians, is a living entity in and of itself. Diabolic dragons, these scholars argue, are just extensions of the plane, living creatures that break off from Hell to enact its will. Whether this is true or whether diabolical dragons are simply the reborn souls of dragons sent to Hell, the fact remains that these dragons are powerful, cunning, and tyrannical. Every diabolic dragon's goal is to further Hell's will, though how this happens can vary. Regardless of their goals, these dragons always approach newcomers with an unsettling calmness.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Diabolic Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Pugwampi.name: Pugwampi
Pugwampi.publicNotes:
Mean, dog-faced, and craven, pugwampis take disproportionate enjoyment from the accidents and missteps of other creatures—something that happens often due to the supernatural aura of ill fortune these gremlins project. They enjoy preparing pranks involving spikes, excrement, pits full of spiders, and similar twisted torments. Pugwampis are somewhat deaf and thus often yell loudly to each other when not hiding. Many pugwampis worship kholos as gods and aspire to be more like them. Kholos, on the other hand, hate pugwampis because of their sycophantic fawning.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life in the Universe, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. Nearly all gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the slightest, carefully targeted nudge from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom stronger gremlins derisively call "baggies."

Unluck Aura.name: Unluck Aura
Unluck Aura.description:
20 feet.

When a creature that isn't an animal, gremlin, or kholo enters the aura, it might become unlucky. It attempts a @Check[type:will|dc:16] save; it must roll twice and take the worse result. On a success, the creature is temporarily immune to pugwampi unluck auras for 24 hours. On a failure, the creature must roll twice and take the worse result on all checks as long as it's within the aura.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.yxgHWK2rTZKKAzDN]{Effect: Unluck Aura}

Worry.name: 撕咬 Worry
Worry.description:
需求 一个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]于恐狼的颚

效果 恐狼用牙齿凶猛地撕扯受擒的生物，造成@Damage[(1d10+2)[piercing]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true]豁免）。

Pack Attack.name: 群起攻之 Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: 对于触及范围内至少有两名恐狼的盟友的生物，恐狼的打击造成1d6点额外伤害。

Dire Wolf.name: 恐狼 Dire Wolf
Dire Wolf.publicNotes:
恐狼比它们的同类更大，个性也更暴躁，它们经常出没在原始的土地上，这些土地可以容纳它们庞大的体型，更大的狩猎范围和胃口。兽人喜欢用恐狼作为坐骑，它们发现自己狂暴的个性非常适合狩猎和战争。

狼在森林、山丘和其他荒野上游荡，成群结队地捕猎围攻，然后再杀死猎物。像大多数食肉动物一样，狼更喜欢攻击它们能找到的最无力或最脆弱的猎物。

Sea Serpent.publicNotes:
这些传说中的野兽像巨大的蛇，背上长有长长的鳍刺。大海蛇性情乖戾、领地意识强烈，能轻易弄翻船只，而且大多数在饥饿时或受到威胁时都会毫不犹豫地这么做。关于受害的船长们的故事比比皆是，他们中的很多人一生都在追捕这些弄沉了他们的爱船、让他们丢掉饭碗的难以追踪的怪物。这种追捕只能依赖于各种谣传或对这种动物的一瞥，因为确实很少有生物能在大海蛇造成的灾难中幸存下来。

虽然许多渔民传说中把大海蛇描述成神祇指派的海洋守护者，亦或是魔鬼或恶魔的代理者。事实上是，大海蛇只是非常巨大的野兽，具有难以被魔法侦测的技巧而已。

Undetectable.description: 大海蛇能自动对任何针对它的带有侦测(Detection)、揭示(Revelation)或探知(Scrying)特征的效果进行反制，并且使用@Check[type:stealth]调整值作为其反制调整值。
Undetectable.name: 难以侦测 Undetectable

Capsize.description: 大海蛇尝试倾复与它相邻的并且体型和它相等或更小型的船只。大海蛇必须进行一次@Check[type:athletics|dc:35]检定（目标体型每比大海蛇小一阶，则DC-5），或对抗驾驶者的航海知识DC，二者取高。
Capsize.name: 倾覆 Capsize

Sea Serpent Algae.name: 大海蛇藻毒 Sea Serpent Algae
Sea Serpent Algae.description:
大海蛇脖子周围的器官里充满了能影响精神的藻类。

豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]，并且如果目标飞行，则浪费它每轮的第一个动作用于下降 20尺 (1轮)

阶段2 困惑； 并且如果目标飞行，持续下降到地面或者水面以下 (1轮)

Spine Rake.name: 棘刺刮擦 Spine Rake
Spine Rake.description: 大海蛇将它背部的棘刺张开，并游泳或行走。在此行动期间任何时刻和大海蛇相邻的生物都受到@Damage[(4d6+8)[slashing]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true]豁免）。

Sea Serpent.name: 大海蛇 Sea Serpent

Sylvan Wine.name: Sylvan Wine
Sylvan Wine.description:
A satyr's wineskin magically enchants any alcohol inside. With an Interact action, a living creature can imbibe the alcohol and gain a +1 item bonus to Will saves and a +3 item bonus to Will saves against fear effects for the following hour. When the wineskin is removed from a satyr's person, the magic remains only until the wine spoils. The wineskin holds up to eight drafts of wine.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QDs8t1U1IepzYlyi]{Effect: Sylvan Wine}

Fleet Performer.name: Fleet Performer
Fleet Performer.description: When the satyr Plays the Pipes to cast a spell, he can Step or Stride as part of the activity.

Play the Pipes.name: Play the Pipes
Play the Pipes.description:
Requirements The satyr is holding a musical instrument.

Effect The satyr plays a melody on his instrument to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} without expending the spell slot.

The spell gains the auditory trait and targets all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] instead of its usual targets. A creature that succeeds at its Will save against any spell is then temporarily immune from spells played from that satyr's pipes for 1 minute. Satyrs are immune to this music.

Satyr.name: Satyr
Satyr.publicNotes:
To a satyr, life is a party and everyone is invited. Notorious for their hedonism, these fey believe there's no greater beauty than can be found in song, drink, indulgent meals, and carnal pleasures. Satyrs use their enchanting songs and natural charm to encourage all manner of people to follow their true desires and free themselves from society's rules. This usually involves enticing mortals to join raucous parties or engage in trysts in moonlit glades. If a potential companion rejects a satyr's advances, however, the satyr has little interest in continuing a conversation and goes off to find more amenable revelers.

The lifestyle of a satyr leaves no room for ongoing affairs or long-term friends. Once his party is over or his lust is satiated, the satyr disappears back into the forest. The offspring satyrs leave behind are satyrs themselves, and they usually end up being taken from their cradles by other fey rather than left in mortals' care. Satyrs are always male.

The untouched beauty of the forest is sacred and precious to a satyr. Brutish intruders who clear-cut trees or massacre animals without eating them risk drawing a satyr's ire. A satyr so provoked uses his spells to undermine foes and attempts to dispatch them either with brutal ambushes or by leading a rush of forest animals to attack.

Other fey, particularly more benevolent fey, look upon satyrs as loutish, embarrassing cousins. They're rarely hostile toward satyrs, but most find them insufferable and advise any mortals they like to steer clear of satyrs' glades.

Frightful Sight.name: 恐怖形象 Frightful Sight
Frightful Sight.description:
60尺

此灵光作用如同@Check[type:will|dc:32]的恐怖威压灵光，生物在看到怪大头之前无需进行豁免。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Mist Vision.name: 雾视 Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: 怪大头忽视由雾气和迷雾带来的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。

Reflective Scales.name: 反射鳞片 Reflective Scales
Reflective Scales.description:
触发 30尺内有生物施放带有光亮特征的法术或使用带有光亮特征的能力

效果 怪大头调整自己的位置来用鳞片反射光线，造成致盲效果。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内所有生物必须成功通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:33]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]状态1轮。

Drain Water.name: 吸水 Drain Water
Drain Water.description:
需求 怪大头处于至少10尺深的水体10尺内，且其水囊是空的

效果 怪大头通过长鼻吸水来填满水囊。降低水体10尺高度。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内处于水中的所有生物直到怪大头下回合开始陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

Inflate.name: 充气 Inflate
Inflate.description: 怪大头使身体充气膨胀。它变为巨型体型，获得30尺飞行速度，直到其下回合结束，然后飞行。如果它@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]或解消此效果便会泄气。

Mist Breath.name: 吐雾 Mist Breath
Mist Breath.description:
需求 怪大头水囊是满的

效果 怪大头排空自己的水囊来在@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]范围内吐出迷雾。雾中所有生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态，且雾外所有生物对雾内生物视作隐蔽状态。迷雾会在1轮后消散。

Spout Water.name: 喷水 Spout Water
Spout Water.description:
需求 怪大头水囊是满的

效果 怪大头排空自己的水囊，用长鼻喷出水流，对@Template[type:line|distance:90]内所有生物造成@Damage[9d10[bludgeoning]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:33|basic:true]豁免。豁免失败的生物被推离10尺（大失败为20尺）。

Quai Dau To.name: 怪大头 Quai Dau To
Quai Dau To.publicNotes:
这种大头魔兽全身覆盖着闪闪发光的鳞片；眼睛像个大铜壶，嘴里长满了锋利的牙齿。虽然外表像鱼，但怪大头大部分时间都生活在陆地上，沿着河边或湖边捕食。它先用长鼻子吸干附近的水，然后再使用致命的技巧捕猎。怪大头可以将水排出体外，其力量之大足以将骑士击下马，或轻柔地将自己包围在薄雾中。

怪大头对声音极为敏感。如果它们听到狩猎场附近有太大的动静，就会猛烈发起攻击。尽管它们体型庞大，但无声无息的移动使它们能够悄悄地接近这些分心的猎物。研究人员经过大量研究发现，怪大头没有传统意义上的耳朵。它们的头骨上部有一个器官，可以膨胀起来用来盛放攻击时使用的水。这个器官对空气中的振动极为敏感，被用作伪耳。

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Zombie Rot.name: Zombie Rot
Zombie Rot.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately

Plague Zombie.name: Plague Zombie
Plague Zombie.publicNotes:
Plague zombies are infested with horrible contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Challenge Fate.name: Challenge Fate
Challenge Fate.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack;

Effect This fate is not set in stone. The attacker rolls the triggering attack twice and uses the worse result.

Walk the Timelines.name: Walk the Timelines
Walk the Timelines.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The dragon splits themself into two versions with different fates. Each copy Strides or Flies from the dragon's current space, then takes a single action. If the actions are both attacks, they use the same multiple attack penalty and count as one attack toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty.

After both actions, the dragon chooses one of the two locations as their actual destination and the other version of themself disappears.

Untethered to Fate.name: Untethered to Fate
Untethered to Fate.description: The dragon can choose to negate any fortune or misfortune effects that would affect them; other creatures remain affected normally.

Destiny Breath.name: Destiny Breath
Destiny Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a translucent mist of potentialities that overwhelms creatures with visions of possible features, dealing @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:will|dc:30] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) as it struggles with the visions.

The dragon can't use Destiny Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Destiny Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Destiny Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Prophetic Wings.name: Prophetic Wings
Prophetic Wings.description:
