Others note that the serpentine form is one of the most primeval shapes, perhaps suggesting that in a reality at the dawn of time, such shapes were all that could exist. The proteans themselves have little to say on the matter, which, perhaps ironically, only adds to the confusion and lack of consensus surrounding their kind. After all, if even chaos cannot be trusted to be chaotic, would that not be the purest form of entropy?

Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A voidworm can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants them the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).

Protean Anatomy.name: Protean Anatomy
Protean Anatomy.description:
A voidworm's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the voidworm takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, they gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the voidworm takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The voidworm is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the voidworm automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The voidworm takes on the appearance of a Tiny animal. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Confounding Lash.name: Confounding Lash
Confounding Lash.description: A creature hit by the voidworm's tail Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical hit). A successful @Check[type:will|dc:16] save negates this effect and grants temporary immunity to confounding lash for 1 minute.

Snow Vision.name: 雪视 Snow Vision
Snow Vision.description: 雪不会减弱雪鬼的视力；它忽视由降雪带来的带来的隐蔽。

Bean Panic.name: 恐豆 Bean Panic
Bean Panic.description: 恶鬼非常害怕豆子，尤其是当季节开始更替之际。如果有生物通过交互动作向恶鬼扔出一把豆子，恶鬼就将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。在以此法陷入惊惧时，其精魂伤害弱点将增加5。恶鬼随后免疫恐豆24小时。

Falling Frozen Lightning.name: 降霜雷 Falling Frozen Lightning
Falling Frozen Lightning.description:
雪鬼召唤降下一道冰冷的闪电，洁白如雪。闪电打击60尺内一处位置，将空气凝固成一团雪，充满@Template[type:burst|distance:20]范围，持续1分钟。

雪中所有生物都进入隐蔽状态，且雪外所有生物对雪内的生物视作@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。进入雪中或在雪中开始回合的生物受到@Damage[15[cold]]伤害，进行@Check[type:fortitude|dc:33|basic:true]豁免。

Icy Deflection.name: 寒冰偏转 Icy Deflection
Icy Deflection.description:
触发 雪鬼成为一个不带有火焰特征的远程打击或法术攻击的目标

效果 雪鬼创造一道冰制的反射性阻挡物，使其针对触发的攻击掷骰在AC上获得+4环境加值。如果攻击未命中，雪鬼将该攻击反射向其20尺内的另一个生物。攻击者对新目标重骰攻击骰。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
雪鬼可以变形成任意中型或大型类人生物（358页）。这不会改变其速度，打击的攻击和伤害加值，但可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常变为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Chilling Combo.name: 刺骨连击 Chilling Combo
Chilling Combo.description: 雪鬼对同一生物进行两次拳头打击。如果两次打击均命中，目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，持续1轮。

Snow Oni.name: 雪鬼 Snow Oni
Snow Oni.publicNotes:
即使在冰天雪地的家园中，雪鬼依旧保持着其暴躁的性格。与世隔绝的环境给了它们苦行僧的外衣，许多雪鬼追求完美的身体，陶醉于将自己的肉体变成强大战斗机器的过程。然而它们和其他同类一样享乐和残暴，热衷于泡温泉，喝烈酒和吃人肉。

和许多恶鬼一样，雪鬼的前额中央有第三只眼睛。这只眼睛赋予雪鬼一种神秘的感官，使它们能够看破哪怕最厚的雪花。

恶鬼是一种起源于天夏的大型野蛮生物，它们看上去是拥有鲜艳的皮肤、獠牙和犄角的类人生物。虽然通常被误认为是魔族，但最早的恶鬼最初是神灵，守护自然的精魂。这些神灵遭受了可怕的创伤，因为剧烈的灾难或人们的冷酷无情而失去了它们神圣的护（Wards），结果变成了如今的暴力生物。虽然有些人认为恶鬼可以通过适当的祭祀仪式在精神上被安抚，让它们变回神灵，但许多希望成为救世主的人却被恶鬼臭名昭著的野蛮力量，令人毛骨悚然的牙齿和对风暴的掌控所击倒。

恶鬼拥有伪装成其他类人生物的能力。它们的伪装少有创意，通常会选择与其恶鬼形态相似的特定外貌，并坚持使用。这种简单性让许多人认为恶鬼只局限于一种变幻形态，但事实并非如此。

Tengu Sneak.name: Tengu Sneak

Eat Fortune.name: Eat Fortune
Eat Fortune.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger A creature within 60 feet uses a fortune or misfortune effect

Effect The tengu negates the attempt to manipulate fate and fortune. Eat Fortune gains the opposing trait, and the triggering effect is disrupted.

Feather Fan Dustup.name: Feather Fan Dustup
Feather Fan Dustup.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes;

Effect The tengu waves their feather fan, summoning a small magical breeze that kicks up dust in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] centered on a corner of their space, which lasts for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. All creatures within that area are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all other creatures are concealed to them.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The tengu deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attacker.name: Surprise Attacker
Surprise Attacker.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the tengu.

Tengu Sneak.publicNotes:
Tengu are an adaptable people originally from the continent of Tian Xia, but whose travels have taken them across all of Golarion. As a people in diaspora, tengu are almost always found within larger kingdoms and communities of other peoples, with the exception of their home nation of Kwanlai. As a result, tengu tend to gather in close-knit social groups both with other tengu as well as with other peoples of non-majority ancestries, collecting words and customs from other cultures the way a bird collects trinkets for its nest.

Although humanoid, tengu have very distinct, birdlike features, and many would say that they resemble crows more than they do humans. They have strong, thick beaks, as well as sharp talons at the ends of their arms and legs. Most of a tengu's body is covered in small feathers that range in color from dark brown and midnight blue to glossy black, with lighter colors being rare but not unheard of. Like many avian creatures, tengu have hollow bones, making them much lighter than other humanoids of their size, and some tengu even possess wings that allow them to fly.

Tengu have a strong cultural focus on the sky, considering tall mountaintops sacred places and worshipping gods associated with nature and storms, like Gozreh or Hei Feng. They have a long and proud tradition of both martial arts and smithing, and many aspiring Tian heroes have sought out a tengu mentor or swordsmith. Tengu magic revolves around using tengu feathers, bound into a fan, as a medium to command wind and lightning, and some tengu even have the power to "eat" misfortune—skills that only help tengu as they continue expanding across Golarion to new lands.

Riding Horse.name: 骑乘马 Riding Horse
Riding Horse.publicNotes: 在许多社会中，马都是坐骑和驮兽。它们是忠诚的和典型的温和生物，对于那些想长途旅行的人来说，它们是无价之宝。较小的种族，像侏儒和半身人，经常使用矮种马作为坐骑，而马是人类和其他中型类人所喜欢的坐骑。大多数人类遇到的马都是驯养的，尽管这些强壮动物组成的大型群落可以在野外找到。

Gallop.name: 奔驰 Gallop
Gallop.description: 骑乘马行走两次，在进行这两次行走时速度有10尺的环境加值。

Shadow Spawn.name: Shadow Spawn
Shadow Spawn.publicNotes: The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light.

Light Vulnerability.name: Light Vulnerability
Light Vulnerability.description: Attacks against the shadow are treated as magical if made by a creature who is in magical light or with an object that is in magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell).

Slink in Shadows.name: Slink in Shadows
Slink in Shadows.description: The shadow can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

Soulbound Doll (Jolly).name: 缚魂娃娃（乐天） Soulbound Doll (Jolly)

Personality Fragments.name: 人格碎片 Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: 缚魂娃娃拥有一部分灵魂提供者的人格碎片，尽管它没有任何生前的记忆。这使得缚魂娃娃与供体灵魂的强烈个性特征相匹配。由于它的灵魂碎片，因此缚魂娃娃拥有无法像大多数构装体一样对精魂免疫。

Soulbound Doll (Jolly).publicNotes:
缚魂娃娃是怪诞的人体模型或娃娃，被灌注了一小片已故凡人的灵魂。这些小小的构装体是由于各种各样的原因被创造出来的——比如说作为同伴或仆人——但是他们的自由意志意味着它们对于他们的创造者并非必然服从。法莱斯玛的信徒常常憎恶缚魂娃娃，认为这是对灵魂自然循环的扭曲，而墓穴女士的崇拜者乐意看到缚魂娃娃的破灭，而不考虑其行为，会将覆灭缚魂偶作为对伟大彼岸的重要服务。

在一系列缚魂构装体中，缚魂娃娃的制造是最简单的，这些构装体包括人形的缚魂人偶，强大的缚魂躯壳，和作为卫兵的缚魂兵马俑。用非自愿的活物创造娃娃是残忍的，非自愿的供体可以抵抗这个过程，通过一次意志检定来对抗创造者的手艺 DC，如果不能阻止灵魂供体的死亡，则会毁掉娃娃。如果某人生前同意使用，也可以用其灵魂制作娃娃。

冒险者遇到的缚魂娃娃通常都是某种守卫；尽管娃娃体型娇小，但灵魂碎片的力量让娃娃的拳头比旁人想象的更加危险。此外，鉴于娃娃的身材，灵魂碎片还能赋予娃娃一个威力巨大的法术。由于具有自主性和非凡的智慧，缚魂娃娃偶尔会被它们的制作者用作强大得多但无意识的构装体的管理者，使这些娃娃能够控制远远超出其自身能力的防御系统。

虽然缚魂娃娃包包含一名刚死不久的人的一小部分灵魂，但其实这不影响死者复活，或直接前往来世。这种灵魂提取的过程对活着的灵魂供体来说则是致命的。

灵魂碎片通常会注入一个镶嵌在娃娃胸部或脖子的灵魂聚焦宝石（硬度10）。灵魂碎片一般会保留原灵魂的强烈个性特征，但娃娃会从初始状态开始不断学习，这意味着它的性格和能力可以改变，可能会变得更像灵魂供体，也可能在自己的道路上越走越远。即使缚魂娃娃被摧毁，它的灵魂聚焦宝石也能保留娃娃的记忆。如果被摧毁的缚魂娃娃的灵魂聚焦宝石是完好的，那么它可以被一些精于缚魂操作的人重新放置到一个新娃娃的身体里，通过这种方法可以很有效的让缚魂娃娃重生。

Diabolic Dragon (Adult).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Hellfire Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair the dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Hell's Sting.name: Hell's Sting
Hell's Sting.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon channels the rancor of Hell back through the body of their foe, overwhelming it with an infernal assault on the mind. The triggering creature takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[type:will|dc:36|basic:true] save. Holy creatures use an outcome one degree of success worse than they roll on their saving throw.

Diabolic Fire.name: Diabolic Fire
Diabolic Fire.description: Any fire damage that a diabolic dragon deals, including fire damage from spells, is imbued with the unholy power of Hell to scorch the spirit as well. A creature takes spirit damage instead of fire damage if that would be more detrimental to the creature (as determined by the GM). A diabolic dragon is immune to the diabolic fire of other diabolic dragons, the fire from divine immolation, and similar effects.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of infernal fire that deals @Damage[16d6[fire]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true] save).

The dragon can't use Hellfire Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Diabolic Dragon (Adult).name: Diabolic Dragon (Adult)
Diabolic Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
Hell, according to some theologians, is a living entity in and of itself. Diabolic dragons, these scholars argue, are just extensions of the plane, living creatures that break off from Hell to enact its will. Whether this is true or whether diabolical dragons are simply the reborn souls of dragons sent to Hell, the fact remains that these dragons are powerful, cunning, and tyrannical. Every diabolic dragon's goal is to further Hell's will, though how this happens can vary. Regardless of their goals, these dragons always approach newcomers with an unsettling calmness.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Illusion Sense.name: Illusion Sense
Illusion Sense.description: When the dragon moves within 30 feet of an illusion that can be disbelieved, they automatically attempt a secret check to disbelieve, even if they didn't spend an action to Interact.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Scintillating Defense.name: Scintillating Defense
Scintillating Defense.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon flashes their iridescent scales at the triggering creature to throw off the attack. The dragon gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} against the triggering attack.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

Lunging Bite.name: Lunging Bite
Lunging Bite.description: The dragon lunges their head forward, making a jaws Strike with an extended reach of 25 feet.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The dragon can Hide in natural environments even if they don't have cover.

Captivating Display.name: Captivating Display
Captivating Display.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon opens the fins on their head, creating a radiant display of enthralling colors. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) for 1 round. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to Captivating Display for 1 minute.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Hallucinatory Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Hallucinatory Breath.name: Hallucinatory Breath
Hallucinatory Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a cloud that assaults the senses and deals @Damage[12d6[mental]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:will|dc:33] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure) and is then temporarily immune to being confused by Hallucinatory Breath for 1 hour.

The dragon can't use Hallucinatory Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hallucinatory Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Mirage Dragon (Adult).name: Mirage Dragon (Adult)
Mirage Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
Mirage dragons are masters of illusion magic and use their powers to deceive others and further their own agendas. In addition to their magical prowess, mirage dragons possess a number of additional features to help them on hunts or mislead attackers, such as their camouflaging scales and a hallucinatory breath that can confound multiple foes at once. Mirage dragons are vain and egotistical figures. They ultimately care more about themselves than others.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Mirage Dragon (Adult).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Animal Empathy.name: Animal Empathy
Animal Empathy.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.

Water Dependent.name: Water Dependent
Water Dependent.description: A naiad is bonded to a spring, pond, or similar-sized water feature. If she is more than 300 feet away from it for 24 hours or more, she gains the weak adjustments until she returns. She can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond herself to a new body of water.

Water Healing.name: Water Healing
Water Healing.description: For every 10 minutes a naiad spends soaking in her bonded body of water, she regains @Damage[7[healing]]{7 Hit Points}.

Naiad.name: Naiad
Naiad.publicNotes:
Naiads protect streams, ponds, springs, and other natural bodies of fresh water. While most naiads lead solitary lives close to their chosen home, sometimes they congregate in coven-like groups where river tributaries meet, performing great magic and blessing the waters of the land. Because naiads' bonds to their bodies of water permit more flexibility, they are the nymphs most likely to interact with humanoids—and even visit their settlements on occasion. Unlike other nymphs, naiads occasionally become adventurers, especially when dark forces seek to despoil nature or otherwise threaten the land, joining forces with others to prevent the corruption of the natural world.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

Azuretzi.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Protean Anatomy.name: Protean Anatomy
Protean Anatomy.description:
An azureti's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the azureti takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, they gain the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case their resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The azureti is immune to polymorph effects unless they're a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the azureti automatically recovers at the end of their next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Spell Pilfer.name: Spell Pilfer
Spell Pilfer.description:
Trigger A creature with an active spell effect within 30 feet of the azuretzi fails to resist another azuretzi's Mocking Touch

Effect The azuretzi attempts a @Check[type:thievery] check to counteract one spell affecting the target creature. On a success, the azuretzi transfers the spell effect to themself, keeping the same remaining duration. The target then becomes temporarily immune to Spell Pilfer for 24 hours.

Mimic Form.name: Mimic Form
Mimic Form.description:
As Change Shape, but an azuretzi can assume the form of a Medium or smaller creature. They can mimic a specific creature they can see, but they must succeed at a @Check[type:perception|dc:25] check or the attempt is disrupted. The azuretzi can transform into the same creature again without a check but can retain the details of only one specific appearance at a time. The azuretzi can Dismiss the effect as a free action to return to their natural form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Mocking Touch.name: Mocking Touch
Mocking Touch.description:
Requirements The azuretzi is not currently using Mocking Touch on a spell

Effect The azuretzi mocks a creature's magical ability with a touch. The azuretzi attempts a @Check[type:thievery|defense:will] check against the target's Will DC.

Critical Success The azuretzi learns all spells of 3rd rank or lower the target has available to cast and chooses one. The azuretzi gains that spell as a mock divine innate spell and can cast it once as an innate divine spell using their own DC and spell attack modifier. The spell is lost if unused after 24 hours. The creature can't cast the mock spell until the azuretzi casts it first or the 24 hour period passes, whichever comes first.

Success As critical success, but the mock spell is lost after 1 hour, and the creature touched can cast the spell normally.

Failure As critical success, but the mock spell is lost at the end of the azuretzi's next turn, and the creature touched can cast the spell normally.

Critical Failure Mocking Touch has no effect.

Entropy Sense.name: Entropy Sense
Entropy Sense.description: An azureti can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants them the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Azuretzi.name: Azuretzi
Azuretzi.publicNotes:
Azuretzis are sinuous, serpentine creatures with daggersharp teeth covered in brilliant blue scales and mottled purple and pink highlights that shimmer in a pareidolic approximation of leering, laughing faces. The Maelstrom's chaotic forces spawn these small proteans from a variety of sources: physical mating between older azuretzis, the paradoxical promotion of bestial naunets, and possibly from mortal petitioners, though these azuretzis may just be confusing putative mortal memories with experiences gained from games of mimicry. Never expect azuretzis to operate by any rational, self-consistent rules.

Azuretzis represent the humor of chaos, particularly in the form of mockery and parody via exaggerated mimicry, twisting a target's features into a laughingstock.

Guardians of disorder and natives of the primal plane of chaos known as the Maelstrom, proteans consider it their calling to spread bedlam and hasten entropic ends. The most powerful proteans are demigods known collectively as the protean lords, although they are mysterious entities whose cults in the Universe tend to be obscure and secretive.

Proteans divide themselves into a loose caste system and possess a dizzying variety of powers. Most proteans have a serpentine body with the head of a primeval beast. Scholars have long been intrigued by this fact—that scions of dissolution and disorder would share so many features—pointing out that there is some semblance of order even in the purest chaos. Others note that the serpentine form is one of the most primeval shapes, perhaps suggesting that in a reality at the dawn of time, such shapes were all that could exist. The proteans themselves have little to say on the matter, which, perhaps ironically, only adds to the confusion and lack of consensus surrounding their kind. After all, if even chaos cannot be trusted to be chaotic, would that not be the purest form of entropy?

Clawed Feet.description:
Trigger The gargoyle is Flying, and a creature moves into an adjacent square below it.

Effect The gargoyle makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature.
Clawed Feet.name: Clawed Feet

Statue.name: Statue
Statue.description: Until the next time it acts, the gargoyle appears to be a statue. It has an automatic result of 32 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a statue.

Gargoyle.name: Gargoyle
Gargoyle.publicNotes:
Gargoyles are monstrous hunters made of elemental stone. They use their resemblance to decorative statues to hide in plain sight in cities during the day and descend upon unlucky pedestrians at night. Their most common form is that of a horned humanoid with bat-like wings, but individual gargoyles show a great deal of variation, with some appearing more or less humanoid and others resembling no known creature. A gargoyle's features are not fixed; city-dwelling gargoyles who remain in the same locale long enough slowly morph, day by day, to match the style of the local architecture. These patient monsters can stay disguised for long stretches of time as they patiently await an opportunity to strike.

Gargoyles tend to be lone hunters, though sometimes they band into fearsome groups called wings for protection or sport. On rare occasions, wings become relatively stable communities, and gargoyles in wings may even ally with other creatures such as demons and intelligent aberrations, though these alliances exist on a razor's edge. The majority of gargoyles are treacherous, vindictive, and petty—traits that preclude lasting partnerships. Almost all have some subject they spend days mulling over while in statue form. Some are collectors, focusing on anything from books to grim trophies, while others are ritualistic or overly passionate about niche intellectual subjects or certain artistic motifs. These tendencies often contribute to the dissolution of wings as individuals with conflicting focuses clash.

Sanctified Roosts

In addition to their appearances matching their environment, gargoyles that position themselves on temples or other consecrated ground slowly succumb to the influence of that location. These gargoyles gain the holy or unholy trait, as do their unarmed Strikes. A gargoyle roosting on a temple of Asmodeus, for example, will eventually gain the unholy trait along with changes to their personality that bring it more in line with the god's ethos. Holy gargoyles are also possible, although gargoyles at such locations often abandon their roosts as their changing personality conflicts with their need to hunt.

Adamantine Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs primal

Resilient Form.name: Resilient Form
Resilient Form.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a weapon or unarmed attack;

Effect The dragon's tough scales ward off deadly attacks. The dragon attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:17]. On a success, the triggering attack becomes a normal hit.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Abandon Armor.name: Abandon Armor
Abandon Armor.description: Once the adamantine dragon is reduced to fewer than half their Hit Points, their resistance is reduced by 10 and they gain a +10 circumstance bonus to their Speeds.

Adamantine Body.name: Adamantine Body
Adamantine Body.description: The dragon’s unarmed melee Strikes are adamantine.

Avalanche Breath.name: Avalanche Breath
Avalanche Breath.description:
The dragon belches a mass of boulders that deals @Damage[8d8[bludgeoning]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

They can't use Avalanche Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge use Avalanche Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Burrowing Pounce.name: Burrowing Pounce
Burrowing Pounce.description:
Requirements The dragon is burrowed

Effect The dragon Burrows, then Leaps out of the ground, landing at a point within 25 feet. The dragon makes a melee Strike against a creature within reach when they land. If the Strike is a critical hit, the target is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Avalanche Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: The dragon can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. They can leave a tunnel if they desire, and they usually don’t.

Adamantine Dragon (Young).name: Adamantine Dragon (Young)
Adamantine Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
The powerful adamantine dragons are one of several dragons known as skymetal dragons. The innate magic that flows through these dragons causes them to draw particular metals to their bodies like magnets or, in some cases, naturally grow these skymetals on their bodies. Adamantine dragons begin their lives with tough scales that are naturally replaced with thicker and even tougher adamantine plating as they grow older. Adamantine dragons are typically steadfast and loyal. Once they commit to a certain purpose, changing their minds is nigh impossible.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Ankylosaurus.name: 甲龙 Ankylosaurus

Punishing Tail.name: 猛力甩尾 Punishing Tail
Punishing Tail.description:
被甲龙尾巴打击击中的生物必须通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:24]检定。

如果失败则获@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}，大失败则@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3}。

Ankylosaurus.publicNotes:
甲龙是四足动物，身披重甲，体型矮胖，性情倔强易怒。尽管它们是食草动物，但也因为暴躁地攻击其他侵入领地的生物而为人所知。

甲龙几乎没有天敌，因为它们的骨皮上复盖着尖刺状突起，这些突起向不同的方向突出，防止大型掠食者从各个方向的攻击。甲龙体长约30尺，肩高10尺，重量超过3吨。

这些巨大的爬行动物是世界原始时代的遗留物，现在仍然大量存在于偏僻的荒野中，或者在幽暗地域的地下魔法洞穴中。蜥蜴人、半兽人、巨人和其他人形生物有时会把恐龙当作坐骑、守卫或猎兽。众所周知，人类和其他族裔也收集恐龙，把它们放在动物园里展出，或把它们当作异域宠物或守卫。这通常是富人或怪咖喜欢干的事情，但确实也有一些德鲁伊和其他自然的守护者能与恐龙亲密相处，甚至把它们作为动物伙伴。当恐龙在它们正常栖息地以外的地区安家时，通常可能是因为被圈养的恐龙逃进荒野造成的。

Smaranava.name: Smaranava
Smaranava.publicNotes:
Many view clouded nagas as jealous, malevolent creatures. Only those with the courage to see clearly can recognize these beings for what they truly are: tragic, wounded beings who have been trapped and corrupted by fate. The betrayal and beheading of the naga's mother goddess, Ravithra, cascaded trauma onto all of her creations. Smaranavas have never recovered from this divine wound, and these cursed serpents live wretched half-lives, attempting to fulfill Ravithra's forgotten purpose by tempting and testing mortals they encounter. In this way, they separate the wicked from the righteous, the worthy from the unworthy.

Smaranavas have dark scales that are rendered dull gray by stuck shed skin, their eyes a milky white due to opaque caps over their eyes. Many ritually scar their necks out of sorrow for their mother Ravithra. Legends claim that the wise and enlightened can free clouded naga from their fates, allowing them to shed their forms and emerge as an awakener naga.

Nagas are serpentine beings with magical powers and keen intellects. Physically, they resemble massive snakes, though they often wear jewelry and other ornaments that clearly separate them from their animal kin. Nagas use their innate magic and poisonous fangs to keep all but the most stalwart foes at bay. They keep their own counsel, viewing their cosmic role to be sacrosanct and beyond the understanding of outside scholars. Their unwillingness to explain themselves or entertain the suggestion of alliances has led to a long history of conflict with their neighbors, who read them as aloof, arrogant, or duplicitous.

Nagas often have a powerful sense of duty to their perceived role within the universe, even if this role leads them to violent or tragic ends. Many see them as harsh and stern due to their devotion, terrifying in their majesty yet possessed of an aura of transcendence.

Coils of Knowledge.name: Coils of Knowledge
Coils of Knowledge.description:
The naga's grip is more spiritual than physical. A creature hit by a smaranava's tail must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the tail until they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}, the naga releases them with an Interact action, or the naga dies.

A captive takes a –4 status penalty to Escape, but can choose to attempt an Occultism or Religion check to Escape instead of the usual options without taking this penalty

Smaranava Venom.name: Smaranava Venom
Smaranava Venom.description:
When a holy creature succeeds at a saving throw against this poison, it is immediately cured

Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 5 minutes

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 minute)

Athamaru Hunter.publicNotes:
Deep in the sea, schools of athamarus—piscine humanoids armed with spears and specialized crossbows—stalk sharks, sea serpents, and giant squid from the backs of their giant moray eel mounts. The first hunters to strike are armed with barbed harpoons that deploy large fans of seaweed, slowing and exhausting their prey. A daring few athamarus use the embedded harpoon as a handle to ride prey for a short time. Once the creature is tired, remaining hunters finish it with longspears. Athamarus developed this hunting tradition to forge skilled warriors and deter potential attackers, partially in response to centuries of oppression and mistreatment from other aquatic cultures.

Athamarus rarely hunt land-dwellers, instead offering to trade their services as guides in exchange for metal and ceramic items they can't build underwater—and for tubers, which they consider earthy delicacies. They render aid to damaged sailing ships and rescue shipwrecked sailors, providing food and guidance.

Athamaru communities—usually villages of 200 individuals or fewer—are matriarchal. The ruler of a given community is also the primary egg-layer, providing each generation with powerful familial bonds. The communities are tight-knit and loyal. Matriarchs are advised and assisted by primal spellcasters and healers.

Cooperative Hunting.description: After the hunter attempts a Strike at a Large or larger target (regardless of success or failure), the next Strike one of the hunter's allies makes against the same target gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll.
Cooperative Hunting.name: Cooperative Hunting

Fan Bolt.name: Fan Bolt
Fan Bolt.description:
The hunter prepares their hooked crossbow bolts with carefully woven seaweed.

On a successful crossbow Strike, the bolt embeds and the seaweed fan deploys. The target takes a -10-foot status penalty to its swim Speed. A creature can Interact to attempt a @Check[type:athletics|dc:18] check, removing the bolt on a success.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.seWuw1GMSm3kzCWV]{Effect: Fan Bolt}

Hunt Prey.name: Hunt Prey
Hunt Prey.description:
The athamaru hunter designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The hunter gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey.

The first time the athamaru hits their designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. These effects last until the hunter uses Hunt Prey again.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The hunter's Strikes deal an additional 1d8 damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the hunter's allies.

Smooth Swimmer.name: Smooth Swimmer
Smooth Swimmer.description: The athamaru hunter ignores difficult terrain caused by aquatic terrain features.

Athamaru Hunter.name: Athamaru Hunter

Mind Crush.name: Mind Crush
Mind Crush.description:
Requirements The nilith has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The nilith reaches into the mind of the grabbed creature and implants disjointed images of the victim's worst fears and nightmares. The grabbed creature takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[type:will|dc:31|basic:true] save. On a critical failure, the target is also affected as though by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]{Never Mind}, and it must attempt a second Will save against that effect.

Nilith.name: Nilith
Nilith.publicNotes:
The sleek, dark niliths resemble hairless, emaciated tree sloths. These creatures are intensely dangerous and fearsome, with glowing red eyes, wicked claws, and mouths full of needlelike teeth. Niliths feed off the emotions, fears, and flesh of the living, and folktales posit that those who have nightmares of these creatures are fated to one day be eaten by them. Niliths draw intense joy from tormenting sapient creatures, often focusing their predations on the pious and the just, from whom they draw forth their most basic fears and worst thoughts and revel in their victims' subsequent terror. More often than not, these despicable manipulators wish to drive their victims into madness and even to suicide. Most niliths lack the patience to spend too much time fully tearing down an individual, and when a nilith tires of its current plaything and becomes bored with its particular thoughts and fears, it murders the quarry before feeding on its flesh and moving onto the next victim.

Niliths are actually extensions of much deadlier creatures that dwell in a distant dimension beyond dreams—in a way, niliths are little more than remote feeding machines for the unknown alien entities to which they are connected. Scholars and dimensional travelers have attempted to uncover the exact mechanisms of this mysterious connection, but they have yet to decipher the truth. Indeed, many who investigate the nature of a nilith's bond are driven to madness before getting anywhere close. The odd connection to otherworldly beings might help explain the longevity of these creatures, as it is believed that niliths can live for thousands of years.

Thankfully for others, niliths are solitary creatures that hate the company of their own kind, likely because these harbingers of nightmares have no wish to taste the horrors they bring to others.

Fortune Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Disruptive Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a spray of magic-disrupting energies that deals @Damage[18d6[force]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:45|basic:true] save). Creatures that fail become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.

The dragon can't use Disruptive Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Disruptive Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Disruptive Breath.name: Disruptive Breath

Drain Hoard.description:
Requirements The dragon is within 60 feet of their hoard

Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon draws power out of the magic items in their hoard, regaining all their expended spontaneous spell slots.
Drain Hoard.name: Drain Hoard

Share the Wealth.name: Share the Wealth
Share the Wealth.description:
Requirements The dragon's body is covered in riches (this is typically the case when the dragon is first encountered)

Effect The dragon shakes their body aggressively, sending coins and other riches flying in every direction, dealing @Damage[18d10[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:50]. The dragon's body is then no longer covered in riches.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Aura of Disruption.name: Aura of Disruption
Aura of Disruption.description:
120 feet.

The dragon radiates disruptive energies that allow them to feed on magic. When a spell is counteracted or disrupted within the aura, the dragon regains one expended spontaneous spell slot and gains 35 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Capture Spell.name: Capture Spell
Capture Spell.description:
Trigger The dragon succeeds or critically succeeds on a saving throw against a spell

Effect The dragon attempts to capture a portion of the spell's magic to feed themself. They attempt to counteract the spell (counteract rank 10, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+37 #Counteract]]{+37}). If successful, the dragon is unaffected by the spell and regains one expended spontaneous spell slot; other subjects are affected by the spell normally.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: Whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike, the dragon chooses to either recharge Disruptive Breath or regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

Treasure Dive.name: Treasure Dive
Treasure Dive.description:
Requirements The dragon's body isn't covered in riches and the dragon is adjacent to their hoard

Effect The dragon Strides or Burrows through their hoard using their land Speed. They coat themself in coins, magic items, and other treasures. This contact with magical items revitalizes the dragon, causing them to regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

The dragon can move through other creatures while moving in this way. Creatures in the dragon's path, or above it if the dragon Burrows, must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:38] save or be pushed 10 feet (or pushed 20 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure).

Fortune Dragon (Ancient).name: Fortune Dragon (Ancient)
Fortune Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
Fortune dragons have the innate ability to draw upon the raw magical energies that surround them. They constantly use these magical energies to empower their magical abilities and even their bodies, as the energy can heal wounds. A fortune dragon has a typical build for an arcane dragon, but their bodies sport a striking feature: their treasure. The dragon's nature of drawing upon magic causes coins, gems, and, most notably, magical items to cling to their body like iron drawn to magnets. A dragon constantly pulls magical energies from the items attached to their body and makes use of these energies to cast spells. The magical energies that flow through a fortune dragon constantly flow through the dragon's items as well, and in many cases, the items melt from the heat produced in this process. Fortune dragons are seekers of novel experiences. This desire for originality leads fortune dragons to approach visitors of other ancestries with curiosity, though this initial interest quickly wanes if a visitor lacks exciting qualities.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Wight.name: 尸妖 Wight
Wight.publicNotes:
尸妖是一类诞生自无法摆脱的怨恨循环的智慧不死生物。这种怨恨可能来自它们生前的歹意，也可能是由死灵魔法仪式人为灌输，这通常涉及亵渎墓葬地点。尸妖通常出没于埋骨地、地下墓穴或其他死者所在之地。它们饥渴的目标乃是生者——那些心脏尚在搏动、面色红润温暖的人会激起他们内心的仇恨。

尸妖的种类就和可能会成为它们的生者一样多。粗壮的莽汉、迅捷的潜行者和狡黠的修补匠都能成为弥补不同生态位的不同尸妖。环境也会影响尸妖的特殊能力与防御。例如，在世界上那些容易暴露于危险自然环境的地方，时常能找到冰霜尸妖（Frost wight），此外，因被遗弃于荒野而产生的怨怼也是一种常见的怨恨来源。自身的坚韧加上虚空能力的维持，令尸妖能在极端环境下存续，而不像低级不死生物那样腐烂。

一旦一只尸妖被迫从坟墓中苏醒，便会掀起一场浩劫。因为被尸妖的诅咒杀死的生物也会化作尸妖，所以只需要一个尸妖和几个倒霉的墓地访客，就能形成一场名副其实的尸潮。因此，精明的牧师和冒险者都知道，解决尸妖问题的最好办法就是迅速且彻底地消灭它们。不过，必须要注意，在摧毁亲代尸妖前一定要先消灭尸妖衍体，因为失去主人的衍体会获得创造属于它自己的衍体的能力。

Grave Weapon.name: 坟墓武器 Grave Weapon
Grave Weapon.description: 这个尸妖绑定着一把与它一同埋葬的匕首。别的尸妖可以绑定别的武器。

Final Spite.name: 最后的怨恨 Final Spite
Final Spite.description:
触发 尸妖的生命值被降至0

效果 尸妖被摧毁前进行一次打击。这次打击能施加怨恨侵蚀诅咒，但无法附加怨恨注能的效果。

Fueled by Spite.name: 怨恨注能 Fueled by Spite
Fueled by Spite.description: 每当一个生物由于尸妖施加的怨恨侵蚀诅咒而失去生命值，那个尸妖获得3点临时生命。

Corrupting Spite.name: 怨恨侵蚀 Corrupting Spite
Corrupting Spite.description:
尸妖的无武装攻击与绑定武器的攻击会施加诅咒，令生物变得更加虚弱、充满怨念。若一个尸妖向一个已经受其影响的生物再次施加怨恨侵蚀，该生物必须进行一次新的检定，此次检定结果好于失败并不会如常产生效果，而是直接被忽略。

在受诅咒影响时死去的类人生物在[[/br 1d4 #Wight Spawn Timer]]{1d4轮}后复活为尸妖，由杀死它的尸妖控制。新的尸妖不能使用怨恨侵蚀且处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}。如果它的创造者死了，或者存在了大约一个月后，新的尸妖就会获得自主并变成一个普通的尸妖。

豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1} (1轮)

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2}且无法将任何生物视作盟友 (1轮)

阶段3 如同阶段2，除了流失2改为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 3} (1轮)

阶段4 如同阶段2，除了流失2改为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 4} (1轮)

Irnakurse.name: Irnakurse

Mind Lash.name: Mind Lash
Mind Lash.description: A creature hit by an irnakurse's tentacle is overwhelmed with corrupted images of a ruined life and must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:28] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 4} on a critical failure). After attempting this save, the creature is temporarily immune to mind lash for 24 hours.

Storm of Tentacles.name: Storm of Tentacles
Storm of Tentacles.description: The irnakurse makes up to four tentacle Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the irnakurse's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all of its attacks.

Soul Scream.name: Soul Scream
Soul Scream.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The irnakurse unleashes an alien shriek of nightmarish horror and pain. All non-aberration creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:28] save.

The irnakurse can Sustain Soul Scream for up to 6 rounds; each time it does, it repeats the effect without a new save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected, and it's temporarily immune to Soul Scream for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is stupefied 1. Further failed saves against Soul Scream increase the stupefied value by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4}. Each time the character gets a full night's rest, the stupefied condition gained from Soul Scream decreases by 1.

Critical Failure As failure, except the stupefied value increases by 2 instead of by 1.

Irnakurse.publicNotes:
Irnakurse are believed to be elves who have been subjected to particularly cruel and humiliating fleshwarping practices, though they are so corrupted by their transformation it is nearly impossible to tell. The process of crafting an irnakurse twists the unfortunate elf into a mass of misplaced limbs, loose flesh, and bony protrusions—parts that should be internal are often left on full display to the world. These beings periodically crawl to the surface from the deepest reaches of the Darklands, leading some elven scholars to the gruesome suspicion that these are remnants of the elves who traveled underground in order to escape Earthfall.

Magical mishaps, divine curses, and untested technology are all capable of wreaking drastic transformations on the body, and are all rampant on the world of Golarion and beyond. Creatures that have undergone changes so drastic they no longer can be considered the same ancestry as they were before are known as fleshwarps. These beings are rare, and their unsettling appearance often provokes horrified responses from other people.

Some creatures revel in the total degradation of their defeated foes through fleshwarping. Though the technique was originally taught to mortals by the demon lord Haagenti, mortals have spent eons modifying and perfecting the method. Fleshcrafters torture their enemies in vats of churning magical reagents, reshaping their flesh and psyche alike into horrid and monstrous things.

Quatoid.name: 人面章鱼 Quatoid

Calming Bioluminescence.name: 平静微光 Calming Bioluminescence
Calming Bioluminescence.description:
30尺。

该灵光散发出昏暗光照，弥散范围内的生物对情绪特征的效果的豁免有+2环境加值。人面章鱼可以一个维持动作启动或关闭平静微光。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.pfG1S7yShwkHT9e0]{效果：平静微光}

Quatoid.publicNotes:
人面章鱼是一种奇特而神秘的水元素，它们生长在水元素位面，如同长着四条触手的章鱼，但是在身上长着一张诡异的人形面孔。人面章鱼即使对其他元素来说也是神秘的，但会对凡人的召唤做出反应。他们在战斗中帮助凡人，但似乎更喜欢提供冷静的建议，甚至在血腥的冲突中寻找替代解决方案。

随着它们的元素领主的长期的监禁中归来，人面章鱼在水元素未免的活动也慢慢变得更加活跃。不过，它们的大部分活动似乎仍然集中在凡间。

水元素可能具有非凡的破坏力，但这往往并非出于本心；就像水可以给主物质位面带来生命一样，它的波浪可以冲击海岸，雨水也能淹没城市。水元素同样如此难以捉摸。

Vampire Vulnerabilities.description:
All vampires possess the following vulnerabilities.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures with strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless they're transported while they hide within their coffin, nor can they enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions—a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome their compulsion just as they do their revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a deity with a holy sanctification option. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so, and it remains brandished for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of their revulsion, they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of their revulsion until they end an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of their revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, they overcome their revulsions for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents them from healing above 0 HP, even in their coffin. Staking a vampire requires 3 actions and works only if the vampire is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if they're in their coffin, the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with holy water while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends their turn in sunlight, and the condition ends when they're no longer in sunlight. If the vampire loses all their actions in this way, they're destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors
Vampire Vulnerabilities.name: Vampire Vulnerabilities

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The servitor deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the vampire regains @Damage[5[healing]]{5 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drained value by 1, killing the victim when it reaches drained 5. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[type:medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Vampire Servitor.name: Vampire Servitor
Vampire Servitor.publicNotes:
Vampires use their servitor pawns for infiltration and reconnaissance.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
Vampire Servitor.hp: coffin restoration, fast healing 5, void healing

Avenging Bite.name: 复仇啃咬 Avenging Bite
Avenging Bite.description:
触发 一个在巫狼颚攻击触及范围内的生物攻击了巫狼的盟友

效果 巫狼对触发生物进行一次颚打击

Pack Attack.name: 成群袭击 Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: 巫狼的打击对触及范围内至少有两名巫狼盟友的生物，造成1d6额外伤害。

Winter Breath.name: 冬之吐息 Winter Breath
Winter Breath.description:
巫狼呼出一道冻霜，对@Template[type:cone|distance:15]范围造成@Damage[5d8[cold]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:23|basic:true]豁免）。

巫狼不能在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Winter Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用冬之吐息。

Witchwarg.name: 巫狼 Witchwarg
Witchwarg.publicNotes:
巫狼与座狼相似，但体型更大，更聪明，也危险得多。它们能够呼出冰冻吐息。当它们愿意为他人效力时，它们通常会将这一特权留给更危险的生物，比如伊利森（Irrisen）的冬女巫。

座狼是一种聪明又狠毒的狼，栖息在地精、大地精、兽人和其他残暴类人生物之中。

Conspirator Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Retract Body.name: Retract Body
Retract Body.description:
Trigger The dragon is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature the dragon can see

Effect The dragon retracts the targeted body part or twists away to avoid the attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Conjure Disguise.name: Conjure Disguise
Conjure Disguise.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon conjures a perfect flesh-suit replica of a humanoid they've seen of their size or smaller and compresses themself into it, along with generating appropriate clothing for the humanoid. This process takes 1 minute to complete, during which the dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. If the dragon stops or is interrupted in this process, the suit is destroyed. Once the process is complete, the dragon can remain in this disguise indefinitely.

The transformation has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]{Change Shape}, except that the disguise is not actively magical in nature and doesn't register as magical to detect magic and similar effects. The dragon loses Retract Body while transformed.

If the dragon is critically hit while wearing the disguise, the suit is destroyed and immediately explodes. This has the effects of Detonate Disguise, except that creatures use the outcome one degree of success better than they rolled on their save.

Detonate Disguise.name: Detonate Disguise
Detonate Disguise.description:
Requirements The dragon is wearing their conjured disguise

Effect The dragon erupts from the disguise, destroying it. The explosive revelation deals @Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]] damage to creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save. A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round as it becomes covered in scraps from the disguise.

Any creature sharing a space with the dragon after they erupt is pushed into the nearest empty space.

Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.
Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge Smoke Breath.

Rushed Transformation.name: Rushed Transformation
Rushed Transformation.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect Using the aid of magic and an exhausting amount of effort, the dragon quickly reshapes their body into the form of a generic humanoid figure. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form} except that it lasts only 1 minute, and the dragon doesn't gain the +4 status bonus to Deception as the transformation makes use of the dragon's body to crudely mimic a humanoid form. The dragon can Dismiss the effect.

Whenever the effect ends, the dragon leaves behind scraps of magically conjured flesh, which could give away the dragon's presence.

Smoke Breath.name: Smoke Breath
Smoke Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a noxious cloud of smoke that deals @Damage[7d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|basic:true] save). The smoke remains for 1 minute. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist}, except it fills the cone's area.

The dragon can't use Smoke Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Conspirator Dragon (Young).name: Conspirator Dragon (Young)
Conspirator Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Hidden among the shadows and upper echelons of society are the conspirator dragons. These dragons are schemers, always looking to manipulate and control others, either for personal gain or simply for the thrill of watching their machinations play out. Conspirator dragons see themselves above others and typically speak with infantilizing tones and words. However, as most conspirator dragons meet others while in disguise, they do their best to maintain their disguise.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Army Ant Swarm.publicNotes:
行军蚁群是由刺人的昆虫组成的可怕地毯，会吞噬它所到之处的一切。

蚂蚁是勤劳的昆虫，是大自然进行生态循环的重要帮手。
Army Ant Swarm.name: 行军蚁群 Army Ant Swarm

Cling.name: 附着 Cling
Cling.description:
触发 一个生物离开蚁群占据的空间

效果 蚁群的一部分附着在生物身上对其进行不断的噬咬，它自身受到@Damage[1d6[untyped]]伤害，对目标造成@Damage[3d6[persistent,piercing]]伤害。受害者浸没在水中能将结束持续性伤害的纯骰检定DC减少至5，受害者受到的任何区域伤害都能杀死这些附着的蚁群。

Swarming Bites.name: 虫群噬咬 Swarming Bites
Swarming Bites.description:
蚁群占据空间内的每个敌人都受到@Damage[3d6[piercing]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|basic:true]豁免）。豁免失败生物还会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}，持续1轮。当生物受到该效果影响，并且尝试带有专注或操作特征的动作，他必须通过@Check[type:flat|dc:5]检定否则会丢失该动作；该纯骰检定在动作结束之后，效果生效之前进行。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.0aRm0b55015XPj7Y]{效果：虫群噬咬}

Clobbering Charge.name: 重击冲锋 Clobbering Charge
Clobbering Charge.description: 肿头龙至多以最大速度行走。如果它在结束移动时触及范围内有目标，它能对目标进行一次头顶打击。如果肿头龙此次打击造成重击，目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

Sudden Shove.name: 突然推撞 Sudden Shove
Sudden Shove.description:
触发 肿头龙以头顶打击对一个体型不超过中型的敌人造成伤害

效果 肿头龙低头再把头扬起，将敌人顶飞。它尝试一次@Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude]检定，对抗目标的强韧DC。

大成功 肿头龙将敌人从自身推离至多10尺，并且击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

成功 肿头龙将敌人推离5尺。

失败 肿头龙未能推动目标。

大失败 类似失败，但是失败的尝试导致肿头龙@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]1轮。

Pachycephalosaurus.name: 肿头龙 Pachycephalosaurus
Pachycephalosaurus.publicNotes:
肿头龙通常是和平的食草恐龙，但在交配季节中会变得更加暴力，它们为了赢得配偶而彼此争斗，并对入侵者发出警告。当潜在的捕食者离它们太近时，它们也会激烈地保护自己。肿头龙的头顶有一个独特的圆顶状的冠，周围环绕着许多钝骨角。该特性加上肿头龙有力而紧凑的脖子，使它能够进行伤害巨大的攻城锤般的冲锋。

一些类人生物群体已经成功地将肿头龙训练成坐骑，但这种生物并不是特别适合这项任务。

肿头龙从头到尾一般15尺，重1400磅。

这些巨大的爬行动物是世界原始时代的遗留物，现在仍然大量存在于偏僻的荒野中，或者在幽暗地域的地下魔法洞穴中。蜥蜴人、半兽人、巨人和其他人形生物有时会把恐龙当作坐骑、守卫或猎兽。众所周知，人类和其他族裔也收集恐龙，把它们放在动物园里展出，或把它们当作异域宠物或守卫。这通常是富人或怪咖喜欢干的事情，但确实也有一些德鲁伊和其他自然的守护者能与恐龙亲密相处，甚至把它们作为动物伙伴。当恐龙在它们正常栖息地以外的地区安家时，通常可能是因为被圈养的恐龙逃进荒野造成的。

Nuckelavee.name: Nuckelavee

Blight Breath.name: Blight Breath
Blight Breath.description:
The nuckelavee breathes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of foulness, dealing @Damage[8d6[void]] damage to living creatures in the area with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|basic:true] save. A creature that fails also takes @Damage[2d6[bleed]] damage.

The nuckelavee can't use Blight Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Blight Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Mortasheen.name: Mortasheen
Mortasheen.description:
The target can't recover from the fatigued condition caused by mortasheen until the disease is cured. Mortasheen gains the virulent trait against animals and plants

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28]

Stage 1 Carrier with no ill effect (1 day);

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 4 dead

Purity Vulnerability.name: Purity Vulnerability
Purity Vulnerability.description:
Unpolluted fresh water burns a nuckelavee like acid, dealing @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage to it and causing it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

A nuckelavee can't heal from damage when it's in an area that isn't polluted (subject to GM discretion).

Nuckelavee.publicNotes:
When pollution despoils a natural waterway, it draws the dreaded nuckelavee to it from the First World. This spirit of wrath is a grisly sight to behold: a horselike monstrosity with the gnarled upper body of a humanoid growing directly from its back. Further enhancing its awfulness, not a patch of skin exists on the misshapen hybrid form, as though it survived its own flaying.

When a nuckelavee rides forth from its domain, it wreaks a trail of destruction across the land surrounding its path. Nuckelavees are considered among the cruelest and most monstrous fey, seen by some as just desserts visited upon those who would befoul the waters of their homes. A nuckelavee, however, doesn't discriminate between those who pollute and those who merely have the misfortune to be in the wrong place at the wrong time.

Despite their vile reputation among humanoids, nuckelavees are generally respectful of their fey counterparts. Once pollution has been cleansed and water fey like naiads return to a body of water, nuckelavees will peacefully withdraw.

Horned Dragon (Ancient).name: Horned Dragon (Ancient)

Twisting Tail.name: Twisting Tail
Twisting Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the dragon disrupts the creature's action.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The dragon can Hide in natural environments even if they don't have cover.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Miasma.name: Miasma
Miasma.description:
20 feet.

After the dragon uses their Poison Breath, a cloud of poison gas continues to emanate from their body for 1 round. Any creature that ends its turn in the miasma takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:37|basic:true] save).

Any creature in the miasma is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and treats other creatures as concealed. The dragon can see through this concealment.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Poison Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Forest Passage.name: Forest Passage
Forest Passage.description: The horned dragon ignores any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don’t impede their progress.

Impaling Charge.name: Impaling Charge
Impaling Charge.description:
Requirements The dragon doesn't have a creature impaled on their horn

Effect The dragon attempts to gore a foe. They Stride, then attempt a horn Strike. On a hit, the target becomes impaled on the dragon's horn. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} while on the horn (and can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} as normal). The dragon doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the impaled creature grabbed. If the dragon moves, they bring the grabbed creature along with them.

Poison Breath.name: Poison Breath
Poison Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[18d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:37|basic:true] save).

They can't use Poison Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Poison Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Trackless Journey.name: Trackless Journey
Trackless Journey.description: The horned dragon always gains the benefits of Cover Tracks in natural surroundings, even while moving at full speed.

Horned Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
The magic that flows through primal dragons can manifest more animalistic or bestial features in a given type of dragon. Notably among these are the massive paired horns of the horned dragon. While their bulky frames, natural coloration, and prominent ridged scales are all remarkable in their own way, it's the horns that are most obvious and striking at first glance. Horned dragons use their horns to impale their prey in a quick and brutal display of their might. They are generally contemplative and have a fixation on knowledge and self-discipline, traits belied by their bestial appearance. As a result, horned dragons are generally more open to speaking with outsiders.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Horned Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Share the Wealth.name: Share the Wealth
Share the Wealth.description:
Requirements The dragon's body is covered in riches (this is typically the case when the dragon is first encountered)

Effect The dragon shakes their body aggressively, sending coins and other riches flying in every direction, dealing @Damage[9d10[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:35|basic:true] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:40]. The dragon's body is then no longer covered in riches.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Aura of Disruption.name: Aura of Disruption
Aura of Disruption.description:
120 feet.

The dragon radiates disruptive energies that allow them to feed on magic. When a spell is counteracted or disrupted within the aura, the dragon regains one expended spontaneous spell slot and gains 25 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Capture Spell.name: Capture Spell
Capture Spell.description:
Trigger The dragon succeeds or critically succeeds on a saving throw against a spell

Effect The dragon attempts to capture a portion of the spell's magic to feed themself. They attempt to counteract the spell (counteract rank 7, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+28 #Counteract]]{+28}). If successful, the dragon is unaffected by the spell and regains one expended spontaneous spell slot; other subjects are affected by the spell normally.

Disruptive Breath.name: Disruptive Breath
Disruptive Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a spray of magic-disrupting energies that deals @Damage[13d6[force]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true] save). Creatures that fail become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.

The dragon can't use Disruptive Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Disruptive Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Treasure Dive.name: Treasure Dive
Treasure Dive.description:
Requirements The dragon's body isn't covered in riches and the dragon is adjacent to their hoard

Effect The dragon Strides or Burrows through their hoard using their land Speed. They coat themself in coins, magic items, and other treasures. This contact with magical items revitalizes the dragon, causing them to regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

The dragon can move through other creatures while moving in this way. Creatures in the dragon's path, or above it if the dragon Burrows, must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:33] save or be pushed 10 feet (or pushed 20 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure).

Fortune Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Fortune Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Fortune Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Fortune dragons have the innate ability to draw upon the raw magical energies that surround them. They constantly use these magical energies to empower their magical abilities and even their bodies, as the energy can heal wounds. A fortune dragon has a typical build for an arcane dragon, but their bodies sport a striking feature: their treasure. The dragon's nature of drawing upon magic causes coins, gems, and, most notably, magical items to cling to their body like iron drawn to magnets. A dragon constantly pulls magical energies from the items attached to their body and makes use of these energies to cast spells. The magical energies that flow through a fortune dragon constantly flow through the dragon's items as well, and in many cases, the items melt from the heat produced in this process. Fortune dragons are seekers of novel experiences. This desire for originality leads fortune dragons to approach visitors of other ancestries with curiosity, though this initial interest quickly wanes if a visitor lacks exciting qualities.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.
Fortune Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Corpse Throwing.description: A zombie hulk can throw Medium or smaller corpses at foes. They can also throw Medium or smaller zombies for this purpose, who take just as much damage as the target they hit. A zombie that survives being thrown falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
Corpse Throwing.name: Corpse Throwing

Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing
Wide Swing.description: The zombie hulk makes two hunk of meat Strikes against different targets within its reach.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A zombie is permanently slowed 1 and can't use reactions.

Zombie Hulk.name: Zombie Hulk
Zombie Hulk.publicNotes:
These towering horrors rise from monstrous, gigantic corpses.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

Hippogriff.name: 鹫马 Hippogriff

Flying Strafe.name: 飞掠 Flying Strafe
Flying Strafe.description: 鹫马最多以满速飞行，并在这一行动中的任何时刻进行两次鸟爪打击。每次打击必须针对不同的生物。每次攻击正常计算多重攻击减值。

Hippogriff.publicNotes:
鹫马兼具猛禽的高傲和骏马的雄姿，它被认为是生物之间偶然杂交的产物，或者可能是一个具有艺术感的塑肉法师的造物。不管它们的来源是什么，这些动物现在在它们喜爱的平原或山区上空很常见。

鹫马有着猛禽的翅膀、前腿和头部，羽毛颜色与鹰或鹰相似，尽管一些饲养者已经成功培育出拥有纯白色或煤黑色羽毛的标本。它们的躯干、后躯和尾巴与马相似，通常为栗色、茶色或灰色，有些罕见的种类皮毛为黑色、斑马色，甚至奶油色。

鹫马的体型与大型马相似。就像它们的陆地马表亲一样，鹫马也经常要警惕地注视着头顶的天空，因为它们都是饥饿的狮鹫和双足飞龙的首选食物。能保护它们免受这些捕食者的攻击的只有它们超快的速度。

鹫马有特别强的领土意识，并且会狂热地保护它们的领土。他们通常喜欢广阔的草原，起伏的山丘和草原。特别强壮的鹫马把它们的家安放在峡谷壁上的壁龛里，它们在岩石沙漠中捕猎土狼、鹿，偶尔还有类人生物。鹫马喜欢捕食哺乳动物，但它们每顿饭后都会吃点草来帮助消化。

由于鹫马的捕猎习惯对牧场主和他们的牲畜而言都是危害，所以有些社区经常悬赏猎杀鹫马。因此，保存完好的鹫马标本经常与鹿、麋鹿和熊的动物标本一起装饰在边境酒馆和偏远的哨所里。

然而，也有其他一些社区从鹫马刚孵化时就训练它们成为坐骑，供精英士兵在战斗中骑乘——其中最引人注目的是在内海地区（Inner Sea）的城邦国家科瓦萨（Korvosa）的紫貂军团佣兵（Sable Company Mercenaries）。有时人们试图用同样的方式训练成年鹫马，但事实证明这要困难得多。鹫马骑士必须使用特殊的马鞍和战斗技巧，以便与坐骑更有效地协同作战，同时避免干扰坐骑翅膀的活动。

Boggard Warrior.name: 沼蜍勇士 Boggard Warrior

Swamp Passage.name: 沼泽穿行 Swamp Passage
Swamp Passage.description: 沼蜍勇士能忽略由于沼泽地形特征产生的困难地形。

Terrifying Croak.name: 恐惧鸣叫 Terrifying Croak
Terrifying Croak.description: 沼蜍勇士发出可怕的鸣叫声。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内的任何非沼蜍人都会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，除非他们能够成功通过@Check[type:will|dc:18]豁免；豁免中掷出大成功的生物会在1分钟内临时免疫该能力。

Tongue Grab.name: 蛙舌擒获 Tongue Grab
Tongue Grab.description: 若沼蜍勇士用蛙舌命中1个生物，那么该生物会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于沼蜍人。与一般的擒获不同，该生物不会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]，但是他也无法移动至沼蜍勇士的蛙舌触及范围之外。生物可以通过命中AC 15并造成至少3点挥砍伤害来切开蛙舌。尽管这么做不会对沼蜍勇士造成伤害，但它可以使沼蜍勇士无法再次使用蛙舌打击，直至沼蜍勇士花费一周重新长出舌头。

Boggard Warrior.publicNotes:
沼蜍勇士强化了单人作战的能力，而且他们更倾向于单打独斗，因为这样就没人和他争抢杀戮的机会了。他们以在追捕逃兵所具备的近乎达到超自然程度的专注力而闻名。

沼蜍人是好斗的两栖类人生物，他们生活在沼泽、湿地甚至部分雨林中。沼蜍人的成长过程首先从卵孵化为蝌蚪，他们会激烈地争夺食物甚至会在这场斗争中吃掉自己的兄弟姐妹。在接下来的3年里，幸存下来的沼蜍人在学习狩猎、制造和战争的基础知识——一切在力量至上的社会中幸存所需要的理解的知识——的同时，长出双手、双腿和肺部。大多数沼蜍人社会的顶端阶级是身胖体肥的沼泽先知（swampseer），他们懂得如何使用邪恶的神术魔法。

Pixie.name: Pixie
Pixie.publicNotes:
Insatiably curious, overly excitable, and just a bit puckish, pixies are wanderers and tricksters who use their pixie dust to create all sorts of whimsical situations, as well as to defend themselves. They take great pride in their skill at archery, even when not using their arrows to deliver magical ailments. They often practice by shooting drops of dew or severing vines and hairs. Other creatures often have trouble understanding a pixie's rapid, rambling way of speaking.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.
Pixie.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Sprinkle Pixie Dust.name: Sprinkle Pixie Dust
Sprinkle Pixie Dust.description:
The pixie sprinkles pixie dust onto one of their arrows. If the pixie hits a creature with that arrow before the pixie's next turn, the arrow inflicts one of the following special effects of the pixie's choice instead of dealing damage. Each effect depends on the target's @Check[type:will|dc:21] save. On a critical hit, the target gets a result one degree worse than it rolled.

  • Charm (emotion, incapacitation, mental) The arrow has the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell, except the target doesn't gain a bonus to its save if the only hostile act was the pixie firing its bow, and the pixie can choose to direct the target's adoration toward another creature rather than itself.
  • Memory Loss (mental) On a failed Will save, the target loses the last 5 minutes of its memory.
  • Sleep (incapacitation, mental, sleep) The target suffers the effects of a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  • Subdual (mental, nonlethal) The target takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage, depending on its basic Will save.

Hryngar Taskmaster.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+2状态加值，坚定意志
