+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Iron Mind.name: 坚定意志 Iron Mind
Iron Mind.description: 地底矮人监工自动不相信所有1环级或更低等级的幻术。

Take Them Down!.name: 拿下他们！ Take Them Down!
Take Them Down!.description:
地底矮人监工猛砸地面，以卓斯卡之名召集盟友采取行动。所有距离地底矮人监工20尺射程内的相同等级或更低等级的地底矮人盟友在攻击检定和伤害检定上获得+1状态加值，持续至地底矮人监工的下个回合结束为止。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.u1Z7i2RyL6Sd9OVU]{效果：拿下他们！}

Hryngar Taskmaster.name: 地底矮人监工 Hryngar Taskmaster
Hryngar Taskmaster.publicNotes:
监工之神卓斯卡的地底矮人牧师往往会在他们的社区中发挥领导作用，通过胁迫和展示武力来推进他们神明的目标。这些领导人通常被称为地底矮人监工，他们同时向地底矮人下属以及被征服的契约工下令，将两者视为可以替换的存在。因此，几乎所有人都厌恶地底矮人监工。

在地表下方深处，被称为地底矮人的冷酷矮人族群顽强地辛苦劳作，声称其他矮人先祖的地下家园属于自己。很久以前，地底矮人的领袖拒绝与他们的“表亲”一同冒险前往地表，放弃了寻天之旅（Quest for Sky）。名为卓斯卡（Droskar）的被流放的矮人神祇拯救了这些地底矮人，使其摆脱了幽暗地域（Darklands）中困扰他们的恐怖之物，为他们提供了力量、诡计与知识，以此换取对他们永无止境的奴役。许多地底矮人认为通过比他们的同族更加卖力地劳作，就可以建设出比位于太阳之下的那些伟大得多的社会，在没日没夜永不停歇的劳作中从星球的金属矿脉里索取无穷的财富。

通过卓斯卡的祝福以及自身那骇人的工作伦理，地底矮人如今统治者上层幽暗地域中纳-沃斯（Nar-Voth）地区的很大一片领土，人们经常能看到地底矮人的商队在巨大甲虫的协作牵引下穿过隧道。地底矮人的领导层通常由卓斯卡的强大神仆所组成，辅以可怖且无人能挡的武艺高超的战士，再加上天生的异能术法，这使得他们能够击败任何能够对地底矮人统治产生直接威胁的存在。地底矮人社会中近乎所有方面都受到严密等级制领导的控制，由监工指导各行各业的下属。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.description:
A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Scent]

Sinful Bite.name: Sinful Bite
Sinful Bite.description:
A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

Critical Success Unaffected

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure sickened 2 plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} for 1 minute

Gluttonyspawn.name: Gluttonyspawn
Gluttonyspawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords—each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today, sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind.

Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, with slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue.

Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold, while envyspawn appear even more gaunt than the rest of their kin.
Gluttonyspawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental

Shining Child.name: 闪耀之子 Shining Child
Shining Child.publicNotes:
闪耀之子是邪恶而又神秘的怪物，它们漫游在遥远的位面和无人踏足的隅陬中搜寻玄秘的知识。它们的体格异常消瘦，有着长长的白发，无力的手上只有四只手指。虽然因为被它们不断散发出的令人炫目的光芒覆盖而难以看清，闪耀之子的外貌不可思议地熟悉却又如此超凡脱俗。不过它们的脸却是如此的可怕，大到失调的眼睛和膨裂开的大嘴揭示了它们的脑袋就是一个充满了不自然光线的空洞。闪耀之子将这种光芒作为武器，用来编制幻觉，或是聚焦成炽热的光束。

由于它们作为外星和异邪学者的名声，闪耀之子有时会被强大的法师或秘学家召唤来探寻稀有的知识。这种生物从不无偿出让它们的学识，它们通常会要求以卑劣的行动作为回报，而这些行动则将推进它们那高深莫测的长远计划。

这些神秘的生物是星界位面的原住民。在这个浩瀚的位面中，形而上学的物质逐渐积聚着，最终合并成半位面。在这个狂暴的过程中，生命之光的火花有时会切开新生的位面，这些原始位面能量的火花以某种方式转变为了闪耀之子。每个新生的半位面都会在它闪亮的“子嗣”身上留下不同的精神印记，这让闪耀之子们很容易就能通过心灵感应认出它们的兄弟姐妹。闪耀之子被永远地困在少年外貌的身体里，它们致力于学术和暴力，徒劳地试图去理解它们在多元宇宙中所扮演的角色以及它们出生时所燃烧着的不公。

闪耀之子总是会使大多数生物感到困惑，因为它们拒绝使用个体的名字，而喜欢交替使用针对个体和集体的称呼。

Radiance Dependence.name: 光芒依存 Radiance Dependence
Radiance Dependence.description: 闪耀之子在黑暗区域内陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

Blinding Aura.name: 炫目灵光 Blinding Aura
Blinding Aura.description:
60尺

闪耀之子发出明亮的光芒。任何在灵光范围内开始其回合的生物必须通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:29]豁免。如果失败则将@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]1分钟，如果大失败则将永久目盲。成功通过豁免的生物将临时免疫此效果24小时。

Overwhelming Light.name: 威势之光 Overwhelming Light
Overwhelming Light.description:
触发 闪耀之子进入一个魔法黑暗的区域或是在一个魔法黑暗的区域中开始其回合。

效果 闪耀之子尝试反制该魔法黑暗（反制等级7，反制调整[[/r 1d20+23 #Counteract]]{+23}）。

Alchemical Rupture.name: 炼金破裂 Alchemical Rupture
Alchemical Rupture.description:
当剧毒注射者受到重击伤害或受到粉碎音波法术影响时，身上的一个玻璃容器会碎裂，对@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]范围喷出炼金液体。投1d6并查阅炼金容器表来决定碎裂的是哪个容器——当结果为1-5时，范围中的生物受到10d6对应类型的伤害（DC28基础反射豁免）。当结果为6时，生物必须进行对抗恶心效果的强韧豁免检定。

[[/br 1d6 #Alchemical Rupture]] 炼金效果
1

@Damage[10d6[acid]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:acid]豁免
2 @Damage[10d6[cold]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:cold]豁免
3 @Damage[10d6[electricity]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:electricity]豁免
4 @Damage[10d6[fire]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:fire]豁免
5 @Damage[10d6[poison]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:poison]豁免
6 恶心：@Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Alchemical Sickness|traits:disease]豁免，失败时@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（大失败时@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}）

Alchemical Injection.name: 炼金注射 Alchemical Injection
Alchemical Injection.description:
当剧毒注射者以注射器打击命中一个生物，投1d6来决定额外效果。注射器造成2d6对应类型的额外伤害（或让目标受到恶心效果，取决于投掷结果）。

[[/br 1d6 #Alchemical Injection]] 炼金效果
1

@Damage[2d6[acid]]伤害
2 @Damage[2d6[cold]]伤害
3 @Damage[2d6[electricity]]伤害
4 @Damage[2d6[fire]]伤害
5 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害
6 恶心：@Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Alchemical Sickness|traits:disease]豁免，失败时 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（大失败时@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}）

Generate Bomb.name: 生成炸弹 Generate Bomb
Generate Bomb.description:
剧毒注射者从炼金容器中汲取物质填满一个小瓶来制造一枚炸弹，并进行一次炸弹打击。投1d6来决定炸弹效果。如果掷骰结果为1-5，炸弹造成3d10伤害和3溅射伤害，对应容器的伤害类型；你可以改为制作一枚不高于11级，造成相同的伤害类型的炼金炸弹，例如掷骰结果为1时为强酸瓶。掷骰结果为6时，它会制作一枚恶心炸弹，使目标和其溅射半径内所有生物受到恶心效果；只被溅射命中的生物在其强韧豁免上获得+2环境加值。

[[/br 1d6 #Generate Bomb]] 炼金效果
1

酸蚀伤害：@Damage[3d10[acid],(3[splash])[acid]]
2 寒冷伤害：@Damage[3d10[cold],(3[splash])[cold]]
3 电击伤害：@Damage[3d10[electricity],(3[splash])[electricity]]
4 火焰伤害：@Damage[3d10[fire],(3[splash])[fire]]
5 毒素伤害：@Damage[3d10[poison],(3[splash])[poison]]
6 恶心：@Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Alchemical Sickness|traits:disease]豁免，失败时@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（大失败时@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}）

Alchemical Chambers.name: 炼金容器 Alchemical Chambers
Alchemical Chambers.description:
剧毒注射者的身躯里有六个存放不同物质的炼金容器。当剧毒注射者使用能力时会产生随机的炼金效果，掷骰1d6来并查阅下表（如果投出的结果是已经破损的容器，则无炼金效果）：

[[/br 1d6 #Alchemical Chambers]] 炼金效果
1

酸蚀伤害
2 寒冷伤害
3 电击伤害
4 火焰伤害
5 毒素伤害
6 恶心：@Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Alchemical Sickness|traits:disease]豁免，失败则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（大失败时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}）。

Noxious Needler.name: 剧毒注射者 Noxious Needler
Noxious Needler.publicNotes:
这种构装体是行走的炼金术噩梦，能够造成各种各样的痛苦创伤。剧毒注射者能服从命令的能力是由漂浮在它穹顶般脑袋里无心智的类人大脑所赋予的，使它们能充当创造者的劳工与卫兵。

在极其罕见的情况下，在创建它们过程中所使用的大脑可能会保留一些记忆碎片，甚至甚至是真正的智力，从而产生一个具有自己人格和计划的剧毒注射者。非自愿的造物经常会追杀其创造者，如果无法复仇，就会将怒火发泄到类似目标上。其他的则会茫然地重复它们最后记忆中的实验。

Motion Sense.description: 活体焦油能通过震动以及气流来感受周遭事物的运动。
Motion Sense.name: 感知运动 Motion Sense

Adhesive Mass.name: 粘性团块 Adhesive Mass
Adhesive Mass.description:
命中活体焦油的武器会被黏在泥怪身上。移除它需要成功通过@Check[type:athletics|dc:23|action:force-open]检定进行破拆。活体焦油同时能够黏在身上任意数量的物体或生物。

它能够通过1个交互动作松开1个黏住的物体，此外在泥怪死亡1分钟后，其身上的粘性物质也会溶解，并会松开所有黏在身上的物体和生物。

Living Tar.name: 活体焦油 Living Tar
Living Tar.publicNotes:
这种泥怪最常见于地下世界，它们会在洞穴中地毯式搜寻可以被自身的腐蚀性分泌物溶解的物体。这些粘稠的团块通常满载着各种骨头、化石以及冒险者们丢弃的武器。

阴湿的地下城与阴影遮蔽的树林中生活着胶质怪、黏菌、以及其他泥怪。尽管这些生物可能并无恶意，但部分泥怪能长成硕大的身躯并具有无法满足的食欲。

Sea Hag.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description:
A sea hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk} to their coven's spells. Their spell DC when leading a coven is 20.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Sea Hag's Bargain.name: Sea Hag's Bargain
Sea Hag's Bargain.description:
The sea hag can make a bargain with a willing creature who must be of sound mind. The creature gives away a special or cherished quality—such as its courage, its beauty, or its voice. In exchange, the sea hag spends 1 minute polymorphing the creature into a form the target desires.

This functions as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]{Change Shape}. It might be a total transformation or just changing one or more aspects of the target's body, and it can't make the creature more than one size smaller or larger. The creature changes its Speeds as appropriate for the new form. It doesn't change the attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but it might change the damage type the Strikes deal. This has an unlimited duration, and as long as it's transformed, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and can't reduce its sickened condition below 2. The creature can slowly and carefully eat and drink despite being sickened. The only way to restore the lost quality used as payment is to defeat the sea hag or make another bargain for its return. Ending the bargain in this way also removes the transformation.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Dread Gaze.name: Dread Gaze
Dread Gaze.description:
The hag gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with a gnawing sense of impending doom, with a result depending on its @Check[type:will|dc:20] save. The target doesn't need to be able to see the sea hag.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is frightened 1 and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. If the target was dying, it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save; if it fails, it dies.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and slowed 1 for 1 minute.

Sea Hag.name: Sea Hag
Sea Hag.publicNotes:
Sea hags specialize in transformation magic, preying on those who are desperate to change some aspect of their physical appearance. Targets often include those suffering from insecurity about their bodies or those desperate to reside in a different environment, such as aquatic creatures who wish to live on land. These hags are known for tempting desperate victims into tragic and excruciating bargains, though they're also happy to drown and eat mariners who stray too close to their dwellings.

A sea hag has the upper half of a humanoid and the lower half of an octopus, with translucent skin and glowing lights visible beneath their flesh. Sea hags can join covens, but their aquatic nature often prevents them from joining mixed covens with other kinds of hags.

Hags are malevolent predators who use magic and manipulation to lure children and young adults into their clutches. Though their true forms are eldritch and horrifying, hags spend much of their lives disguised as ordinary women. They seek out targets who are unhappy, innocent, or otherwise vulnerable, preying on their weaknesses before snatching them up. The typical hag is abusive, controlling, and narcissistic. Though less malicious hags possibly exist, they rarely reveal their true forms, making them nearly impossible to find.

Krooth.allSaves: 对抗恐惧的豁免+4状态加值
Krooth.name: 食鳄兽 Krooth
Krooth.publicNotes:
食鳄兽，有时也被称为“食鳄者”（Crocodile Eaters），是出没于沼泽和湿地的迅速而致命的捕食者。虽然它们以捕食鳄鱼、短吻鳄和其他几乎所有长肉的生物而闻名，但是它们更喜爱的猎物是蜥蜴人（lizardfolk）、沼蜍人（boggards）和恐龙们。

食鳄兽可能单独出现，也可能成群出现。雄性的食鳄兽是独行并且领地意识强烈的生物——凶狠、胆大、嗜血。而另一方面，雌性食鳄兽可能会躲避潜在的天敌，但是当幼崽受到威胁的时候，它们会立即变得暴力。它们的幼崽是如此的脆弱，以至于一群雌性食鳄兽会聚在一起共同抚养后代，它们会派出较小的群体去寻找食物，而其他成员则留下来照看幼崽。食鳄兽每四五年交配一次，交配场面令人毛骨悚然。一整群雌性食鳄兽会成群结队的寻找一只落单的雄性食鳄兽，在一场持续一整天的狂欢中争夺它们的战利品。交配结束之后，雌性们会杀死它们的配偶，并吃掉它营养丰富的肉身，尤其是它的器官。这些器官含有一种特殊的能有利于妊娠的化合物。许多自然学家愿意出高价购买雄性食鳄兽的新鲜遗骸，这样他们就可以研究这种生物血液和器官的奇异特性。此外，食鳄兽拥有带毒的、中空的牙齿，当食鳄兽噬咬猎物的时候，一颗牙齿会脱落并留在猎物身上，中空的牙齿会像导流管一样让猎物的血液源源不断地流出来。

无论雄性还是雌性的食鳄兽似乎都很讨厌地精及其亚种的肉，尤其是熊地精的。这并不意味着食鳄兽会放过地精，尤其是那些威胁到它们后代的地精。但它们通常只用爪子和尾巴来杀死地精，并且之后会非常仔细地清理自己。

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Fear.name: 对抗恐惧的豁免+4状态加值 +4 Status to All Saves vs. Fear

Pain Frenzy.name: 痛苦狂怒 Pain Frenzy
Pain Frenzy.description:
当食鳄兽遭受重击时，它的攻击掷骰和伤害掷骰有+2状态加值，持续直到它的下一回合结束。在狂怒持续期间它无法使用反应动作。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.tJx9B2e3AET6PbJD]{效果：痛苦狂怒}

Reactive Strike (Tail Only).name: 反应打击（仅尾巴） Reactive Strike (Tail Only)

Poison Tooth.name: 毒牙 Poison Tooth
Poison Tooth.description:
需求 食鳄兽在本回合的上个动作是一次颚咬打击，并且对生物造成了伤害； 效果

效果 食鳄兽在被命中的目标身上留下一枚牙齿。目标受到@Damage[1d6[bleed]]伤害和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。只要牙齿不移除，两者都无法被治愈。

安全地移除牙齿需要通过@Check[type:medicine|dc:26|traits:action:administer-first-aid]的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]检定。此急救动作只能移除牙齿和流失状态，并不能自动中止流血伤害。

Centaur Herbalist.name: Centaur Herbalist
Centaur Herbalist.publicNotes:
Many centaurs are skilled in the study of plants, especially those in the areas in which they roam. They can use such herbs to both heal and cause distress in those who attack them.

Centaurs are legendary hunters and trackers who resemble heavily muscled humans with the bodies of powerful horses from the waist down. They are typically nomadic and consider themselves the stewards of the surrounding landscapes. While stories of bloody clashes between centaurs and humanoid travelers are well known, centaurs are neither intrinsically bloodthirsty nor recklessly aggressive. Rather, they are proud and stubborn and do not take kindly to outsiders who seeks to plunder the natural resources of the areas in which their communities have lived, some of which have been home to centaurs for thousands of years. Against despoilers of nature who fail to heed their warnings, centaurs do not hesitate to use their finely honed hunting skills to inflict deadly wounds.

Centaurs train with weapons as well as their heavy hooves, and the thunder of centaurs charging across the plains is often mistaken for a stampede or even an earthquake. Despite the tight bonds they form with their kin, some centaurs establish close alliances with elves, fey, gnomes, and isolated human communities. Such allies often benefit by learning from the centaurs' extensive knowledge of herbalism and wilderness survival. While centaurs enjoying traveling, most find it difficult to cut ties with their families and leave their bands to seek adventure in the wider world.

Centaurs have incredible variation in their individual size and coloration. Their upper torsos share the same variation in skin tone as other humanoids of their region, but their lower bodies—like those of horses—can vary widely from parent to child. Most centaurs are at least 7 feet tall and weigh more than 2,000 pounds.

Centaurs live in groups of dozens of members, usually led by an individual who has carried out many noble deeds and earned a lifetime of respect from their comrades. The revered leader guides the habits of their entire group; a wise seer might encourage the clan to roam far from civilization to preserve some unspoiled terrain, while an aggressive warrior might foster skirmishes with nearby humanoid settlements and rival centaur groups.

Load Sachet.name: Load Sachet
Load Sachet.description:
Requirements The centaur herbalist has at least one herbal sachet;

Effect The centaur herbalist Interacts to load an herbal sachet in her sling. The next ranged Strike she makes with her sling deals an additional 1d6 poison damage.

Drowning Drone.name: 淹没之音 Drowning Drone
Drowning Drone.description:
触发 沼泽先知或他的60尺内的1名盟友尝试豁免检定对抗听觉或音波效果

效果 沼泽先知会发出低沉的鸣叫压过其他声音。他掷骰一次@Check[type:performance]检定。若沼泽先知和他位于区域内的沼蜍盟友可以进行选择，在沼泽先知的表演检定和他们的豁免结果中取较高的数值，并以此来判断对抗听觉或音波效果后产生的效果。

Tongue Grab.name: 蛙舌擒获 Tongue Grab
Tongue Grab.description: 若沼蜍先知用蛙舌命中1个生物，那么该生物会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于沼蜍人。与一般的擒获不同，该生物不会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]，但是他也无法移动至沼蜍先知的蛙舌触及范围之外。生物可以通过命中AC 15并造成至少4点挥砍伤害来切开蛙舌。尽管这么做不会对沼蜍先知造成伤害，但它可以使沼蜍先知无法再次使用蛙舌打击，直至沼蜍先知花费一周重新长出舌头。

Destructive Croak.name: 破灭鸣叫 Destructive Croak
Destructive Croak.description:
沼泽先知发出强力的嘶鸣，这会对@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]范围的非沼蜍人生物造成@Damage[4d6[sonic]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:19|basic:true]豁免）；任何处于惊惧状态的生物都会承受额外音波伤害，伤害数值为惊惧状态值的两倍。

沼泽先知在之后的[[/br 1d4 #Recharge use Destructive Croak]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用破灭鸣叫。

Swamp Passage.name: 沼泽穿行 Swamp Passage
Swamp Passage.description: 沼蜍先知能忽略由于沼泽地形特征产生的困难地形。

Terrifying Croak.name: 恐惧鸣叫 Terrifying Croak
Terrifying Croak.description: 沼蜍先知发出可怕的鸣叫声。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内的任何非沼蜍人都会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，除非他们能够成功通过@Check[type:will|dc:19]豁免；豁免中掷出大成功的生物会在1分钟内临时免疫该能力。

Boggard Swampseer.name: 沼蜍沼泽先知 Boggard Swampseer
Boggard Swampseer.publicNotes:
沼蜍沼泽先知通过信仰恶魔领主果甘蜍来获得施法力量的馈赠，他们用自己的力量统治沼蜍人村庄，协调村庄其余人的秩序并计划袭击周边的社群。

沼蜍人是好斗的两栖类人生物，他们生活在沼泽、湿地甚至部分雨林中。沼蜍人的成长过程首先从卵孵化为蝌蚪，他们会激烈地争夺食物甚至会在这场斗争中吃掉自己的兄弟姐妹。在接下来的3年里，幸存下来的沼蜍人在学习狩猎、制造和战争的基础知识——一切在力量至上的社会中幸存所需要的理解的知识——的同时，长出双手、双腿和肺部。大多数沼蜍人社会的顶端阶级是身胖体肥的沼泽先知（swampseer），他们懂得如何使用邪恶的神术魔法。

Gourd Leshy.name: 葫芦莱西 Gourd Leshy

Keepsake.name: 保存信物 Keepsake
Keepsake.description: 葫芦莱西能在它的大脑袋里储存一件重量为负载L或更轻的物品，隐藏它如同@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]效果。如果储存超过24小时，该物品则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dINQzhqGmIsqGMUY]的增益。

Ensnare.description:
当葫芦莱西的拳头或种子打击命中目标时，藤蔓会从葫芦叶（或种子）中猛冲出来，缠绕在目标的四肢上。

目标必须通过@Check[type:reflex|dc:17]豁免。如果失败，目标在速度上承受-10尺状态减值，持续1轮。如果大失败，目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]状态1轮，且速度减值持续1分钟。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.fPhbDSTPuT01f0Kn]{效果：诱捕}
Ensnare.name: 诱捕 Ensnare

Verdant Burst.name: 翠绿爆发 Verdant Burst
Verdant Burst.description:
当葫芦莱西死亡时会从它的身体爆发出一股原能能量，恢复@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内所有植物生物@Damage[1d8[healing]]HP。此区域旋即长满葫芦苗，成为困难地形。

如果该地表不适宜植物生长，则葫芦苗会在24小时后枯萎。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
葫芦莱西变成一株结有葫芦果的植物。此能力效果等同于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Gourd Leshy.publicNotes:
葫芦莱西是田野、花园和农场的守护者。许多村庄受益于葫芦莱西的庇护，即使农庄里的人从没意识到莱西的存在。

莱西是具有智慧的植物，是原始荒野和大地力量的守护者。它们起初是由强大的精类生物创造的，当一个纯熟的原能施法者——通常是德鲁伊——将自然精魂和一个精心培育的当地的植物结合起来的时候，莱西就诞生了。创造莱西所需求的仪式和材料因莱西的类型而异。一般莱西会在具有重要自然意义的地方获得生命，例如树精林地、德鲁伊石环、仙女之环或巨大的自然奇观中。

Intimidating Display.name: 威吓姿态 Intimidating Display
Intimidating Display.description:
巨伞蜥行走。如果行走结束时至少与一个生物相邻，则伞蜥张开它多彩的颈部褶边，并发出吓人的嘶嘶声。每个相邻生物都必须通过@Check[type:will|dc:21]豁免否则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}（大失败@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}）。

这些生物在一分钟之内获得对威吓姿态的临时免疫。

Giant Frilled Lizard.name: 巨伞蜥 Giant Frilled Lizard
Giant Frilled Lizard.publicNotes:
巨伞蜥生活在温暖的热带森林和大草原上，对毫无戒心的旅行者来说，它们是致命的威胁。除了睡觉或悄悄接近猎物的时候以外，巨伞蜴会在阳光下晒上几个小时。探险者有时会将他们误认为龙，因为它们体型巨大还带着漂亮的脖子褶边（当他们因为攻击或守卫领土而张开褶边时，可能会被误认为翅膀），还有凶猛的嘶嘶声，用来吓唬那些太大而不能吃的生物。

巨伞蜥的主要食物来源是大号节肢动物和其他无脊椎动物，但是它们也会毫不犹豫地把脊椎动物列为食谱，包括其他蜥蜴、猴子以及任何它能放进嘴里的东西——甚至人形生物。尽管巨伞蜥能在短时间内爆发出惊人的速度，但是它们更喜欢在捕猎时一动不动地躺着，伏击路过的猎物。

蜥蜴们外表和能力各异，但大多数都具有爬行动物的基本形状——长长的尾巴，多齿的嘴和四条腿。虽然有一些蜥蜴种类能够在短时间内用两条腿运动，但大多数都是严格意义上的四足动物。这里列举了大型蜥蜴中最常见和最著名的三个物种。

Bandersnatch.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Confusing Gaze.name: 困惑凝视 Confusing Gaze
Confusing Gaze.description:
20尺。

在灵光范围的结束回合的生物，必须成功通过一次@Check[type:will|dc:35] 豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]1轮。

Planar Acclimation.name: 位面适应 Planar Acclimation
Planar Acclimation.description: 凶掠猫总是将当前所处位面视作位于故乡位面。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Quick Recovery.name: 快速恢复 Quick Recovery
Quick Recovery.description: 凶掠猫以惊人的速度恢复。在其回合结束时，它减少1点其承受的一种削弱状态的状态值（濒死除外）。如果它处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]或石化状态，它可以改为成功通过一次@Check[type:flat|dc:16]检定来结束其所选择的这些状态之一；它不能对其他没有状态值的状态使用快速恢复。

Reactive Strike (Tail Only).name: 反应打击（仅限尾） Reactive Strike (Tail Only)

Focus Gaze.name: 聚焦凝视 Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description: 凶掠猫注视20尺内一个对其可见的生物。目标必须立即尝试一次意志豁免对抗凶掠猫的困惑凝视。在尝试豁免之后，生物临时免疫凶掠猫的困惑凝视，直到凶掠猫的下个回合开始。

Frumious Charge.name: 凶恶冲锋 Frumious Charge
Frumious Charge.description: 凶掠猫行走，忽视困难地形，然后在移动结束时进行两次爪打击。

Lash Out.name: 穷追猛打 Lash Out
Lash Out.description: 凶掠猫在它回合获得一个额外的只能用来反应打击的反应动作。

Pain.name: 剧痛 Pain
Pain.description: 凶掠猫的刺能创造出异常疼痛的伤口。受伤的生物必须成功通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:38]豁免来抵抗因这份剧痛而陷入的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}（大失败时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2}）。凶掠猫再次进行的能导致剧痛的打击会在每次豁免失败时，使流失的状态值提高1点，最高到流失4。

Bandersnatch.name: 凶掠猫 Bandersnatch
Bandersnatch.publicNotes: 凶掠猫是一种巨大的六腿猫科动物，身上长满了邪恶的刺一直延伸到它们威武的尾巴尖。与第一世界的其他传说中的生物，比如炸脖龙一样，凶掠猫和这些臭名昭著的生物一同被统称为“天恩”。这些可怕的猎手非常喜欢通过对任何所处环境完美的适应力来猎杀其他致命或聪明的掠食者。凶掠猫会追踪猎物，然后快速凶猛地扑杀之。那些从凶掠猫口中幸存的人证实虽然这种猫的尖牙和利爪是致命的，但眼睛才是它们最厉害的武器。凶掠猫的眼睛不断变换颜色，强度和图案，使得被其注视者会陷入一种困惑的恐慌中。

Goblin Scuttle.name: 地精小跑 Goblin Scuttle
Goblin Scuttle.description:
触发 一个地精盟友在与该勇士相邻的位置结束其移动动作

效果 该地精勇士@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{快步 Steps}。

Goblin Warrior.name: 地精勇士 Goblin Warrior
Goblin Warrior.publicNotes:
地精部落的前线战士喜欢大部队作战——特别是当他们的数量足够让他们至少三打一的时候。

这些小型类人生物通常有着绿色或是灰色的皮肤，大大的脑袋和宽大的耳朵。虽然有那么一些地精是文明的，并且努力成为类人生物社群中正直的一员，但有许多地精依旧还是鲁莽而又邪恶的生物，以制造破坏为乐。这些地精纯粹只是为了片刻的欢乐而屠杀牲畜、盗窃、或是烧毁建筑。他们沉迷于对那些被他们成为“长腿”——也就是那些比他们更高的类人生物——耍一些恶劣的把戏。

地精很迷信，对魔法有着强烈的敬畏，对火焰有着异乎寻常的迷恋；精通魔法或者火焰的地精会得到他们部族的尊敬。大多数其他类人生物都很难理解地精的观点：他们讨厌犬科动物却又热衷于和所谓的“地精犬”分享他们的巢穴，他们会无畏地攻击大型生物却又害怕马匹，他们鄙视蔬菜却又将腌菜作为美味佳肴。当然，对于一只地精而言，这些全都是极为明智的人生抉择。

Fast Healing 2 (While Underwater).name: 快速治疗2（在水下时） Fast Healing 2 (While Underwater)

Acid Breath.name: 酸蚀吐息 Acid Breath
Acid Breath.description:
水魔蝠对@Template[type:cone|distance:15]范围喷出酸液，对范围内所有生物造成@Damage[2d6[acid]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true]豁免）。

水魔蝠在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Acid Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次进行吐息。

Drench.name: 浸湿 Drench
Drench.description: 水魔蝠尝试浇灭@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]范围内的所有火焰。它能自动熄灭所有非魔法火焰，并且尝试反制魔法火焰（反制调整值[[/r 1d20+7 #Counteract]]{+7}）。

Water Scamp.name: 水魔蝠 Water Scamp
Water Scamp.publicNotes:
水魔蝠和其他魔蝠的区别在于它们光滑的皮毛，在皮肤旁边有一层水。虽然它们能像同类一样飞行，还能变出足够的水来让自己永远不会干涸，但水魔蝠只有在必要的时候才会离开水。尽管陆生种族的学者认为这些小龙虾很安静，而且相当容易受惊，但水下文明缺发现他们精力旺盛，出奇地顽皮。

魔蝠是一种类似蝙蝠的生物，具有元素之力。魔蝠会被更强大的居民从元素位面驱逐出去，或者被新手召唤师召唤到物质宇宙。所有的魔蝠有魔法力量，因为他们与家乡位面有一种挥之不去的联系，它们主要用它来搞一些简单的恶作剧。

魔蝠迅速构成了智力导向的等级制度。当类人生物第一次遇到这种生物时，它们常常会让魔蝠感到困惑。这些困惑的魔蝠通常会采取一系列不断升级的恶作剧，看看这些类人生物能从哪种情境中逃脱，以便在等级制度中给他们安排合适的地位。

Assume Form.name: Assume Form
Assume Form.description: The ugothol spends 10 minutes reshaping its appearance to take on the shape of any Small or Medium humanoid. It gains a +4 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to pass as that creature.

Blood Nourishment.name: Blood Nourishment
Blood Nourishment.description: The ugothol uses its three-pronged tongue to drink the blood of an adjacent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature. The creature gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}

Revert Form.name: Revert Form
Revert Form.description:
Requirements The ugothol is in an assumed form

Effect The ugothol resumes its true form. Until the start of its next turn, it gains a +2 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.SA5f54t1dVah5fJm]{Effect: Revert Form}

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and Visual

Compression.name: Compression
Compression.description: When the ugothol successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezes}, it moves through the tight space at full speed. Narrow confines are not difficult terrain for an ugothol.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The ugothol deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Ugothol.name: Ugothol
Ugothol.publicNotes:
Among the subtler of the alghollthu creations were the ugothols—also known as faceless stalkers. These twisted beings used shapeshifting to infiltrate settlements and assassinate key targets. They sowed discord and replaced leaders, causing unwanted organizations to implode and bothersome people to lose face and eventually disappear.

In bygone millennia, aquatic monsters known as alghollthus used their occult powers to conquer and rule vast swaths of the world. Alghollthus shaped their servitors and other creatures using mental manipulation and physically transformative magic. The rulers of the alghollthus, the so-called "veiled masters," further shaped entire societies by assuming the forms of those they controlled.

In time, the alghollthus grew frustrated with upstart surface societies and meddling gods. They used incredible magical power to call forth a cataclysm, hoping to destroy the rebellious societies they'd manipulated. Yet they miscalculated the will to survive of those they treated as their pawns, and in time the world recovered, this time free of alghollthu influence.

Today, the alghollthus have mostly remained within the deep aquatic realms where they still rule without question. Yet they have not abandoned their plots entirely, and the reemergence of servitors like faceless stalkers suggests that the alghollthus have turned their hateful eyes to the surface once again.
Ugothol.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. auditory and visual

Divine Revulsion.name: Divine Revulsion
Divine Revulsion.description:
If a redcap sees a creature brandish a religious symbol of a deity (which requires an Interact action by that creature) or cast a divine spell while wearing a religious symbol, the redcap must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save. They then become temporarily immune to all brandished religious symbols for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The redcap is unaffected.

Success The redcap is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Failure The redcap gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition for 1 round and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}.

Blood Soak.name: Blood Soak
Blood Soak.description:
The redcap dips their cap in the blood of a slain foe. The foe must have died in the last minute, and the redcap must have helped kill it. The redcap gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wPIGBcpCqCWgrCiq]{Effect: Blood Soak}

Stomp.name: Stomp
Stomp.description: The redcap Strides up to half its Speed and makes a boot Strike at any point during that movement. If the boot Strike hits a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} creature, it deals an extra @Damage[2d6[bleed]].

Red Cap.name: Red Cap
Red Cap.description:
A redcap's woolen hat is dyed with the blood of their victims. If the redcap loses their cap, they no longer benefit from fast healing and take a –4 status penalty to their damage rolls. They can create a new cap in 10 minutes, but that cap doesn't grant them powers until the redcap has turned it red with Blood Soak. A cap has no benefit for creatures other than the redcap who made it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.s5mS7CyE0oOYlecv]{Effect: Lost Red Cap}

Deadly Cleave.name: Deadly Cleave
Deadly Cleave.description:
Trigger The redcap reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points with a sickle Strike

Effect The redcap makes another scythe Strike against a different creature, using the same multiple attack penalty as the sickle Strike that triggered this reaction. This counts toward their multiple attack penalty.

Redcap.name: Redcap
Redcap.publicNotes:
Redcaps are sadistic and capricious fey who thrill in bloodletting and murder. While they are most famous for appearing as wizened, bearded men, redcaps of other genders are no less fearsome or cruel. However, redcaps are ultimately craven bullies, cowed by anything more powerful than themselves, a trait that leads them to fear and despise the symbols of deities.

Many fairy tales explain how the redcaps draw power from dipping the hats for which they are named in fresh blood. Just as iconic to these cruel little fey are their iron-clad boots, and the clanging sound of their metal soles clanking on stone floors is both discordant and disconcerting—especially to those who recognize the sound for what it is. Redcaps typically stand only 3 feet tall, with hunched frames, pointed ears, crooked teeth, and long, white, tangled hair.

Though unlikely to share true affection, redcaps find camaraderie in murder. Small troupes of redcaps travel together, sharing bloody kills and reminiscing on their brutal exploits. They loathe the company of most other creatures, with the notable exception of the feline fey called elananxes.

Rekhep.name: 雷克普 Rekhep

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Archon's Protection.name: 圣使护卫 Archon's Protection
Archon's Protection.description:
触发 一个敌人伤害圣使的盟友，且该敌人和该盟友皆距离圣使15尺内

效果 该盟友在对抗触发伤害时获得全部伤害抗力15，圣使可对触发本能力的敌人进行一次打击。

Archon’s Pursuit.name: 圣使追击 Archon’s Pursuit
Archon’s Pursuit.description:
频率 每天一次

需求 雷克普看到一个生物在上一轮传送，并且雷克普至少还能施展一次@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]

效果 雷克普施展一次次元移位，且法术升阶至5环，让雷克普抵达距离他追捕生物30尺的一处未被占据的空间。如果该生物离得太远，雷克普在抵达时会尽可能靠近该生物。

Courageous Switch.name: 王车易位 Courageous Switch
Courageous Switch.description: 当一个雷克普使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]内在法术时，他可以选择移动到他能看到的、在法术范围内的一名自愿盟友占据的空间里。如果他这样做，这名盟友与圣使交换位置，出现在圣使刚刚离开的空间，就好像此盟友也施展了次元移位。

Holy Armament.name: 圣洁武备 Holy Armament
Holy Armament.description: 任何武器在被雷克普持握的时候都会获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DH0kB9Wbr5pDeunX]符文。

Living Shield.name: 活体盾牌 Living Shield
Living Shield.description:
雷克普给予一位邻接盟友AC+2环境加值，此效果持续到该盟友不再与此圣使邻接，或者到圣使的下个回合开始，以先发生的为准。当雷克普为一个正在被本能力影响的盟友发动圣使护卫能力时，雷克普会代替该盟友获得抗力并承受伤害。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Xu7QxeF9S8ysJpuI]{效果：活体盾牌}

Terrifying Smite.name: 吓敌斩 Terrifying Smite
Terrifying Smite.description: 雷克普对一个触及内有雷克普盟友的敌人进行一次打击。若命中，目标会额外受到2d8精魂伤害且获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。打击重击时，额外伤害和惊惧值翻倍。

Rekhep.publicNotes:
雷克普乃是为天堂抵御魔族入侵的活盾牌。他们用身躯层叠成的庞大阵型能够抵御任何攻击。鉴于他们惊人的力量和威严的身材，坚盾圣使是温顺者们的理想守卫，有时会被召唤到物质宇宙来抵御大量为恶之徒的攻击。

圣使是天堂（Heaven）的守护者、腐化的敌人。早在诸神与他们的仆人涉足天界位面前，圣使就已作为此地的原住民栖息在那了。打一照面，圣使和神圣天使很快便发现他们是一类人，心中皆怀着正义与公义。联盟由此成立，如今，圣使们是所有天族与他们信赖的凡人们的忠实盟友。

当第一位圣使从宏伟的天堂七层山脉凝聚成形后，他们会选择来到天堂的灵魂中有意愿也有资格的加入他们的行列。这些凡人听到并回应了一个神秘声音的召唤，在山顶的花园（the Garden）中显形。在那里，他们发誓永远为正义事业服务，脱胎换骨成为新的圣使。

虽然圣使们十分在意保卫凡人的生命，并愿意在对抗魔族的战斗中牺牲自我，他们总让人觉得死板又难以捉摸，他们的外观也几乎能称得上骇人且怪异。因此，他们在与凡人或自由奔放的灵使交互时时常遇到困难。尽管如此，圣使从还是能从他人身上汲取强大力量，尤其是那些堪称楷模的贤德之人。

除了他们的天族盟友，圣使还与御衡者维持着古老的联系。时至今日，我们仍能见到个高深莫测的集团一起合作，共同捍卫尘封已久的秘密，执行早在凡人诞生前创立的规则。圣使仅将这些行为解释为必要之举，不做进一步的说明；在这点上，哪怕是圣使的天使盟友也对他们的固执感到沮丧。
Rekhep.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Quelaunt.name: 奎伦特 Quelaunt
Quelaunt.allSaves: 对抗情绪的意志豁免获得+2加值

+2 to Will Saves vs. Emotion.name: 对抗情绪的意志豁免获得+2加值 +2 to Will Saves vs. Emotion

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊） 60尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet

Emotional Focus.name: 情绪聚能 Emotional Focus
Emotional Focus.description: 奎伦特可以在不消耗聚能点的情况下，以8环级异能内在法术的形式随意施展如下牧师领域法术：@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jJphHQlENHFlSElH]， @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J8pL8yTshga8QOk8]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dj44lViYKvOJ8a53]。

Emotional Frenzy.name: 情绪狂暴 Emotional Frenzy
Emotional Frenzy.description: 奎伦特从它的随意施展内在法术和情绪聚能法术中选择至多三个法术释放。

Feed on Emotion.name: 饱食情绪 Feed on Emotion
Feed on Emotion.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 奎伦特吞噬30尺内一个受有害情绪影响生物的不安情绪。目标必须成功通过一次@Check[type:will|dc:37]检定，否则将受到@Damage[4d10[mental]]伤害并且陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]1轮。

如果目标豁免失败，奎伦特将获得等量的HP，且恢复用于饱食情绪的动作。它不能用恢复的动作再次使用饱食情绪。

Rapid Strikes.name: 迅猛打击 Rapid Strikes
Rapid Strikes.description: 奎伦特进行三次近战打击，每次选择触及范围内的不同目标。多重攻击惩罚适用于每次攻击，但只会在所有攻击结算后才会累积。

Spiral of Despair.name: 绝望螺旋 Spiral of Despair
Spiral of Despair.description:
触发 一个生物在对抗奎伦特的内在法术或情绪聚能法术中豁免失败。

效果 奎伦特侵入触发生物的意识，播下负面情绪的种子，同时剥夺目标希望和积极的情感。奎伦特可以立即结束一个会让触发生物受益的情绪效果。

Quelaunt.publicNotes:
这种三手三足的怪物没有可识别的眼睛、鼻子、耳朵或嘴巴，也没有可见的消化食物的手段。它的肢体均匀地分布在身体各处，以至于在任何时候都无法分辨它的朝向。很少有人能够注视奎伦特那异样的外貌太久，因为这短暂的思绪很快就会变成思想入侵，奎伦特会在心灵中种下猜忌，悲伤和愤怒。这种怪物不仅会以猎物的负面情绪为乐，并且也以它们为食，它们从猎物的恐惧中汲取力量和营养。奎伦特会不吝残忍地加害猎物，因为猎物受苦越多，奎伦特的盛宴就越丰盛。

众所周知奎伦特会与其他异怪恐兽有所协作，包括与集脑魔（jah-tohls）和其他生物组成的黑色支配者（the Dominion of the Black）。然而更普遍的理论把他们描绘成更接近外星生物——或许是由另一维度入侵而来的纯粹由思想和情感构成的存在——并且声称自然状态下它们根本不具备物理躯体。少有理论敢于再深入思考；唯一已知的是某次奎伦特的尸检导致了研究者几天后自杀，所有笔记都被神秘地销毁了。无论这些奇怪的怪物解剖结构中蕴含着怎样的秘密，显然都是足够重要的，足以需要维持极严密的保护，即便是在死后。

Electric Eel.name: Electric Eel

Stunning Shock.name: Stunning Shock
Stunning Shock.description:
A creature critically hit by the electric eel's tail must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

Electric Eel.publicNotes:
Usually found in freshwater rivers and lakes, an electric eel is not particularly aggressive, but its ability to stun predators and prey alike can be dangerous to larger creatures searching for their next meal. Electric eels are more closely related to catfish than to other eels.

Although these long, narrow fish share similarities in appearance, eels are a diverse group of creatures.

Aura of Disruption.name: Aura of Disruption
Aura of Disruption.description:
120 feet.

The dragon radiates disruptive energies that allow them to feed on magic. When a spell is counteracted or disrupted within the aura, the dragon regains one expended spontaneous spell slot and gains 35 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Capture Spell.name: Capture Spell
Capture Spell.description:
Trigger The dragon succeeds or critically succeeds on a saving throw against a spell

Effect The dragon attempts to capture a portion of the spell's magic to feed themself. They attempt to counteract the spell (counteract rank 10, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+37 #Counteract]]{+37}). If successful, the dragon is unaffected by the spell and regains one expended spontaneous spell slot; other subjects are affected by the spell normally.

Disruptive Breath.name: Disruptive Breath
Disruptive Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a spray of magic-disrupting energies that deals @Damage[18d6[force]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:45|basic:true] save). Creatures that fail become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.

The dragon can't use Disruptive Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Disruptive Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Share the Wealth.description:
Requirements The dragon's body is covered in riches (this is typically the case when the dragon is first encountered)

Effect The dragon shakes their body aggressively, sending coins and other riches flying in every direction, dealing @Damage[18d10[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:50]. The dragon's body is then no longer covered in riches.
Share the Wealth.name: Share the Wealth

Treasure Dive.name: Treasure Dive
Treasure Dive.description:
Requirements The dragon's body isn't covered in riches and the dragon is adjacent to their hoard

Effect The dragon Strides or Burrows through their hoard using their land Speed. They coat themself in coins, magic items, and other treasures. This contact with magical items revitalizes the dragon, causing them to regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

The dragon can move through other creatures while moving in this way. Creatures in the dragon's path, or above it if the dragon Burrows, must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:38] save or be pushed 10 feet (or pushed 20 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure).

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Drain Hoard.name: Drain Hoard
Drain Hoard.description:
Requirements The dragon is within 60 feet of their hoard

Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon draws power out of the magic items in their hoard, regaining all their expended spontaneous spell slots.

Fortune Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Fortune Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Fortune Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Fortune dragons have the innate ability to draw upon the raw magical energies that surround them. They constantly use these magical energies to empower their magical abilities and even their bodies, as the energy can heal wounds. A fortune dragon has a typical build for an arcane dragon, but their bodies sport a striking feature: their treasure. The dragon's nature of drawing upon magic causes coins, gems, and, most notably, magical items to cling to their body like iron drawn to magnets. A dragon constantly pulls magical energies from the items attached to their body and makes use of these energies to cast spells. The magical energies that flow through a fortune dragon constantly flow through the dragon's items as well, and in many cases, the items melt from the heat produced in this process. Fortune dragons are seekers of novel experiences. This desire for originality leads fortune dragons to approach visitors of other ancestries with curiosity, though this initial interest quickly wanes if a visitor lacks exciting qualities.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.
Fortune Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: A lizardfolk stargazer can hold their breath for 20 minutes.

Lizardfolk Stargazer.name: Lizardfolk Stargazer
Lizardfolk Stargazer.publicNotes:
The tradition of astrology and looking to the stars for both navigation and prognostication is well-established in iruxi society, and their wise and observant stargazers are among the people's most respected members. Even the lowliest stargazer, as presented here, has a number of useful primal spells to aid their kin; in larger iruxi settlements, stargazers wield even greater powers.

Capable and adaptable predators, the reptilian beings known as lizardfolk are heirs to truly ancient civilizations. Their oral traditions cover thousands of years, and they revere the bones of their ancestors. Fossilized lizardfolk are even built into the walls of lizardfolk's stone and glass cities, to allow these predecessors to watch over their kin. Lizardfolk likewise have longstanding traditions of religious worship and astrology, with eyes on the past, the future, and the stars whenever they make a large decision. Their long history has taught them to be patient in all things, though this has seen them losing ground to hastier peoples in modern times.

Lizardfolk refer to themselves as "iruxi," though they have taken their common moniker among other peoples in stride. Most of their settlements are entirely communal, with hatchlings raised by anyone with the time and temperament for such a role. Iruxis dwell and thrive in all tropical and temperate biomes, but they are most at home in swamplands, coastal regions, and river lands. They are talented swimmers, and many of their major cities are partially submerged to take advantage of this fact, causing them to often be overlooked by others. Fish and aquatic plants make up a large part of their preferred diets.

Umbral Gnome Warrior.name: Umbral Gnome Warrior
Umbral Gnome Warrior.publicNotes:
Umbral gnome warriors are quick to charge into battle but focus on defending their kin and their homes over more aggressive tactics when a choice is available.

Gnomes are known for being creative and curious. They stand at around 3 feet tall, and their vivid personalities match their naturally vivid hair and eye color. Gnomes possess a natural connection to their ancestral home, the First World. They crave adventure and new experiences to fight off an ancestry-wide affliction known as the Bleaching. Gnomes who fail to dream and innovate begin to slowly lose their color and fall into a deep depression.

A notable subgroup of gnomes called umbral gnomes typically have gray or brown skin with a stony texture, and thin, pale hair or bald pates. Umbral gnomes are most numerous in the Darklands, where they go by the name drathnelar. Umbral gnomes often attribute these physical changes to the gnome deity regarded as the first of their kind, Nivi Rhombodazzle. Nivi was a surface gnome who traveled deep into the Darklands and was ultimately rewarded with demigodhood when she exchanged a particular gemstone with the dwarven deity, Torag. Nivi is immune to the Bleaching, and umbral gnomes are often immune or resistant to it as well.

Giylea.name: 吉里阿 Giylea

All-Knowing Eyes.name: 全知之眼 All-Knowing Eyes
All-Knowing Eyes.description:
30尺

当一个生物在吉里阿的灵光中结束回合时，他必须进行@Check[type:will|dc:34]豁免。若该生物豁免失败，在他下个回合结束前，其进行的任何欺骗技能检定成功度下降一级。如果一个生物正乔装或处于一个不是它真正形态的形态中时检定失败，还会在其下个回合结束前陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Archon's Protection.name: 圣使护卫 Archon's Protection
Archon's Protection.description:
触发 一个敌人伤害圣使的盟友，且该敌人和该盟友皆距离圣使15尺内

效果 该盟友在对抗触发伤害时获得全部伤害抗力20，圣使可对触发本能力的敌人进行一次打击。

Fiery Spokes.name: 炽热轮辐 Fiery Spokes
Fiery Spokes.description: 吉里阿狂怒急旋，喷射出一片神火之雨。@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]范围内的所有生物都会受到@Damage[(12d6)[fire],(5d6)[spirit]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true]豁免。吉里阿在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Fiery Spokes]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用此能力。

Focus Gaze.name: 专注凝视 Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description: 吉里阿将他的目光聚焦到30尺内一个他能看见的生物上。该目标必须立刻进行一次@Check[type:will|dc:37|traits:aura,divine,mental,visual]豁免来对抗全知之眼 的效果。若该生物正处于魔法伪装的作用下，抑或他改变了形态，吉里阿会尝试反制该魔法伪装效果（反制[[/r 1d20+29 #Counteract]]{+29}，8环级）。在检定过后，该生物临时免疫本能力，直到吉里阿的下个回合开始。

Giylea.publicNotes:
吉里阿被称为刑轮圣使，因其外形如同一个每根辐条上都生有一眼的飞行装甲火轮。由于他们能看穿谎言，因此经常担任顾问；此外，在惩处邪恶时，他们的眼不着砂和专诚执拗堪称传奇。

圣使是天堂（Heaven）的守护者、腐化的敌人。早在诸神与他们的仆人涉足天界位面前，圣使就已作为此地的原住民栖息在那了。打一照面，圣使和神圣天使很快便发现他们是一类人，心中皆怀着正义与公义。联盟由此成立，如今，圣使们是所有天族与他们信赖的凡人们的忠实盟友。

当第一位圣使从宏伟的天堂七层山脉凝聚成形后，他们会选择来到天堂的灵魂中有意愿也有资格的加入他们的行列。这些凡人听到并回应了一个神秘声音的召唤，在山顶的花园（the Garden）中显形。在那里，他们发誓永远为正义事业服务，脱胎换骨成为新的圣使。

虽然圣使们十分在意保卫凡人的生命，并愿意在对抗魔族的战斗中牺牲自我，他们总让人觉得死板又难以捉摸，他们的外观也几乎能称得上骇人且怪异。因此，他们在与凡人或自由奔放的灵使交互时时常遇到困难。尽管如此，圣使从还是能从他人身上汲取强大力量，尤其是那些堪称楷模的贤德之人。

除了他们的天族盟友，圣使还与御衡者维持着古老的联系。时至今日，我们仍能见到个高深莫测的集团一起合作，共同捍卫尘封已久的秘密，执行早在凡人诞生前创立的规则。圣使仅将这些行为解释为必要之举，不做进一步的说明；在这点上，哪怕是圣使的天使盟友也对他们的固执感到沮丧。
Giylea.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Head Hunter.name: 猎头者 Head Hunter
Head Hunter.description: 无头骑士持有的任何挥砍武器都获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.hg3IogR8ue2IWwgS]符文效果，并且持有的任何短柄斧都获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qlunQzfnzPQpMG6U]符文效果。如有无头骑士以挥砍武器的重击杀死一个敌人，则目标被斩首，效果就如同无头骑士对目标使用了收割（Reap）技能一般。这些效果只有当无头骑士持握武器的时候才生效。

Reap.name: 收割 Reap
Reap.description: 无头骑士砍掉触及内一个死亡生物的头颅。无头骑士的恐怖威压灵光范围内的所有生物必须立即进行一次新的豁免，即时他们当前对气势凶猛临时免疫。

Summon Steed.name: 召唤战马 Summon Steed
Summon Steed.description: 无头骑士召唤一只套有精英模板和魔族和邪秽特征的战马。这匹坐骑会一只持续存在直到它死亡、或无头骑士解消此效果、或无头骑士再次使用召唤战马。

Dullahan.name: 无头骑士 Dullahan
Dullahan.publicNotes:
被称为“杜拉罕”的无头猎人骑着漆黑如夜的战马，追踪并砍下那些它认为该死之人的头颅。当接近目标时，无头骑士首先会低声说出受害者的名字，然后迅速收集它的战利品（头颅），给那些所有目睹处决现场的人蒙上了一层恐惧的阴影。

当一个特别残暴的战士被斩首，而这个战士的灵魂依然固执地留在主物质位面（或拒绝前往来世）时，他就有可能变成无头骑士。大多数无头骑士会回到他们的故乡，在那里他们可以对那些生前冒犯过自己的人（或者他们或者的后代）进行报复。无头骑士迅速且无情地贯彻自己的正义，一旦选定目标它就会坚定不移地执行计划。

也许对于一些无头骑士来说比报复活人更重要的目标是找到自己早已腐烂的脑袋。但凡能挥舞着无头骑士头颅的家伙无疑很有两下子，无头骑士会不情愿地为这样的主人服务，只为了换回自己丢失的头颅。强大的魔族，例如魔鬼会命令无头骑士为他们收割灵魂或指挥军队，而凡人可能会利用这样的不死战士来解决个人冤仇。然而，不管它的主人是什么身份或地位，只要有机会，无头骑士就会毫不犹豫地杀死主人，取回自己的脑袋。

Dryad Queen.name: Dryad Queen

Nature Empathy.name: Nature Empathy
Nature Empathy.description: The dryad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals and plants.

Inspiration.description:
The nymph queen inspires a single intelligent creature by giving that creature a token of her favor, typically a lock of her hair, though it can be some other significant object as well. As long as the creature carries her token and remains in good standing with her, the creature gains a +1 status bonus to all Crafting checks, Performance checks, and Will saves.

If the nymph grants her token to a bard, and she's the bard's muse, the queen chooses one additional benefit granted by her token: a +1 status bonus to all Lore checks, a +2 status bonus to Performance checks when determining the effects of compositions, a +4 status bonus to untrained skill checks, or a +2 status bonus to Will saves against fey.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.iSyyR4QVOaY6mxtg]{Effect: Nymph Queen's Inspiration}
Inspiration.name: Inspiration

Tree Meld.name: Tree Meld
Tree Meld.description:
A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants} spell cast by a dryad has an unlimited duration.

In addition, if the dryad merges with any tree in her domain, she can choose to instead enter an extradimensional living space within the tree, and can bring up to eight adjacent, willing creatures with her; the spell gains the extradimensional trait. The dryad can still be expelled from this space.

Tied to the Land.name: Tied to the Land
Tied to the Land.description:
The dryad queen is tied to a forest or other woodland.

A nymph queen is intrinsically tied to a specific region. As long as the queen is healthy, the environment is exceptionally resilient, allowing the nymph queen to automatically attempt to counteract any spell that would harm the environment (such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7yWXx3qC4eFNHhxD]{Blight} ritual), using her spell DC with a counteract rank equal to the highest-rank druid spell she can cast.

When the nymph queen becomes physically or psychologically unhealthy, however, her warded region eventually becomes twisted or unhealthy as well. In that case, restoring the nymph queen swiftly heals the entire region.

Nymph's Beauty.name: Nymph's Beauty
Nymph's Beauty.description:
30 feet.

On a failed save, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} in awe for 1 minute.

Creatures that start their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:30] save or suffer an effect described in the nymph queen's entry.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Nymph queens can transform between their original form, which looks much like a typical nymph of their kind, and any Small or Medium humanoid form, typically choosing a more humanoid-looking version of their natural form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Focus Beauty.name: Focus Beauty
Focus Beauty.description:
On a failed save, if the target was already affected by the dryad queen's beauty, the target can't use hostile actions against the dryad queen for 1 hour.

The nymph queen focuses her beauty upon a target, who must attempt a save against her nymph's beauty aura (@Check[type:will|dc:30] save). If the creature fails and was already affected by the aura, it takes a greater effect described in the nymph queen's entry.

A nymph queen can Focus Beauty on a given creature only once per turn.

Dryad Queen.publicNotes:
Also called a hamadryad, a dryad queen rules over an entire forest, or a portion of an incredibly large forest, leading and protecting all dryads within. Dryad queens often have strange relationships with powerful and deadly fey, working together in a dualistic way despite their differences, with the queen representing nature's wonders and the other fey representing nature's wrath.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

Nymph Queens

Nymph queens are powerful nymphs who rule over entire regions of untouched wilderness, not just single trees or ponds. Every variety of nymph can have a queen. Naiad queens are among the most prominent, and more often interact with nearby mortals. Thus, some scholars refer to naiad queens as simply "nymphs."

Wraith.name: 缚灵 Wraith
Wraith.publicNotes:
缚灵是一类忌讳光明又耗竭生命的恶毒亡灵。他们阴暗的身躯上包裹着一席无实体的长袍，宛若警官的职徽；长袍下如炬的目光反映着他们对生者的评判。缚灵可以通过卑劣的魔法或直接暴露于虚空中产生，但多数情况下，他们诞生于惨绝人寰的死亡。当一场惨剧凄切到连现实都无法见证时，虚空的短暂显现便会在一片黑暗中留下无数的缚灵。缚灵乃是空虚与渴求的存在，他们会本能地将其他存在唤入相同的如虚空般的空虚中。

缚灵可以出没于任何他们可以与生者安全交互的地点，寻找那些有资格成为新缚灵的人，同时处理掉其他的，尽管他们的阳光弱点将他们限制在世界的阴暗角落——在那里他们可以与黑暗环境完美融合，然后悄无声息地吞噬他们的猎物。缚灵们对谁有资格成为他们的猎物有不同的看法，但他们通常会选择那些已经与虚空最接近的人，无论是因为形而上的联系，还是因为他们经历了无数次死亡。以这种方式创造出来的新缚灵都会带有这些人格特征，而其余的个性则会因为暴露在虚空中而被扭曲或磨灭殆尽。

缚灵与他们的同类聚集在死亡和混乱司空见惯的地方——被战争蹂躏的乡村、大都市内由犯罪头目控制的地下社会，或者是魔族仪式的举行场所。在这些地方，生者最好呆在光里。缚灵足够聪明，能战斗中利用自己的虚体特性，因此他们会躲在曲折的洞穴或有走廊的建筑中，并避免在空旷的地方活动。

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: 阳光失能 Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: 在日光下的缚灵获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2}。

Grip of Fear.name: 恐惧之攫 Grip of Fear
Grip of Fear.description: 缚灵将手伸入邻近生物的胸膛，紧攥他们的心脏。目标受到@Damage[6d6[mental]]伤害，@Check[type:will|dc:24|basic:true]豁免。如果豁免大失败，该生物还会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]至缚灵的下一回合开始。

Robes of Welcome.name: 接引长袍 Robes of Welcome
Robes of Welcome.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 缚灵用他的长袍裹住一个邻接的生物，令他暴露于虚空之拥。如果任何生物正被缚灵的虚空之拥诅咒，该缚灵就无法再将虚空之拥施加给其他任何生物。

Void's Embrace.name: 虚空之拥 Void's Embrace
Void's Embrace.description:
若受害者在日光下成功通过对抗本诅咒的豁免，诅咒立刻结束。当你受到本诅咒影响时，你无视诅咒你的那个缚灵的抗力

豁免骰 @Check[type:will|dc:24]

阶段1 受害者在任何光线下都会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh] (1小时)

阶段2 受害者获得30尺的生命感知但在任何光线下都会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2] (1小时)

阶段3 如同阶段2，但受害者还会获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.TTCw5NusiSSkJU1x] (1小时)

阶段4 受害者@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]且无法醒来 (1天)

阶段5 受害者死亡并化作缚灵，他的肉身崩解成灰

Charnel Creation.name: 尸骸造物 Charnel Creation

Electric Healing.name: 电击治疗 Electric Healing
Electric Healing.description: 尸骸造物每次被带有电击特征的效果影响时，它会失去其具有的任何@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]状态，并恢复等同于将要造成的法术伤害一半的生命值。如果造物在造成电击伤害的区域内开始其回合，它恢复@Damage[2d4[healing]]生命值。

Electric Reflexes.name: 电击反射 Electric Reflexes
Electric Reflexes.description:
触发 尸骸造物受到电击伤害并且一个生物与之相邻。

效果 尸骸造物猛击并试图擒获相邻的生物。尸骸造物尝试一次运动检定来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]相邻的生物，如果尸骸造物成功，该生物还要受到@Damage[3d6[electricity]]伤害；如果尸骸造物大成功，则该生物受到@Damage[6d6[electricity]]伤害。

Berserk Slam.name: 狂暴猛击 Berserk Slam
Berserk Slam.description:
需求 尸骸造物处于狂暴状态。

效果 尸骸造物以-1环境减值进行一次拳击打击，造成1d6额外伤害并且将目标击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

Berserk.name: 狂暴 Berserk
Berserk.description: 严重损坏的尸骸造物可能会狂暴。每当它开始回合时，如果生命值小于等于40点，尸骸造物必须通过@Check[type:flat|dc:5]检定，否则狂暴。狂暴的尸骸造物会胡乱攻击最近的活物，如果附近没有生物时则会攻击附近的物体。处于狂暴时，尸骸造物失去对心灵的免疫。

Charnel Creation.publicNotes: 由皮肤和血肉碎块拼成的尸骸造物是对生命的怪诞模仿。虽然它没有头脑，但当它受到伤害时却会狂怒，这让它给人留下了存在微弱情感的错觉。这些构装体通常被用来守卫秘密实验室，亵渎的墓地，塑肉师和死灵法师那血腥的停尸房，这些家伙为了自己的目的肆无忌惮地亵渎尸体。不过人们认为第一个被创造出的尸骸造物是由简单的基本素材组成的，被认为是一种错误尝试的产物，这些怪物真正的人类还差得远。在某些情况下，如果一个尸骸造物的大脑拥有特别强大的人格，那么它可能会出现该人格的回响，不过这种悲惨的情况（幸好）极其罕见。

Balisse.name: Balisse
Balisse.publicNotes:
Balisses, or confessor angels, seek to assist mortals ensnared by moral dilemmas or crises of faith. They prefer to guide people to their own decisions rather than demand obedience to a higher cause, as intrinsic belief is even more powerful than unquestioning obedience. While most balisses are fundamentally honest, they use their guiding angel ability to seem less intimidating and decrease the chance the mortal will simply acquiesce to the opinion of an obviously divine being.

While balisses can spring from any soul with suitable patience and strong counsel, they often form from souls of those who performed evil acts but were redeemed. These souls recognize the struggle and shame of those in similar situations, and can offer advice from the heart rather than from rote sympathy. Many serve the goddess Sarenrae, but they can serve other good deities and empyreal lords as well.

The celestial hosts of angels are messengers and warriors, divided into choirs based on their abilities and purviews. Angels were one of the first creations of the gods, and many still assist their righteous creators throughout the cosmos. Most angels in modern times are not direct creations of the divine, however, instead consisting of ascended mortal souls drawn from the celestial planes.

The majority of unaffiliated angels live in Nirvana, the plane of virtue and enlightenment. Angels who are affiliated with deities dwell in those deities' domains or other areas where that god holds influence. Regardless of residence or service, angels remain benevolent messengers possessed with magical auras to aid their allies.
Balisse.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Confessor's Aura.name: Confessor's Aura
Confessor's Aura.description:
20 feet.

Creatures in the balisse's aura are subject to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aewxsale5xWEPKLk]{Ring of Truth} (@Check[type:will|dc:23]). Additionally, if these creatures choose to honestly express their own conflicted feelings, the aura makes it easier for them to put words to those feelings.

Brand of the Impenitent.name: Brand of the Impenitent
Brand of the Impenitent.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The balisse marks a creature within their confessor's aura as irredeemable. They can do so only after a failed attempt to convince the creature to repent. The touched creature takes a –1 status penalty to AC and saves, reduces all its resistances by 2, and gains weakness 2 to holy. The duration depends on the target's @Check[type:will|dc:26] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The duration is 1 round.

Failure The duration is 1 day.

Critical Failure The duration is unlimited.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.BmAw66zEkifSvOtg]{Effect: Brand of the Impenitent}

Guiding Angel.name: Guiding Angel
Guiding Angel.description:
Requirements The balisse is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}

Effect The balisse spiritually attaches themself to an adjacent mortal who doesn't have the unholy trait. They merge with the mortal's body and are unable to use any of their spells and abilities other than to interact with the mortal. They can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AjLSHZSWQ90exdLo]{Dismiss} the effect to leave the mortal. While merged, the balisse can either communicate using a bodiless voice only the mortal can hear or can take a form of their choice that only the mortal can see, such as a small angel on the mortal's shoulder.

Hunt Prey.description: The werebear designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The werebear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} their prey and to Survival checks when they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} their prey. The first time the werebear hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. These effects last until the werebear uses Hunt Prey again.
Hunt Prey.name: Hunt Prey

Bear Empathy.name: Bear Empathy
Bear Empathy.description:
The werebear can communicate with ursine creatures.

The werecreature can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals of its general kind.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
• Human
    • Size Medium
    • Melee fist +13 Damage 1d4+7
  • Grizzly Bear
    • Speed 35 feet

The werecreature changes into its humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true werecreature's natural form is its hybrid shape.

In humanoid shape, the werecreature uses its original humanoid size, loses its jaws and claws Strikes, and gains a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by its claw.

In animal shape, its Speed and size change to that of the animal, it gains any special Strike effects of the animal that it didn't already have (such as Grab), and it loses its weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Curse of the Werebear.name: Curse of the Werebear
Curse of the Werebear.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

Mauler.name: Mauler
Mauler.description: The werebear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Moon Frenzy.name: Moon Frenzy
Moon Frenzy.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

Werebear.name: Werebear
Werebear.publicNotes:
Unwavering conviction fills a werebear during their transformations. This can drive them zealously into noble causes, but it can also make them ruthless, violent, and single-minded. Alliances can fall from a werebear's mind as their bestial temper overcomes them and their goal overwhelms all. As a result, werebears are loners, rarely even living together as families longer than necessary. As long as there is nothing around to threaten it or the natural area it protects (typically a forest), a werebear in its animal form is generally content to forage and sleep away the night.

Werecreatures are humanoids doomed to transform into animals and animalhumanoid hybrids under the light of the full moon. These shapechanging creatures are the result of an ancient primal curse that they can, in turn, transmit through their own bites. Their ability to lurk unseen in the wilds as well as among people, combined with the contagiousness of their condition, makes werecreatures a perennial cause of panicked suspicion.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.description:
A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Scent]

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Sinful Bite.name: Sinful Bite
Sinful Bite.description:
A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

Critical Success Unaffected

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure sickened 2 plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute

Pridespawn.name: Pridespawn
Pridespawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords—each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today, sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind.

Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, with slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue.

Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold, while envyspawn appear even more gaunt than the rest of their kin.
Pridespawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental

Deep Plunge.name: 紧急下潜 Deep Plunge
Deep Plunge.description: 盐鲨突然垂直下潜，它垂直向下方游泳两次。如果有生物被它擒获或束缚，它能带着该生物一起移动。

Brine Shark.name: 盐鲨 Brine Shark
Brine Shark.publicNotes:
盐鲨是致命的元素，在水元素位面无尽的海洋中漫游。它们也经常溜进凡间的海洋，与自然捕食者竞争，甚至混入血肉之躯的鲨鱼群中。

水元素可能具有非凡的破坏力，但这往往并非出于本心；就像水可以给主物质位面带来生命一样，它的波浪可以冲击海岸，雨水也能淹没城市。水元素同样如此难以捉摸。

Naiad Queen.name: Naiad Queen

Animal Empathy.name: Animal Empathy
Animal Empathy.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.

Inspiration.name: Inspiration
Inspiration.description:
The nymph queen inspires a single intelligent creature by giving that creature a token of her favor, typically a lock of her hair, though it can be some other significant object as well. As long as the creature carries her token and remains in good standing with her, the creature gains a +1 status bonus to all Crafting checks, Performance checks, and Will saves.

If the nymph grants her token to a bard, and she's the bard's muse, the queen chooses one additional benefit granted by her token: a +1 status bonus to all Lore checks, a +2 status bonus to Performance checks when determining the effects of compositions, a +4 status bonus to untrained skill checks, or a +2 status bonus to Will saves against fey.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.iSyyR4QVOaY6mxtg]{Effect: Nymph Queen's Inspiration}

Water Healing.name: Water Healing
Water Healing.description: For every 10 minutes a naiad spends soaking in any body of water in her domain, she regains @Damage[30[healing]]{30 Hit Points}.

Tied to the Land.name: Tied to the Land
Tied to the Land.description:
The queen is tied to a body of water or area with a great deal of water features.

A nymph queen is intrinsically tied to a specific region. As long as the queen is healthy, the environment is exceptionally resilient, allowing the nymph queen to automatically attempt to counteract any spell that would harm the environment (such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7yWXx3qC4eFNHhxD]{Blight} ritual), using her spell DC with a counteract rank equal to the highest-rank druid spell she can cast.

When the nymph queen becomes physically or psychologically unhealthy, however, her warded region eventually becomes twisted or unhealthy as well. In that case, restoring the nymph queen swiftly heals the entire region.

Nymph's Beauty.name: Nymph's Beauty
Nymph's Beauty.description:
30 feet.

A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and becomes stunned 1 each time it starts its turn within the aura for the next 24 hours, even if it can't see the naiad queen.

Creatures that start their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:23] save or suffer an effect described in the nymph queen's entry.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Nymph queens can transform between their original form, which looks much like a typical nymph of their kind, and any Small or Medium humanoid form, typically choosing a more humanoid-looking version of their natural form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Focus Beauty.name: Focus Beauty
Focus Beauty.description:
If a target already affected by nymph's beauty fails its save, the image of the queen sears into the creature's mind, effectively blinding the creature until its vision is restored with sound body or a similar effect.

The naiad queen can Dismiss the effect.

The nymph queen focuses her beauty upon a target, who must attempt a save against her nymph's beauty aura (@Check[type:will|dc:23] save). If the creature fails and was already affected by the aura, it takes a greater effect described in the nymph queen's entry.

A nymph queen can Focus Beauty on a given creature only once per turn.

Naiad Queen.publicNotes:
Naiad queens rule over pristine wildernesses centered around untouched lakes, massive rivers, or other collective bodies of fresh water. Bards' songs and artists' paintings of these powerful nymphs tend to depict naiad queens in their slightly more humanoid forms, which they don when they make the rare journey into civilized lands to garner allies, gather news, or gauge threats.

Most naiad queens treat those who respect their domains with kindness, but they're fierce—and quick to eliminate foes. Their blinding beauty and breadth of offensive spells make naiad queens fierce opponents if forced into a fight.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

Nymph Queens

Nymph queens are powerful nymphs who rule over entire regions of untouched wilderness, not just single trees or ponds. Every variety of nymph can have a queen. Naiad queens are among the most prominent, and more often interact with nearby mortals. Thus, some scholars refer to naiad queens as simply "nymphs."

Stunning Strike.name: Stunning Strike
Stunning Strike.description:
Requirements The tabellia hit a foe earlier this turn with a weapon Strike

Effect The tabellia makes a weapon Strike against the foe. On a success, the foe must also succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure).

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Messenger's Amnesty.name: Messenger's Amnesty
Messenger's Amnesty.description: An tabellia with a message to deliver is continually protected by the effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8xRzLhwGL7Dgy3EZ]{Sanctuary} (@Check[type:will|dc:32]). If the angel breaks the sanctuary, the effect returns if the angel ceases hostility for 10 minutes.

Traveler's Aura.name: Traveler's Aura
Traveler's Aura.description:
20 feet.

Creatures in the tabellia's aura are immune to ambient environmental damage from any plane, including severe and extreme heat and cold as well as more otherworldly dangers. The tabellia is never @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures within their aura.

Tabellia.name: Tabellia
Tabellia.publicNotes:
Tabellias are the elite messengers of the celestial realms, serving deities and celestial armies by delivering messages, performing reconnaissance, and providing support for those in need of aid. They watch over planar travelers and take powerful mortals under their wings to mentor them. Tabellias carry scrolls containing important messages and other celestial secrets. Most creatures, even wicked ones, respect the strength of tabellias and allow them to travel untroubled.

Tabellias can form spontaneously from the souls of exceptional mortals but are also sometimes created from such souls intentionally by deities or demigods. In the latter cases, tabellias often bear physical features that mark them as closely affiliated with that deity. A tabellia created by Sarenrae, for example, might have hair made of fire, while one created by Torag might look more dwarven, and one created by Desna could have butterfly wings instead of feathered wings. It's not unusual for tabellias created by deities to share their creators' philosophies and interests.

The celestial hosts of angels are messengers and warriors, divided into choirs based on their abilities and purviews. Angels were one of the first creations of the gods, and many still assist their righteous creators throughout the cosmos. Most angels in modern times are not direct creations of the divine, however, instead consisting of ascended mortal souls drawn from the celestial planes.

The majority of unaffiliated angels live in Nirvana, the plane of virtue and enlightenment. Angels who are affiliated with deities dwell in those deities' domains or other areas where that god holds influence. Regardless of residence or service, angels remain benevolent messengers possessed with magical auras to aid their allies.
Tabellia.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Globster.name: 格罗布斯特 Globster

Saturated.name: 浸润饱和 Saturated
Saturated.description: 格罗布斯特能在水体之外存活1小时，在此之后，它便会陷入溺水和窒息的风险。

Nauseating Slap.name: 作呕拍击 Nauseating Slap
Nauseating Slap.description:
活物被格罗布斯特的触手击打后必须尝试@Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]豁免。失败时，该生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。若该生物已经陷入恶心状态，状态值增加1点，最高为恶心4。

当生物成功通过豁免检定时，它会临时免疫24小时。

Globster.publicNotes:
潮水将各种碎渣冲刷到岸上，从人畜无害的海藻与贝壳到腐烂的庞大水生生物的尸骸均有可能。格罗布斯特经常别误认成此类物质，但这种假设并非完全错误——这些无心智的流动物质由腐烂的海洋生物所构成，这些未被完全分解的物质融合成了一团令人作呕、散发着臭气的臃肿淤泥。

尽管没有心智，但格罗布斯特却是会搜寻活体猎物的猎食者。它们通常会蜷缩在海床上，在那里用恶臭的躯体吸引食腐生物，并迅速将被引来的生物化作泥怪的下一顿美餐。当潮汐将这些怪物冲上岸后，它们只不过是转而捕猎陆上生物而已。沿海的社群通常会早在目视到被冲上岸的格罗布斯特之前便注意到它的气味。那些被派去调查的人通常会把格罗布斯特误认为搁浅鲸鱼的尸骸，之后才发现预想中的尸体不但活得好好的，而且还非常饿。

先贤们曾认为格罗布斯特是不死生物，是被驱使着觅食的翻卷成团的腐烂肉块，尽管它们没有心智，但它们却仍旧活着。它们会被水边的淤积垃圾场和漂浮的废弃驳船所吸引，且具有足够的模糊意识来聚集到食物充足的地点。

由于格罗布斯特的构成物质是大量鲸脂和油性组织，因此它们能被搜集来用充当灯油、润滑油、烹饪用脂肪等多种用途。如果有人能忍受它的气味的话，那么格罗布斯特分解时留下的粘稠物质就能够满足这些功用。紧实的脂肪会很快变质，但许多临时性的地精海滨烧烤摊都会把这种物质切城厚片油炸来制成美味佳肴。

格罗布斯特会吃下活物，但仅会消化其中一部分。未消化的残渣会积聚在格罗布斯特愈发臃肿的躯体内。它们会把这些恶臭的物质存在移动时会发出潮湿水声的身体内，直至本能或受创促使它们吐出一团全新的格罗布斯特来帮助自己吞噬周遭的一切。一个存有足量废渣的格罗布斯特会在受到伤害时自动以自由动作创造另一个新格罗布斯特。此类遭遇会被视同为对抗两个5级生物的遭遇，而非正常的一个。据学者们所知，这是此种生物创造更多同类的唯一途径。

Mirage Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Mirage Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Mirage Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Scintillating Defense.name: Scintillating Defense
Scintillating Defense.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon flashes their iridescent scales at the triggering creature to throw off the attack. The dragon gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} against the triggering attack.

Captivating Display.name: Captivating Display
Captivating Display.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon opens the fins on their head, creating a radiant display of enthralling colors. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) for 1 round. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to Captivating Display for 1 minute.

Hallucinatory Breath.name: Hallucinatory Breath
Hallucinatory Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a cloud that assaults the senses and deals @Damage[17d6[mental]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[type:will|dc:41] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure) and is then temporarily immune to being confused by Hallucinatory Breath for 1 hour.

The dragon can't use Hallucinatory Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hallucinatory Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Lunging Bite.name: Lunging Bite
Lunging Bite.description: The dragon lunges their head forward, making a jaws Strike with an extended reach of 25 feet.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The dragon can Hide in natural environments even if they don't have cover.

Illusion Sense.name: Illusion Sense
Illusion Sense.description: When the dragon moves within 30 feet of an illusion that can be disbelieved, they automatically attempt a secret check to disbelieve, even if they didn't spend an action to Interact.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Mirage Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Mirage dragons are masters of illusion magic and use their powers to deceive others and further their own agendas. In addition to their magical prowess, mirage dragons possess a number of additional features to help them on hunts or mislead attackers, such as their camouflaging scales and a hallucinatory breath that can confound multiple foes at once. Mirage dragons are vain and egotistical figures. They ultimately care more about themselves than others.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Moon Frenzy.name: Moon Frenzy
Moon Frenzy.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The werewolf's Strikes deal 1d6 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the werewolf's allies.

Wolf Empathy.name: Wolf Empathy
Wolf Empathy.description:
The werewolf can communicate with canine creatures.

The werecreature can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals of its general kind.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
• Human
    • Melee fist +11 Damage 1d4+8
  • Animal
    • Speed 40 feet
    • Melee jaws with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown}

The werecreature changes into its humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true werecreature's natural form is its hybrid shape.

In humanoid shape, the werecreature uses its original humanoid size, loses its jaws and claws Strikes, and gains a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by its claw.

In animal shape, its Speed and size change to that of the animal, it gains any special Strike effects of the animal that it didn't already have (such as Grab), and it loses its weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Curse of the Werewolf.name: Curse of the Werewolf
Curse of the Werewolf.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

Werewolf.name: Werewolf
Werewolf.publicNotes:
