Carry Off Prey.description: 高基特斯在有生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于其颚中时，能以全额速度带着该生物一起移动。

Skittering Assault.name: 跳跃突袭 Skittering Assault
Skittering Assault.description: 高基特斯行走三次。在每次行走期间，它都能在过程中的任何一点对触及范围内的一个生物进行一次腿打击；每次攻击必须针对不同的生物，直到所有打击都结束之后，多重攻击减值才生效。如果在跳跃突袭过程中有任何一次打击大失败，则跳跃突袭中止。

Gogiteth.publicNotes:
高基特斯是一种不断往下滴着粘液的、由许多牙齿、眼睛和毛茸茸的蜘蛛腿组成的噩梦，它的外观总会深深的烙在任何目击者的脑海里。这些成群的跳跃着的怪物在幽暗地域（Darklands）底层区域，与洞穴蠕虫等其他恐怖的地底生物争夺食物和资源。高基特斯很少独自行动，因为这些体型庞大的害兽在很久之前就意识到群居是最佳的生存手段。即使是最顽强的幽暗地域居民也会在发现高基特斯时寻找掩护，因为只要出现一只就意味着后面会跟着一群。

高基特斯在移动时会发出噼啪声。它们腿上的关节在每次移动时都会发出“啪”的一声，不过它们可以主动抑制这种声音，因此可以在捕猎时隐藏自己。这些奇怪的生物还能发出回荡在巢穴里的尖锐哨声。一些幽暗地域的居民传说，成群的高基特斯在一起时会唱起怪异的、不协调的歌曲。

对高基特斯的解剖结果激发了不少人关于它们起源的猜想。一些人则认为它们是错误的塑肉实验的结果。另一些人则认为，它们可能某种程度上和黑色支配者（Dominion of the Black）有关——可能是这些外星实体的远亲或被驱逐的异类；依据这个传说，高基特斯一来到格拉利昂，就爬进了地下深处，避开炙热的太阳。

高基特斯是幽暗地域所有其他居民的威胁。居住在高基特斯滋生的地区，濑加美名（Sekamina）和奥瓦（Orv）的人们，常常组织狩猎队来消灭它们，甚至在高基特斯虫群出现时，会暂时和敌人休战。因为即使是一个普通巢穴里面也足足能够容纳20多只高基特斯，所以清剿它们巢穴的任务是非常危险的。

Fey Dragonet.publicNotes:
Although they are much smaller than their larger dragon cousins, fey dragonets have many of the same physiological attributes, including long necks, toothy maws, sinuous tails, and sharp claws. They flit about on iridescent butterfly wings, the coloring of which changes based on where they live, giving them a natural camouflage. Unlike their larger kin, an adult fey dragonet remains the same size throughout their lifespan. The only visual clue to the age of a fey dragonet is the sheen on their scales, a glimmer that becomes more lustrous the older they get.

Fey dragonets usually exhibit pleasant and good-natured temperaments, though they have a mischievous streak that leads them to play tricks on those around them. In search of amusement, they prefer harmless annoyances over wounding malice. While often spontaneous, they may also spend months, if not years, planning the perfect prank. Especially responsive targets endear themselves to fey dragonets and may create a lifelong bond. A fey dragonet's reputation as a trickster leads many to associate them with fey, with whom the tiny dragons have cordial relationships, and this association gives them their name.

Peaceful by nature, fey dragonets don't enjoy confrontation. If faced with hostility, they prefer to remain at a distance and breathe euphoric gas at their foes, diffusing the skirmish by creating an atmosphere of bliss. If conflict escalates, they target their opponents with spells, using their renowned trickery to escape. If their companions are in danger, however, their desire to remain out of combat changes. Fey dragonets protect their friends by any means available, including physical combat.

Sometimes, as fey dragonets grow older, their connection to the First World grows stronger. In addition to growing more lustrous and vibrant in appearance, these fey dragonets gain an increasing amount of magical primal power. Such fey dragonets increase in strength as appropriate—a fey dragonet of 20th level or even higher is possible, but it's exceptionally unusual to encounter a fey dragonet of 9th level or higher beyond the most remote regions of the First World. When creating a more powerful fey dragonet, change their spellcasting tradition to primal and grant them primal spells appropriate for a druid of their level. Fey dragonets don't grow much larger, regardless of how powerful they become. It's often difficult to tell how powerful one of these tiny dragons truly is at a glance!

Euphoric Breath.description:
The dragonet breathes euphoric gas in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}; on a critical failure, the duration is 1 minute.

The fey dragonet can't use Euphoric Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Euphoric Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Euphoric Breath.name: Euphoric Breath

Fey Dragonet.name: Fey Dragonet

Mindwarping.name: Mindwarping
Mindwarping.description:
The sting of a vrolikai is mind-warping. A creature struck must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:44] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature becomes stupefied 1. If it's already stupefied, its stupefied value increases by 1 instead (to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4}).

Critical Failure As failure, plus the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Death-Stealing Gaze.name: Death-Stealing Gaze
Death-Stealing Gaze.description:
30 feet. When a non-demon ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

A creature that dies while it has drain from a vrolikai's gaze rises as a ghoul the next midnight. The GM determines what kind of ghoul.

Black Flame Knives.name: Black Flame Knives
Black Flame Knives.description: The vrolikai manifests a dagger-shaped blade of what looks like crystallized black flame in each of their four hands. These weapons function as +2 greater striking daggers that deal an additional 2d6 void damage. They fade away into nothingness 1 minute after a vrolikai no longer carries them.

Consume Death.name: Consume Death
Consume Death.description:
The vrolikai focuses their deathstealing gaze upon a single target they can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Fortitude save against death-stealing gaze.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is affected by death-stealing gaze and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. If the creature was already drained 1 by the death-stealing gaze before attempting the save, a failed save increases the value of the drained condition by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}. The vrolikai gains 10 temporary Hit Points, and the drained creature is temporarily immune until the start of the vrolikai's next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature increases the amount of drain by 2.

Focused Flames.name: Focused Flames
Focused Flames.description:
The vrolikai attacks a single target with all of their black flame knives. The demon makes a black flame knife Strike with the following additional effects. This counts toward the vrolikai's multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of back flame knives the vrolikai used.

Critical Success The target takes an additional 2d6 void damage for each knife beyond the first (typically @Damage[6d6[void]]{6d6 extra damage}) and takes @Damage[4d6[persistent,void]] damage.

Success The target takes an additional 2d6 void damage for each knife beyond the first.

Failure The vrolikai deals the damage their black flame knife Strike normally deals on a hit.

Vrolikai.name: Vrolikai
Vrolikai.publicNotes:
Powerful vrolikais command the untamed armies of demonkind, uniting them behind their one unifying desire for death and destruction. Unlike other demons, the dreaded vrolikai doesn't form directly from a single soul—they instead manifest when a demon devours so many damned souls that their own individual desires are lost in the sinful cacophony. A vrolikai who survives this process gains great power and can claim a region of the Outer Rifts as their own domain.

Vrolikais' enthusiastic embrace of the multitude of sins makes them uniquely suited to lead and unite demons, such that even demon lords often must rely on vrolikais to command their forces. The chaotic and conflicting motivations of demonkind leave little room to find common ground, but the vrolikai can expound upon the beauty of every kind of sin while marching demon armies to battle.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.

Boar.name: Boar

Boar Charge.name: Boar Charge
Boar Charge.description: The boar Strides twice and then makes a tusk Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

Boar.publicNotes:
Boars are omnivorous mammals, hunted heavily because their meat is considered a delicacy. Boars are most likely to attack humanoids either in self-defense or during their mating season in the winter months, when the males grow an extra inch of tissue to protect their organs as they fight off rivals. Of course, in some cultures, boars are trained to become much more aggressive so they can fill the roles of warbeast and guardian. When such boars escape back into the wild, they can become true terrors in the region.

While domesticated pigs are a staple of farm life, wild boars are much more dangerous. Foul-tempered warthogs are relatively common, while the lumbering, primeval beasts known as daeodons are less so. Voracious boars can ravage the countryside in which they live, making them a particular nuisance to farmers. Boars breed freely, and a pair of boars can rapidly grow to a large family.

Scamper.name: Scamper
Scamper.description:
Requirements The kobold cavern mage is adjacent to at least one enemy

Effect The kobold cavern mage Strides up to their Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. They must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

Inspiring Display.name: Inspiring Display
Inspiring Display.description:
Requirements The cavern mage's previous action was to Cast a Spell

Effect The cavern mage uses their magical display to inspire another kobold within 30 feet. That kobold gains 4 temporary Hit Points that last until the start of the cavern mage's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.smk2cD6M3dsEPBCY]{Effect: Inspiring Display}

Kobold Cavern Mage.name: Kobold Cavern Mage
Kobold Cavern Mage.publicNotes:
Kobold cavern mages are born more than trained, hatching from eggs that absorbed particularly large amounts of primal earth energy. Although there are many elementals and even natural terrain features that can give rise to cavern mages, most are related to the cavern-dwelling earth nymphs known as lampads. These lonely and capricious fey are as enthusiastic to receive the company of a kobold tribe as the kobolds are for the protection they receive in return.

Kobolds are small reptilian humanoids. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniacal leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power they generally lack. Notably, kobold eggs left in the proximity of magical creatures or places tend to absorb similar traits from the exposure. The resulting physical changes mark the appearance of each tribe, but a few lucky kobolds are also born with magical power that reflects their tribe's patron.

Tiger.publicNotes:
老虎是独来独往且有领地意识的猎手，它们会用带斑纹的兽皮融入作为家园的森林和丛林中，并且更喜欢出其不意地发动攻击。

自然界中很少有掠食者能与猫的潜行能力相匹敌。大型猫科动物分部于任何环境，它们通常会与居住地保持距离。当文明人侵入大型猫科动物的猎场时，这些动物往往会不顾一切地对粗心的旅行者进行攻击。
Tiger.name: 老虎 Tiger

Pounce.name: 猛扑 Pounce
Pounce.description: 老虎行走，在行动结束后衔接1次打击。如果老虎在执行此行动前处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]状态，则它保持藏匿直到该次打击结束。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 老虎对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]的生物造成额外1d6精准伤害。

Wrestle.name: 猛压 Wrestle
Wrestle.description: 老虎对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于它生物进行1次利爪打击。如果此打击命中，则目标被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

Magma Worm.name: Magma Worm
Magma Worm.publicNotes:
Among the most dangerous of their kind are the fiery magma worms. In addition to being even larger than benthic worms, the magma worm has a penchant for burrowing through volcanic regions that, over the generations, have infused it with a supernatural link to the Elemental Plane of Fire. The fiery heart of an active volcano is an attractive lair for a magma worm, as are the sprawling fields of molten rock found in the deepest reaches of the Darklands. Legends of ancient dwarven societies and colonists of the Elemental Planes populating moats of lava with magma worms likely have some basis in truth, although the methods used to keep these "moat worms" contained—and prevented from chewing their way through fortress foundations—must have been significant.

Magma worms sometimes frequent areas on the surface where volcanism creates hot springs or other geothermal features, but even then they prefer to spend most of their time burrowing through the ground in their never-ending search for sustenance. Surface lands claimed by magma worms are notable for the mound-shaped burrows these creatures leave behind as they dig.

Cave worms are gigantic scavengers that bore through the depths of the world, eating whatever material they find. Named for their distinctive habitats, these worms are ravenous and display overwhelming destructive capabilities. Cave worms of different types and abilities lurk in the more remote corners of the world—tales speak of arctic worms that dwell within immense glaciers or icebergs and grave worms that burrow through the boneyards of long-forgotten ruins, to name a few.

Fire Healing.name: Fire Healing
Fire Healing.description: As long as a magma worm is in contact with a fire or body of magma at least as large as itself, it gains fast healing 20. When struck by a magical fire effect from anything other than itself, a crimson worm regains Hit Points equal to half the fire damage the effect would otherwise deal.

Inexorable.name: Inexorable
Inexorable.description: The magma worm recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

Slough Skin.name: Slough Skin
Slough Skin.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The magma worm would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis})

Effect The magma worm negates the triggering condition or effect by sloughing an outer layer of its skin. Effects from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can't be avoided in this way.

Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The worm @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabs} a creature

Effect The worm uses Swallow Whole.

Fire Breath.name: Fire Breath
Fire Breath.description:
The magma worm breathes a blast of flame in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] that deals @Damage[18d6[fire]] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:41|basic:true] save).

It can't use Fire Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Fire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Magma Worm Venom.name: Magma Worm Venom
Magma Worm Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and drained 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round).

Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: A magma worm can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

Thrash.name: Thrash
Thrash.description: The worm makes a Strike once against each creature in its reach. It can Strike up to once with its jaws, up to once with its stinger, and any number of times with its body. Each attack counts toward the worm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.

Cold Adaptation.name: 耐寒 Cold Adaptation
Cold Adaptation.description: 猛犸象受到的寒冷环境效果下降一级。

Dual Tusks.name: 双牙戳刺 Dual Tusks
Dual Tusks.description: 猛犸象进行两次象牙打击，每次攻击不同的目标。此动作在计算多重攻击减值时算一次攻击，并且多重攻击减值在两次攻击之后才增加。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Cold.name: 对寒冷的豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Cold

Grabbing Trunk.name: 鼻卷 Grabbing Trunk
Grabbing Trunk.description: 猛犸象的象鼻攻击命中中型或更小体型的生物后可以让其陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]状态。如果猛犸象移动，则可以带着受擒的生物一起移动。

Mammoth.name: 猛犸象 Mammoth
Mammoth.publicNotes:
猛犸象大多生活在寒冷的气候中，它们习惯于与凶残的捕食者打交道，在它们踩踏和碾压敌人的时候用更大的象牙造成更多的破坏。居住在严寒的冻土带的人形生物们会依靠猛犸象的力量来帮助他们生存。

通过大象长长的、灵活的象鼻和令人印象深刻的长牙，人们立刻就能认出它们。在不同的地方的大象有不同的特征。大象在许多地区被当做驮畜，但其实它们非常聪明，必须非常小心地对待。
Mammoth.allSaves: 对寒冷的豁免+2状态加值

Curse of Fire.name: Curse of Fire
Curse of Fire.description:
When a creature slays the crag linnorm, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:35] save or gain weakness to fire 15 with an unlimited duration.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.VFIVdYmS3XTdd3hj]{Effect: Curse of Fire}

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Crag Linnorm Venom.name: Crag Linnorm Venom
Crag Linnorm Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34];

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Magma Breath.name: Magma Breath
Magma Breath.description:
The crag linnorm breathes out a stream of magma in a @Template[type:line|distance:120] that deals @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage to creatures within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true] save). Any creature that fails its save also takes @Damage[4d6[persistent,fire]]{4d6 persistent fire damage}.

The linnorm can't use Magma Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Magma Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

The magma remains until the start of the linnorm's next turn. If the linnorm was on the ground, the magma remains as a burning line on the ground directly under the line of the Magma Breath; if the linnorm was airborne, the magma rains down in a sheet 60 feet high. Any creature that moves across or through the magma takes @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true] save).

At the start of the linnorm's next turn, the magma cools to a thin layer of brittle stone, or the magma rain finishes falling and turns to harmless pebbles. The cooled magma quickly degrades to powder and sand over the course of several hours.

Crag Linnorm.name: Crag Linnorm
Crag Linnorm.publicNotes:
Despite being among the weakest linnorms, the crag linnorm is a devastating predator, capable of quickly cooking their foes with their magma breath.

Immense, primeval dragons of the northern reaches of the world, linnorms hate those they deem to be lesser creatures and seek to inflict as much suffering as possible upon their unfortunate victims. While these serpentine monstrosities might not be the powerful winged dragons most imagine, they nonetheless possess incredible strength and deadly powers that often rival more notorious dragons' brutality.
Crag Linnorm.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Qarna.publicNotes:
康瓦纳是隐秘而不知疲倦的哨兵与探子，巡逻于外环位面（Outer Sphere）不羁的荒野上，铲除邪恶，保护小社群免受恶魔、魔鬼和更可怕的东西的侵扰。他们宛若一尊华丽的塑像，其上雕刻着四个雄鹿般的头、长着金色的角。当受他们的盟友，尤其是埃拉斯蒂尔，所托之时，他们会旅行到物质宇宙并巡视危险的边境地区，暗中去做善事，例如引导猎人寻找食物、帮助迷路的孩子、以及赶走邪恶生物。

圣使是天堂（Heaven）的守护者、腐化的敌人。早在诸神与他们的仆人涉足天界位面前，圣使就已作为此地的原住民栖息在那了。打一照面，圣使和神圣天使很快便发现他们是一类人，心中皆怀着正义与公义。联盟由此成立，如今，圣使们是所有天族与他们信赖的凡人们的忠实盟友。

当第一位圣使从宏伟的天堂七层山脉凝聚成形后，他们会选择来到天堂的灵魂中有意愿也有资格的加入他们的行列。这些凡人听到并回应了一个神秘声音的召唤，在山顶的花园（the Garden）中显形。在那里，他们发誓永远为正义事业服务，脱胎换骨成为新的圣使。

虽然圣使们十分在意保卫凡人的生命，并愿意在对抗魔族的战斗中牺牲自我，他们总让人觉得死板又难以捉摸，他们的外观也几乎能称得上骇人且怪异。因此，他们在与凡人或自由奔放的灵使交互时时常遇到困难。尽管如此，圣使从还是能从他人身上汲取强大力量，尤其是那些堪称楷模的贤德之人。

除了他们的天族盟友，圣使还与御衡者维持着古老的联系。时至今日，我们仍能见到个高深莫测的集团一起合作，共同捍卫尘封已久的秘密，执行早在凡人诞生前创立的规则。圣使仅将这些行为解释为必要之举，不做进一步的说明；在这点上，哪怕是圣使的天使盟友也对他们的固执感到沮丧。
Qarna.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Archon's Protection.description:
触发 一个敌人伤害圣使的盟友，且该敌人和该盟友皆距离圣使15尺内

效果 该盟友在对抗触发伤害时获得全部伤害抗力5，圣使可对触发本能力的敌人进行一次打击。
Archon's Protection.name: 圣使护卫 Archon's Protection

Archon’s Pursuit.description:
频率 每天一次

需求 康瓦纳看到一个生物在上一轮传送，并且康瓦纳至少还能施展一次@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]

效果 康瓦纳施展一次次元移位，且法术升阶至5环级，让康瓦纳抵达距离他追捕生物30尺的一处未被占据的空间。如果该生物离得太远，康瓦纳在抵达时会尽可能靠近该生物。
Archon’s Pursuit.name: 圣使追击 Archon’s Pursuit

Distracting Arrow.name: 干扰箭 Distracting Arrow
Distracting Arrow.description: 康瓦纳进行一次复合长弓打击。若命中，箭矢会卡在目标的身上，该生物的感官也会自此专注于圣使，其他的一切对那个生物而言都变得模糊不清。该生物在对抗除了那个康瓦纳以外的任何目标时，攻击骰和察觉检定均受到-2状态减值。该生物能用一个交互动作拔出箭矢以结束此效果。

Touch of Charity.name: 救济之触 Touch of Charity
Touch of Charity.description: 康瓦纳触碰一个自愿生物来分担该生物的伤势。康瓦纳能将最多30点HP传递给被触摸的生物。康瓦纳不能传递比他当前HP更多的HP。

Qarna.name: 康瓦纳 Qarna

Pall of Shadow.name: Pall of Shadow
Pall of Shadow.description: When a shadow giant hits with a melee attack, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and take a –1 status penalty to Perception checks involving sight as long as they remain drained. On a critical failure, this condition doesn't heal naturally and can be removed only with magic.

Shadow Chain.name: Shadow Chain
Shadow Chain.description: Shadows extend the giant's chain as they make a spiked chain Strike, increasing their reach to 60 feet for that Strike. If this hits, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save or be teleported to an empty space within the shadow giant's normal reach.

Shadowcloak.name: Shadowcloak
Shadowcloak.description: The shadow giant gains the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3JG1t3T4mWn6vTke]{Blur} spell for 1 minute or until it is exposed to direct sunlight, whichever comes first.

Shadow Giant.name: Shadow Giant
Shadow Giant.publicNotes:
Shadow giants are natives of the Netherworld, where they have dwelled in perpetual twilight for millennia. They live in familiar groups and uphold a nomadic way of life as they roam across ancestral lands between shadowy forests and misty chasms. These hunter-gatherers pass down lore through oral histories, conduct pilgrimages to unholy ziggurats of black stone, and bathe in the blood of their long-standing foes, including rival shadow giant clans and fiends of the Netherworld intent on enslaving their kind.

Standing 15 feet tall, with gray skin and hair only a shade lighter, shadow giants are fearsome foes with a well-earned reputation as zealous warmongers and ruthless combatants. They rarely interact with outsiders, though they may treat with proven warriors who show the giants the respect and deference they feel they deserve.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

Aquatic Predator.name: Aquatic Predator
Aquatic Predator.description: An azarketi deals 2d8 additional damage on a successful weapon Strike while they are underwater.

Hydration.name: Hydration
Hydration.description: Azarketi must regularly submerge themselves in water to rehydrate their water-acclimated skin. After the first 24 hours outside of water, they gain a –1 status penalty to Fortitude saves as their skin cracks and their gills become painful. After 48 hours, they begin to suffocate until returned to water.

Speaker of the Oceans.name: Speaker of the Oceans
Speaker of the Oceans.description: An azarketi tide tamer can speak with animals that have the aquatic or amphibious trait.

Azarketi Tide Tamer.name: Azarketi Tide Tamer
Azarketi Tide Tamer.publicNotes:
The most ambitious and capable azarketis become tide tamers, learning how to speak with and train aquatic animals.

Azarketis, also known as gillmen, can be found all over Golarion, with a particularly high concentration around Absalom and the Inner Sea. Descendants of the ancient Azlanti, the azarketis survived the cataclysm of Earthfall by fleeing into the ocean, where they were warped into amphibious forms by the alghollthu.

Hobgoblin Archer.name: Hobgoblin Archer
Hobgoblin Archer.publicNotes:
Bands of hobgoblin soldiers typically have at least one archer among their ranks. In smaller groups, the hobgoblin archer also serves as that band's captain.

Hobgoblins may appear to outsiders to be the most civilized of goblinkind, but their civilization is hardly one of kindness and equality-instead, they revel in all that is militaristic, tyrannical, cruel, and destructive. Hobgoblins are singularly devoted to war, and their entire culture is built upon fostering and maintaining conflict while simultaneously proving their superiority in battle. Hobgoblins are highly organized, and they work efficiently and effectively in groups, whether that group is a small raiding party, a roving war band, or a fully regimented army. Hobgoblin rulers require little provocation before declaring war, and more often than not, such wars are waged to gain slaves or territory. Physically, hobgoblins stand about as tall as humans and have gray, ashen skin.

Hobgoblin society is organized along military lines, and every hobgoblin is effectively a member of the army. Each hobgoblin in a community has a rank in the military hierarchy, and individuals are naturally ambitious and obsessed with advancement. Hobgoblins are constantly expected to prove that they're fearless, ruthless, cunning, and strong. Demonstrating such aptitudes is an individual hobgoblin's best hope for promotion through the ranks, but failure leads only to cruel exploitation at the hands of their superiors. Though brutal, hobgoblin society is a true meritocracy, and all hobgoblins, regardless of age, gender, or birth, wield authority and earn respect from their peers based on their skill in battle. Even those individuals who serve in non-combat roles in hobgoblin society-blacksmiths, builders, cooks, messengers, quartermasters, and the like-know that they perform vital jobs that support the larger hobgoblin army, though they rarely rise above the rank of common soldier. Everyone contributes to the larger whole, ensuring that hobgoblin society is the strongest and most efficient it can be, and anyone who fails to do so is culled from the army and this hobgoblin society as dead weight. Hobgoblins don't usually engage in trade with other races, or even with other hobgoblin tribes, preferring to take what they want by force.

Formation.name: Formation
Formation.description: When it's adjacent to at least two other allies, the hobgoblin archer gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.

Crossbow Precision.name: Crossbow Precision
Crossbow Precision.description: The first time the archer hits with a crossbow attack in a round, it deals 1d8 extra precision damage.

Perfect Aim.name: Perfect Aim
Perfect Aim.description:
The hobgoblin archer ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition.

Their targets don't benefit from lesser cover, and they reduce the AC bonus from standard cover by 2 against the hobgoblin archer's attack.

Running Reload.name: Running Reload
Running Reload.description: The archer Strides, Steps, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneaks}, then Interacts to reload.

Curse of Death.name: Curse of Death
Curse of Death.description: When a creature slays the tarn linnorm, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:46] save or it can no longer recover Hit Points via any means, such as healing spells, the Medicine skill, or natural healing from rest. This has an unlimited duration.

Double Breath.name: Double Breath
Double Breath.description:
The tarn linnorm uses Corrosive Breath twice. A creature attempts only one save and can take damage only once.

The linnorm can't use Corrosive Breath or Double Breath again for [[/br 2d4 #Recharge Corrosive Breath or Double Breath]]{2d4 rounds}.

Tarn Linnorm Venom.name: Tarn Linnorm Venom
Tarn Linnorm Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:44]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[7d6[acid]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[11d6[acid]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Corrosive Breath.name: Corrosive Breath
Corrosive Breath.description:
The tarn linnorm can expel either a @Template[type:line|distance:120] or a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of acid, dealing @Damage[20d6[acid]] damage to creatures within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:44|basic:true] save).

The linnorm can't use Corrosive Breath or Double Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Corrosive Breath or Double Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

The acid creates toxic fumes. At the beginning of the linnorm's next turn, those who failed the breath weapon's Reflex save must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42] or gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 4} from the poisonous fumes.

Double Bite.name: Double Bite
Double Bite.description: The tarn linnorm Strides and then makes a jaws Strike with each of their heads, each against a different target. Both attacks count toward the tarn linnorm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the tarn linnorm makes all of these attacks.

Tarn Linnorm.name: Tarn Linnorm
Tarn Linnorm.publicNotes:
Although more powerful linnorms exist, the multi-headed tarn linnorm can wreak an awe-inspiring amount of devastation.

Immense, primeval dragons of the northern reaches of the world, linnorms hate those they deem to be lesser creatures and seek to inflict as much suffering as possible upon their unfortunate victims. While these serpentine monstrosities might not be the powerful winged dragons most imagine, they nonetheless possess incredible strength and deadly powers that often rival more notorious dragons' brutality.
Tarn Linnorm.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Winged Chupacabra.name: Winged Chupacabra
Winged Chupacabra.publicNotes:
Some chupacabras are mutants with large reptilian wings and have been known to carry off goats or even children.

These notorious predators have an undeniable thirst for blood. Chupacabras prefer to prey on the weak and slow, often hiding in wait and watching potential prey for long periods before attacking. Spry and stealthy, they most often make their homes in areas of high grass and protective rock, their slightly reflective scales allowing them to blend in well with such surroundings.

Chupacabras prefer to eat lone travelers and farm animals (particularly goats) and leave little evidence of their presence apart from the grisly, blood-drained husks of their meals. Their tendency to stay out of sight combined with their naturally nocturnal activity often leads superstitious locals to conclude the worst, imagining that a particularly reckless vampire lives in the area.

A typical chupacabra measures nearly 4 feet from its muzzle to the tip of its spiny tail, and it stands just under 3-1/2 feet tall. With their slight build and lightweight bones, most weigh close to 50 pounds. They mate rarely and only during the hottest months, with the females each producing a single egg that hatches into a tiny, dehydrated creature. The mother usually leaves helpless prey in her cave so the hatchling can immediately feed.

Although chupacabras are typically solitary creatures, they have been known to form small gangs in bountiful areas. Members of these groups work well together, growing bold enough to attack larger animals, small herds, and otherwise more dangerous prey. Stories of chupacabras attacking travelers or laying siege to farmhouses typically stem from the hunting practices of such gangs. Regions where chupacabra activity like this is more common often have complex and colorful myths and tall tales about chupacabra capabilities or motive—and a few of the claims, such as that some chupacabras can fly, are all too true.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The chupacabra Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the chupacabra began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Suck Blood.name: Suck Blood
Suck Blood.description:
Requirements The chupacabra has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The chupacabra sucks blood from the grabbed creature. The chupacabra gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition for 1 minute and can use the extra action only for Strike and Stride actions.

A chupacabra can't Suck Blood again while it is quickened in this way.

A creature that has its blood drained by a chupacabra is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

Lustspawn.name: Lustspawn
Lustspawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords—each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today, sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind.

Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, with slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue.

Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold, while envyspawn appear even more gaunt than the rest of their kin.
Lustspawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental

Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.description:
A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Scent]

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Sinful Bite.name: Sinful Bite
Sinful Bite.description:
A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

Critical Success Unaffected

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure sickened 2 plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute

Giant Octopus.name: 巨章鱼 Giant Octopus

Compression.name: 压缩 Compression
Compression.description: 巨章鱼在不进行挤入的情况下可以穿过至少2尺宽的裂隙，如果@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]则可以穿过1尺宽的裂隙。

Giant Octopus Venom.name: 巨章鱼毒液 Giant Octopus Venom
Giant Octopus Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}并措手不及 (1轮)

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}并措手不及 (1轮)

Ink Cloud.name: 墨水云 Ink Cloud
Ink Cloud.description:
巨章鱼向周围@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围喷出墨水云。这团云对水域之外空间不起作用。在墨水云中的生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]状态，并且不能使用它们的嗅觉感官。墨水云1分钟之后消散。

巨章鱼[[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6轮}之内无法再使用该能力。

Jet.name: 喷射 Jet
Jet.description: 巨章鱼在水中直线前进200尺，并且不触发反应动作。

Writhing Arms.name: 舞动腕足 Writhing Arms
Writhing Arms.description:
巨章鱼用四条不同的腕足进行四次打击，每条选择不同的目标。每次攻击都计算多重攻击减值，但是多重攻击减值要在此项行动的全部攻击动作都结束之后才增加。

如果巨章鱼在之后使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]动作，它尝试擒获舞动腕足命中的任意数量的生物。

Giant Octopus.publicNotes:
巨章鱼在黑暗的深海中出没。它们聪明、适应性强，捕食并吞噬各种动物。尽管巨章鱼最多能长到16尺长，但只要有和它的喙差不多大的缝隙，它就可以压缩自己的身体然后挤过去。

巨型章鱼喜欢把沉船、珊瑚礁或水下洞穴作为巢穴，在那里它们可以利用狭窄的空间来保护自己。就像它们较小的同类一样，它们喜欢用现成的东西来装饰自己的巢穴——对巨章鱼来说，其中许多也是魔法武器、盾牌或从沉船或倒下的冒险家那里打捞出来的艺术品。

Giant Flytrap.name: 巨捕蝇草 Giant Flytrap

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊） 60尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet

Hungry Flurry.name: 饥饿猛击 Hungry Flurry
Hungry Flurry.description: 巨捕蝇草针对不同目标以-2减值进行四次叶荚打击。这些攻击计算巨捕蝇草的多重攻击减值，但是在攻击结束之后才会生效。

Quick Capture.name: 快速捕获 Quick Capture
Quick Capture.description:
触发 一个生物命中或触碰捕蝇草。

效果 捕蝇草对触发此能力的生物进行一次叶荚打击，如果命中，则该生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于叶荚。

Focused Assault.name: 集中攻击 Focused Assault
Focused Assault.description: 巨捕蝇草用四对叶荚攻击同一目标。巨捕蝇草进行一次叶荚打击。一旦成功命中，巨捕蝇草造成一次叶荚打击的伤害，并且除了第一对叶荚外，每多一个叶荚就能造成额外[[/r {1d8}]]伤害。即使攻击失败，巨捕蝇草仍然能造成一次叶荚伤害，但是它不能使用精通擒获能力。大失败则不造成伤害。此能力计算巨捕蝇草的多重攻击减值，次数等于巨捕蝇草的叶荚数。

Giant Flytrap.publicNotes:
巨捕蝇草能很好地融入周围的树林中，它们可以快速打击毫无戒心的冒险者和森林域行者，给他们带来“惊喜”。

捕蝇草能捕食巨大的昆虫、类人生物和其他大型猎物。

Leopard.name: 花豹 Leopard
Leopard.publicNotes:
花豹是大型猫科动物中体型较小的一种，但与它们缠斗仍然很危险。花豹的数据也可以用于黑豹，白斑雪豹，或黄褐色的美洲狮。

自然界中很少有掠食者能与猫的潜行能力相匹敌。大型猫科动物分部于任何环境，它们通常会与居住地保持距离。当文明人侵入大型猫科动物的猎场时，这些动物往往会不顾一切地对粗心的旅行者进行攻击。

Maul.name: 撕咬 Maul
Maul.description: 花豹对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于它生物进行两次利爪打击。这两次打击都计入它的多重攻击减值，但在两次打击完成后才生效。

Pounce.name: 猛扑 Pounce
Pounce.description: 花豹行走，在行动结束后衔接1次打击。如果花豹在执行此行动前处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]状态，则它保持藏匿直到该次打击结束。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 花豹对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]的生物造成额外1d4精准伤害。

Capturing Grab.description: 该能力作用机制类似@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]，除了正常效果外，成功时巨螳螂还能将生物拉至相邻方格，然后对该生物进行一次虫颚打击。这个额外效果再巨螳螂维持擒获时不生效。
Capturing Grab.name: 捕获 Capturing Grab

Lunging Strike.name: 扑击 Lunging Strike
Lunging Strike.description: 巨螳螂攻击时向前伸展自己的前肢，进行一次触及增长到20尺的镰腿打击。如果命中，即便该生物在它通常的触及范围之外，巨螳螂也能够在打击之后能使用捕获能力。

Sudden Strike.name: 突袭 Sudden Strike
Sudden Strike.description: 在战斗第一轮，尚未行动的敌人对巨螳螂@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

Giant Mantis.name: 巨螳螂 Giant Mantis
Giant Mantis.publicNotes:
这些普通螳螂的巨大祷螳螂站起来比一般的人类还要高。

这些体型巨大的可怕昆虫是寂静无声的掠食者，前肢如闪电般敏捷，一咬就能把骨头啃断。

Abandon Armor.name: Abandon Armor
Abandon Armor.description: Once the adamantine dragon is reduced to fewer than half their Hit Points, their resistance is reduced by 10 and they gain a +10 circumstance bonus to their Speeds.

Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The dragon Grabs a creature

Effect The dragon uses Swallow Whole.
Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow

Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: The dragon can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. They can leave a tunnel if they desire, and they usually don’t.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Resilient Form.name: Resilient Form
Resilient Form.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a weapon or unarmed attack;

Effect The dragon's tough scales ward off deadly attacks. The dragon attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:17]. On a success, the triggering attack becomes a normal hit.

Adamantine Body.name: Adamantine Body
Adamantine Body.description: The dragon’s unarmed melee Strikes are adamantine.

Avalanche Breath.name: Avalanche Breath
Avalanche Breath.description:
The dragon belches a mass of boulders that deals @Damage[15d8[bludgeoning]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save).

They can't use Avalanche Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge use Avalanche Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Burrowing Pounce.name: Burrowing Pounce
Burrowing Pounce.description:
Requirements The dragon is burrowed

Effect The dragon Burrows, then Leaps out of the ground, landing at a point within 25 feet. The dragon makes a melee Strike against a creature within reach when they land. If the Strike is a critical hit, the target is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Avalanche Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Adamantine Dragon (Ancient).name: Adamantine Dragon (Ancient)
Adamantine Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
The powerful adamantine dragons are one of several dragons known as skymetal dragons. The innate magic that flows through these dragons causes them to draw particular metals to their bodies like magnets or, in some cases, naturally grow these skymetals on their bodies. Adamantine dragons begin their lives with tough scales that are naturally replaced with thicker and even tougher adamantine plating as they grow older. Adamantine dragons are typically steadfast and loyal. Once they commit to a certain purpose, changing their minds is nigh impossible.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Adamantine Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs primal

Ultrasonic Blast.name: 超音爆 Ultrasonic Blast
Ultrasonic Blast.description:
巨兽像用其象鼻发出一道@Template[type:line|distance:150]的超巨大音爆，造成@Damage[12d10[sonic]]伤害。音波的频率高到让类人生物完全无法感知，但它造成的伤害显而易见。区域内每个生物必须尝试一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:40|traits:damaging-effect]豁免。

巨兽像不能在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Ultrasonic Blast]]{1d4轮}内再次使超音爆。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物受到一半伤害且陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

失败 生物受到完整伤害且陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}。

大失败 生物受到双倍伤害且陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3}。

Flawless Hearing.name: 完美听觉 Flawless Hearing
Flawless Hearing.description: 巨兽像拥有难以置信的听觉。它能够如同距离声源只有5尺远听到1000尺内发出的任何声音，以及如同距离声源只有30尺远听到1英里内的发出的任何声音。巨兽像的听觉是一种精确感官。

Roll.name: 滚动 Roll
Roll.description: 巨兽像卷起头，滚动成一个装甲球。当滚动时，巨兽像具有AC 44， 强韧 +37， 反射 +29， 意志 +33， 且 速度 100 尺，但它不能使用象鼻打击或超音爆。它在滚动时可以使用足踏打击，但只能作为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]的一部分。巨兽像可以再次使用该动作来解除滚动恢复其站立姿态。

Aolaz.name: 巨兽像 Aolaz
Aolaz.publicNotes:
巨兽像是用石头和金属制成的巨大野兽，以魔法为其灌注了生命本质。它们的创造方法是个遗失已久的秘密，而它们也如此罕见让学者也没有机会去研究活动的样本。最为世人所知的巨兽像都是博物馆中的残片和被摧毁或是在许久之前便已停止活动的战场遗迹，虽然残存的记录表明有更多的巨兽像被制造出来过并仍可能留存，尚待出土。

巨大多数巨兽像都以巨型陆生野兽的形态建成，例如大象，犀牛或恐龙。不管是什么类型的生物，巨兽像都有着相似的构造，它不需要像模仿的动物那样行走在地面上——它被注入了可以踏水甚至飞行的魔法能力。只有极少数人能在激怒巨兽像后逃脱。

Glow.name: 发光 Glow
Glow.description:
20尺

鬼火本身是隐形的，但是它闪烁着彩色的光芒，这能给灵光范围内带来明亮光照，并让鬼火变得可见。

Feed on Fear.name: 吞食恐惧 Feed on Fear
Feed on Fear.description:
频率 每轮一次

需求 鬼火15尺内的一个敌人受到恐惧效果影响或陷入濒死。

效果 鬼火以生物的恐惧为食。它恢复@Damage[2d4[healing]]生命值，并且如果它已经变暗（Gone Dark），则会重新让自己发光。

Go Dark.name: 变暗 Go Dark
Go Dark.description: 鬼火能压制自己的光芒，让自己变得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]。它可以再次使用此动作来结束此效果。如果它在隐形时进行放电打击，则电弧光芒会暴露自身所在的位置，对所有能看见它的生物而言，它此时只具备@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]状态，直到它再次移动。

Will-o'-Wisp.name: 鬼火 Will-o'-Wisp
Will-o'-Wisp.publicNotes:
鬼火是一团邪恶的彩色光球，出没于偏僻的沼泽和森林，在那里引诱毫无戒心的旅行者陷入危险。鬼火可以让自身的光芒发出变化，模仿晃动的灯光或摇曳的火苗，把迷路或失去方向的旅行者从安全的小径上引开。它们可以让自己的光芒完全熄灭，变得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]。一旦它们的猎物完全迷失了方向，并意识到原处飘来飘去的光芒实际并没有把他们带向安全之所，鬼火就会乐在其中。当然，即使是在隐形状态下，鬼火也很少会远离它们的目标，因为它要尽情地享受受害者的恐惧和惊慌。

在发光的状态下，鬼火的身躯是一轮模糊的球体，直径约1英尺，重量不到5磅。虽然大多数鬼火仅仅是半透明的、无特征的球体，只有在它们发出的变换的光芒中才清晰可见，但有少数鬼火有暗斑，当近距离观察时，其形状就如同骷髅头一样。它们不需要通常意义上的食物，也不具备消化能力；它们以附近生物的恐惧为食。因此，它们喜欢和能让受害者感到恐惧的不死生物一起行动。鬼火虽然并非不朽，但是很长寿，并且记性很好。尽管和这种邪恶的怪物进行合作是一件困难的事情，但一个被威吓或被击败的鬼火往往可以提供很多知识和信息。

鬼火栖息在荒凉的沼泽和森林中，通常活跃于在黄昏和夜幕降临之后。它们不会把受害者带往陷阱之类的死地，而是更愿意把受害者带到能长期遭受痛苦折磨的地方，例如弥漫着毒气的地方、遍布流沙的地方或大型怪物出没的巢穴里。根据对鬼火的研究，它们对不同种类的恐惧在味道上能品尝出细微的差别。那些慢慢意识到自己陷入迷途的人心里滋长的恐惧，和那些面对巨大怪物突然来袭的人所受到的猛然惊吓截然不同。正因为如此，它们喜欢用不同方式来引发猎物的恐惧，以确保自己不会吃腻。

Crawling Hand.publicNotes:
伏行之手是来自中型生物的手掌，它们快速而灵巧，在阴影中快速移动，然后突袭猎物。

一般来说，当被切断的手被死灵能量赋予了模糊的感知能力，并被转化成成不知疲倦的杀手时，伏行之手就诞生了。当然，当一个生物在一个充满死灵能量或与虚能产生联系的地方失去了自己的手掌时，伏行之手也可能会自发复诞。
Crawling Hand.name: 伏行之手 Crawling Hand

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊）30尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet

Mark Quarry.name: 标记猎物 Mark Quarry
Mark Quarry.description: 在伏行之手上涂上一滴指定目标的血液可以让伏行之手追踪指定猎物。若伏行之手当前没有猎物，那么下个被他伤害的生物会自动成为他的猎物。伏行之手在@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]猎物时的察觉检定，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]猎物时的生存检定，打击猎物时的伤害掷骰上获得+1环境加值。

Throat Grab.name: 咽喉擒获 Throat Grab
Throat Grab.description:
此能力作用与擒获相同，但伏行之手能抓住中型或更小体型生物的喉咙。被此法@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]的生物难以开口说话，在执行任何需要说话的动作（包括施法）时必须花费额外一个动作。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Grab]

Flame Drake.name: Flame Drake
Flame Drake.publicNotes:
Flame drakes dwell near volcanoes and magma, but it's not unheard of for one to drift into nearby areas like forests or wooded hills. Their scales are usually some shade of red, occasionally fading to smoky blacks and grays along the edges of their wings and the tips of their tails.

Rampages of flame drakes often grudgingly live alongside clans of fire giants, rather than be forced from their volcanic homes.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct, drakes are draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of the primal dragons they share evolutionary roots with. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties—small social groups fittingly called "rampages"—makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them with their formidable jaws and thickscaled tails to use in close combat. Most drakes would rather avoid this, however, preferring to use their magical breath to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

Different species of drakes rarely come into conflict. Part of this is their distinct habitats, but drakes are open to negotiating simple agreements between rampages. This courtesy does not extend to dragonets, which drakes happily take as prey. Solitary tamed drakes are also excluded from such agreements and considered free game if their tamer isn't strong enough to protect them.

Drake Eggs

While drake hides aren't any more valuable than those of similarly sized creatures, drake eggs are prized commodities. They are used as components in powerful spells as well as eaten by various cultures, but the most common use for drake eggs is hatching and rearing drakes to serve as mounts and guardians.

A typical drake lays a clutch of 2d4 eggs every 5 years. Eggs hatch within 3 to 6 weeks, during which time they must be kept in conditions appropriate to their natural environment, perhaps the most difficult aspect of drake husbandry. While it is generally easy for breeders to incubate the eggs of desert or jungle drakes (which require mildly warm temperatures to hatch) or river drakes (which must be submerged in running water), the eggs of flame and frost drakes require extreme temperatures in order to hatch, which can be difficult to replicate safely.

A drake egg is an object with Hardness 3, 5 HP, and no Broken Threshold. The coloration of drake eggs varies only slightly from one species to the next. A creature must succeed at a @Check[type:nature|dc:20] check, or a relevant DC 20 Lore check, to identify the drake species of a specific egg.

Once a drake hatches, they imprint on the first creature that they see. A creature imprinted on in this way can use Nature to Train and Command that drake. The market price of a drake egg varies depending on the type of drake and the exact legal situation. Because drakes are dangerous and intelligent creatures, many societies do not condone the trade of drake eggs and criminalize those who engage in it.

It takes 2 years for a drake hatchling to grow to full size. A well-trained drake can make a fearsome mount or guardian, but many careless would-be drake trainers are devoured by their charges.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a flame drake's vision; they ignore @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} from smoke.

Draconic Frenzy.description: The flame drake makes two Fangs Strikes and one Tail Strike in any order.
Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy

Fireball Breath.name: Fireball Breath
Fireball Breath.description:
The flame drake expels a ball of flame to a range of 180 feet that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20]. Creatures in the burst take @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true] save).

The flame drake can't use Fireball Breath again for [[/br 1d6 #Recharge Fireball Breath]]{1d6 rounds}.

Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
Speed Surge.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The flame drake Strides or Flies twice.

Kholo Hunter.name: Kholo Hunter
Kholo Hunter.publicNotes:
Kholo are tall, hyena-headed humanoids who dwell in savannas, warm grasslands, and arid hills. Given their appearance, their affinity for hyenas should not be surprising; kholos share their homes, food, and even many of their behaviors with these animals. Much like hyenas, kholos have a notorious reputation, for much the same reason—their uncanny laughter, frightening intelligence, and efficient pack tactics make them intimidating competition or foes. Kholos are keen to lean into these rumors, using them as a form of psychological warfare against their enemies.

Also like hyenas, kholos prefer to hunt in packs, and are exceptionally skilled at setting up ambushes or separating individual targets from larger groups. As kholo packs value all their members highly, any tactic that gives them an advantage in dangerous situations is seen as virtuous, while chivalry and honor are derided as pointlessly risky. It's a philosophy borne from a deep respect and love for their kholo brethren, but to most other people, it makes kholos terrible neighbors.

Kholos willingly eat nearly any other creature, including dead kholos, which can evoke strong reactions from people and cultures with a taboo against cannibalism or desecrating the dead. To a kholo, it's often more offensive to not eat a dead body, no matter its origin; kholos see no point in wasting precious meat in a harsh and challenging world. Worse still is the refusal to eat the flesh of a dead kholo, which they consider an insult to that kholo's memory and an implication that their flesh is unworthy of consumption. Eating the flesh of honored enemies is, for kholos, a respectful ritual, allowing that being to live on within the pack instead of rotting like trash on the ground.

Kholo women are often larger and stronger than kholo men and are typically considered the leaders of their hunting packs and clans.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: A kholo hunter deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the kholo hunter's allies.

Rugged Travel.name: Rugged Travel
Rugged Travel.description: A kholo ignores the first square of difficult terrain they move into each time they Step or Stride.

Sedacthy Scout.name: Sedacthy Scout
Sedacthy Scout.publicNotes:
Scouts, usually young sedacthies, ply the ocean in search of animal servants or tread ashore to hunt. Scouts hunting on the surface press crocodiles and snakes into service, while those underwater prefer electric eels and hippocampi.

Sedacthies are amphibious, fish-like humanoids who lurk in Golarion's oceans and are known for leading their animal servants ashore to devour air breathers. When an entire fishing village disappears overnight, sedacthies are the first suspects. Sedacthies pride themselves as natural leaders, with ambition limited only by their strict adherence to hierarchy. A sedacthy's station is determined by the strength of the animal servants they press into service, and the mettle they prove during hunts and in battles against outsiders.

Sea Speech.name: Sea Speech
Sea Speech.description: A sedacthy speaking Thalassic can be understood by any animal that has a swim Speed or the amphibious or aquatic trait. By spending a week regularly interacting with such an animal, the sedacthy can make it permanently helpful.

Shared Feast.name: Shared Feast
Shared Feast.description: The sedacthy makes a jaws Strike. If it hits, an ally of their choice can spend a reaction to make a jaws Strike against the same target. Allies with beaks or similar attacks can use those instead of jaws.

Wriggling Rush.description:
Frequency once per round;

Effect The scout takes a Stride action and a Swim action, in either order. They ignore difficult terrain from mud, quicksand, and similar terrain during this movement.
Wriggling Rush.name: Wriggling Rush

Pack Attack.name: 群起攻之 Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: 犬的打击目标如果位于至少两个盟友的触及范围内，则造成额外1d4伤害。

Guard Dog.name: 看门犬 Guard Dog
Guard Dog.publicNotes:
看门犬很忠诚，并且受到很多社群的喜爱。它们通常被当作宠物，同时也是优秀的保护者和追踪者，在保护心爱的主人和其家庭成员时无所畏惧。下面的数据适用于任何不同种类的从20到50磅的狗。野狗也可以使用这些数据，但它们野蛮的天性使它们更加不可预测和具有威胁性。和他们的野生表亲（译注：可能这里说的是狼）不同的是，野狗可能更加危险，因为它们通常缺乏对人类本能的恐惧，而这种恐惧让一般的野生动物不会轻易和人接触。

它们通过气味探测猎物或掠食者的能力以及它们喜欢和人形生物作伴的习性，使它们成为大多数冒险家的理想宠物。世界上有数百种狗，从粘人的小型观赏犬到肩高接近4尺的肌肉发达的大型犬，几乎在有人居住的任何地方都有它们的身影。体型较大的犬种甚至可以作为小体型冒险者的坐骑，在一些文化中，犬类可以作为驮畜，拉着满载物资的雪橇穿越冰原。无论如何，许多冒险家认为养狗是一件很值得的事情。

Vengeful Anger.description: As long as it isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, a mitflit gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.
Vengeful Anger.name: Vengeful Anger

Self-Loathing.name: Self-Loathing
Self-Loathing.description: A mitflit's self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a -4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}.

Mitflit.name: Mitflit
Mitflit.publicNotes:
Mitflits are self-loathing and pitiful cowards, easily bullied into servitude by other creatures or even slightly more powerful mitflit leaders. They tame insects, spiders, and other small vermin to serve as faithful allies. Mitflits have lost most of their ancestral magic, leaving them to feel incomplete and full of doubt and insecurity. Mitflits find companionship in the other base creatures of the world, and forge strong bonds of friendship with vermin, the only other beings that seem willing to accept them. A social structure, even one in which they are bullied, partially fills the hole within most mitflits' personalities, and they rarely rebel or last out unless their rage hits a breaking point.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life in the Universe, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. Nearly all gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the slightest, carefully targeted nudge from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom stronger gremlins derisively call "baggies."

Nightmare.name: 梦魇 Nightmare
Nightmare.publicNotes: 梦魇是一种浑身燃烧着的马，预兆着死亡。

Smoke.name: 喷烟 Smoke
Smoke.description:
15尺

梦魇不断喷出黑烟。灵光内的生物将对外部视作@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]，而灵光外部的生物对内部的生物也视作隐蔽。梦魇和它的骑手可以看穿这片烟雾。

在区域内开始回合的生物必须成功通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:23|traits:inhaled,poison]豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}。其随后对因该烟雾陷入恶心临时免疫1分钟。这是一种吸入性毒素，梦魇和它的骑手对其免疫。

Flaming Gallop.name: 烈焰飞驰 Flaming Gallop
Flaming Gallop.description: 梦魇以至多其三倍速度行走或飞行。它的蹄子迸发出猛烈的火焰，对驰骋过程中所有相邻的生物（骑手除外）造成@Damage[3d6[fire]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true]豁免）。在一次烈焰飞驰期间，每个生物只会被影响一次。

Stegosaurus.publicNotes:
剑龙很容易被认出来，因为它的脊骨上有两排菱形的背板，厚实的尾巴上有两对尖刺。这种奇怪的结构保护了这种食草动物不受捕食者的伤害，因为剑龙可以伏下身子，用它的背板阻挡攻击者并保护它们厚实的身体。

尽管剑龙体型更大，但通常比甲龙更温顺、和平。这两种特性的结合使它容易成为训练有素的宠物或守卫。但即便如此，也不应随意惹恼剑龙——恼怒的剑龙可以毫无预警地用尾巴进行猛烈攻击。

这些巨大的爬行动物是世界原始时代的遗留物，现在仍然大量存在于偏僻的荒野中，或者在幽暗地域的地下魔法洞穴中。蜥蜴人、半兽人、巨人和其他人形生物有时会把恐龙当作坐骑、守卫或猎兽。众所周知，人类和其他族裔也收集恐龙，把它们放在动物园里展出，或把它们当作异域宠物或守卫。这通常是富人或怪咖喜欢干的事情，但确实也有一些德鲁伊和其他自然的守护者能与恐龙亲密相处，甚至把它们作为动物伙伴。当恐龙在它们正常栖息地以外的地区安家时，通常可能是因为被圈养的恐龙逃进荒野造成的。

Dorsal Deflection.name: 背骨偏斜 Dorsal Deflection
Dorsal Deflection.description:
触发 剑龙被当做近战攻击目标

效果 剑龙善于用自己背上的骨板御敌。剑龙对触发此能力的攻击，AC获得+2环境加值，并且在攻击结束后可以进行一次快步。

Stegosaurus.name: 剑龙 Stegosaurus

Fortune Dragon (Young).name: Fortune Dragon (Young)

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Capture Spell.description:
Trigger The dragon succeeds or critically succeeds on a saving throw against a spell

Effect The dragon attempts to capture a portion of the spell's magic to feed themself. They attempt to counteract the spell (counteract rank 5, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+20 #Counteract]]{+20}). If successful, the dragon is unaffected by the spell and regains one expended spontaneous spell slot; other subjects are affected by the spell normally.
Capture Spell.name: Capture Spell

Disruptive Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a spray of magic-disrupting energies that deals @Damage[9d6[force]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true] save). Creatures that fail become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.

The dragon can't use Disruptive Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Disruptive Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Disruptive Breath.name: Disruptive Breath

Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.
Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy

Draconic Momentum.description: Whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike, the dragon chooses to either recharge Disruptive Breath or regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.
Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum

Share the Wealth.name: Share the Wealth
Share the Wealth.description:
Requirements The dragon's body is covered in riches (this is typically the case when the dragon is first encountered)

Effect The dragon shakes their body aggressively, sending coins and other riches flying in every direction, dealing @Damage[6d10[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. The dragon's body is then no longer covered in riches.

Treasure Dive.name: Treasure Dive
Treasure Dive.description:
Requirements The dragon's body isn't covered in riches and the dragon is adjacent to their hoard

Effect The dragon Strides or Burrows through their hoard using their land Speed. They coat themself in coins, magic items, and other treasures. This contact with magical items revitalizes the dragon, causing them to regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

The dragon can move through other creatures while moving in this way. Creatures in the dragon's path, or above it if the dragon Burrows, must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:27] save or be pushed 10 feet (or pushed 20 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure).

Fortune Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Fortune dragons have the innate ability to draw upon the raw magical energies that surround them. They constantly use these magical energies to empower their magical abilities and even their bodies, as the energy can heal wounds. A fortune dragon has a typical build for an arcane dragon, but their bodies sport a striking feature: their treasure. The dragon's nature of drawing upon magic causes coins, gems, and, most notably, magical items to cling to their body like iron drawn to magnets. A dragon constantly pulls magical energies from the items attached to their body and makes use of these energies to cast spells. The magical energies that flow through a fortune dragon constantly flow through the dragon's items as well, and in many cases, the items melt from the heat produced in this process. Fortune dragons are seekers of novel experiences. This desire for originality leads fortune dragons to approach visitors of other ancestries with curiosity, though this initial interest quickly wanes if a visitor lacks exciting qualities.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Fortune Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Vordine.publicNotes:
The vast city of Dis trains endless legions of vordines to guard the upper layers of Hell and march across the planes at the archdevils' orders. Although quick to bend their knees to higher-ranking devils and even mortals favored by Asmodeus, vordines are relentlessly cruel to orts and other devils they can call their subordinates.

Although higher ranks in the infernal military are held by more powerful devils, like the nessari who serve as generals, a labyrinthine structure gives each vordine a rank and certain responsibilities. Some vordines are responsible for the battlefield command of squads, while others relay orders from above or are set to handling specific administrative tasks for their unit. The greatest gift one can offer a vordine is an increased rank to lord over other vordines.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks.

Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly orts perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as infantry and contract devils, while the greatest nessaris command entire infernal armies.

Asmodeus stands at the apex of the structure he created, but the layers below him are marked by a constant jockeying for position. Most diabolic plans ultimately serve to improve the schemer's place in the hierarchy.

Burning Hoofprints.name: Burning Hoofprints
Burning Hoofprints.description: The vordine Strides, trailing hoofprints in each square they exit. The hoofprints burn for 1 minute. A creature on the ground that enters a square with burning hoofprints or begins its turn in one takes @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage.

Trident of Dis.name: Trident of Dis
Trident of Dis.description: The vordine makes a trident Strike, increasing their reach to 10 feet for that Strike. If there is an unholy ally between the vordine and their target, that creature's energy causes the Strike to deal an additional @Damage[1d6[spirit]] damage.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Vordine.name: Vordine
Vordine.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Dero Magister.publicNotes:
Dero magisters are leaders among dero society. They perform the bulk of the cruel operations and memory-altering procedures inflicted upon their victims.

Deros are short, wiry humanoids with milky white eyes, gray-blue skin, and wild shocks of off-white or gray hair. The descendants of a mysterious type of fey abandoned in the deepest, darkest caverns of Golarion, deros are the subject of fearful legends and folk tales to most of the world's surface races. They skulk beneath major metropolitan areas, performing cruel and twisted experiments on unwilling subjects.

Deros, particularly the leading magisters, are fixated with curing their allergy to sunlight. To understand how the surface dwellers can withstand the light of the sun, deros conduct late-night raids on surface cities, abducting victims and performing terrible experiments on them. Those who survive are often returned with much of their memory erased and their bodies bearing mysterious scars.

The largest dero settlements are built around esoteric machines of floating crystals. As these crystals grind against each other and hum with sickening blue energy, crystal flakes and powdery residue collect beneath the machinery. Dero magisters gather these products, creating tools and repurposing the crystals to power magical items.

Vulnerable to Sunlight.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight
Vulnerable to Sunlight.description: A dero magister takes [[/r {10}]]{10 damage} for every hour they're exposed to sunlight.

Cytillesh Stare.name: Cytillesh Stare
Cytillesh Stare.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The magister focuses their gaze on a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round and must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:24] saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Dero Medicine.name: Dero Medicine
Dero Medicine.description:
Requirements The dero is wearing a cytillesh toolkit and has a hand free

Effect The dero excises damaged flesh and crudely stitches wounds shut, healing themself or an ally in reach for @Damage[(2d8+10)[healing]]{2d8+10 Hit Points}. For 1 hour, the target has slashing weakness 2 and is immune to Dero Medicine.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.vqKBIflXiAmCx5QQ]{Effect: Dero Medicine}

Dero Magister.name: Dero Magister

Ankhrav Hive Mother.name: 掘地虫巢母 Ankhrav Hive Mother
Ankhrav Hive Mother.publicNotes:
掘地虫巢母是一种可怕的掠食者，人们可以很容易地将其与普通的掘地虫区分开来，不仅因为它们更大的体型，还因为它们有一对锋利的、象螳螂一样的巨大前肢。

掘地虫是巨大的、穴居的节肢类捕食者，在乡村地区常被当地居民当做一种常见的天灾。

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 90 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊）90 尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 90 feet

Armor-Rending Bite.name: 裂甲噬咬 Armor-Rending Bite
Armor-Rending Bite.description: 巢母进行1次虫颚打击，一旦打击命中，可以对目标的护甲造成酸蚀伤害，并且该酸蚀伤害无视目标护甲的硬度。

Frenzy Pheromone.name: 狂暴信息素 Frenzy Pheromone
Frenzy Pheromone.description:
巢母释放一种信息素，使得@Template[type:emanation|distance:100]范围内其他掘地虫获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened 1}效果，持续到巢母下轮行动开始为止。该额外动作仅仅可以用来掘进、移动、或打击。

巢母在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Frenzy Pheromone]]{1d4轮}内无法再次释放信息素。

Spray Acid.name: 喷射酸液 Spray Acid
Spray Acid.description:
巢母对@Template[type:cone|distance:60]范围喷射酸蚀，造成@Damage[8d6[acid],1d6[persistent,acid]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true]豁免）。

巢母在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Spray Acid]]{1d4轮}内无法再次喷射酸液。

String Slime.publicNotes:
在地下或地城中，这些不断抽动的、宛如蛞蝓一般的长型粘怪在自己的领地中不断四处搜寻着食物。除了形状以外，它们名称还来源于可以射出宛如缠结线绳一般不断延伸的粘液线的能力。

阴湿的地下城与阴影遮蔽的树林中生活着胶质怪、黏菌、以及其他泥怪。尽管这些生物可能并无恶意，但部分泥怪能长成硕大的身躯并具有无法满足的食欲。

Split.name: 分裂 Split
Split.description: 每当缠线粘怪要承受挥砍伤害（假定它并不对此免疫）并且至少具有10点HP时，它会分裂为两个完全一致的粘怪，其HP为原来的一半。其中一个缠线粘怪与原先的粘怪占据相同的空间，另一个则出现在相邻的无主空间内。若相邻空间均被占用，则按照GM的判定来移动较小的生物和物体来给粘怪腾出空间、或者取消此次分裂。

Tag Team.name: 团队触杀 Tag Team
Tag Team.description:
需求 30尺射程内有另一个缠线粘怪

效果 粘怪向着其他缠线粘怪射出一道原生质。在这条线上的生物承受@Damage[3d6[acid]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:16|basic:true]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

Weak Acid.name: 弱酸性 Weak Acid
Weak Acid.description: 缠线粘怪的酸蚀伤害只能作用于有机物——不会作用于金属、石材或者其他无机物。.

Motion Sense.name: 感知运动 Motion Sense
Motion Sense.description: 缠线粘怪能通过震动以及气流来感受周遭事物的运动。

String Slime.name: 缠线粘怪 String Slime

Elemental Tsunami.name: 元素海啸 Elemental Tsunami
Elemental Tsunami.publicNotes:
元素海啸是超大型且具有毁灭性的元素，丝毫未体现出水具有的滋养和关怀的一面。

水元素可能具有非凡的破坏力，但这往往并非出于本心；就像水可以给主物质位面带来生命一样，它的波浪可以冲击海岸，雨水也能淹没城市。水元素同样如此难以捉摸。

Waterbound.name: 受缚于水 Waterbound
Waterbound.description: 当元素海啸没有接触到水时，它会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}并无法使用反应动作。

Vortex.name: 涡流 Vortex
Vortex.description:
50尺。

灵光范围内的，且与元素海啸位于同一水体内的水，对于正在游泳且没有水特征的生物来说，视为困难地形。

Drench.name: 浸湿 Drench
Drench.description:
元素尝试浇灭@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]范围内的所有火焰。

它能自动熄灭所有非魔法火焰，并且尝试反制魔法火焰（反制调整值[[/r 1d20+20 #Drench]]{+20}）。

Surge.name: 浪涌 Surge
Surge.description:
元素海啸迅速扩张其占据空间填满涡流的范围。任何位于涡流弥散范围内的生物都会受到@Damage[(5d12+6)[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:31|basic:true]豁免）。豁免失败的生物被推离20尺。

之后元素海啸缩回它原来所占据的空间。元素海啸在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Surge]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用浪涌能力。.

Push or Pull 10 feet.name: 推离或拉拽10尺 Push or Pull 10 feet
Push or Pull 10 feet.description:
在成功击中生物时，元素海啸可以选择推离或拉曳该生物。

推离1

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Push]

拉拽1

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Pull]

Soulbound Doll (Rash).name: 缚魂娃娃（鲁莽） Soulbound Doll (Rash)
Soulbound Doll (Rash).publicNotes:
缚魂娃娃是怪诞的人体模型或娃娃，被灌注了一小片已故凡人的灵魂。这些小小的构装体是由于各种各样的原因被创造出来的——比如说作为同伴或仆人——但是他们的自由意志意味着它们对于他们的创造者并非必然服从。法莱斯玛的信徒常常憎恶缚魂娃娃，认为这是对灵魂自然循环的扭曲，而墓穴女士的崇拜者乐意看到缚魂娃娃的破灭，而不考虑其行为，会将覆灭缚魂偶作为对伟大彼岸的重要服务。

在一系列缚魂构装体中，缚魂娃娃的制造是最简单的，这些构装体包括人形的缚魂人偶，强大的缚魂躯壳，和作为卫兵的缚魂兵马俑。用非自愿的活物创造娃娃是残忍的，非自愿的供体可以抵抗这个过程，通过一次意志检定来对抗创造者的手艺 DC，如果不能阻止灵魂供体的死亡，则会毁掉娃娃。如果某人生前同意使用，也可以用其灵魂制作娃娃。

冒险者遇到的缚魂娃娃通常都是某种守卫；尽管娃娃体型娇小，但灵魂碎片的力量让娃娃的拳头比旁人想象的更加危险。此外，鉴于娃娃的身材，灵魂碎片还能赋予娃娃一个威力巨大的法术。由于具有自主性和非凡的智慧，缚魂娃娃偶尔会被它们的制作者用作强大得多但无意识的构装体的管理者，使这些娃娃能够控制远远超出其自身能力的防御系统。

虽然缚魂娃娃包包含一名刚死不久的人的一小部分灵魂，但其实这不影响死者复活，或直接前往来世。这种灵魂提取的过程对活着的灵魂供体来说则是致命的。

灵魂碎片通常会注入一个镶嵌在娃娃胸部或脖子的灵魂聚焦宝石（硬度10）。灵魂碎片一般会保留原灵魂的强烈个性特征，但娃娃会从初始状态开始不断学习，这意味着它的性格和能力可以改变，可能会变得更像灵魂供体，也可能在自己的道路上越走越远。即使缚魂娃娃被摧毁，它的灵魂聚焦宝石也能保留娃娃的记忆。如果被摧毁的缚魂娃娃的灵魂聚焦宝石是完好的，那么它可以被一些精于缚魂操作的人重新放置到一个新娃娃的身体里，通过这种方法可以很有效的让缚魂娃娃重生。

Personality Fragments.name: 人格碎片 Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: 缚魂娃娃拥有一部分灵魂提供者的人格碎片，尽管它没有任何生前的记忆。这使得缚魂娃娃与供体灵魂的强烈个性特征相匹配。由于它的灵魂碎片，因此缚魂娃娃拥有无法像大多数构装体一样对精魂免疫。

Sphinx.publicNotes:
Sphinxes are mystical beings with the body of a lion, the wings of a great bird, and the upper torso and head of a human. They are often maligned in legends as nothing more than monsters, and though they are quick to anger and are capable of exacting deadly retribution for perceived slights, they are also very intelligent.

Sphinxes are often associated with desert regions, but they can dwell in more moderate climates as well. They form small groups consisting of a single, extended family that hunts and works together to protect and teach their young. As they mature, sphinxes develop a wanderlust, a drive to gather hidden lore and solve the world's greatest riddles-the trait that is perhaps most often identified with their kind.

While sometimes bound into service as guardians for powerful spellcasters, lone sphinxes may also be encountered on journeys of discovery and as purveyors of esoteric lore. If treated with the proper respect-and fed well-a sphinx can demonstrate a willingness to exchange information. Their favorite currency is, of course, riddles and secrets. One who can trade knowledge for knowledge has a much better chance of succeeding while bargaining with a sphinx. However, a sphinx's insatiable thirst for new riddles as well their extensive collection of secrets accumulated over hundreds of years of life-makes it difficult to offer them something they don't already know. Those who attempt to trade petty insight and stale riddles may invoke a sphinx's ire and will not live long enough to regret it.

Bardic Lore.description: Sphinxes are naturally curious, and their love of puzzles and mysteries leads them to gather information on a broad range of topics. Sphinxes have Bardic Lore, a special Lore skill that can be used only to Recall Knowledge, but on any topic.
Bardic Lore.name: Bardic Lore

Claw Rake.name: Claw Rake
Claw Rake.description: The sphinx rears back on their hind legs and makes two claw Strikes at the same target, using the same attack bonus as their highest melee attack. If both attacks deal damage, the target takes extra damage equal to one claw Strike.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The sphinx Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the sphinx began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, they remain hidden until after the attack.

Riddler’s Rune.name: Riddler’s Rune
Riddler’s Rune.description:
Once per week, a Sphinx can create a magical symbol as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o0l57UfBm9ScEUMW]{Rune Trap} ritual. The sphinx usually shapes it to take the form of a written riddle and sets the password to the answer.

A creature that gives the wrong answer or tries to pass without answering must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save or be affected by one of the following spells, chosen by the sphinx when creating the symbol: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.BilnTGuXrof9Dt9D]{Synaptic Pulse} (5th), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} (4th), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear} (4th), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain} (4th), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} (4th). The sphinx learns the identity of any creature that answers the riddle and tends to be friendly to them if they answered correctly.

Sphinx.name: Sphinx

Aesra.name: 艾斯拉 Aesra
Aesra.publicNotes:
尽管他们手执烈焰利刃，生得一圈永不交睫的眼眸，艾斯拉实际是圣使中的和平使者，他们更喜欢通过和解与互惠，而非利刃来伸张正义。尽管如此，当被迫与魔族势力作战时，艾斯拉绝不会在战斗中迟疑，在艾奥梅黛等神圣指挥官的麾下发起攻势。

圣使是天堂（Heaven）的守护者、腐化的敌人。早在诸神与他们的仆人涉足天界位面前，圣使就已作为此地的原住民栖息在那了。打一照面，圣使和神圣天使很快便发现他们是一类人，心中皆怀着正义与公义。联盟由此成立，如今，圣使们是所有天族与他们信赖的凡人们的忠实盟友。

当第一位圣使从宏伟的天堂七层山脉凝聚成形后，他们会选择来到天堂的灵魂中有意愿也有资格的加入他们的行列。这些凡人听到并回应了一个神秘声音的召唤，在山顶的花园（the Garden）中显形。在那里，他们发誓永远为正义事业服务，脱胎换骨成为新的圣使。

虽然圣使们十分在意保卫凡人的生命，并愿意在对抗魔族的战斗中牺牲自我，他们总让人觉得死板又难以捉摸，他们的外观也几乎能称得上骇人且怪异。因此，他们在与凡人或自由奔放的灵使交互时时常遇到困难。尽管如此，圣使从还是能从他人身上汲取强大力量，尤其是那些堪称楷模的贤德之人。

除了他们的天族盟友，圣使还与御衡者维持着古老的联系。时至今日，我们仍能见到个高深莫测的集团一起合作，共同捍卫尘封已久的秘密，执行早在凡人诞生前创立的规则。圣使仅将这些行为解释为必要之举，不做进一步的说明；在这点上，哪怕是圣使的天使盟友也对他们的固执感到沮丧。
Aesra.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Archon's Protection.description:
触发 一个敌人伤害圣使的盟友，且该敌人和该盟友皆距离圣使15尺内

效果 该盟友在对抗触发伤害时获得全部伤害抗力10，圣使可对触发本能力的敌人进行一次打击。
Archon's Protection.name: 圣使护卫 Archon's Protection

Flame of Justice.name: 正义之炎 Flame of Justice
Flame of Justice.description: 一位艾斯拉的正义之魂在他的手中凝聚为一把烈焰铸就的双手巨剑。若该武器被缴械/卸武或作为远程武器投出，正义之炎会在掉到地上或造成伤害后消失，并立即出现于艾斯拉的手中。在重击时，被攻击的目标还会受到@Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]]伤害。
