Maintain Formation.description: 当艾斯拉施展@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]时，他可以携带一个邻接的自愿圣使一同传送。该圣使会出现在与那名艾斯拉新占据空间邻接的空地上。
Maintain Formation.name: 保持阵型 Maintain Formation

Flaming Slash.name: 烈焰挥斩 Flaming Slash
Flaming Slash.description: 艾斯拉横扫剑身，创造出一道@Template[type:cone|distance:15]范围的圣焰，造成@Damage[5d6[fire]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:23|basic:true]豁免。

Fire Giant.name: Fire Giant
Fire Giant.publicNotes:
The most militaristic of giants, fire giants focus obsessively on learning combat techniques, mastering the arts of forging weapons and armor, and finding new ways to dominate their enemies. Most fire giant communities are built around elemental rifts, hot springs, or volcanic calderas and cannot be moved easily, inspiring unwavering defense against any intruders. As a result, their social and political structures are grounded firmly in martial hierarchies, with a strict emphasis on following the orders of one’s superior.

As soon as a fire giant can walk, they are fitted with their first suit of forged armor. This armor is constantly remolded and replaced as the giant matures. Beyond what they can forge in their volcanic furnaces, fire giants also look to tame dinosaurs, drakes, and hell hounds as tools of war.

Fire giants are usually identified by their powerful stature and bright orange hair that flickers and dances as if aflame. A typical fire giant stands about 14 feet tall, weighs around 7,000 pounds, and lives to be 350 years old.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

Flaming Stroke.name: Flaming Stroke
Flaming Stroke.description: The fire giant imbues their blade with flames and makes a greatsword Strike with a –2 circumstance penalty against each creature in a @Template[type:line|distance:15]. They make one attack roll only and compare the result to each creature's AC. This Strike deals an additional 1d6 fire damage and counts as one attack for the fire giant's multiple attack penalty

Elananx.name: Elananx
Elananx.publicNotes:
These strange, fey felines resemble large, broad bobcats from a distance, but a closer view reveals something amiss. Their forms ripple and billow with heat, and their eyes glow from within as if they contained tiny, flickering flames. The pungent scent of rotting leaves smoldering in a bonfire clings to their fur. Yet those who have the chance to watch elananxes hunt or attack prey witness the greatest indication that these creatures are something more than mere predators, for they act with cruel and savvy instincts, reveling in the pain they inflict.

Elananxes typically hunt alone, but sometimes these cunning and malicious hunters of the First World roam in packs called billows to take down large prey. Like many house cats, elananxes are not content to merely track and devour prey, but prefer to toy with their victims, drawing joy from the fear and pain of those they capture. To this end, elananxes rarely use their cinder dispersal ability to evade their targets, instead opting to foil their quarry just before the end of the hunt—though, as selfish creatures who wish to live to hunt again, elananxes often reserve one use of this ability, just in case.

Because of their clever and malicious ways, elananxes are favored as hunting companions by redcaps, who go out of their way to befriend or make deals with these creatures. Redcaps also find great sport in hunts where competing elananxes chase a single creature. Although they're large enough to serve as mounts for redcaps, elananxes despise being ridden and resist such attempts—little is as sure to cause a supposedly friendly elananx to turn on its redcap ally as a foolhardy attempt to treat the fey cat as a horse!

Elananxes have a strange affinity with forest fires. Because they are immune to the damage caused by flickering flames, they enjoy capering and caterwauling through the smoky, burning ruins of forest infernos. Some have even been known to use their burning bites to deliberately light undergrowth on fire, simply so they might experience the beauty of the flames combined with the inevitable pain such disasters inflict on other creatures.

Cinder Dispersal.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The elananx takes damage from a hostile source

Effect The elananx disperses into a cloud of smoke and cinders, filling its space and a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20]. While in this form, the elananx can't be attacked or targeted, and it doesn't take up space. Anything inside this cloud is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and any creature ending its turn there takes @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage. At the start of its turn, the elananx returns to its normal form in any square the cloud covered. If the elananx Strikes a creature using its first action after returning to its normal form, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and the Strike deals an extra @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage.
Cinder Dispersal.name: Cinder Dispersal

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The elananx's Strikes deal an extra 1d6 damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of its allies.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The elananx Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the elananx began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the attack.

Tooth Fairy Swarm.publicNotes:
一群合作的牙仙可以在短短几秒内完成强行拔牙。

当孩子的牙齿（或则，更少见的情况，整个孩子）被埋葬在充盈精类能量的地形中时，牙仙便诞生了。牙仙会如同幼虫从蛋中孵化一样从被埋葬的牙齿中破壳而出，他们会用能找到的一切来制造粗糙的夹钳，然后去狩猎更多的牙齿——不管主人是否愿意。

Plaque Burst.name: 牙斑爆炸 Plaque Burst
Plaque Burst.description: 当被杀死时，牙仙群会爆炸成一堆粘稠，难闻的白色尘埃。@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]范围内的每个生物必须成功通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（大失败时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}）。

Pinch.description: 牙仙们夹住受害者的手指，鼻子，耳朵或类似突出的身体部位。每个位于集群占据空间的敌人受到@Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true]豁免）。此豁免中取得大失败的生物会因痛苦陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。
Pinch.name: 痛夹 Pinch

Pry.name: 撬牙 Pry
Pry.description:
牙仙们试图撬出目标的牙齿。集群占据空间内的一名敌人受到@Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true]豁免）。如果豁免失败，目标受到2持续流血伤害并失去一颗牙齿。

如果生物失去一颗牙齿，他将在基于魅力的技能检定上承受-1状态减值，且在施法时必须成功通过一次@Check[type:flat|dc:5]检定，除非该法术具有晦匿特征。这些效果持续1天，或直到被偷走的牙齿被装回且目标恢复了至少1生命值。

Tooth Fairy Swarm.name: 牙仙群 Tooth Fairy Swarm

Mummy Pharaoh.publicNotes:
While mummy guardians are undead crafted from the corpses of sacrificed—usually unwilling victims—and retain only fragments of their memories, a mummy pharaoh is the result of a deliberate embrace of undeath by a sadistic and cruel ruler. The transformation from life to undeath beneath the scorching desert sand is only somewhat less awful, but as the transition is an intentional bid to escape death by a powerful personality who fully embraces the blasphemous repercussions of the choice, the mummy pharaoh retains its memories and personality intact.

While many cultures practice mummification for benign reasons, undead mummies are created through grueling rituals, typically to provide eternally vigilant guardians. Much more rarely, a body mummified without those special rites can rise again due to its hatred of the living.
Mummy Pharaoh.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. vitality

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

Reactive Strike (Special).description:
The mummy pharaoh can use Reactive Strike when a creature within its reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. It can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and it disrupts actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]
Reactive Strike (Special).name: Reactive Strike (Special)

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a mummy pharaoh is destroyed, necromantic energies rebuild its body in its tomb over [[/br 1d10 #Days to Rejuvenate]]{1d10 days}. If the body is destroyed during that time, the process starts anew. A reforming mummy pharaoh is destroyed permanently if their tomb is consecrated.

Sacred Wrappings.name: Sacred Wrappings
Sacred Wrappings.description:
When a creature deals physical damage to the pharaoh or triggers one of the pharaoh's weaknesses, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Regardless of the results of the save, the creature is then immune to that mummy's sacred wrappings for 24 hours.

Undead Mastery.description:
100 feet.

Commanded or allied undead in the aura that have a lower level than the mummy pharaoh gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, AC, saves, and skill checks.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4M2K16mH4gndHAKa]{Effect: Undead Mastery}
Undead Mastery.name: Undead Mastery

Sandstorm Wrath.name: Sandstorm Wrath
Sandstorm Wrath.description:
The mummy pharaoh exhales a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of superheated sand that deals @Damage[5d6[fire],5d6[slashing]]{5d6 fire and 5d6 slashing damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

The mummy pharaoh can't use Sandstorm Wrath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge use Sandstorm Wrath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Veil of Sand.description:
Sand whirls around the mummy pharaoh in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] until the beginning of their next turn. Creatures inside the sand are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to those outside it and any living creature ending its turn within the sand takes @Damage[4d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|basic:true] save

Veil of Sand ends if the mummy takes damage from their water weakness.
Veil of Sand.name: Veil of Sand

Mummy Pharaoh.name: Mummy Pharaoh

Changeling Exile.publicNotes:
This changeling exile is the child of a cuckoo hag.

As children of hags, perhaps destined to become hags themselves, changelings face a life of conflict. Born of supernatural creatures who usually kill and consume the child's father, changelings are deposited into their father's society to be raised. These offspring appear to be members of their paternal ancestry and have been found among dwarves, gnomes, orcs, goblins, and others, but human-ancestry changelings are by far the most common. Within the normal range for their ancestry, changelings tend toward slighter builds, darker hair, and pale complexions, though their most common feature is a nearly universal heterochromia, leading to widespread superstition about individuals with different colored eyes.

When changelings come of age, they sometimes manifest abilities granted by their hag heritage. Some gain the ability to see in the dark, some grow fingernails long and hard enough to serve as claws, and others gain even stranger abilities specific to their hag mother. For instance, dream mays, the children of cuckoo hags, can gain an enhanced ability to resist the magic of dreams and sleep. Other types of changelings include slag mays, the children of iron hags; callow mays, the children of sweet hags; brine mays, the children of sea hags; and others for each type of hag.

As beings infused with supernatural power, changelings find themselves drawn to either the occult magic common among hags or primal magic. At roughly the same time in their lives, many changelings—women in particular—begin to hear the Call, a psychic urging from their hag mother luring them away from the communities that raised them. If followed, the Call eventually leads the changeling to the hag's coven, where they are twisted into hags themselves. Some changelings are able to resist this Call and continue on with their mortal lives. The fact that the Call disproportionately targets female changelings has led to a widespread misunderstanding that all changelings are female, while changelings of other genders are simply assumed to be members of their paternal ancestry.

+2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Dream a.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Dream and Sleep

Changeling Exile.name: Changeling Exile
Changeling Exile.allSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. dream and sleep

Reefclaw.publicNotes:
Reefclaws are aquatic monsters that resemble huge shrimp or lobsters. As one might expect from its name, a reefclaw's oversized claws are powerful weapons with a viselike grip and the ability to inject potent venom into unfortunate prey.

Though reefclaws can't speak, they are intelligent enough to understand the local language of humanoids near their hunting grounds. The creatures sometimes listen to conversations, either to gain intelligence on the best place to ambush aquatic or land-dwelling prey, or merely for entertainment value—reefclaws are particularly fond of listening to people with high-pitched voices. Reefclaws are usually solitary hunters, but small swarms of female reefclaws have been known to gather around a single male for mating purposes or together for the communal raising of their broods. In the latter case, the females will perform widespread hunts in order to bring back a large enough bounty to feed their young. Such hunting parties are extremely dangerous—they've been known to tip over small fishing boats and attack those who fall overboard.

Once a reefclaw has decided upon a course of action, it follows through even if doing so spells its own end. More than one reefclaw survivor has said that the creature released its bone-crushing grasp only after the brains were leaking from its broken skull, and even then, the reefclaw was able to perform a terrible last slash as part of its dying breath. During mating season, female reefclaws are often a little more pragmatic and release their prey before endangering themselves and their offspring.

Despite their intelligence and the accompanying moral quandaries, reefclaws frequently find their way onto the dinner plates of land-dwelling hunters such as humans and hobgoblins. According to those who have a taste for reefclaw flesh, the meat is either delectably sweet (for reefclaws raised in colder waters) or slightly tangy (in the case of warm-water reefclaws). Most people who know of reefclaws' intellect find the act of eating them distasteful, but this does not dissuade unscrupulous nobles in coastal regions, for whom reefclaw meat is a delicacy well worth the expense. Likewise, fishers whose focus is on the bottom line of their ledgers are more than willing to hunt the dangerous creatures—or, even better, hire out the task to naive adventurers.

Death Frenzy.description:
Trigger The reefclaw is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Effect The reefclaw makes a claw Strike before dying.
Death Frenzy.name: Death Frenzy

Reefclaw Venom.name: Reefclaw Venom
Reefclaw Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Reefclaw.name: Reefclaw

Hell Hound.name: Hell Hound
Hell Hound.publicNotes:
A hell hound's appearance dismisses any doubts as to their infernal origins—flesh the color of burning pitch, teeth as sharp as any fiend's pitchfork, and a shroud of ever-burning hellfire are all trademark features.

Hell hounds are fiendish, extraplanar canines hailing from the Pit that can hunt down quarry and breathe supernatural gouts of flame. They are temperamental and quick to exhibit aggressive behavior.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description:
The hell hound breathes flames that deal @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true] save).

The hell hound can't use Hellfire Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. If the hell hound would take fire damage or be targeted by a fire effect, their Hellfire Breath recharges.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The hell hound's Strikes deal 1d4 extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the hell hounds' allies.

Xulgath Skulker.name: Xulgath Skulker
Xulgath Skulker.publicNotes:
Xulgath warrens are patrolled—some might say "haunted"—by the community's skulkers. These xulgaths specialize in stealth, striking swiftly from the shadows and otherwise ambushing foes.

Reptilian humanoids who live in the uppermost reaches of the Darklands, xulgaths (known as troglodytes to many surface-dwelling folk) often attack intruders in their territory on sight. They live in simple familial communities called clutches, battling rival groups and other aggressive Darklands inhabitants in order to survive. They occasionally raid surface settlements, usually at the behest of cruel, bloodthirsty leaders who are often themselves in the thrall of more powerful creatures like nagas or demons. A typical xulgath has dull gray, dark gray, or ashen scales, with a long tail and bony protrusions that run the length of their spine. A typical xulgath is 5 feet tall and weighs 150 pounds.

Although today the xulgaths are brutal and scattered, they were one of the first intelligent humanoids to rise in the primeval world, once ruling over a mighty empire that stretched throughout the Darklands. Today, all that remains of this era are ruins of massive stone ziggurats and crumbling cities found within some of the larger caverns. Some groups of xulgaths continue to live among these ruins, venerating their ancestors' accomplishments, while others consider these areas taboo and leave them to become infested with Darklands vermin. Sages don't agree on why the ancient xulgath civilization fell. Some suspect it was the result of losing several wars waged against serpentfolk, while others suggest that the corruptive influence of demon worship rotted their culture from within.

Certainly, many xulgath settlements continue to worship demons to this day, paying homage and offering live sacrifices to demons or other terrible creatures from the Outer Rifts. Occasionally, a xulgath mystic can call forth and bind a lesser demon to help serve the group, but one who delves too deep into occultism might summon a more powerful fiend that either tears the xulgaths to pieces or seizes control of the settlement.

Hidden Movement.name: Hidden Movement
Hidden Movement.description: If a xulgath skulker starts their turn @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by a creature or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from it, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the skulker's attacks until the end merely hidden from it, that creature is off-guard against the skulker's attacks until of the skulker's turn. the end of the skulker's turn.

Mask Stench.description: The stalker masks their stench with curated herbs, suppressing their stench aura. The skulker can resume their stench aura as a free action.
Mask Stench.name: Mask Stench

Sneak Attack.description: A xulgath skulker deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

Swamp Passage.description: 沼蜍斥候能忽略由于沼泽地形特征产生的困难地形。
Swamp Passage.name: 沼泽穿行 Swamp Passage

Tongue Grab.description: 若沼蜍斥候用蛙舌命中1个生物，那么该生物会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于沼蜍人。与一般的擒获不同，该生物不会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]，但是他也无法移动至沼蜍斥候的蛙舌触及范围之外。生物可以通过命中AC 13并造成至少2点挥砍伤害来切开蛙舌。尽管这么做不会对沼蜍斥候造成伤害，但它可以使沼蜍斥候无法再次使用蛙舌打击，直至沼蜍斥候花费一周重新长出舌头。
Tongue Grab.name: 蛙舌擒获 Tongue Grab

Terrifying Croak.name: 恐惧鸣叫 Terrifying Croak
Terrifying Croak.description: 沼蜍斥候发出可怕的鸣叫声。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内的任何非沼蜍人都会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，除非他们能够成功通过@Check[type:will|dc:17]豁免；豁免中掷出大成功的生物会在1分钟内临时免疫该能力。

Boggard Scout.name: 沼蜍斥候 Boggard Scout
Boggard Scout.publicNotes:
沼蜍斥候的任务通常为在领地的边界巡逻，因此他们会学习其他语言（通常为通用语），以便应对入侵者。

沼蜍人是好斗的两栖类人生物，他们生活在沼泽、湿地甚至部分雨林中。沼蜍人的成长过程首先从卵孵化为蝌蚪，他们会激烈地争夺食物甚至会在这场斗争中吃掉自己的兄弟姐妹。在接下来的3年里，幸存下来的沼蜍人在学习狩猎、制造和战争的基础知识——一切在力量至上的社会中幸存所需要的理解的知识——的同时，长出双手、双腿和肺部。大多数沼蜍人社会的顶端阶级是身胖体肥的沼泽先知（swampseer），他们懂得如何使用邪恶的神术魔法。

Gylou.name: Gylou
Gylou.publicNotes:
Though gylous are deeply entrenched in the expansive and complex machinations of Hell, they are highly skilled agents capable of nuanced diplomacy, masterful deception, physical finesse, and nearly any other tasks they set their minds to. This versatility has led to gylous becoming widespread throughout all layers of Hell, enabling them to filter key information to their masters regarding other devils' plots and schemes. Their allegiance is no secret, but their skills are so great that powerful devils employ one or more gylous regardless. While most gylous have a feminine form (combined with their role, this is the source of their common moniker of "handmaiden"), some have other gender presentations, and nearly all gylous take on carefully cultivated illusions to best suit the roles they fill. More often than not, gylous arise when lesser devils who have demonstrated exceptional utility and invaluable skills are uplifted into a new form, though on rare occasions they are shaped from the souls of evil mortals who showed unparalleled savvy within bureaucratic enterprises.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks.

Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly orts perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as infantry and contract devils, while the greatest nessaris command entire infernal armies.

Asmodeus stands at the apex of the structure he created, but the layers below him are marked by a constant jockeying for position. Most diabolic plans ultimately serve to improve the schemer's place in the hierarchy.
Gylou.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Reflexive Grab.name: Reflexive Grab
Reflexive Grab.description:
Trigger A creature leaves a square within the gylou's reach using a move action or attempts a melee Strike against the gylou

Effect The gylou lashes out with a tentacle, attempting to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the triggering creature. If the triggering Strike was with a melee weapon, the attacking creature can Release the weapon to cause the gylou to automatically fail the Athletics check.

Encage in Tentacles.description:
Requirements The gylou has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The gylou transfers the grabbed creature into their lower body's net of encaging tentacles, freeing their limbs and tentacles to make Strikes. This has the same effects as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]{Swallow Whole} (Medium, @Damage[(2d12+12)[bludgeoning]], Rupture 30), except the encaged creature is not at risk of suffocation, and the gylou can bring the encaged creature with them when they cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}. A gylou can have only one creature encaged at a time.
Encage in Tentacles.name: Encage in Tentacles

Indispensable Savvy.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The gylou attempts a skill check but hasn't rolled yet

Effect The gylou demonstrates a preternatural ability for the task at hand. They use their Deception modifier for the triggering check and for all skill checks using the same skill thereafter until the next time the gylou uses this ability or until 24 hours have passed, whichever happens first.
Indispensable Savvy.name: Indispensable Savvy

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description: @Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Roc.name: 大鹏 Roc
Roc.publicNotes:
大鹏这种传说中体型巨大的猛禽能够捕猎大象，通常从喙到尾巴长约30尺，翼展达80尺以上。它们的狩猎策略是用它们强有力的爪子抓住猎物，然后在进食前从高处将其扔下，再用带钩的喙从骨头上撕下肉来。这种方法会产生大量的腐肉，这会导致一群见机行事食腐动物紧跟在大鹏后面，比如乌鸦和秃鹰，它们很容易就能偷偷啄食残渣。大多数情况下，大鹏并不介意这些生物，它们有时会和死掉的猎物一起被吃掉。

大鹏通常在山顶和崖壁上筑巢，只有最勇敢的陆地居民才能找到其所在。它们捕食的时候会飞很远，在陆地和海洋捕食大型猎物，以维持自己和幼仔的生命。大鹏是孤僻的独行捕食者，会在空中互相激斗以保护领土。大约每十年一次，一对交配的夫妻会一起抚养他们的幼雏。一旦雏鸟长大到可以独立捕食的年龄，父母就会分开，再次单独捕食。

特别有技巧的德鲁伊或游侠可能会捕获并训练大鹏作为飞行坐骑或狩猎伙伴，尽管此等令人难以置信的壮举很难找到几个实例。最简单的方法就是在它刚孵化的那一刻，从幼雏出生时看到的第一个生物的印象开始。然而，获得一枚大鹏的蛋绝非易事，对于想要抢蛋的人来说，这往往意味着给自己判了死刑。

Wing Rebuff.name: 翼返 Wing Rebuff
Wing Rebuff.description:
触发 一个位于大鹏翼击触及范围之外的生物进入大鹏的翼触及范围

效果 大鹏对触发生物进行一次羽翼打击。如果大鹏推离目标，则目标的移动动作被打断。

Carry.name: 携行 Carry
Carry.description: 大鹏用一只或两只鸟爪@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]一个生物时，能以半速飞行，并带着目标一起移动。

Flying Strafe.name: 飞掠 Flying Strafe
Flying Strafe.description: 大鹏最多以满速飞行，并在这一行动中的任何时刻进行两次鸟爪打击。每次打击必须针对不同的生物。每次攻击正常计算多重攻击减值。

Snack.name: 小菜 Snack
Snack.description: 大鹏攻击被自己鸟爪@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]的生物时，在攻击掷骰上有+2环境加值。

Goblin Scuttle.name: 地精小跑 Goblin Scuttle
Goblin Scuttle.description:
触发 一个地精盟友在与该地精相邻的位置结束其移动动作。

效果 地精突击手@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{快步 Steps}。

Goblin Commando.name: 地精突击手 Goblin Commando
Goblin Commando.publicNotes:
理论上，地精突袭的领导者被叫做地精突击手。但实际上，一旦战斗开始，鲜有地精突击手会继续领导他的战友们。他们大多数都会逃避自己的责任而宁意卷入争斗之中，从而在部落成员里获得更多的荣誉。

这些小型类人生物通常有着绿色或是灰色的皮肤，大大的脑袋和宽大的耳朵。虽然有那么一些地精是文明的，并且努力成为类人生物社群中正直的一员，但有许多地精依旧还是鲁莽而又邪恶的生物，以制造破坏为乐。这些地精纯粹只是为了片刻的欢乐而屠杀牲畜、盗窃、或是烧毁建筑。他们沉迷于对那些被他们成为“长腿”——也就是那些比他们更高的类人生物——耍一些恶劣的把戏。

地精很迷信，对魔法有着强烈的敬畏，对火焰有着异乎寻常的迷恋；精通魔法或者火焰的地精会得到他们部族的尊敬。大多数其他类人生物都很难理解地精的观点：他们讨厌犬科动物却又热衷于和所谓的“地精犬”分享他们的巢穴，他们会无畏地攻击大型生物却又害怕马匹，他们鄙视蔬菜却又将腌菜作为美味佳肴。当然，对于一只地精而言，这些全都是极为明智的人生抉择。

Zephyr Hawk.name: Zephyr Hawk
Zephyr Hawk.publicNotes:
Zephyr hawks drift among the currents of the Plane of Air in great flocks. They delight in riding the air currents with no destination in mind.

Hailing from the Plane of Air, these beings appear in a variety of sizes and shapes. They're noted for being elusive, swift, and often difficult to detect due to being composed primarily of air.

Circling Attack.name: Circling Attack
Circling Attack.description: The zephyr hawk Flies up to half its Speed, makes two wing Strikes, then Flies up to half its Speed again to return to its original location. The second half of this movement doesn't trigger reactions. Both attacks count toward the zephyr hawk's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes both attacks.

Grindylow.name: Grindylow
Grindylow.publicNotes:
The top half of a grindylow vaguely resembles a goblin, but from the waist down, their bodies split into a tangle of suckered, wriggling tentacles. Grindylows mostly dwell in shallow waters, fresh and briny, including lakes, rivers, coastal regions, and coral reefs. They generally organize into groups called schools, which can range from a few individuals to a few hundred. Smaller schools are sometimes taken over by a powerful aquatic creature, though such alliances only last until the school faces a major setback, at which point the surviving grindylows scatter and form smaller schools of their own.

Grindylows aren't territorial, but they are pragmatic. While they rarely build permanent structures, they will adopt a good hunting ground for generations until driven away by predators. They often lair in mobile shelters, such as a sargasso of seaweed or hull of an abandoned ship. They are skilled scavengers and hunters who eat anything they can sink their teeth into.

Grindylows respect the power of larger sea predators but have a special hatred for squids (or anything that resembles a squid). Sailors plying grindylow-infested waters often paint the images of squids on the bottoms of their hulls in hopes of warding off potentials raids. While this can keep smaller schools at bay, it can also backfire, potentially inciting larger groups to gather for a coordinated attack; this becomes especially likely if the ship's route is predictable. Their hatred of squids does not extend to other tentacled creatures; grindylows consider octopuses to be the epitome of grace and power.

Reactive Strike (Special).description:
A grindylow gains 1 extra reaction at the start of each of their turns that they can use only to make a Reactive Strike with a tentacle. They can't use more than one Reactive Strike triggered by the same action or choice.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]
Reactive Strike (Special).name: Reactive Strike (Special)

Clinging Suckers.description:
When a grindylow successfully Grabs a creature larger than themself, they attach to that creature. The @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} creature is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but if it moves, the grindylow moves with it.

If the creature is Medium or smaller, it takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds while the grindylow is attached. The grindylow is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while attached to a creature.
Clinging Suckers.name: Clinging Suckers

Jet.description: The grindylow moves up to 60 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions.
Jet.name: Jet

Elf Ranger.name: Elf Ranger
Elf Ranger.publicNotes:
Many elves learn the bow before even picking up their first blade. Because of this, many elves act as rangers at some point in their long lives.

Elves are mysterious and intelligent, and graceful and cunning in battle.

Double Shot.name: Double Shot
Double Shot.description: The elf ranger makes two shortbow Strikes targeting two different creatures within the shortbow’s first range increment. Both Strikes uses the elf’s current multiple attack penalty, but each strike takes a –2 penalty.

Broad Swipe.description: The giant makes two Strikes with its glaive against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. Both attacks count toward the giant's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.
Broad Swipe.name: Broad Swipe

Terrifying Charge.name: Terrifying Charge
Terrifying Charge.description:
The giant Strides and makes a horns Strike with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage.

If the strike hits, the giant attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target.

Skeletal Giant.name: Skeletal Giant
Skeletal Giant.publicNotes:
The reanimated bones of giants make excellent necromantic thralls.

Animated skeletons are among the most common types of undead.

Kholo Sergeant.name: Kholo Sergeant
Kholo Sergeant.publicNotes:
When kholos band together to form mercenary bands or raiding parties, the strongest or most respected among them is often designated the hunt leader or sergeant. These kholo are responsible for the safety and success of their packmates and train extensively in the art of war. Their skill at arms makes them powerful adversaries. A kholo sergeant might also serve as a mercenary group's leader in other affairs, such as sorting out domestic disputes or negotiating with rival kholo bands.

Kholo are tall, hyena-headed humanoids who dwell in savannas, warm grasslands, and arid hills. Given their appearance, their affinity for hyenas should not be surprising; kholos share their homes, food, and even many of their behaviors with these animals. Much like hyenas, kholos have a notorious reputation, for much the same reason—their uncanny laughter, frightening intelligence, and efficient pack tactics make them intimidating competition or foes. Kholos are keen to lean into these rumors, using them as a form of psychological warfare against their enemies.

Also like hyenas, kholos prefer to hunt in packs, and are exceptionally skilled at setting up ambushes or separating individual targets from larger groups. As kholo packs value all their members highly, any tactic that gives them an advantage in dangerous situations is seen as virtuous, while chivalry and honor are derided as pointlessly risky. It's a philosophy borne from a deep respect and love for their kholo brethren, but to most other people, it makes kholos terrible neighbors.

Kholos willingly eat nearly any other creature, including dead kholos, which can evoke strong reactions from people and cultures with a taboo against cannibalism or desecrating the dead. To a kholo, it's often more offensive to not eat a dead body, no matter its origin; kholos see no point in wasting precious meat in a harsh and challenging world. Worse still is the refusal to eat the flesh of a dead kholo, which they consider an insult to that kholo's memory and an implication that their flesh is unworthy of consumption. Eating the flesh of honored enemies is, for kholos, a respectful ritual, allowing that being to live on within the pack instead of rotting like trash on the ground.

Kholo women are often larger and stronger than kholo men and are typically considered the leaders of their hunting packs and clans.

Bark Orders.name: Bark Orders
Bark Orders.description: The kholo sergeant commands its allies to reposition. Any allies who hear and understand this order can use a reaction to Step.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: A kholo hunter deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the kholo hunter's allies.

Rugged Travel.name: Rugged Travel
Rugged Travel.description: A kholo ignores the first square of difficult terrain they move into each time they Step or Stride.

Mirage Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Mirage Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Mirage Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Mirage dragons are masters of illusion magic and use their powers to deceive others and further their own agendas. In addition to their magical prowess, mirage dragons possess a number of additional features to help them on hunts or mislead attackers, such as their camouflaging scales and a hallucinatory breath that can confound multiple foes at once. Mirage dragons are vain and egotistical figures. They ultimately care more about themselves than others.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Mirage Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The dragon can Hide in natural environments even if they don't have cover.

Illusion Sense.name: Illusion Sense
Illusion Sense.description: When the dragon moves within 30 feet of an illusion that can be disbelieved, they automatically attempt a secret check to disbelieve, even if they didn't spend an action to Interact.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Scintillating Defense.name: Scintillating Defense
Scintillating Defense.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon flashes their iridescent scales at the triggering creature to throw off the attack. The dragon gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} against the triggering attack.

Captivating Display.name: Captivating Display
Captivating Display.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon opens the fins on their head, creating a radiant display of enthralling colors. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) for 1 round. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to Captivating Display for 1 minute.

Hallucinatory Breath.name: Hallucinatory Breath
Hallucinatory Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a cloud that assaults the senses and deals @Damage[12d6[mental]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:will|dc:33] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure) and is then temporarily immune to being confused by Hallucinatory Breath for 1 hour.

The dragon can't use Hallucinatory Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hallucinatory Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Lunging Bite.name: Lunging Bite
Lunging Bite.description: The dragon lunges their head forward, making a jaws Strike with an extended reach of 25 feet.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Centipede Swarm.name: 蜈蚣群 Centipede Swarm
Centipede Swarm.publicNotes:
蜈蚣群确实很危险，它们像飞掠而过的贪婪地毯，能在几分钟内吃掉旅行者。一些炼金术士把从蜈蚣群里取来的整只蜈蚣浸泡在他们的灵药和一些突变药剂里，声称这样可以增强效能，但另一些人认为这不过是江湖庸医的噱头。狗头人和螨精都会狡猾地把蜈蚣群放进陷阱里，从装满害虫的简单陷坑，到更复杂的把害虫倾倒到粗心的闯入者头上的滑槽。

作为猎手和食腐动物，蜈蚣生活在粪便和碎石中，它们冒险家们经常面对的威胁。蜈蚣长而多节的身体上长着数十条腿，它们以惊人的速度四处乱窜，用有毒的虫颚攻击猎物，用恶毒的毒素折磨猎物，然后慢慢地用令人作呕的动作进食。

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊）30尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet

Centipede Swarm Venom.name: 蜈蚣群毒 Centipede Swarm Venom
Centipede Swarm Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[1d8[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}并措手不及 (1轮)

Swarming Bites.description: 在蜈蚣群占据方格内的所有敌人都必须受到@Damage[1d8[piercing]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true]豁免）附加蜈蚣群毒。
Swarming Bites.name: 虫群噬咬 Swarming Bites

Lich.name: Lich
Lich.publicNotes:
A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster.

To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history-both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.
Lich.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. vitality

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
Trigger A creature casts a spell the lich has prepared.

Effect The lich expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. The lich loses its spell slot as if it had cast the triggering spell. The lich then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Lich Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if their soul cage is found and destroyed.

Drain Soul Cage.name: Drain Soul Cage
Drain Soul Cage.description:
6th rank

Frequency once per day

Effect The lich taps into their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qFVPeeJ70B1u2n81]{Soul Cage}'s power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest rank the lich can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich's prepared spells. The lich's soul cage doesn't need to be present for the lich to use this ability.

Siphon Life.name: Siphon Life
Siphon Life.description:
A lich's form draws forth life from those who come into contact with it. When the lich damages a living creature with an unarmed attack, the lich gains 5 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

If the lich is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} at the start of its turn, each creature grabbing or restraining it must succeed at a Fortitude save or become drained 1. If the lich siphons a creature's life again, the drained value increase by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the lich's spellcasting action, the lich attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.
Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting

Bone Prophet.publicNotes:
The speakers for the dead known as bone prophets hold an esteemed place as voices for their decapitated god. Burial rites, necromantic rituals, and the delivery of cryptic utterances supposedly whispered to them by Ydersius all fall under the dominion of these priests.

Before their ancient clash with humanity devastated their civilization, serpentfolk were masters of a sprawling underground empire. Their power was shattered and their god Ydersius decapitated (although not quite slain). The cunning, intelligence, and magical abilities of serpentfolk have diminished from their ancient heights, and most are born without these boons. This is partially the result of cruel genetic meddling among serpentfolk—though the ruling class, zyss, are born with an innate spellcasting ability, their blood runs thin, making them susceptible to wounds. Seen as the failures of the serpentfolk's experiments are the aapophs, who are strong but prone to mutation and lack innate spellcasting.

Today, the central realm of the Darklands retains the old name of the serpentfolk empire that once dominated this region—Sekamina. This name is also the source of the serpentfolk's Aklo title, sekmin, which they are often called in ancient texts. Serpentfolk dominion had declined before ghouls, gugs, umbral gnomes, and other forces. Yet their recent ventures have brought them back to a stronger place in the Darklands. Many serpentfolk sleeping in torpor in secluded vaults have awakened.

Zyss serpentfolk tend toward megalomania, with dreams of returning to their place of dominance. Many of their plans hinge on resurrecting Ydersius, their decapitated god. His headless body still thrashes about, mindless, in the Darklands, waiting to be reunited with his lost skull. Serpentfolk numbers are so small that reclaiming their dominance seems a distant dream, especially since their reproduction is slow. Though a parent can birth a dozen young at once, the gestation period lasts up to a decade, and the likelihood that even one will be zyss is low. There's no telling whether a child will be zyss or aapoph, regardless of parentage. A coveted zyss child is just as likely to arise from aapoph parents as from two zyss, and every serpentfolk colony has someone in charge of sorting the young, identifying the earliest signs of magic in them.
Bone Prophet.allSaves: +4 status to will saves vs. mental, +1 status to all saves vs. magical

Thin of Blood.name: Thin of Blood
Thin of Blood.description: Bone Prophets recover slowly from injuries. When they take physical damage from a critical hit, they gain @Damage[2d4[persistent,bleed]] damage. They take a –2 circumstance penalty to flat checks to recover from persistent damage and saving throws against afflictions.

Raise Serpent.name: Raise Serpent
Raise Serpent.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The bone prophet animates corpses of snakes, serpentfolk, or similar serpentine creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Any flesh on the bodies sloughs off, and they rise as skeletons. The bone prophet can raise one Large creature as a skeletal giant or up to three Medium creatures as skeletal champions; the equipment and attacks might be different depending on the corpses' possessions. These skeletons have the minion trait and are under the bone prophet's control; the bone prophet can give all these minions the same command with a single action that has the concentrate trait. Any skeletal minions that still remain after 10 minutes crumble to dust.

Serpentfolk Venom.name: Serpentfolk Venom
Serpentfolk Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Bone Prophet.name: Bone Prophet

Seraptis.name: Seraptis
Seraptis.publicNotes:
Four-armed seraptis demons are radical nihilists at heart, despising other creatures out of bitter entitlement and laughing hysterically when others die or suffer. They arise from souls that engaged in dedicated campaigns of misery, driving their victims toward despair and suicide. After their awakening as a seraptis, the hungry mouths carved into their arms devour others' suffering, bringing a lively hue to the demon's cold skin.

These demons seek to drag mortals down to their level, luring pawns into deepseated resentment. Feeding their targets an unending stream of half-truths and propaganda, they often drive these mortals to vent their rage into unforgivable deeds against innocents. Although thrilled by the misery their mortal pawns inflict, the demons' true comfort is to harvest the souls of those pawns as more of their kind.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.
Seraptis.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Blood Healing.name: Blood Healing
Blood Healing.description:
30 feet.

Whenever a humanoid within the aura takes bleed damage, the blood flows through the air to the seraptis's mouths and the seraptis heals by the same amount.

Recovery Vulnerability.description: When a creature within the seraptis's blood healing aura recovers from persistent damage, the seraptis takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.
Recovery Vulnerability.name: Recovery Vulnerability

Bloody Dance.name: Bloody Dance
Bloody Dance.description: The seraptis makes a Strike with up to four arms, each against a different target and using a claw or scimitar as appropriate. These attacks count toward the seraptis's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks. The seraptis can use Grab following this activity, separately attempting to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} each creature hit by a claw.

Gnawing Arms.name: Gnawing Arms
Gnawing Arms.description:
Requirements The seraptis has at least one creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect s The seraptis's arm mouths gnaw on those creatures, dealing each of them @Damage[(2d6+8)[piercing]] damage with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37|basic:true] save. Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[2d6[bleed]]{2d6 persistent bleed damage}.

Isolating Words.description:
The seraptis telepathically explains a plausible secret to a creature within 30 feet. That creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:37] save or be mentally cut off from those around them for 1 minute (or permanently on a critical failure). The affected creature treats no one as an ally and any speech they hear is warped, encouraging conflict, and negating any linguistic ability from creatures that aren't unholy.

Regardless of the results of the saving throw, the creature is immune to Isolating Words for 24 hours.
Isolating Words.name: Isolating Words

Diabolic Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Hell, according to some theologians, is a living entity in and of itself. Diabolic dragons, these scholars argue, are just extensions of the plane, living creatures that break off from Hell to enact its will. Whether this is true or whether diabolical dragons are simply the reborn souls of dragons sent to Hell, the fact remains that these dragons are powerful, cunning, and tyrannical. Every diabolic dragon's goal is to further Hell's will, though how this happens can vary. Regardless of their goals, these dragons always approach newcomers with an unsettling calmness.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.
Diabolic Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair the dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Hell's Sting.name: Hell's Sting
Hell's Sting.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon channels the rancor of Hell back through the body of their foe, overwhelming it with an infernal assault on the mind. The triggering creature takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[type:will|dc:30|basic:true] save. Holy creatures use an outcome one degree of success worse than they roll on their saving throw.

Diabolic Fire.name: Diabolic Fire
Diabolic Fire.description: Any fire damage that a diabolic dragon deals, including fire damage from spells, is imbued with the unholy power of Hell to scorch the spirit as well. A creature takes spirit damage instead of fire damage if that would be more detrimental to the creature (as determined by the GM). A diabolic dragon is immune to the diabolic fire of other diabolic dragons, the fire from divine immolation, and similar effects.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of infernal fire that deals @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true] save).

The dragon can't use Hellfire Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Diabolic Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Diabolic Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)

Caligni Dancer.publicNotes:
Caligni dancers serve as intermediaries between caligni factions, carrying messages and negotiating deals between the notoriously independent groups. Although physically fragile, the dancers serve an important role within caligni society and are rarely seen without guards.

Calignis lurk in subterranean cities, with each caligni growing into a specific role and form determined by supernatural influences in caligni society. Regardless of their size or role, all calignis are gaunt, with pale flesh and white eyes. Many relish the chance to creep above ground at night to steal resources, shadow their surface counterparts, or simply make mischief.

Distracting Frolic.name: Distracting Frolic
Distracting Frolic.description:
Trigger An ally within 10 feet of the dancer rolls a saving throw against a mental or illusion effect

Effect The target ally can roll the save twice and take the better result.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.E10qJgInN8Fx3yhW]{Effect: Distracting Frolic}

Final Dance.name: Final Dance
Final Dance.description:
When the dancer dies, their body dissolves into a swirling mass of darkness and light. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

The dancer's possessions are left in a pile where they died.

Dancer's Curse.description:
The caligni dancer touches a foe and curses it.

If the target fails a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save, it gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

The target is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

These conditions persist until the curse is removed. The victim can attempt a new @Check[type:will|dc:18] save once per hour to end the curse.
Dancer's Curse.name: Dancer's Curse

Sneak Attack.description: The caligni dancer deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

Caligni Dancer.name: Caligni Dancer

Conspirator Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Conspirator Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Conspirator Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Hidden among the shadows and upper echelons of society are the conspirator dragons. These dragons are schemers, always looking to manipulate and control others, either for personal gain or simply for the thrill of watching their machinations play out. Conspirator dragons see themselves above others and typically speak with infantilizing tones and words. However, as most conspirator dragons meet others while in disguise, they do their best to maintain their disguise.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Retract Body.description:
Trigger The dragon is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature the dragon can see

Effect The dragon retracts the targeted body part or twists away to avoid the attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
Retract Body.name: Retract Body

Conjure Disguise.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon conjures a perfect flesh-suit replica of a humanoid they've seen of their size or smaller and compresses themself into it, along with generating appropriate clothing for the humanoid. This process takes 1 minute to complete, during which the dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. If the dragon stops or is interrupted in this process, the suit is destroyed. Once the process is complete, the dragon can remain in this disguise indefinitely.

The transformation has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]{Change Shape}, except that the disguise is not actively magical in nature and doesn't register as magical to detect magic and similar effects. The dragon loses Retract Body while transformed.

If the dragon is critically hit while wearing the disguise, the suit is destroyed and immediately explodes. This has the effects of Detonate Disguise, except that creatures use the outcome one degree of success better than they rolled on their save.
Conjure Disguise.name: Conjure Disguise

Detonate Disguise.description:
Requirements The dragon is wearing their conjured disguise

Effect The dragon erupts from the disguise, destroying it. The explosive revelation deals @Damage[13d6[bludgeoning]] damage to creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:31|basic:true] save. A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round as it becomes covered in scraps from the disguise.

Any creature sharing a space with the dragon after they erupt is pushed into the nearest empty space.
Detonate Disguise.name: Detonate Disguise

Rushed Transformation.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect Using the aid of magic and an exhausting amount of effort, the dragon quickly reshapes their body into the form of a generic humanoid figure. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form} except that it lasts only 1 minute, and the dragon doesn't gain the +4 status bonus to Deception as the transformation makes use of the dragon's body to crudely mimic a humanoid form. The dragon can Dismiss the effect.

Whenever the effect ends, the dragon leaves behind scraps of magically conjured flesh, which could give away the dragon's presence.
Rushed Transformation.name: Rushed Transformation

Smoke Breath.name: Smoke Breath
Smoke Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a noxious cloud of smoke that deals @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:33|basic:true] save). The smoke remains for 1 minute. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist}, except it fills the cone's area.

The dragon can't use Smoke Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

Conspirator Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

Slurk.publicNotes:
泥蛙是一种表旁皮黏糊糊的，长牙的蛙类动物，在地底和洞穴中出没。它有两根巨大的獠牙，用来攻击猎物、打败竞争者。由于泥蛙天生就能毫不费力的爬上洞穴顶部，因此粗心的洞穴冒险者很容易就会走到他们可怕的獠牙之下。

泥蛙能从它们苍白的皮肤中分泌出两种截然不同的恶臭分泌物。泥蛙背上的大脓疱能分泌出粘稠的树脂状粘液，这些粘液接触到在空气后会很快变硬。通过收缩皮肤，泥蛙可以让脓包中的粘液超入侵者的方向猛烈喷出，使其包裹在黏液中，使得他们难以抵御泥蛙的其他攻击或另一种分泌物。泥蛙的腹部腺体能分泌出一种奇臭无比的滑腻油脂，这可以保护泥蛙自己不受背部粘液影响，而且这还有额外的好处，让泥蛙变得很难被擒抱或捕获。要想知道附近是否有泥蛙，最好的办法就是寻找这些油脂硬块，这些油脂硬块会堆积在洞穴角落里或是泥蛙用餐之后休息的岩石堆中，慢慢变干。

一般认为泥蛙是矮人试图驯养和繁殖大型地底蛙类作为食物和牲畜但是最终失败产生的结果。虽然是表面上是失败品，但泥蛙经常受到一些地下居民的喜爱。狗头人就非常喜欢泥蛙，会驯养他们作为坐骑或守卫。虽然其他一些人形生物，例如蟾蜍人，有时候会驯养泥蛙作为守卫，但是狗头人依然是它们之中最常使用泥蛙的。骑着泥蛙的狗头人通常会躲在洞穴高处的岩架上，利用其高度优势和远程突袭优势对敌人进行远程攻击。狗头人骑士也会利用泥蛙的攀爬能力，从洞穴的岩壁上向敌人冲锋。

+2 Status to Fortitude Saves vs. Grapple.name: 对抗擒拿、移位或推撞的豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to Fortitude Saves vs. Grapple, Reposition, or Shove

Belly Grease.name: 腹部油脂 Belly Grease
Belly Grease.description: 泥蛙腹部的腺体分泌一层光滑的油脂，复盖脚下5尺弥漫范围的地面，受影响的区域视为不稳地面，持续10分钟。之后干燥成一层硬皮。通过油脂时的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]检定DC为18。

Entangling Slime.name: 纠缠粘液 Entangling Slime
Entangling Slime.description:
被泥蛙粘液喷射击中的生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}，并且移动速度有5尺减值，持续1小时或直到粘液被移除。

被粘液减速的目标或者目标相邻的生物可以通过三个交互动作来移除粘液。这些交互动作不必连续，也不必由同一生物做出。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.jQmfZcPD6xVYx5nb]{效果：纠缠粘液}

Slurk.name: 泥蛙 Slurk
Slurk.allSaves: 对抗擒拿、移位或推撞的豁免+2状态加值

Mirage Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Mirage Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Mirage Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Mirage dragons are masters of illusion magic and use their powers to deceive others and further their own agendas. In addition to their magical prowess, mirage dragons possess a number of additional features to help them on hunts or mislead attackers, such as their camouflaging scales and a hallucinatory breath that can confound multiple foes at once. Mirage dragons are vain and egotistical figures. They ultimately care more about themselves than others.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Mirage Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Camouflage.description: The dragon can Hide in natural environments even if they don't have cover.
Camouflage.name: Camouflage

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Scintillating Defense.name: Scintillating Defense
Scintillating Defense.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon flashes their iridescent scales at the triggering creature to throw off the attack. The dragon gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} against the triggering attack.

Hallucinatory Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a cloud that assaults the senses and deals @Damage[7d6[mental]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:will|dc:27] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure) and is then temporarily immune to being confused by Hallucinatory Breath for 1 hour.

The dragon can't use Hallucinatory Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hallucinatory Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Hallucinatory Breath.name: Hallucinatory Breath

Lunging Bite.name: Lunging Bite
Lunging Bite.description: The dragon lunges their head forward, making a jaws Strike with an extended reach of 20 feet.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Fortune Dragon (Adult).name: Fortune Dragon (Adult)
Fortune Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
Fortune dragons have the innate ability to draw upon the raw magical energies that surround them. They constantly use these magical energies to empower their magical abilities and even their bodies, as the energy can heal wounds. A fortune dragon has a typical build for an arcane dragon, but their bodies sport a striking feature: their treasure. The dragon's nature of drawing upon magic causes coins, gems, and, most notably, magical items to cling to their body like iron drawn to magnets. A dragon constantly pulls magical energies from the items attached to their body and makes use of these energies to cast spells. The magical energies that flow through a fortune dragon constantly flow through the dragon's items as well, and in many cases, the items melt from the heat produced in this process. Fortune dragons are seekers of novel experiences. This desire for originality leads fortune dragons to approach visitors of other ancestries with curiosity, though this initial interest quickly wanes if a visitor lacks exciting qualities.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Fortune Dragon (Adult).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Aura of Disruption.name: Aura of Disruption
Aura of Disruption.description:
120 feet.

The dragon radiates disruptive energies that allow them to feed on magic. When a spell is counteracted or disrupted within the aura, the dragon regains one expended spontaneous spell slot and gains 25 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Capture Spell.description:
Trigger The dragon succeeds or critically succeeds on a saving throw against a spell

Effect The dragon attempts to capture a portion of the spell's magic to feed themself. They attempt to counteract the spell (counteract rank 7, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+28 #Counteract]]{+28}). If successful, the dragon is unaffected by the spell and regains one expended spontaneous spell slot; other subjects are affected by the spell normally.
Capture Spell.name: Capture Spell

Disruptive Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a spray of magic-disrupting energies that deals @Damage[13d6[force]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true] save). Creatures that fail become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.

The dragon can't use Disruptive Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Disruptive Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Disruptive Breath.name: Disruptive Breath

Share the Wealth.name: Share the Wealth
Share the Wealth.description:
Requirements The dragon's body is covered in riches (this is typically the case when the dragon is first encountered)

Effect The dragon shakes their body aggressively, sending coins and other riches flying in every direction, dealing @Damage[9d10[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:35|basic:true] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:40]. The dragon's body is then no longer covered in riches.

Treasure Dive.description:
Requirements The dragon's body isn't covered in riches and the dragon is adjacent to their hoard

Effect The dragon Strides or Burrows through their hoard using their land Speed. They coat themself in coins, magic items, and other treasures. This contact with magical items revitalizes the dragon, causing them to regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

The dragon can move through other creatures while moving in this way. Creatures in the dragon's path, or above it if the dragon Burrows, must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:33] save or be pushed 10 feet (or pushed 20 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure).
Treasure Dive.name: Treasure Dive

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: Whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike, the dragon chooses to either recharge Disruptive Breath or regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

Sprigjack.publicNotes:
较弱小的枝节妖经常能在开垦过的森林甚至是花园中找到。它们会试图赶走入侵者，逐渐使它们的生长环境变得野化。

枝节妖是失调森林的住民，残酷且热爱恶作剧的精类及自身所处森林的结合作用下形成了他们。枝节妖的身体由多刺的荆棘以及藤蔓编织而成。在枝节妖头顶上生长的蓬松苔藓就宛如他的头发一般。细碎且破败的枝条在他脸上断裂开来形成了嘴部。新生的叶片和枝条随机地从他的身上伸展开来。格拉利昂的许多茂密森林中都至少有一小撮枝节妖生活在灌木丛中。

尽管具有暴力倾向且十分好斗，但枝节妖极为关心被他们认为属于自己的森林。这些生物会骚扰那些深入到自己的森林领域中的外来者，将其中哪怕最意志坚定的探索者、林务工作者、以及旅行者逼走，这种行为在那些入侵者于森林中开辟道路时尤甚。然而，在牵涉到其他森林生物时，他们并不会具有很强的领地意识。当木族生物，尤其是精类，集合起来对抗外部威胁时，该地区的枝节妖哪怕没有得到邀请，也会急切地前来参加战斗。

Bramble Jump.description:
需求 枝节妖处于灌木丛中

效果 枝节妖爬进灌木丛中并立即传送至60尺范围内的一处有灌木丛的方格。此次移动不会触发反应动作。
Bramble Jump.name: 荆丛迁跃 Bramble Jump

Sprigjack.name: 小枝妖 Sprigjack

Conspirator Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
Hidden among the shadows and upper echelons of society are the conspirator dragons. These dragons are schemers, always looking to manipulate and control others, either for personal gain or simply for the thrill of watching their machinations play out. Conspirator dragons see themselves above others and typically speak with infantilizing tones and words. However, as most conspirator dragons meet others while in disguise, they do their best to maintain their disguise.

Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Effect Using the aid of magic and an exhausting amount of effort, the dragon quickly reshapes their body into the form of a generic humanoid figure. Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Conspirator Dragon (Adult).name: Conspirator Dragon (Adult)
Conspirator Dragon (Adult).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

Giant Crawling Hand.publicNotes:
伏行巨手是来自像巨人这样大体型生物的手掌。

一般来说，当被切断的手被死灵能量赋予了模糊的感知能力，并被转化成成不知疲倦的杀手时，伏行之手就诞生了。当然，当一个生物在一个充满死灵能量或与虚能产生联系的地方失去了自己的手掌时，伏行之手也可能会自发复诞。

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊）30尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 30 feet

Pus Burst.name: 脓液喷射 Pus Burst
Pus Burst.description:
触发 伏行巨手受到穿刺或挥砍伤害

效果 随机一个与伏行巨手相邻的生物被喷射的浓汁溅到，受到@Damage[4d6[void]]伤害。受影响的生物还需要通过@Check[type:reflex|dc:21]豁免。

大成功 该生物不受伤害

成功 该生物受到一半伤害且陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}

失败 该生物受到完整伤害且陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}

大失败 该生物受到双倍伤害且陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 3}

Mark Quarry.name: 标记猎物 Mark Quarry
Mark Quarry.description: 在伏行巨手上涂上一滴指定目标的血液可以让伏行之手追踪指定猎物。若伏行巨手当前没有猎物，那么下个被他伤害的生物会自动成为他的猎物。伏行巨手在@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]猎物时的察觉检定，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]猎物时的生存检定，打击猎物时的伤害掷骰上获得+1环境加值。

Giant Crawling Hand.name: 伏行巨手 Giant Crawling Hand

Stone Mauler.name: Stone Mauler
Stone Mauler.publicNotes:
These towering heaps of earth can inflict tremendous damage up close and from afar.

Earth elementals make excellent bodyguards for adventuresome spelunkers and are ideal protectors of important subterranean locations such as vaults and treasuries.

Earthbound.name: Earthbound
Earthbound.description: When not touching solid ground, a stone mauler is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Crumble.name: Crumble
Crumble.description:
Trigger The stone mauler takes damage from a hostile source while atop rock or earth

Effect The stone mauler crumbles into the ground, Burrowing down 15 feet. This Burrowing does not trigger reactions.

The stone mauler can't Crumble again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Crumble]]{1d4 rounds}.

Spike Stones.name: Spike Stones
Spike Stones.description:
5 feet.

Spikes of rock rise up from all stone surfaces in the emanation, creating difficult terrain. A creature moving in the terrain takes @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage for each square of spikes it moves into (a Large or larger creature takes damage only once for each square it moves, even if its space covers multiple squares of spikes). Creatures with the earth trait ignore all effects within the area.

The stone mauler can disable or activate this aura using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The stone mauler can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the stone mauler moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Tyrannosaurus.publicNotes:
暴龙被认为是一般意义上的恐龙之王，它是巨大的掠食者，嘴巴宽大，牙齿锋利无比。一些巨人部落甚至把暴龙训练成坐骑或战兽。

这些巨大的爬行动物是世界原始时代的遗留物，现在仍然大量存在于偏僻的荒野中，或者在幽暗地域的地下魔法洞穴中。蜥蜴人、半兽人、巨人和其他人形生物有时会把恐龙当作坐骑、守卫或猎兽。众所周知，人类和其他族裔也收集恐龙，把它们放在动物园里展出，或把它们当作异域宠物或守卫。这通常是富人或怪咖喜欢干的事情，但确实也有一些德鲁伊和其他自然的守护者能与恐龙亲密相处，甚至把它们作为动物伙伴。当恐龙在它们正常栖息地以外的地区安家时，通常可能是因为被圈养的恐龙逃进荒野造成的。

Fling.description:
需求 一个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于暴龙的颚部

效果 暴龙把嘴里的生物扔到至多离它嘴10英尺高，20英尺远的空中。目标生物坠落25尺（假设暴龙尽可能高地将目标扔到高处），并承受相应的坠落伤害。如果该生物落在另一个生物身上，则被砸中的生物将受到相同数量的钝击伤害。被砸的生物可以尝试@Check[type:reflex|dc:23|basic:true]反射豁免。
Fling.name: 抛掷 Fling

Pin Prey.description:
触发 暴龙的脚掌对不超过大型的敌人造成重击

效果 暴龙脚掌打击命中的生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]，并且被摁在当前的方格里。只要暴龙一直不移动，被摁死的生物视同@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]。

暴龙对被摁死的目标的攻击掷骰有+2环境加值，但只有对受擒于颚部的生物才能使用活吞能力。
Pin Prey.name: 摁死 Pin Prey

Tyrannosaurus.name: 暴龙 Tyrannosaurus

Skeleton Guard.name: Skeleton Guard
Skeleton Guard.publicNotes:
The most common skeletal minions are mere guardians.

Animated skeletons are among the most common types of undead.

Marsh Giant.publicNotes:
Dwellers of brackish coastal salt marshes and fetid bogs and swamps, marsh giants appear hideous to most airbreathers, with fishlike mouths, slimy graygreen skin, and dark, beady eyes. They prefer to eat the flesh of those they slay in battle, including other marsh giants, and guzzle stagnant water from cauldrons or directly from their swampy homes.

Marsh giant clans are insular, with each clan dedicating itself to zealous worship of a sea-dwelling deity, demon lord, or stranger entity. Whatever forces call to the marsh giants sometimes ensnare boggards and ogres as well, gathering in grim worship. Rather than favor these humanoid hangerson, marsh giants lavish attention on favored pets: krooths, giant octopuses, or primeval creatures like dinosaurs and the crocodilian deinosuchuses.

Barely topping 11 feet tall and 1,000 pounds, marsh giants are small for giants but make up for their stature with their zealotry.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.
