Focused Assault.description: 捕蝇草用两对叶荚攻击同一目标。捕蝇草进行一次叶荚打击。一旦成功命中，捕蝇草造成一次叶荚打击的伤害，并且除了第一对叶荚外，每多一个叶荚就能造成额外@Damage[1d8[piercing]]伤害。即使攻击失败，捕蝇草仍然能造成一次叶荚伤害，但是它不能使用精通擒获能力。大失败则不造成伤害。此能力计算捕蝇草的多重攻击减值，次数等于捕蝇草的叶荚数。

Hungry Flurry.name: 饥饿猛击 Hungry Flurry
Hungry Flurry.description: 捕蝇草针对不同目标以-2减值进行两次叶荚打击。这些攻击计算捕蝇草的多重攻击减值，但是在攻击结束之后才会生效。

Zecui.name: Zecui
Zecui.publicNotes:
These chitinous entities can only grow to adulthood within a host creature, usually a humanoid or larger animal. When such hosts are particularly plentiful, zecuis can multiply at a horrifying rate, sealing hosts in subterranean chambers until their larvae grow to adulthood. However, during lean times, zecui adults will sate their hunger by eating those hosts along with any unlucky larvae gestating within, unable to be infested by their own young.

Between periods of wakefulness, zecuis hibernate for decades in burrows or buried within the soil. Sometimes an unincubated larva will be buried this way, waiting for a living host to come in contact with it. Once a zecui larva has gestated long enough to take control of its host, it may seek out larger and more powerful entities to devour the host, transferring themselves to a more plentiful source of food.

Preserve Prey.name: Preserve Prey
Preserve Prey.description:
Trigger A living creature within 30 feet is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The zecui channels corrupt vitality into the triggering creature, which still goes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} but does not gain the dying condition. While that creature is unconscious, the residual energy attempts to counteract any vitality spell healing that creature with a [[/r 1d20+15 #Counteract]]{+15} counteract modifier.

Dual Stab.name: Dual Stab
Dual Stab.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The zecui makes two shortsword Strikes against an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} target. These strikes count towards the zecui's multiple attack penalty, but it doesn't increase until after the second attack.

Harden Chitin.name: Harden Chitin
Harden Chitin.description: The zecui fuses much of their chitin into a black metallic shell. They gain resistance 5 to all damage (except mental and spirit) until they next take a move action.

Zecui Larvae.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]

Stage 1 visible lumps as the larvae move but no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and controlled by the zecui larva (1 day)

Stage 5 the creature dies and the adult zecui can emerge from the corpse as an Interact action
Zecui Larvae.name: Zecui Larvae

Spit Mucus.name: Spit Mucus
Spit Mucus.description: A creature hit by the zecui's spit attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the larva-infested mucus and stuck to the nearest surface until it [[/act escape dc=25]]{Escapes (DC 25)}. While that creature is immobilized, it is exposed to zecui larvae at the end of each of its turns.

Sedacthy Marauder.name: Sedacthy Marauder
Sedacthy Marauder.publicNotes:
Physically imposing sedacthies prove their status by controlling dangerous aquatic creatures like great white sharks and giant moray eels.

Sedacthies are amphibious, fish-like humanoids who lurk in Golarion's oceans and are known for leading their animal servants ashore to devour air breathers. When an entire fishing village disappears overnight, sedacthies are the first suspects. Sedacthies pride themselves as natural leaders, with ambition limited only by their strict adherence to hierarchy. A sedacthy's station is determined by the strength of the animal servants they press into service, and the mettle they prove during hunts and in battles against outsiders.

Sea Speech.name: Sea Speech
Sea Speech.description: A sedacthy speaking Thalassic can be understood by any animal that has a swim Speed or the amphibious or aquatic trait. By spending a week regularly interacting with such an animal, the sedacthy can make it permanently helpful.

Vengeful Throw.name: Vengeful Throw
Vengeful Throw.description:
Trigger The marauder takes damage from a creature 20 feet or further away

Effect The marauder makes a ranged spear Strike against the triggering creature. This attack doesn't take a range increment penalty if the target is within the second range increment.

Challenging Shriek.name: Challenging Shriek
Challenging Shriek.description:
The marauder unleashes a terrifying battle cry. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save. Regardless of the results, creatures are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Shared Feast.description: The sedacthy makes a jaws Strike. If it hits, an ally of their choice can spend a reaction to make a jaws Strike against the same target. Allies with beaks or similar attacks can use those instead of jaws.
Shared Feast.name: Shared Feast

Soulbound Doll (Gentle).name: 缚魂娃娃（温柔） Soulbound Doll (Gentle)
Soulbound Doll (Gentle).publicNotes:
缚魂娃娃是怪诞的人体模型或娃娃，被灌注了一小片已故凡人的灵魂。这些小小的构装体是由于各种各样的原因被创造出来的——比如说作为同伴或仆人——但是他们的自由意志意味着它们对于他们的创造者并非必然服从。法莱斯玛的信徒常常憎恶缚魂娃娃，认为这是对灵魂自然循环的扭曲，而墓穴女士的崇拜者乐意看到缚魂娃娃的破灭，而不考虑其行为，会将覆灭缚魂偶作为对伟大彼岸的重要服务。

在一系列缚魂构装体中，缚魂娃娃的制造是最简单的，这些构装体包括人形的缚魂人偶，强大的缚魂躯壳，和作为卫兵的缚魂兵马俑。用非自愿的活物创造娃娃是残忍的，非自愿的供体可以抵抗这个过程，通过一次意志检定来对抗创造者的手艺 DC，如果不能阻止灵魂供体的死亡，则会毁掉娃娃。如果某人生前同意使用，也可以用其灵魂制作娃娃。

冒险者遇到的缚魂娃娃通常都是某种守卫；尽管娃娃体型娇小，但灵魂碎片的力量让娃娃的拳头比旁人想象的更加危险。此外，鉴于娃娃的身材，灵魂碎片还能赋予娃娃一个威力巨大的法术。由于具有自主性和非凡的智慧，缚魂娃娃偶尔会被它们的制作者用作强大得多但无意识的构装体的管理者，使这些娃娃能够控制远远超出其自身能力的防御系统。

虽然缚魂娃娃包包含一名刚死不久的人的一小部分灵魂，但其实这不影响死者复活，或直接前往来世。这种灵魂提取的过程对活着的灵魂供体来说则是致命的。

灵魂碎片通常会注入一个镶嵌在娃娃胸部或脖子的灵魂聚焦宝石（硬度10）。灵魂碎片一般会保留原灵魂的强烈个性特征，但娃娃会从初始状态开始不断学习，这意味着它的性格和能力可以改变，可能会变得更像灵魂供体，也可能在自己的道路上越走越远。即使缚魂娃娃被摧毁，它的灵魂聚焦宝石也能保留娃娃的记忆。如果被摧毁的缚魂娃娃的灵魂聚焦宝石是完好的，那么它可以被一些精于缚魂操作的人重新放置到一个新娃娃的身体里，通过这种方法可以很有效的让缚魂娃娃重生。

Personality Fragments.name: 人格碎片 Personality Fragments
Personality Fragments.description: 缚魂娃娃拥有一部分灵魂提供者的人格碎片，尽管它没有任何生前的记忆。这使得缚魂娃娃与供体灵魂的强烈个性特征相匹配。由于它的灵魂碎片，因此缚魂娃娃拥有无法像大多数构装体一样对精魂免疫。

Giant Moray Eel.name: Giant Moray Eel
Giant Moray Eel.publicNotes:
Giant moray eels dwell in warm, tropical waters and build lairs in narrow, twisting caves made of coral. Their size, speed, and powerful bite make them dangerous to divers and fishers. Giant moray eels have rubbery hides that secrete a layer of mucus, making them difficult to harm with some weapons.

Although these long, narrow fish share similarities in appearance, eels are a diverse group of creatures.

Ambush.name: Ambush
Ambush.description:
Trigger A target creature passes within 20 feet of the giant moray eel's hiding place and has not detected the giant moray eel

Effect The giant moray eel lunges out of its hiding place, Swims directly toward the triggering creature, and makes a jaws Strike against it. The target creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to this attack.

Pharyngeal Jaws.name: Pharyngeal Jaws
Pharyngeal Jaws.description:
Requirements The giant moray eel has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its jaws

Effect The giant moray eel uses its second set of jaws to pull the prey into its gullet. The eel deals @Damage[(1d6+4)[piercing]] damage to the grabbed creature and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its Swallow Whole attempts and to the DC for the creature to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}. This effect ends if the target Escapes or the giant moray eel Swallows it Whole.

Eagle.publicNotes:
这些大型猛禽从令人难以置信的高度俯冲下来，用它们强有力的利爪迅速抓走鱼类和小型哺乳动物。鹰在高大的树顶或陡峭的悬崖上筑巢，可以把周围地区一览无余。

很少有鸟类能与鹰的美丽和优雅相媲美。
Eagle.name: 鹰 Eagle

Eagle Dive.name: 俯冲 Eagle Dive
Eagle Dive.description: 鹰以它的两倍飞行速度直线@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]，下降高度至少10尺，然后进行一次鸟爪打击。

Jabali.name: 土巨灵 Jabali
Jabali.publicNotes:
土巨灵诞生自土元素位面，是骄傲且坚硬的巨灵。他们重视身体技巧，喜欢讨价还价，概率游戏，以及金工和石工。

在凡人有史之前，巨灵是物质宇宙中最早拥有自由意志的造物之一。他们由元素物质组成，他们行遍物质宇宙和六大元素位面：气、土、火、金、水还有木。随着时间的推移，留在每个元素位面的巨灵发现他们的物质被这些元素所取代。金元素的金巨灵和木元素的木巨灵则见元素之怒。

巨灵长老 Genie Shuyookhs

更年长、更睿智、更强大的巨灵拥有更大的权力，被尊称为长老（通常而言，如果巨灵是女性，被称为“女长老”，如果巨灵是男性，则被称为“男长老”）。一般来说，长老至少比同族典型范例高5级，并且可以获得额外的法术。长老的基本知识见边栏，并在元素之怒中有进一步的详细介绍。

他们最神奇的力量是每年实现三次愿望的能力。这并非与生俱来的能力，而是通过流传已久的仪式作法来尝试复现小巨灵那实现愿望的能力。

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊） 60尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet

Earth Glide.name: 穿地 Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: 土巨灵可以用完整掘地速度@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]穿越泥土和岩石，不会留下隧道和经过痕迹。

Stone Clutch.name: 岩石紧抱 Stone Clutch
Stone Clutch.description: 当土巨灵推撞一个生物到岩石障碍上时，其表面会伸出石头手指握住他。目标必须成功通过一次@Check[type:reflex|dc:22]豁免，否则将@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于该表面（@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]DC 28）。

Horned Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Horned Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Horned Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
The magic that flows through primal dragons can manifest more animalistic or bestial features in a given type of dragon. Notably among these are the massive paired horns of the horned dragon. While their bulky frames, natural coloration, and prominent ridged scales are all remarkable in their own way, it's the horns that are most obvious and striking at first glance. Horned dragons use their horns to impale their prey in a quick and brutal display of their might. They are generally contemplative and have a fixation on knowledge and self-discipline, traits belied by their bestial appearance. As a result, horned dragons are generally more open to speaking with outsiders.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.

Twisting Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the dragon disrupts the creature's action.
Twisting Tail.name: Twisting Tail

Forest Passage.name: Forest Passage
Forest Passage.description: The horned dragon ignores any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don’t impede their progress.

Impaling Charge.name: Impaling Charge
Impaling Charge.description:
Requirements The dragon doesn't have a creature impaled on their horn

Effect The dragon attempts to gore a foe. They Stride, then attempt a horn Strike. On a hit, the target becomes impaled on the dragon's horn. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} while on the horn (and can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} as normal). The dragon doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the impaled creature grabbed. If the dragon moves, they bring the grabbed creature along with them.

Poison Breath.name: Poison Breath
Poison Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[9d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true] save).

They can't use Poison Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Poison Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Goblin War Chanter.name: 地精战咏者 Goblin War Chanter
Goblin War Chanter.publicNotes:
虽然所有地精都喜欢唱歌，但地精战咏者却为他们所掌握的歌唱艺术而自豪。不可否认的是，他们的民谣和短歌都很朗朗上口，而且在战斗中很好地发挥了作用，在激励地精的同时分散了敌人的注意力。然而这歌是否是令人愉快就是完全值得商榷的事情了。

这些小型类人生物通常有着绿色或是灰色的皮肤，大大的脑袋和宽大的耳朵。虽然有那么一些地精是文明的，并且努力成为类人生物社群中正直的一员，但有许多地精依旧还是鲁莽而又邪恶的生物，以制造破坏为乐。这些地精纯粹只是为了片刻的欢乐而屠杀牲畜、盗窃、或是烧毁建筑。他们沉迷于对那些被他们成为“长腿”——也就是那些比他们更高的类人生物——耍一些恶劣的把戏。

地精很迷信，对魔法有着强烈的敬畏，对火焰有着异乎寻常的迷恋；精通魔法或者火焰的地精会得到他们部族的尊敬。大多数其他类人生物都很难理解地精的观点：他们讨厌犬科动物却又热衷于和所谓的“地精犬”分享他们的巢穴，他们会无畏地攻击大型生物却又害怕马匹，他们鄙视蔬菜却又将腌菜作为美味佳肴。当然，对于一只地精而言，这些全都是极为明智的人生抉择。

Goblin Scuttle.description:
触发 一个地精盟友在与该地精相邻的位置结束其移动动作。

效果 地精战咏者@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{快步 Steps}。
Goblin Scuttle.name: 地精小跑 Goblin Scuttle

Goblin Song.name: 地精之歌 Goblin Song
Goblin Song.description:
地精战咏者唱着烦人的地精之歌，用愚蠢和重复的歌词分散敌人的注意力。战咏者尝试一次@Check[type:performance|traits:auditory,concentrate,linguistic]检定对抗@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30尺}内最多两个敌人的意志DC。这具有通常表演检定所带有的特征和限制。

大成功 目标在察觉检定和意志豁免上承受-1状态减值，持续1分钟。@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.bIRIS6mnynr72RDw]{效果: 地精之歌 (大成功)}

成功 同大成功，但是目标只在1轮内受其影响。@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.5veOBmMYQxywTudd]{效果: 地精之歌 (成功)}

大失败 目标临时免疫地精之歌1小时。

prototypeToken.name: 地精战咏者 Goblin War Chanter

Paleohemoth.name: 化石巨兽 Paleohemoth
Paleohemoth.publicNotes:
化石巨兽通常由恐龙骨骼化石或是其他远古巨兽的骨骼化石制成，尽管有些工匠扩展了这个定义，改为使用魔法石化的龙骨甚至是巨人骨骼。化石巨兽的形式没有定式，会被制作得尽可能可怕，而非是解剖学精度的模型。因此，绝大多数化石巨兽都是有着巨大手臂，其末端装有完整的如霸王龙这样顶尖掠食者颅骨的噩梦蜥形混合体，而他们的撕咬也强大得足以石化肉体。

完整的化石骨骼是难以企及的组件，更不用说整具骨架了。获取它们的一个替代方案便是雇佣老练的猎人或冒险家来寻找活着的恐龙，带回其骨头，或是使用魔法将它们石化。当然，一些纯粹主义者更喜欢真正的化石骨骼，并愿意为之花费巨资。无论如何，机会总是等待着有进取心的人，只要他们拥有合适的工具和几个宽敞的空间袋。

使得化石巨兽活化的魔法赋予了他们一种模块化的灵活性，使得他们通过瞬间重新组合四肢，用机动性换取了触及范围。这通常需要将腿部的骨骼移动到手臂上来延长手臂。这虽然导致解剖结构显得愚蠢，但十分有效。这种能力也让他们静止时看上去像是一团杂乱无章的骨头，使得他们很可能被误认为是装饰品，而非守卫。

创造这种生物的原因各不相同。虽然它们通常涉及于在幽深黑暗的地牢中保护邪恶的天才，但它们在其他地方也大有用武之地。更优雅的版本可以用来保护 上层收藏家的私人收藏。苏威雅（Thuvia）在他们的建筑竞技场中大量使用化石巨兽。虽然它们起初并不允许进行战斗，但利用漏洞，使它们在竞技场中大受欢迎。

Fossilization.name: 化石化 Fossilization
Fossilization.description:
每轮第一次某生物受到来自化石巨兽颚的伤害时，目标必须尝试一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:32]豁免。如果失败且尚未因此能力陷入缓慢，目标将陷入持续1分钟的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。

如果该生物已经因此能力陷入缓慢，豁免失败将导致其永久@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]。

Reassemble.name: 重组装 Reassemble
Reassemble.description: 化石巨兽重组了其骨骼，将其触及提升为25尺，降低其速度到15尺。它可以再次使用此动作来恢复至原始形态。

Greater Nightmare.name: 高等梦魇 Greater Nightmare
Greater Nightmare.publicNotes:
巨大的高等梦魇其价值在于能够带着骑手入侵其他现实的能力。

梦魇是一种浑身燃烧着的马，预兆着死亡。

Smoke.name: 喷烟 Smoke
Smoke.description:
20尺

高等梦魇不断喷出黑烟。灵光内的生物将对外部视作@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]，而灵光外部的生物对内部的生物也视作隐蔽。高等梦魇和它的骑手可以看穿这片烟雾。

在区域内开始回合的生物必须成功通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|traits:inhaled,poison]豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}。其随后对因该烟雾陷入恶心临时免疫1分钟。这是一种吸入性毒素，高等梦魇和它的骑手对其免疫。

Flaming Gallop.name: 烈焰飞驰 Flaming Gallop
Flaming Gallop.description: 高等梦魇以至多其三倍速度行走或飞行。它的蹄子迸发出猛烈的火焰，对驰骋过程中所有相邻的生物（骑手除外）造成@Damage[6d6[fire]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true]豁免）。在一次烈焰飞驰期间，每个生物只会被影响一次。

Zombie Brute.name: Zombie Brute
Zombie Brute.publicNotes:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Troll Warleader.name: Troll Warleader
Troll Warleader.publicNotes:
Long-lived trolls sometimes force their way through the twin distractions of hunger and pain to learn more about the world around them. To manage their regeneration, they learn to cover themselves in crude armor that slowly becomes integrated with the top layer of their flesh. Marked by this armor and aided by their superior wits, these warleaders gather a variety of trolls to serve them in raiding parties.

The warleader presented here is a forest troll, but warleaders can be other types of trolls as well. Many of them are adapted to battle tactics that are best suited to their home environments.

Slavering, cruel, invincible brutes: this is the villager's stock description for the dread monsters known as trolls. The roots of these stories are undoubtedly true. Trolls' flesh endlessly regrows, going so far as to sprout aberrant limbs or additional heads if not pruned, and a bottomless hunger is required to feed such unfettered growth. Even in the process of glutting themselves, however, trolls find opportunities to taunt their prey and inflict petty cruelties.

A troll's ability to survive is so strong that they believe even the smallest scrap of flesh will slowly regenerate into a new form, suffering as all the powers of the land are gathered to revive them. Despite the pain, trolls speak of this unassailable vitality as a blessing from their creator. Few trolls have heard the laughter of demons who claim that creator cursed the trolls and cast them down from lofty heights, binding them so they could never rise again.

Trolls prefer to remain solitary, keeping every scrap of food for themselves. In rare instances, an old and powerful troll comes to lead groups of trolls. Such warleaders possess enough cunning to lead their hordes in devastating raids and massacres, and their presence permanently alters the surrounding ecosystem. This link to their environment is an often misunderstood aspect of trollkind, and grows more acute with a troll's age and power. That's not to say trolls are valorous protectors of nature. They're vicious and territorial, and will blight their own territory forever if it means more to eat for a day.

Easily Misled.description: The forest troll gets a –4 circumstance penalty to their Perception DC against Deception checks.
Easily Misled.name: Easily Misled

Furious Roar.name: Furious Roar
Furious Roar.description:
Trigger The troll warleader takes electricity or fire damage

Effect The warleader uses their Primordial Roar and, if they're aware of the damage's source, can Stride toward it. If the warleader has persistent fire damage, they attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] to remove it.

Primordial Roar.name: Primordial Roar
Primordial Roar.description:
The troll warleader unleashes a bestial roar. Each non-troll creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:100] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save. The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Shed Armor.name: Shed Armor
Shed Armor.description:
The warleader cuts their armor loose from their flesh. They immediately heal @Damage[60[healing]]{60 Hit Points} in a surge of regeneration as they grow twisted limbs and malformed faces.

Without their armor, the warleader's AC drops to 26 but they gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.9qV49KjZujZnSp6w]{All-Around Vision} from the new faces.

Putting the armor back on takes 10 minutes, and this ability can't be used again until 1 hour has passed.

Sweeping Axes.name: Sweeping Axes
Sweeping Axes.description:
Requirements The troll warleader is wielding two battle axes

Effect The warleader makes a battle axe Strike against each creature in their reach and the bonus from sweep applies to each attack. These attacks count against their multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

Troll Warleader.ac: (26 plus all-around vision after Shed Armor)

Dromaar Mountaineer.name: Dromaar Mountaineer
Dromaar Mountaineer.publicNotes:
Dromaar mountaineers are hardened half-orc scouts who often lead raiding or scouting parties on dangerous expeditions. Dromaar scouts who lead many successful expeditions can rise to positions of prominence within their holds, and those who command enough loyalty may even claim a hold of their own.

Many orcs are forged in the fires of violence and conflict, often from the moment they're born. As they live lives that are frequently cut brutally short, orcs revel in testing their strength against worthy foes, whether by challenging a higher-ranking member of their community for dominance, taming a powerful beast, or slaying a fearsome monster.

Tall and powerful, with long arms and thickly muscled legs, many orcs top 7 feet in height. Their heavy limbs and broad, almost bow-legged stances combine with a tendency to slouch forward to create an almost contradictory set of circumstances where an orc can tower over other humanoids while simultaneously staring them in the eye. These features, alongside a tendency to scar easily, can make them seem quite intimidating.

The half-orc dromaars, most commonly born of unions between orcs and humans, are often tested even more harshly than their full orc kin, but those who endure these tests can rise to positions of authority. "An orc can have what an orc can hold" is a saying that not only applies to an individual's ability to secure their own destiny and position, but is also likely the root of orcs referring to their communities as holds.

Tangle Prey.name: Tangle Prey
Tangle Prey.description: The dromaar draws a bola and Strikes a target within 20 feet. On a success, the dromaar immediately rolls an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the target's Fortitude DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} them.

Caldera Oni.name: 火山鬼 Caldera Oni
Caldera Oni.publicNotes:
火山鬼就像充斥其家园的熔岩一样热血沸腾，对战争的刺激有着惊人的渴望。虽然它们参与战斗是为了征服和控制他人，但火鬼也喜欢战斗的快感，会为纯粹的乐趣而战斗。向火山鬼提出真正的挑战可能会赢得它们的怜悯，以及一份在其身侧效劳的邀请。

恶鬼是一种起源于天夏的大型野蛮生物，它们看上去是拥有鲜艳的皮肤、獠牙和犄角的类人生物。虽然通常被误认为是魔族，但最早的恶鬼最初是神灵，守护自然的精魂。这些神灵遭受了可怕的创伤，因为剧烈的灾难或人们的冷酷无情而失去了它们神圣的护（Wards），结果变成了如今的暴力生物。虽然有些人认为恶鬼可以通过适当的祭祀仪式在精神上被安抚，让它们变回神灵，但许多希望成为救世主的人却被恶鬼臭名昭著的野蛮力量，令人毛骨悚然的牙齿和对风暴的掌控所击倒。

恶鬼拥有伪装成其他类人生物的能力。它们的伪装少有创意，通常会选择与其恶鬼形态相似的特定外貌，并坚持使用。这种简单性让许多人认为恶鬼只局限于一种变幻形态，但事实并非如此。

Bean Panic.name: 恐豆 Bean Panic
Bean Panic.description: 恶鬼非常害怕豆子，尤其是当季节开始更替之际。如果有生物通过交互动作向恶鬼扔出一把豆子，恶鬼就将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。在以此法陷入惊惧时，其精魂伤害弱点将增加5。恶鬼随后免疫恐豆24小时。

Stoke the Volcano.name: 激怒火山 Stoke the Volcano
Stoke the Volcano.description: 当火山鬼被重击时，愤怒的火焰便会在其体内滋生。它会从灰烬形态或燃烧战舞中选择一项再充能。

Ash Form.name: 灰烬形态 Ash Form
Ash Form.description:
频率 每分钟一次

效果 火山鬼变成一团喷发而出的火山灰，然后飞行。此次移动不会触发反应动作，火山鬼可以移动穿越小缝隙或被其他生物占据的空间。

火山鬼随后变回其物质形态，并获得4环级@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]效果，持续[[/br 1d4 #Ash Form Duration]]{1d4轮}。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
火山鬼可以变形成任意中型或大型类人生物。这不会改变其速度，打击的攻击和伤害加值，但可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常变为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Dance of Burning War.name: 炙战舞 Dance of Burning War
Dance of Burning War.description:
频率 每分钟一次

效果 恶鬼的热烈变得势不可挡，致使它喷出过热的灰烬，在战场上舞动。火山鬼行走，然后进行一次近战打击。如果打击命中，恶鬼可以再次行走并再次打击，如此重复直到它打击未命中或总计进行了三次打击。

恶鬼随后停止舞蹈，召唤出一道火山闪电越出灰烬云。在战舞期间被打击命中过的每个生物受到@Damage[3d6[fire],3d6[electricity]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true]豁免。

Deinonychus.name: 恐爪龙 Deinonychus
Deinonychus.publicNotes:
恐爪龙是狡猾的捕猎者，他们组成多达一打数量的群体，成群结队地发起攻击，用锋利的爪子和有力的下颚撕扯猎物。它们瘦削而肌肉发达，有两条有力的腿和一条帮助它们保持平衡的长尾巴。尽管恐爪龙不使用他们的灵巧的前肢攻击，但是可以使用它们跨越小型障碍。有些恐爪龙有鳞片状的皮肤，大多数则有色彩鲜艳的羽毛。恐爪龙大约有6英尺高，150磅重。

这些巨大的爬行动物是世界原始时代的遗留物，现在仍然大量存在于偏僻的荒野中，或者在幽暗地域的地下魔法洞穴中。蜥蜴人、半兽人、巨人和其他人形生物有时会把恐龙当作坐骑、守卫或猎兽。众所周知，人类和其他族裔也收集恐龙，把它们放在动物园里展出，或把它们当作异域宠物或守卫。这通常是富人或怪咖喜欢干的事情，但确实也有一些德鲁伊和其他自然的守护者能与恐龙亲密相处，甚至把它们作为动物伙伴。当恐龙在它们正常栖息地以外的地区安家时，通常可能是因为被圈养的恐龙逃进荒野造成的。

Darting Strike.name: 突进攻击 Darting Strike
Darting Strike.description: 恐爪龙行走至多10尺然后进行1次打击，或是进行1次打击后行走至多10尺。

Poracha.name: Poracha
Poracha.publicNotes:
Porachas are feline beasts native to the mystical Forest of Spirits in Tian Xia. In their natural form, these graceful eight-legged creatures sport a gray tabby coat of fur streaked with lines of olive green, but they are rarely seen this way. Even the youngest porachas are capable of hiding within objects, making them incredibly elusive and rarely seen except on their own terms. Because porachas can so effortlessly blend in with the forest and emerge from its dark corners in an instant, superstitious locals believe these beasts are related to kami—nature spirits who embody individual trees, stones, or other elements of nature in the Forest of Spirits. The truth is, while porachas frequently associate with kami, they are their own breed of monster.

The poracha's most iconic feature is its ability to bend reality to teleport, or jaunt, short distances. But a poracha can also rest within objects, allowing it to safely sleep inside. Given that a poracha experiences time very slowly while hiding within objects, it can sleep inside one for an extended period. Once it wakes, a poracha departs to play in the living world.

Porachas especially enjoy resting inside roadside milestones, to maximize their chances of coming across travelers. Porachas rarely tread humanoid-occupied lands, preferring the company of the kami and their natural habitat in the Forest of Spirits. Though they enjoy occasional conversation, they're extremely sensitive to sound; they speak softly and request the same from those they speak with. Their territories span vast swaths of the wood, making them ideal allies for hunters or treasure seekers who would otherwise become lost in the dense trees. But porachas are nothing if not fickle, and typically demand inscrutable favors in return for their aid, such as the planting of a rare sapling or the clearing of an invasive monster species. Any attempt to coerce or trick a poracha into service is ill advised, for these sacred beasts have many friends among the kami as well as others of their kind. Though they generally don't travel in groups, porachas know where to find more of their kind in times of need, and an organized pack of porachas is a disorienting threat.

Jaunt.name: Jaunt
Jaunt.description:
The poracha teleports up to 40 feet to a location it can see.

It can't use Jaunt again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge use Jaunt]]{1d4 rounds}.

Object Meld.description:
The poracha touches an adjacent object of enough volume to contain it. It merges into the object indefinitely, and while it's inside, time moves exceptionally slowly for it and it has only limited perception of the outside world. The poracha can sense what's going on outside the object only using tremorsense.

The poracha can use only mental actions or Jaunt; if it Jaunts, it leaves the object and appears where it chooses. If a creature Strikes the object, the poracha is expelled unharmed.
Object Meld.name: Object Meld

Lesser Death.name: 次级死神 Lesser Death
Lesser Death.publicNotes:
没人确切知道次级死神为何物，尽管有些人声称他们是收割者死神的化身。然而与那个奇诡的猎手不同的是，次级死神在某些罕见的情况下会成群结队地捕猎。通常它们会从被诅咒的魔法物品中显现。另外一些时候，它们只是扮演着死亡本身，如同收割者死神所做的那样——默默收割，从不懊悔，也无宽恕。在很罕见的情况下，多个次级死神合力消灭大量人口，他们的镰刀扫过人群，收割整个城市的生命，并且（可能是故意地）引发了关于有很多个收割者死神的谣言。

收割者死神坚定不移的死亡化身。它沉寂如坟墓，如同时间本身一样无可避免，这个传说中的存在追捕并杀死那些逃避死亡太久的生物。有时候收割者死神会毫无预兆地降临，完成那些其他生物无法完成的任务。收割者死神不侍奉神祇，魔族（fiend），御衡者（aeon），或异界存在。招魂者（psychopomps）和天族（celestials）们既鄙视又畏惧它，但很少有人敢于阻挡它的道路。它就像某种永恒的瘟疫，杀死那些试图消除多元宇宙中它的存在的人。收割者死神绝世独立，秉持自己下达的判决。一旦收割者死神选择好的猎物，无论凡人或不朽者的恳求和辩解它都充耳不闻。它的动机从未为人所知，但无论出于何种目的，其结果都是不可动摇、无法改变的。

虽然传说认为收割者死神会在每个人死的时候出现在他们面前，但真相其实有些出入。执行这种守夜其实是招魂者的职责范围，它们是不朽的存在，负责保护和引导死后凡人的灵魂前往来世。收割者死神只是在推行天启骑士（Apocalypse Riders）所统治的末日荒原（Abaddon）的邪恶议程。的确，收割者死神和死亡骑士卡戎（Charon, the Rider of Death）之间有许多相似之处，但没有任何证据表明这两个实体合作过。相反，冷酷的死神本身就是末日荒原的具现，这方面被一些人认为是神秘的原初骑士（First Rider）的化身。当收割者死神降临到某个世界时，它并非作为仁慈的天使，而是作为一个无情的生命收割机而存在。那些落入收割者死神手中的生物不一定是注定该死的，他们也一视同仁地被选择、被追猎、被谋杀。

也许那些关于死神的传说中，最让人不寒而栗的是它作为一个唯一实体的本质。因为有些人不相信只有唯一的死神存在于世。谣传有至少九名收割者死神组成的一个议会，他们在现实中潜行，屠杀生灵，为真实之熵效力。根据一些死亡邪教的教义，收割者死神的最终目标是结束整个生死循环，成为空虚宇宙静默的主宰。
Lesser Death.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Death's Grace.name: 死亡恩赐 Death's Grace
Death's Grace.description: 对于判断是否属于不死生物而产生区别的效果，次级死神可自由选择是否作为不死生物接受。即便次级死神不将自身视为不死生物，它亦无法被视为活物。

Status Sight.description: 次级死神能自动知晓视线所及的所有生物的HP、状态、苦难以及情绪。
Status Sight.name: 状态视觉 Status Sight

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Aura of Misfortune.name: 厄运灵光 Aura of Misfortune
Aura of Misfortune.description:
20尺

灵光范围内所有活着的生物在所有基于d20的掷骰中必须掷骰两次，并且取较低的结果。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QoneHsjZKtGHWlam]{效果：厄运灵光}

Lurking Death.name: 暗藏杀机 Lurking Death
Lurking Death.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物进行一次远程攻击，或进行一个带有专注、操作、移动特征的动作

效果 次级死神传送到触发目标相邻的空间，然后对其进行一次近战打击。如果打击命中，次级死神打断该触发动作。

Void Healing.name: 虚能治疗 Void Healing
Void Healing.description:
次级死神可以选择是否受到命能伤害。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.NegativeHealing]

Infuse Weapon.name: 灌注武器 Infuse Weapon
Infuse Weapon.description: 次级死神所持握的任何巨镰都获得灵巧特性，并且无法被卸武，自动成为+2高等强击锐锋巨镰。

Giant Hippocampus.publicNotes:
巨海驹生活在海洋的最深处，在海岸附近从未有人见过，通常它们被认为是水手们编造的传说。

这种被称为海驹的奇怪动物，从头到身体都像陆地上的马，但在它们的腿上长着张开的鳍而不是蹄自，并且下半身是像鱼一样的有力的尾巴。海驹有五颜六色的鳞片，从珍珠白色到海草绿色不等，还有亮丽的背鳍状的鬃毛。在狂野的大海中，大多数类型的海驹都倾向于聚集在海草和海藻林附近的浅滩，那里能为它们提供食物并作为躲避捕食者的庇护所。它们群居生活以保证的安全，就像陆地上的马组成马群一样。

海驹很受海底社会和海边居民的珍视，因为海驹和马一样容易训练，而且能实现许多相似的功能，如驮畜、战争坐骑、拉船或作为宠物饲养。虽然海驹可以穿戴马铠，但这对它们的影响很大，所以大多数训练员都让他们轻装上阵。更多的时候，它们被训练用来拉特殊设计的水下战车或水橇。海驹不能离开水，因为它们在陆地上很笨拙，不能忍受骑手骑着它们在地面上扑腾，无法长时间呼吸空气。

海驹有许多不同的亚种存在，尽管大多数海驹只是在颜色上存在不同。更忠心耿耿的亚种，如极地海驹，专门居住在北极水域，它的数据以普通海驹套上精英模板的形式呈现。

Sudden Retreat.name: 突然撤退 Sudden Retreat
Sudden Retreat.description: 巨海驹进行一次鱼尾打击，然后以+10尺环境加值的游泳速度进行游泳。如果此行动触发反应动作，它的对抗此反应动作的AC获得+2环境加值。

Giant Hippocampus.name: 巨海驹 Giant Hippocampus

Brontosaurus.publicNotes:
雷龙是真正巨大的庞然大物，它们是步履缓慢的食草动物，大到除了最大型的捕食者之外几乎没有天敌。雷龙身体很长，弯曲的脖子和小型的脑袋让他们可以从最高的树梢处享用嫩芽。虽然它们的脚能踩碎整个建筑物，但这些食草动物通常都很平和，并且会选择合适的地方下脚。

这些巨大的爬行动物是世界原始时代的遗留物，现在仍然大量存在于偏僻的荒野中，或者在幽暗地域的地下魔法洞穴中。蜥蜴人、半兽人、巨人和其他人形生物有时会把恐龙当作坐骑、守卫或猎兽。众所周知，人类和其他族裔也收集恐龙，把它们放在动物园里展出，或把它们当作异域宠物或守卫。这通常是富人或怪咖喜欢干的事情，但确实也有一些德鲁伊和其他自然的守护者能与恐龙亲密相处，甚至把它们作为动物伙伴。当恐龙在它们正常栖息地以外的地区安家时，通常可能是因为被圈养的恐龙逃进荒野造成的。

Tail Sweep.name: 尾部横扫 Tail Sweep
Tail Sweep.description:
雷龙进行1次尾巴打击，并将攻击掷骰结果和最多三名敌人的AC比较，每一个敌人都必须在雷龙尾巴近战触范围内，且至少和另一个敌人相邻。它只需要丢一次伤害掷骰并对命中的每一个目标造成相同的伤害。

尾部横扫在计算多重攻击减值时视作两次攻击。

Brontosaurus.name: 雷龙 Brontosaurus

Zoaem.publicNotes:
这些永远好奇的圣使是由赋予了实体的旋转光轮构成的。它们担任圣使军团的瞭望员与机动支援部队，有时会集结形成称为“格式塔”的强大光明斗士。规模更大的佐阿姆甚至能暂时融合成更强大的圣使，更接近原初佐阿姆的力量，祂将自己打散以有效地服务天堂。

圣使是天堂（Heaven）的守护者、腐化的敌人。早在诸神与他们的仆人涉足天界位面前，圣使就已作为此地的原住民栖息在那了。打一照面，圣使和神圣天使很快便发现他们是一类人，心中皆怀着正义与公义。联盟由此成立，如今，圣使们是所有天族与他们信赖的凡人们的忠实盟友。

当第一位圣使从宏伟的天堂七层山脉凝聚成形后，他们会选择来到天堂的灵魂中有意愿也有资格的加入他们的行列。这些凡人听到并回应了一个神秘声音的召唤，在山顶的花园（the Garden）中显形。在那里，他们发誓永远为正义事业服务，脱胎换骨成为新的圣使。

虽然圣使们十分在意保卫凡人的生命，并愿意在对抗魔族的战斗中牺牲自我，他们总让人觉得死板又难以捉摸，他们的外观也几乎能称得上骇人且怪异。因此，他们在与凡人或自由奔放的灵使交互时时常遇到困难。尽管如此，圣使从还是能从他人身上汲取强大力量，尤其是那些堪称楷模的贤德之人。

除了他们的天族盟友，圣使还与御衡者维持着古老的联系。时至今日，我们仍能见到个高深莫测的集团一起合作，共同捍卫尘封已久的秘密，执行早在凡人诞生前创立的规则。圣使仅将这些行为解释为必要之举，不做进一步的说明；在这点上，哪怕是圣使的天使盟友也对他们的固执感到沮丧。

Archon's Protection.name: 圣使护卫 Archon's Protection
Archon's Protection.description:
触发 一个敌人伤害圣使的盟友，且该敌人和该盟友皆距离圣使15尺内

效果 该盟友在对抗触发伤害时获得全部伤害抗力3，圣使可对触发本能力的敌人进行一次打击。

Behold!.name: 看哪！ Behold!
Behold!.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 佐阿姆的环与翼以复杂的模式移动，@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]或60尺距离内的@Template[type:burst|distance:5]范围内的生物会被迷惑。（作用范围由佐阿姆决定）。范围内的每个生物都必须进行@Check[type:will|dc:17]豁免，检定失败则会被佐阿姆@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]并获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}（大失败则会震慑1轮）。

Light of Truth.description:
佐阿姆发出耀眼的真相之光，效果如同@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]（@Check[type:reflex|dc:17]豁免）但范围为@Template[type:line|distance:60]。在对抗受本能力影响的生物时，佐阿姆及其盟友的伤害骰和回忆知识检定均获得+1状态加值。佐阿姆在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Light of Truth]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用本能力。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.hekJBWsLxkt8zd7x]{效果：揭示之光}
Light of Truth.name: 揭示之光 Light of Truth

Zoaem.name: 佐阿姆 Zoaem

Lizardfolk Defender.name: Lizardfolk Defender
Lizardfolk Defender.publicNotes:
A lizardfolk defender serves as a protector of the young, guardian of the settlement, and when no other options are available, a soldier in times of war. They eagerly rise to the defense of their kin but do not revel in battle. An iruxi defender would rather turn back intruders and allow them to flee with the knowledge they were beaten, in hopes that such word prevents further invasions, but they are not naive. Iruxis understand the need for revenge, and when they allow a foe to escape, they do not forget.

Capable and adaptable predators, the reptilian beings known as lizardfolk are heirs to truly ancient civilizations. Their oral traditions cover thousands of years, and they revere the bones of their ancestors. Fossilized lizardfolk are even built into the walls of lizardfolk's stone and glass cities, to allow these predecessors to watch over their kin. Lizardfolk likewise have longstanding traditions of religious worship and astrology, with eyes on the past, the future, and the stars whenever they make a large decision. Their long history has taught them to be patient in all things, though this has seen them losing ground to hastier peoples in modern times.

Lizardfolk refer to themselves as "iruxi," though they have taken their common moniker among other peoples in stride. Most of their settlements are entirely communal, with hatchlings raised by anyone with the time and temperament for such a role. Iruxis dwell and thrive in all tropical and temperate biomes, but they are most at home in swamplands, coastal regions, and river lands. They are talented swimmers, and many of their major cities are partially submerged to take advantage of this fact, causing them to often be overlooked by others. Fish and aquatic plants make up a large part of their preferred diets.

Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: A lizardfolk defender can hold their breath for 15 minutes.

Terrain Advantage.name: Terrain Advantage
Terrain Advantage.description: Non-lizardfolk creatures that are in difficult terrain or are in water and lack a swim Speed are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the lizardfolk defender.

Skeletal Horse.name: Skeletal Horse

Gallop.name: Gallop
Gallop.description: The horse Strides twice, with its Speed increased by 10 feet.

Undead Steed.name: Undead Steed
Undead Steed.description: Undead and creatures allied with them can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command} a skeletal steed without needing to attempt a skill check.

Skeletal Horse.publicNotes:
Skeletal horses are sometimes used as mounts by other undead or monsters.

Animated skeletons are among the most common types of undead.

Aapoph Serpentfolk.name: Aapoph Serpentfolk
Aapoph Serpentfolk.publicNotes:
Aapophs possess greater strength and stronger venom than their zyss kin, but they lack zyss's innate magic. Unlike their selfish superiors, aapophs are communal and group together to hunt, wrestle, and sleep curled together in pits.

Aapophs often have physical mutations—horns, vestigial tails, or spines protruding from their scales—yet these have little impact on their overall combat prowess—and combat prowess is the measure by which zyss judge them.

Before their ancient clash with humanity devastated their civilization, serpentfolk were masters of a sprawling underground empire. Their power was shattered and their god Ydersius decapitated (although not quite slain). The cunning, intelligence, and magical abilities of serpentfolk have diminished from their ancient heights, and most are born without these boons. This is partially the result of cruel genetic meddling among serpentfolk—though the ruling class, zyss, are born with an innate spellcasting ability, their blood runs thin, making them susceptible to wounds. Seen as the failures of the serpentfolk's experiments are the aapophs, who are strong but prone to mutation and lack innate spellcasting.

Today, the central realm of the Darklands retains the old name of the serpentfolk empire that once dominated this region—Sekamina. This name is also the source of the serpentfolk's Aklo title, sekmin, which they are often called in ancient texts. Serpentfolk dominion had declined before ghouls, gugs, umbral gnomes, and other forces. Yet their recent ventures have brought them back to a stronger place in the Darklands. Many serpentfolk sleeping in torpor in secluded vaults have awakened.

Zyss serpentfolk tend toward megalomania, with dreams of returning to their place of dominance. Many of their plans hinge on resurrecting Ydersius, their decapitated god. His headless body still thrashes about, mindless, in the Darklands, waiting to be reunited with his lost skull. Serpentfolk numbers are so small that reclaiming their dominance seems a distant dream, especially since their reproduction is slow. Though a parent can birth a dozen young at once, the gestation period lasts up to a decade, and the likelihood that even one will be zyss is low. There's no telling whether a child will be zyss or aapoph, regardless of parentage. A coveted zyss child is just as likely to arise from aapoph parents as from two zyss, and every serpentfolk colony has someone in charge of sorting the young, identifying the earliest signs of magic in them.

Serpentfolk Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)
Serpentfolk Venom.name: Serpentfolk Venom

+2 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental.name: +2 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental

Slithering Attack.name: Slithering Attack
Slithering Attack.description: The aapoph serpentfolk makes one scimitar or fangs Strike and one tail Strike, each targeting a different creature. These attacks both count toward the aapoph's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the aapoph makes both attacks.

Aapoph Serpentfolk.allSaves: +2 status to will saves vs. mental

Warg.publicNotes:
座狼就和狼一样成群狩猎，但它们喜欢玩弄受害者，这使得它们能很容易地与表亲区分开。兽人和大地精经常招募座狼。大多数座狼都愿意接受这种协议，但如果食物耗尽，座狼十分愿意将地精的肉作为食物。

座狼是一种聪明又狠毒的狼，栖息在地精、大地精、兽人和其他残暴类人生物之中。

Pack Attack.name: 成群袭击 Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: 座狼的打击对触及范围内至少有两名座狼盟友的生物，造成1d4额外伤害。

Avenging Bite.name: 复仇啃咬 Avenging Bite
Avenging Bite.description:
触发 一个在座狼颚攻击触及范围内的生物攻击了座狼的盟友

效果 座狼对触发生物进行一次颚打击。

Warg.name: 座狼 Warg

Ogre Glutton.name: Ogre Glutton
Ogre Glutton.publicNotes:
Ogre gluttons take the act of feeding to a horrific extreme, capable of extending their already cavernous mouths wide enough to gulp down a halfling. Stories of ogre gluttons being tricked into eating razor-edged shields or barrels filled with poisoned meat are common, but such tales are of little consolation to those who have been gobbled whole by these ravenous giants. In addition to their sadistic table manners, ogre gluttons have a disturbing knack for coming up with violent "games" that are little more than drawn-out torments, yet those who somehow manage to beat a glutton at the rules of their own game can often enrage the ogre enough that the resulting tantrum provides an opportunity for the captives to escape.

For many societies, ogres embody brutish, amoral violence and greedy cruelty. Standing 10 feet tall and densely muscled, ogres are usually as strong as they are vicious. The worst ogres are sadists, enjoying remorseless murder, torture, and violence in all of its forms. Although they prefer to vent their violent urges on other humanoids—the smaller the better—ogre captivity can end in a horrifying fate for anyone unlucky enough to fall within their meaty grasp: becoming dinner. But for all their creativity in inflicting pain, ogres often forget that their playthings lack their own robust fortitude and high pain tolerance, and many of their captives die sooner than the ogres might prefer. Meanwhile, those who manage to survive captivity in an ogre's larder often emerge with lasting mental scars. A captive able to keep their wits about them, however, can sometimes trick the brutes by promising treasure, more plentiful food sources, or other crude amusements, taking advantage of an ogre's often-limited intellect to engineer opportunities to escape or gain revenge.

Ogres are social creatures only in the most debased sense. They gather together in groups called families, though members are not always related by blood. The most powerful ogre in any family is the "boss"—usually the family's patriarch or matriarch—whom the other ogres in the family learn to quickly obey or risk being brutalized by the boss's loyal kin. Ogres lair in caves, crumbling ruins, or dilapidated shacks close enough to humanoid settlements or animal trails to make raiding easy. Their lairs are filthy and frequently contain all-too-recognizable evidence of their depravity, along with assorted treasures stolen from past captives.

Glutton's Feast.name: Glutton's Feast
Glutton's Feast.description: If the ogre glutton damages a living creature with their jaws Strike, they gain [[/r 1d4 #Temporary Hit Points]]{1d4 temporary Hit Points} for 1 minute.

Glutton's Rush.name: Glutton's Rush
Glutton's Rush.description: The ogre glutton Strides twice and makes a jaws Strike. If they damage a living creature with this Strike, the temporary Hit Points they receive from Glutton's Feast is increased to [[/r 2d4 #Temporary Hit Points]]{2d4}.

Deinosuchus.publicNotes:
恐鳄是鳄鱼的远古祖先，是一种巨大的掠食者，能够捕食那些误入领地的恐龙!

鳄鱼强大且具有原始的外表，是危险的天然掠食者，栖息在沼泽、河流、池塘和其他湿地。

Deep Breath.description: 恐鳄能屏住呼吸长达2小时之久。
Deep Breath.name: 闭气 Deep Breath

Deinosuchus.name: 恐鳄 Deinosuchus

Giant Anaconda.name: 巨蟒 Giant Anaconda
Giant Anaconda.publicNotes:
巨蟒能够能够吞噬整个像马那么大的生物，更不用说骑手了。尽管新手荒野旅客会小心警惕可能从头顶树冠中掉下的蛇，但巨蟒在池塘和河流中最为常见，在那它们以海牛和水豚为食。这种狩猎策略使巨蟒能够在将猎物勒紧的同时淹死它，从而减少在狩猎时受伤的几率。尽管冒险家们散布了耸人听闻的故事，但这些蛇很少攻击类人生物。

蛇的种类多样，从盘踞密林缠卷猎物的蟒蛇，到有着致命啮咬的剧毒蝰蛇。不管怎样，所有的蛇都是通过张开其双颚整个吞咽猎物，再利用充满力量的肌肉将食物从喉腔转移至胃部消化。

Tighten Coils.description:
触发 一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于巨蟒或被巨蟒@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]的生物尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]

效果 逃脱检定的DC加2。
Tighten Coils.name: 紧收缠缚 Tighten Coils

Slither.name: 蛇行 Slither
Slither.description: 巨蟒以其半速行走、攀爬或游泳，拖动@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于它的生物。

Wrap in Coils.name: 蜷曲缠缚 Wrap in Coils
Wrap in Coils.description:
需求 一个不超过大型的生物，被巨蟒的颚@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或者@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]

效果 巨蟒缠绕上生物，从而腾出嘴用于发动攻击，而后对该生物使用高等紧勒。巨蟒可以盘住在它占据方格内的所有生物。

Giant Eagle.name: 巨鹰 Giant Eagle
Giant Eagle.publicNotes:
巨鹰并非是区区动物，它们睿智并且有强烈的荣誉感。作为它们山区家园的守护者，巨鹰试图阻止文明对荒野的侵蚀，以及邪恶的人形生物聚落对自然的掠夺。和一般的独居的鹰不同的是，可能有一打巨鹰共同生活在同一个巢穴中，它们共同防御自己的领地。

巨鹰的翼展可达30尺宽，体重可达500磅。这些令人印象深刻的巨鸟不容易被击败或吓退。巨鹰可能会让值得信赖的盟友骑在它身上，但它们会抵制鞍具、挽具等装备，因为这让它们看起来更像是负重的牲畜而非值得信赖的伙伴。巨鹰寿命很长，对背负的义务和誓言都非常认真，常常会记仇多年，很难轻易原谅别人。

很少有鸟类能与鹰的美丽和优雅相媲美。

Carry.name: 携行 Carry
Carry.description: 一个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]于巨鹰的鸟爪中时，它能以一半的速度飞行，并带着目标一起移动。

Eagle Dive.name: 俯冲 Eagle Dive
Eagle Dive.description: 巨鹰能最多以它的两倍飞行速度直线@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]，下降高度至少10尺，然后进行一次鸟爪打击。

Evasive Maneuvers.name: 机动规避 Evasive Maneuvers
Evasive Maneuvers.description: 当巨鹰成功进行反射豁免时，其结果视为大成功。

Living Whirlwind.name: Living Whirlwind
Living Whirlwind.publicNotes:
A living whirlwind resembles a dust devil with a vague mouth and eyes formed among the dust and debris swirling within it.

Hailing from the Plane of Air, these beings appear in a variety of sizes and shapes. They're noted for being elusive, swift, and often difficult to detect due to being composed primarily of air.

Disperse.description:
Trigger The living whirlwind takes damage from a hostile action;

Effect The living whirlwind disperses. Until the end of the current turn, it can't be attacked or targeted, doesn't take up space, and its high winds aura is suppressed.

At the end of the turn, the living whirlwind reforms in any unoccupied space within 25 feet of where it dispersed, and its high winds are restored.
Disperse.name: Disperse

High Winds.name: High Winds
High Winds.description:
20 feet.

Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures that don't have the air trait.

Swiftness.name: Swiftness
Swiftness.description: The living whirlwind's movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Forceful Winds.name: Forceful Winds
Forceful Winds.description: The living whirlwind creates a @Template[type:line|distance:60] of violent wind. Creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save or be pushed back 10 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Hobgoblin General.name: Hobgoblin General
Hobgoblin General.publicNotes:
Hobgoblin generals serve as leaders of entire armies and rulers of hobgoblin settlements. A general does not permit the luxuries of rule to soften them. They lead their forces on the field of battle and view this opportunity to excel in a fight at the head of an army as the true reward for a life spent honing one's skills in battle.

Hobgoblins may appear to outsiders to be the most civilized of goblinkind, but their civilization is hardly one of kindness and equality-instead, they revel in all that is militaristic, tyrannical, cruel, and destructive. Hobgoblins are singularly devoted to war, and their entire culture is built upon fostering and maintaining conflict while simultaneously proving their superiority in battle. Hobgoblins are highly organized, and they work efficiently and effectively in groups, whether that group is a small raiding party, a roving war band, or a fully regimented army. Hobgoblin rulers require little provocation before declaring war, and more often than not, such wars are waged to gain slaves or territory. Physically, hobgoblins stand about as tall as humans and have gray, ashen skin.

Hobgoblin society is organized along military lines, and every hobgoblin is effectively a member of the army. Each hobgoblin in a community has a rank in the military hierarchy, and individuals are naturally ambitious and obsessed with advancement. Hobgoblins are constantly expected to prove that they're fearless, ruthless, cunning, and strong. Demonstrating such aptitudes is an individual hobgoblin's best hope for promotion through the ranks, but failure leads only to cruel exploitation at the hands of their superiors. Though brutal, hobgoblin society is a true meritocracy, and all hobgoblins, regardless of age, gender, or birth, wield authority and earn respect from their peers based on their skill in battle. Even those individuals who serve in non-combat roles in hobgoblin society-blacksmiths, builders, cooks, messengers, quartermasters, and the like-know that they perform vital jobs that support the larger hobgoblin army, though they rarely rise above the rank of common soldier. Everyone contributes to the larger whole, ensuring that hobgoblin society is the strongest and most efficient it can be, and anyone who fails to do so is culled from the army and this hobgoblin society as dead weight. Hobgoblins don't usually engage in trade with other races, or even with other hobgoblin tribes, preferring to take what they want by force.

General's Cry.description: When a hobgoblin general rolls initiative, as long as they can perceive at least one foe, they can yell a mighty battle cry. The hobgoblin general attempts an Intimidate check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a single foe within 60 feet as a free action. If successful, any ally with the goblin trait can, as its first action on its first turn of the combat, Stride up to double its speed as a single action.
General's Cry.name: General's Cry

Formation.name: Formation
Formation.description: When it's adjacent to at least two other allies, the hobgoblin general gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.

Polearm Critical Specialization.name: Polearm Critical Specialization
Polearm Critical Specialization.description: On a critical hit, the target of the critical hit is moved 5 feet in a direction of the hobgoblin general's choice.

Cinder Rat.name: Cinder Rat
Cinder Rat.publicNotes:
These oversized rodents are made of smoldering charcoal and elemental fire, and noxious fumes continually bellow from their flaming flesh. Even other fire elementals find cinder rats unpleasant and are glad when they're summoned away from the Plane of Fire.

Fire elementals are destructive manifestations of the scorching Plane of Fire. Although most fire elementals revel in the chance to experience new kinds of fires away from their home plane, even the most considerate fire elemental can be a danger to humanoids and their property.

Fetid Fumes.description:
5 feet.

A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn there must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Everything within the aura, including the cinder rat, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by smoke.
Fetid Fumes.name: Fetid Fumes

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The cinder rat ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Giant Bat.name: 巨蝙蝠 Giant Bat
Giant Bat.publicNotes:
虽然在黑暗的洞穴和凋敝的废墟中，大型蝙蝠并不罕见，而且可能会让那些神经脆弱的洞穴探险者觉得恐怖，但是这里所描述的巨型蝙蝠才是真正的怪物，它们的体重远远超过100磅，翼展也在15尺以上。它们主要以水果和虫子为食，但是也会因为恐惧或饥饿而产生攻击行为。巨型蝙蝠的袭击会迅速引发关于更危险的怪物的谣言——许多人会误以为这些巨大的动物是某种恶魔或吸血鬼变身而来。但是就像其他蝙蝠一样，巨型蝙蝠只是一种群居且聪明的哺乳动物。它们有的时候被较小体型的类人生物——通常是那些山区或地下国度的居民当做坐骑使用。

种类繁多的蝙蝠生活在世界各个角落。这些夜行动物大多是无害的食虫动物，但致命品种的吸血蝙蝠和体型像马一样大的巨型蝙蝠对冒险者们来说是较大的威胁。

Echolocation (Precise) 40 feet.description: 巨蝙蝠的听觉在列出的范围内是精确感官。
Echolocation (Precise) 40 feet.name: 回声定位（精确）40尺 Echolocation (Precise) 40 feet

Wing Thrash.name: 翼扫 Wing Thrash
Wing Thrash.description:
触发 一个相邻敌人对巨蝙蝠造成伤害。

效果 巨蝙蝠选择进行一次或二次蝠翼打击——第一次针对触发该能力的生物，第二次针对另一个相邻生物。

Omen Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Omen Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Omen Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Fate is a fickle matter on Golarion. Even with prophecy broken on the world, there are ways to look to the immediate future or acquire a vague sense of long-term events. Omen dragons are bound to see the future—nebulous though it might be—at all times. Visions of the future hound them like a quiet song that never stops playing in their minds. While an omen dragon can focus on or ignore the music of fate at any time, the song plays all the same. At a glance, omen dragons resemble other occult dragons in appearance, save for the mirror-like interior membrane of their wings. An omen dragon's wings offer glimpses into the future. These glimpses are cloudy and vague, but generally correct, if only technically. Omen dragons have a natural compulsion to share the futures they see. These dragons have no compunctions about what the visions show and share their knowledge equally with innocent villagers as they do with wicked tyrants.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Challenge Fate.name: Challenge Fate
Challenge Fate.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack;

Effect This fate is not set in stone. The attacker rolls the triggering attack twice and uses the worse result.

Untethered to Fate.name: Untethered to Fate
Untethered to Fate.description: The dragon can choose to negate any fortune or misfortune effects that would affect them; other creatures remain affected normally.

Destiny Breath.name: Destiny Breath
Destiny Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a translucent mist of potentialities that overwhelms creatures with visions of possible features, dealing @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:will|dc:30] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) as it struggles with the visions.

The dragon can't use Destiny Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Destiny Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Prophetic Wings.description:
The dragon or any ally can glimpse into the future through the dragon's wings in a process that requires 10 minutes of concentration. This casts a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} spell, except that the wings can predict results up to 1 month into the future and the dragon always speaks a few cryptic words related to the result of the prediction.

The dragon can use their wings in this way only once per day, and a given creature can seek a future in the wings only once per week.
Prophetic Wings.name: Prophetic Wings

Walk the Timelines.name: Walk the Timelines
Walk the Timelines.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The dragon splits themself into two versions with different fates. Each copy Strides or Flies from the dragon's current space, then takes a single action. If the actions are both attacks, they use the same multiple attack penalty and count as one attack toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty.

After both actions, the dragon chooses one of the two locations as their actual destination and the other version of themself disappears.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Omen Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

Zombie Shambler.name: Zombie Shambler
Zombie Shambler.publicNotes:
A zombie shambler is a slow-moving horror dangerous in larger groups.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Lawbringer Warpriest.name: Lawbringer Warpriest
Lawbringer Warpriest.publicNotes:
Mortals whose ancestry has been influenced by archons are called lawbringers. They may have mortal ancestors who fought alongside archons against the forces of evil and entropy, or they may have been born from a union between an archon and a mortal. Many lawbringers seek adventure to bringing order to the world.

Many immortals dwell upon the other planes of the Great Beyond. Some are benevolent and kind, like angels. Others are cruel and destructive, like demons. And some fit roles outside of morality, like psychopomps. It's far from unheard of for mortals and immortals alike to become entangled romantically, and the children of such engagements carry a supernatural element in their bloodlines for generations to follow. After the first generation, this otherworldly influence usually lies dormant, but now and then, the influence can manifest strongly in descendants many years later. These inheritors of extraplanar legacies are known collectively as planar scions.

Nephilim

Nephilim are planar scions with a connection to the planes of the Outer Sphere. Some are obviously tied to realms such as Heaven or Hell, while others are cryptic amalgams of metaphysical traits.

Responsive Recovery.name: Responsive Recovery
Responsive Recovery.description:
Trigger One of the lawbringer's allies is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Requirements The lawbringer has a heal spell prepared

Effect Before the ally falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or dies, the lawbringer Strides toward them and casts a 2-action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell targeting the ally. The ally remains standing.

Channel Smite.name: Channel Smite
Channel Smite.description:
Requirements The lawbringer has a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} spell prepared

Effect The lawbringer makes a melee Strike and expends a harm or heal spell. On a hit, they cast the 1-action version of the spell to damage the target. The target automatically gets a failure on its save (or a critical failure if the lawbringer's Strike was a critical hit). The spell doesn't have the manipulate trait when cast this way.

Shuln.name: Shuln
Shuln.publicNotes:
Scourges of the upper Darklands, these enormous, mole-like monstrosities slice and burrow through solid stone with massive forearms and adamantine-strong claws. Shulns grow to about 20 feet long and have four tiny, nearly imperceptible eyes; a long, pale snout; four thick-muscled legs that end in long, serrated claws; and a stubby pink tail. As a young shuln matures, its unique metabolism produces adamantine that becomes infused throughout its skeletal system. In addition to making their claws and fangs nearly unbreakable, this unique physiological trait makes shulns unparalleled burrowers and highly sought by monster hunters who hope to harvest the precious material from their corpses.

Shulns have a ravenous appetite and eat nearly anything they can catch, but their preferred diet consists almost entirely of large invertebrates, especially cave worms. They rely on tiny sensory whiskers that cover their snouts and allow them to detect subtle movements in the air and ground without the use of vision. When they detect suitable prey, shulns bite their target at the first opportunity, injecting it with a potent paralytic toxin present in their saliva. So strong is this poison that it's capable of subduing even the near-unstoppable cave worm, making shulns a valuable (if dangerous) companion to anyone making excursions into worm-infested regions of the Darklands. Shulns' notoriously ill-tempered dispositions and their knack for digging into areas of an underground settlement where digging ought not to occur make them frustrating creatures to keep around, but when the alternative is an unpredictable but deadly visit from an enormous, hungry cave worm, the annoyances are well worth the trouble.

Encounters with much larger shuln-like entities on the Plane of Earth suggest that these creatures may have originated from there. The larger shulns still retain their elemental qualities, are quite a bit smarter, and have their own suite of earth-themed innate primal spells—but for all that, they still love the taste of cave worm.

Armor-Rending Strikes.description: Any time the shuln scores a critical hit with a melee Strike, it also deals the same amount of damage to the target's armor, bypassing any Hardness lower than 10, like adamantine.
Armor-Rending Strikes.name: Armor-Rending Strikes

Shuln Saliva.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage, and slowed 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for [[/br 2d6 #Paralysis Duration]]{2d6 hours}. Shuln saliva overcomes the inexorable ability.
Shuln Saliva.name: Shuln Saliva

Unstoppable Burrow.description: Shulns can burrow into solid rock and any metal with a hardness less than that of adamantine like it is soil or loose rubble, leaving a tunnel 10 feet in diameter.
Unstoppable Burrow.name: Unstoppable Burrow

Mummy Guardian.name: Mummy Guardian
Mummy Guardian.publicNotes:
The majority of mummy guardians were created by cruel and selfish masters to serve as guardians to protect their tombs from intruders. The traditional method of creating a mummy guardian is a laborious and sadistic process that begins well before the poor soul to be transformed is dead. The victim is ritualistically starved of nourishing food and instead fed strange spices, preservative agents, and toxins intended to quicken the desiccation of the flesh. The victim remains immobile but painfully aware during the final stages, as its now-useless entrails are extracted. The victim is then shrouded in funerary wrappings and entombed within a necromantically ensorcelled sarcophagus to await instructions in the potentially distant future. While it's certainly possible to use other methods to create a mummy guardian from an already-deceased body, those who seek to create these foul undead as their guardians in the afterlife often feel that such methods result in inferior undead—the pain and agony of death by mummification being an essential step in the process.

Regardless of the method of their creation, mummy guardians are more than just physical shells of flesh and bone. They retain fragmented, distorted versions of their minds, with only enough memories of their living personality remaining to fuel their undead anger and jealousy of those who yet live. This burning rage only intensifies over the centuries of waiting within a crypt for the chance to actually act, and thus, when most mummy guardians are awoken by tomb robbers or adventurers, they stop at nothing in pursuit of spiteful slaughter.

While many cultures practice mummification for benign reasons, undead mummies are created through grueling rituals, typically to provide eternally vigilant guardians. Much more rarely, a body mummified without those special rites can rise again due to its hatred of the living.

Alchemical Weakness.description: The guardian's weakness to alchemical items not only applies to damage from alchemical items, but the guardian also takes 5 damage when splashed with non-damaging alchemical items or dosed with alchemical poisons, even if they're immune to their other effects.
Alchemical Weakness.name: Alchemical Weakness

Blighted Consumption.name: Blighted Consumption
Blighted Consumption.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet eats or drinks (including an alchemical item or potion)

Effect The food or drink burns like the caustic substances fed to the mummy before its death. If the creature fails a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] save, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} after they finish the consumption and can't reduce their sickened condition while within 30 feet of any mummy.

Choking Pain.name: Choking Pain
Choking Pain.description:
Requirements The mummy's last action was a successful fist Strike

Effect The mummy shares the pain of its dying moments with the target of that Strike. That creature takes @Damage[3d8[void]] damage with a @Check[type:will|dc:24|basic:true] save. If the creature critically fails the saving throw, it can't speak for 1 round, including to Cast a Spell.

Coil Spy.name: Coil Spy

+4 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental.name: +4 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental

Thin of Blood.name: Thin of Blood
Thin of Blood.description: Coil spies recover slowly from injuries. When they take physical damage from a critical hit, they gain @Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]] damage. They take a –2 circumstance penalty to flat checks to recover from persistent damage and saving throws against afflictions.

Deceptive Reposition.description: The Coil spy Strides up to half their Speed and attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint}, in either order.
Deceptive Reposition.name: Deceptive Reposition

Maintain Disguise.name: Maintain Disguise
Maintain Disguise.description:
A Coil spy can maintain an ongoing @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} as long as they are conscious without having to re-cast the spell; they need only Cast the Spell again to reassume their illusory disguise if they wish to change their appearance or if the active spell is dispelled.

Coil spies typically seek privacy when they need to sleep, as an ongoing illusory disguise ends an hour after they fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.

Serpentfolk Venom.name: Serpentfolk Venom
Serpentfolk Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The Coil spy's Strikes deal an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Coil Spy.publicNotes:
Some serpentfolk undergo intense ritual training and practice to improve their innate ability to disguise themselves. These serpentfolk often identify as members of a sinister society known as the Coils of Ydersius, and the most devoted of their number seek out methods of reincarnating into new forms to infiltrate enemy societies even more efficiently. Coil spies train in methods of infiltrating other societies to such an extent that they might be capable of infiltrating a mammalian civilization for years. Though they're expected to work entirely toward the eventual triumph of their people, most Coil spies also find personal pursuits. When Coil spies get caught, it's rarely due to a lack of skill, but rather to their arrogance or recklessness as they pursue their hedonistic desires.

Before their ancient clash with humanity devastated their civilization, serpentfolk were masters of a sprawling underground empire. Their power was shattered and their god Ydersius decapitated (although not quite slain). The cunning, intelligence, and magical abilities of serpentfolk have diminished from their ancient heights, and most are born without these boons. This is partially the result of cruel genetic meddling among serpentfolk—though the ruling class, zyss, are born with an innate spellcasting ability, their blood runs thin, making them susceptible to wounds. Seen as the failures of the serpentfolk's experiments are the aapophs, who are strong but prone to mutation and lack innate spellcasting.

Today, the central realm of the Darklands retains the old name of the serpentfolk empire that once dominated this region—Sekamina. This name is also the source of the serpentfolk's Aklo title, sekmin, which they are often called in ancient texts. Serpentfolk dominion had declined before ghouls, gugs, umbral gnomes, and other forces. Yet their recent ventures have brought them back to a stronger place in the Darklands. Many serpentfolk sleeping in torpor in secluded vaults have awakened.

Zyss serpentfolk tend toward megalomania, with dreams of returning to their place of dominance. Many of their plans hinge on resurrecting Ydersius, their decapitated god. His headless body still thrashes about, mindless, in the Darklands, waiting to be reunited with his lost skull. Serpentfolk numbers are so small that reclaiming their dominance seems a distant dream, especially since their reproduction is slow. Though a parent can birth a dozen young at once, the gestation period lasts up to a decade, and the likelihood that even one will be zyss is low. There's no telling whether a child will be zyss or aapoph, regardless of parentage. A coveted zyss child is just as likely to arise from aapoph parents as from two zyss, and every serpentfolk colony has someone in charge of sorting the young, identifying the earliest signs of magic in them.
Coil Spy.allSaves: +4 status to will saves vs. mental, +1 status to all saves vs magic

Python.name: 蟒蛇 Python
Python.publicNotes:
这种无毒的蛇类除了对小型哺乳动物和鸟类外，很少对其他动物构成威胁，它们通过盘绕猎物并用强大的肌肉碾碎猎物来捕猎。尽管如此，由于它们的力量，较大的蟒蛇可能是危险的。爬虫学家有时把蟒蛇当宠物养。

蛇的种类多样，从盘踞密林缠卷猎物的蟒蛇，到有着致命啮咬的剧毒蝰蛇。不管怎样，所有的蛇都是通过张开其双颚整个吞咽猎物，再利用充满力量的肌肉将食物从喉腔转移至胃部消化。

Tighten Coils.description:
触发 一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于蟒蛇或被蟒蛇@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]的生物尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]

效果 逃脱检定的DC加2。
Tighten Coils.name: 紧收缠缚 Tighten Coils

Wrap in Coils.description:
需求 一个体型不超过中型的生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于蟒蛇的颚或被蟒蛇的颚@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]

效果 蟒蛇缠绕上生物，从而腾出颚用于发动攻击，而后对该生物使用紧勒。蟒蛇只能盘住一个生物。
Wrap in Coils.name: 蜷曲缠缚 Wrap in Coils

Phantom Beast.name: 魅影魔兽 Phantom Beast
Phantom Beast.publicNotes:
除了死去的智慧类人生物的灵魂外，灵魂之河还承载着怪物、动物和其他生物的灵魂。同样地，它从整个现实中汲取灵魂，因此人类和精灵的灵魂与那些来自未知世界的陌生生物的灵魂混到一起。像其他任何生物一样，这些来自遥远又奇异的生物的灵魂有时会被冲到灵界的海岸上，成为与常见的类人魅影所差甚远的同类造物（前者往往被误认为幽灵或其他不死生物）。

下述的魅影就是这样一个实体：一头来自遥远世界的奇怪魔兽，不断重复生前的行为，只为在死后寻找自己的命运。他们陌生的外表可能会让观察者认为他们是头怪物，发起攻击，并发现这头魅影魔兽绝对乐于反击。更富有同情心的冒险家可能会转而帮助魅影找到返回灵魂之河的路，从而完成他们的灵魂之旅。

根据大多数神学家的说法，一个灵魂步入来世的轨迹通常相当简单。当一位凡人死亡，他的灵魂抵达灵魂之河并最终到达骨园，它们在那由法莱斯玛审判。经审判的灵魂进入适合它最后安息的领域——天堂、地狱、末日荒原等等——在那里它成为一个残影。

然而，当一个等待判决的灵魂过早地离开灵魂之河并被引入灵界时，麻烦就发生了。不论是如邪魔或鬼婆等穷凶极恶的干预者、还是恶毒的位面魔法、甚至是命运，这些灵魂被逐出生与死的天然秩序，并徘徊在近乎于炼狱的状态中。不像祈并者，这些缥缈/灵质组成的魅影保留着他们生前的回忆；而且，不像一些和幽灵类似的魂魄，魅影并没有染上不死的邪恶影响——至少，最开始没有，但只要魅影还存在着，腐化的威胁就一直是它们的心头大患。一些魅影最终屈服于这种命运，另一些则终能重新加入灵魂之河。在那之前，这些流浪的灵魂孤苦无依——一群没有真正的家、规划或目的之人。

许多魅影都不想留在这古怪如炼狱般的状态中，要么是因为他们想继续在灵魂之河的旅程，要么是因为他们害怕不死的腐化。为了完成这天然的灵魂循环并成为被审判的对象从而抵达来世，一个魅影必须找到回到灵魂之河的方法。然而，这样的探索并非易事——即使是最有经验的旅行者也会被灵界的薄雾所迷惑，无数的捕食者在这一领域徘徊，寻找可以束缚或吞噬的迷途灵魂。

Walk the Ethereal Line.name: 游于两界 Walk the Ethereal Line
Walk the Ethereal Line.description:
魅影游走在物质宇宙和灵界间那细薄的分界线上，从而同时存在于两个位面。

他们能通过再次使用此能力来转换回仅存在于灵界的状态。

-1 Status to All Saves vs. Death Effects.name: 对抗死亡效果-1状态减值

Susceptible to Death.name: 易于死亡 Susceptible to Death
Susceptible to Death.description:
尽管魅影并非生者，但他们也并非亡灵，而且他们还特别容易受到死亡效果的影响。

一个因死亡效果（如@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Z9OrRXKgAPv6Hn5l]{处死一指 Execute}法术）导致生命值降低到0的魅影会立即被带到灵魂之河，在那里他们的灵魂会回归至通往来世的正常路径。

Phantom Touch.description: 每次发动打击时，魅影都可以选择造成精魂伤害，而非普通的物理伤害。
Phantom Touch.name: 魅影之触 Phantom Touch

Grab Item.description: 魅影魔兽尝试从一个生物上@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{盗取 Steal}一件至多1负载的物品，哪怕被偷的生物正在战斗中，但该物品必须不是正在被使用的物品。如果他们成功了，他们就会用心灵遥控的方式把物体带在身边。
Grab Item.name: 抓取物品 Grab Item

Phantom Beast.allSaves: 对抗死亡效果-1状态减值

Animated Broom.name: 活化扫帚 Animated Broom
Animated Broom.publicNotes:
活化扫帚通常可以执行清洁和维护的琐碎任务，但必要时也能保护房间免受入侵。比起那些更加复杂和昂贵的物体，这些简单的活化物体要更为常见得多。

通过某些仪式或是其他怪异的魔法，活物物体有着诸多形态和多种用途。这类生物中有很大一部分都被作为守卫，对那些毫无戒心的冒险者发起突然袭击。剩下的则是作为土豪们的玩物，被用于处理一些零活，诸如此类。

Construct Armor (Hardness 2).name: 构装护甲（硬度2） Construct Armor (Hardness 2)
Construct Armor (Hardness 2).description: 与普通的物体一样，活化扫帚同样拥有硬度。硬度可以减少其所受到的任何伤害，其数值等同于硬度的数值。一旦活化扫帚的生命值降低至一半以下，或是受到重击伤害后，其构装护甲将会破损，其AC降低至13。

Dust.name: 灰尘 Dust
Dust.description:
被活化扫着的扫帚毛击中的生物必须成功通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:15]检定，否则会花费下一个动作来咳嗽。即使同时被附有灰尘的攻击击中了多次，生物也仅需花费1个动作咳嗽即可清除灰尘。

不需要呼吸的生物免疫此效果。

Goblin Dog.name: 地精犬 Goblin Dog
Goblin Dog.publicNotes:
和地精同名的这种宠物其实并非犬类生物，它们实际上是体型庞大、有着有着圆鼻头、身体和四肢都较长的啮齿动物。地精犬通常胆怯且丑陋，它们倾向于潜伏在灌木或阴影深处，只会突袭那些落单或受伤的猎物。地精犬通常会成群结队地寻找猎物，它们一旦受伤便有可能逃离战斗，即便这么做会意味着抛弃伙伴也无所谓。

地精犬的命名来源于它们与地精的长期联系，后者会饲养这些野兽看家护院或用作坐骑。大多数地精都对此称呼有很大意见，因为一般的地精都会惊讶于这个名字带来的暗示——犬这个称呼把他们喜爱的坐骑与真正的犬只挂上了钩。当然，地精毕竟还是地精，他们也不会费心为这些生物提出独属于地精的称呼。

即便是受到良好照顾的地精犬也会长出发痒的疥癣，产生大量皮屑并顽固地影响那些与其接触的生物。这种“地精疹”会引起荨麻疹并产生烂疮，就好像地精犬本身一样丑陋且让人不快。地精犬的皮屑几乎可以让所有其它生物产生过敏反应——毕竟没几个生物像它那样惯于生活在糟糕的卫生环境里——当然，地精是个显著的个例，不管地精是否维持清洁，他们都对这种疾病具有完全的免疫。

饥饿能驱使地精犬爆发近乎反常的暴力；残忍的地精有时会在战斗前夕故意饿着他们的宠物。地精犬可以靠着他们能找到的任何有机物维生，它们尤其喜爱腐肉。尽管地精本身就不怎么挑食，但他们仍会将地精犬视为有价值的宠物，因为这些让人厌烦的动物甚至能够吃下地精也不敢吃的东西。实际上，“它吃么？”是少数几个地精乐于和自己的宠物一起玩的游戏，在这个游戏里地精会在地精犬的鼻子前悬挂一口能吃掉的各种物件（地精并不会每次都悬挂能够食用或能够安全消化的东西）。可悲的是，“它死么？”通常会是地精犬在“它吃么？”之后进行的第二场游戏，从这两个游戏中幸存下来的地精犬会因为其强大的消化能力而获得声誉，经常会成为部族内最受欢迎的宠物，其待遇也会比大多数普通地精更好。

Irritating Dander.description: 以非武装攻击命中地精犬、尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{擒拿 Grapple}地精犬或者以其他方式接触地精犬的生物有可能染上地精疹。
Irritating Dander.name: 刺激性皮屑 Irritating Dander

Juke.description:
需求 必须有生物骑乘着地精犬

触发 骑手指挥地精犬

效果 地精犬在执行命令前先进行快步
Juke.name: 乱动 Juke

Goblin Pox.description:
地精与地精犬免疫地精疹。

豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (1轮)

阶段2 恶心1和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} (1轮)

阶段3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}和无法将恶心值降低至1以下 (1天)
Goblin Pox.name: 地精疹 Goblin Pox

Scratch.name: 搔挠 Scratch
Scratch.description: 地精犬用力抓挠自身的表皮，将所有邻接生物传播地精疹。

Conspirator Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Conspirator Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Conspirator Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Hidden among the shadows and upper echelons of society are the conspirator dragons. These dragons are schemers, always looking to manipulate and control others, either for personal gain or simply for the thrill of watching their machinations play out. Conspirator dragons see themselves above others and typically speak with infantilizing tones and words. However, as most conspirator dragons meet others while in disguise, they do their best to maintain their disguise.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.
Conspirator Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Retract Body.name: Retract Body
Retract Body.description:
Trigger The dragon is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature the dragon can see

Effect The dragon retracts the targeted body part or twists away to avoid the attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Conjure Disguise.name: Conjure Disguise
Conjure Disguise.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon conjures a perfect flesh-suit replica of a humanoid they've seen of their size or smaller and compresses themself into it, along with generating appropriate clothing for the humanoid. This process takes 1 minute to complete, during which the dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. If the dragon stops or is interrupted in this process, the suit is destroyed. Once the process is complete, the dragon can remain in this disguise indefinitely.

The transformation has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]{Change Shape}, except that the disguise is not actively magical in nature and doesn't register as magical to detect magic and similar effects. The dragon loses Retract Body while transformed.

If the dragon is critically hit while wearing the disguise, the suit is destroyed and immediately explodes. This has the effects of Detonate Disguise, except that creatures use the outcome one degree of success better than they rolled on their save.

Detonate Disguise.description:
Requirements The dragon is wearing their conjured disguise

Effect The dragon erupts from the disguise, destroying it. The explosive revelation deals @Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]] damage to creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save. A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round as it becomes covered in scraps from the disguise.

Any creature sharing a space with the dragon after they erupt is pushed into the nearest empty space.
Detonate Disguise.name: Detonate Disguise

Rushed Transformation.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect Using the aid of magic and an exhausting amount of effort, the dragon quickly reshapes their body into the form of a generic humanoid figure. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form} except that it lasts only 1 minute, and the dragon doesn't gain the +4 status bonus to Deception as the transformation makes use of the dragon's body to crudely mimic a humanoid form. The dragon can Dismiss the effect.

Whenever the effect ends, the dragon leaves behind scraps of magically conjured flesh, which could give away the dragon's presence.
Rushed Transformation.name: Rushed Transformation

Smoke Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a noxious cloud of smoke that deals @Damage[7d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|basic:true] save). The smoke remains for 1 minute. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist}, except it fills the cone's area.

The dragon can't use Smoke Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
Smoke Breath.name: Smoke Breath

Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

Cythnigot.name: Cythnigot
Cythnigot.publicNotes:
The cythnigot is a foul fungal parasite that grows and thrives in the corpses of small creatures. It wears these bodies like a suit, but also adjusts and tailors the fleshy covering to fit its needs, and the body ends up looking as alien as anything else spawned from the Chthonian depths. The cythnigot's most identifying feature is the long stalk of fungal material that extends from creature's body, ending in a surprisingly strong set of fanged jaws.
