Long before the creatures known as demons came to be the dominant force in the Outer Rifts, qlippoth ruled the innumerable cracks of the Outer Sphere. These inimical creatures are a form of primordial and alien evil that predates mortal life, and most immortal life as well. Since the rise of mortal sin and the associated expansion of demonic life through the Outer Rifts, qlippoth have been driven to their deepest reaches, and they seethe with rancor at the loss of their realms. Yet, rather than directly oppose demons, qlippoth instead turn to the source—mortal sin—and wage an endless war to eradicate all creatures capable of sinful acts so that the demonic tide might be turned back. To ensure they do not bolster their foe's ranks, they enact horrific transformations on their targets, converting their victims into beings incapable of discerning right from wrong; this renders them unable to be judged by Pharasma's courts and thus incapable of becoming fiends. Most mortals consider the ministrations of a qlippoth to be far worse than any fate awaiting them in the afterlife.

Sickening Display.description:
The cythnigot presents its awful appearance fully, and creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:17] save. Once a creature attempts this save, it's temporarily immune to further Sickening Displays for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until its next turn.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and is off-guard for as long as it's sickened.

Critical Failure As failure but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
Sickening Display.name: Sickening Display

Tangle Spores.description:
A creature bitten by a cythnigot becomes afflicted by fast-growing spores that swiftly grow into twitching spikes and hideous pallid growths of hairlike fibers. These growths erupt from the bite wound and writhe and wrap around the creature's limbs. Plant creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to save against tangle spores

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17];

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 clumsy 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, off-guard, and if you attempt a manipulate action, you must succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] or it's lost; roll the check after spending the action, but before any effects are applied (1 round).
Tangle Spores.name: Tangle Spores

Merfolk Warrior.name: Merfolk Warrior
Merfolk Warrior.publicNotes:
Merfolk warriors form the bulk of the militias of their vast underwater realms and meet potential aggressors head-on with uncompromising force.

Elegant, mysterious, and graceful; all this and more can be said of merfolk. These enigmatic people resemble humanoids with delicate features from the waist up but with the fins and tail of a massive fish from the waist down. Found in nearly all of Golarion's oceans, merfolk are as varied in appearance as humans, their skin ranging from pale to umber and all shades in between, while their gleaming scales shimmer with the majesty of the sea.

Aquatic Dash.name: Aquatic Dash
Aquatic Dash.description: The merfolk warrior swims and attacks in one of two patterns. They either Swim twice and Strike at the end of their movement, or Swim once and Strike at any point during their movement.

Rhu-Chalik.name: 茹-恰里克 Rhu-Chalik
Rhu-Chalik.publicNotes:
茹-恰里克也被称作虚空漫游者，能够无期限地在深空中生存，它们可以花费数个纪元来在世界之间穿梭，为黑色支配者侦查这些星球。茹-恰里克更喜欢独自工作，以减少重复掠夺思维的可能性，但有时候会受到那些认为记忆传递是至高无上者的协助。这些鬼鬼祟祟的存在精于计算，且耐心无限，只会搜寻最杰出的头脑，来跨越星辰献给它们的主人。

黑色支配者是一个深空征服者的联合体，在格拉里昂恒星系最偏远的行星阿克腾（Aucturn）上拥有强大的势力。支配者的秘密前哨遍布整个格拉里昂；它们在这颗星球上大部分成员都是斥候，利用自己的技能来窃取大脑和身份，搜集情报，完全不顾及所有渗透世界的居民。

Thoughtsense 60 feet.description: 茹-恰里克能用所列范围的精确感官感知到生物的心灵要素；它不能用思维感知来感知到无心智的生物。
Thoughtsense 60 feet.name: 思维感知60尺 Thoughtsense 60 feet

No Breath.name: 无需呼吸 No Breath
No Breath.description: 茹-恰里克不需要呼吸且免疫需要呼吸的效果（例如吸入式毒素）。

Excruciating Enzyme.name: 剧痛酶 Excruciating Enzyme
Excruciating Enzyme.description: 茹-恰里克的触须能够分泌一种能够引发剧烈疼痛的酶。被触须打击命中的生物必须成功通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:24]豁免，否则将因疼痛陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

Label Memories.description:
茹-恰里克入侵100尺内一个目标的心灵，将记忆分类成外形结构以供传输。目标必须尝试一次@Check[type:will|dc:24]豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响，且暂时免疫标记记忆1分钟。

成功 目标不受影响。

失败 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}，持续1分钟，因其心灵根据茹-恰里克的需要而被重组。如果其已经因为此效果而陷入呆滞，则目标改为陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]状态1分钟，或直到其因为受到伤害而恢复。

大失败 同失败，但如果目标已经因为标记记忆陷入呆滞，则其改为陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]状态1分钟而非困惑。
Label Memories.name: 标记记忆 Label Memories

Transmit Memories.name: 传输记忆 Transmit Memories
Transmit Memories.description:
需求 茹-恰里克与一个因标记记忆而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]状态的生物相邻

效果 茹-恰里克复制该生物的意识，并通过心灵将这份复制的意识跨越虚空传送给其等候的主人。目标生物会在这个过程中深度迷失，在之后一天内陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}。

Augnagar.name: Augnagar
Augnagar.publicNotes:
The brutish and gluttonous augnagar live to feast—preferably on rotten flesh and, when possible, demon flesh. But to them, the greatest delicacy is the flesh of other augnagars. Augnagars have swollen, spiderlike legs with leathery membranes like a bat's wings, and three tails ending in hooked stings perfect for slicing flesh.

An augnagar that gorges sufficiently, especially on other augnagars, can grow so massive it can't even move, thrashing and festering where it lies. It eventually flies into a frenzy of self-cannibalism as it rips apart its own flesh to feast on. From the ruinous remains emerges a thulgant—a smaller but more powerful qlippoth.

Long before the creatures known as demons came to be the dominant force in the Outer Rifts, qlippoth ruled the innumerable cracks of the Outer Sphere. These inimical creatures are a form of primordial and alien evil that predates mortal life, and most immortal life as well. Since the rise of mortal sin and the associated expansion of demonic life through the Outer Rifts, qlippoth have been driven to their deepest reaches, and they seethe with rancor at the loss of their realms. Yet, rather than directly oppose demons, qlippoth instead turn to the source—mortal sin—and wage an endless war to eradicate all creatures capable of sinful acts so that the demonic tide might be turned back. To ensure they do not bolster their foe's ranks, they enact horrific transformations on their targets, converting their victims into beings incapable of discerning right from wrong; this renders them unable to be judged by Pharasma's courts and thus incapable of becoming fiends. Most mortals consider the ministrations of a qlippoth to be far worse than any fate awaiting them in the afterlife.

Confusing Display.name: Confusing Display
Confusing Display.description:
The augnagar's writhing limbs and flesh seethe and squirm in a disorienting and unsettling manner. Creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:34] save, after which they are temporarily immune to further Confusing Displays for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is stupefied 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature can't attempt a flat check to recover from confusion whenever it takes damage from an attack or spell.

Inhale Vitality.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The augnagar inhales sharply, drawing life force out of creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[14d6[void]] damage with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34|basic:true] save. A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

If any creatures take damage from this activity, the augnagar becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round, and it can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.
Inhale Vitality.name: Inhale Vitality

Rotting Curse.name: Rotting Curse
Rotting Curse.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 drained 2 and the creature displays hideous, festering wounds exuding a horrific stench. When the victim takes piercing or slashing damage, creatures within 30 feet must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. The victim automatically fails this save (1 day).

Diabolic Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Hell, according to some theologians, is a living entity in and of itself. Diabolic dragons, these scholars argue, are just extensions of the plane, living creatures that break off from Hell to enact its will. Whether this is true or whether diabolical dragons are simply the reborn souls of dragons sent to Hell, the fact remains that these dragons are powerful, cunning, and tyrannical. Every diabolic dragon's goal is to further Hell's will, though how this happens can vary. Regardless of their goals, these dragons always approach newcomers with an unsettling calmness.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.

Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair the dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Hell's Sting.name: Hell's Sting
Hell's Sting.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon channels the rancor of Hell back through the body of their foe, overwhelming it with an infernal assault on the mind. The triggering creature takes @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[type:will|dc:42|basic:true] save. Holy creatures use an outcome one degree of success worse than they roll on their saving throw.

Diabolic Fire.name: Diabolic Fire
Diabolic Fire.description: Any fire damage that a diabolic dragon deals, including fire damage from spells, is imbued with the unholy power of Hell to scorch the spirit as well. A creature takes spirit damage instead of fire damage if that would be more detrimental to the creature (as determined by the GM). A diabolic dragon is immune to the diabolic fire of other diabolic dragons, the fire from divine immolation, and similar effects.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of infernal fire that deals @Damage[21d6[fire]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true] save).

The dragon can't use Hellfire Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Diabolic Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Diabolic Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Diabolic Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Kholo Bonekeeper.name: Kholo Bonekeeper
Kholo Bonekeeper.publicNotes:
Some kholos serve as conduits to the divine and are responsible for placating spirits and gods alike. Lamashtu is a favored deity of kholo bonekeepers, as many kholos believe their kind were birthed from the Mother of Monsters. While some kholos embrace the Old Mother completely, others see her as a nightmarish power only to be approached if they're willing to pay the price. Other popular kholo deities include Calistria, Nethys, Mahathallah, or Shelyn.

Kholo are tall, hyena-headed humanoids who dwell in savannas, warm grasslands, and arid hills. Given their appearance, their affinity for hyenas should not be surprising; kholos share their homes, food, and even many of their behaviors with these animals. Much like hyenas, kholos have a notorious reputation, for much the same reason—their uncanny laughter, frightening intelligence, and efficient pack tactics make them intimidating competition or foes. Kholos are keen to lean into these rumors, using them as a form of psychological warfare against their enemies.

Also like hyenas, kholos prefer to hunt in packs, and are exceptionally skilled at setting up ambushes or separating individual targets from larger groups. As kholo packs value all their members highly, any tactic that gives them an advantage in dangerous situations is seen as virtuous, while chivalry and honor are derided as pointlessly risky. It's a philosophy borne from a deep respect and love for their kholo brethren, but to most other people, it makes kholos terrible neighbors.

Kholos willingly eat nearly any other creature, including dead kholos, which can evoke strong reactions from people and cultures with a taboo against cannibalism or desecrating the dead. To a kholo, it's often more offensive to not eat a dead body, no matter its origin; kholos see no point in wasting precious meat in a harsh and challenging world. Worse still is the refusal to eat the flesh of a dead kholo, which they consider an insult to that kholo's memory and an implication that their flesh is unworthy of consumption. Eating the flesh of honored enemies is, for kholos, a respectful ritual, allowing that being to live on within the pack instead of rotting like trash on the ground.

Kholo women are often larger and stronger than kholo men and are typically considered the leaders of their hunting packs and clans.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: A kholo hunter deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the kholo hunter's allies.

Rugged Travel.name: Rugged Travel
Rugged Travel.description: A kholo ignores the first square of difficult terrain they move into each time they Step or Stride.

Imp.name: Imp
Imp.publicNotes: Imps are fiendish infiltrators and corrupters who, despite their diminutive stature, are more than capable of subtly influencing a weak-willed individual into performing increasingly evil acts over time. An imp will often agree to serve a mortal and act docile and loyal in a long-term plot to eventually get their master killed or damn their soul. Imps are born directly from the Outer Planes themselves, rather than from mortal souls, and thus they serve outside any fiendish hierarchies, granting them leeway to pursue their specialties. Despite standing a mere 2 feet tall, imps can be vicious combatants, flying out of reach and turning invisible to escape should the odds turn against them.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The imp takes on the appearance of a Medium or smaller animal. While transformed, the imp loses their normal senses, innate spells, and special actions, but doesn't otherwise change their statistics and can still speak and use telepathy. The imp also gains any special senses of the animal and any Speeds the animal has.

This doesn't change the attack and damage modifiers of their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (depending on what kinds of attacks the animal has) and prevents them from exposing creatures to imp venom.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Fiendish Temptation.name: Fiendish Temptation
Fiendish Temptation.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The imp offers a nonfiend within 15 feet a bargain, granting a boon of good luck if the creature accepts voluntarily. The boon lasts for 1 hour once accepted.

Once during the hour, the creature can roll an attack roll or saving throw twice and use the higher result. If the creature dies while the boon is in place, the imp decides where the creature's soul travels. This typically makes the soul bound for eternity in the imp's home plane, and the creature unable to be raised or resurrected except by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual or similar magic.

Imp Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, clumsy 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)
Imp Venom.name: Imp Venom

Fiendish Healing.name: Fiendish Healing
Fiendish Healing.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect The imp regains [[/r 1d6[healing]]] Hit Points.

Animated Statue.name: 活化雕像 Animated Statue
Animated Statue.publicNotes:
活化雕像通常都被用于守护墓穴、小型神庙、或是政府大楼中的某些区域，它们通常都会混杂在其他普通雕像之中，借此隐藏它们作为活化生物的特性，直到它们因为入侵者而被激怒。许多不那么谨慎的妄想雕像会活化并发动攻击的冒险者，会砸碎他们所遇到的一切雕像，从而使得那些无害的古老的文物惨遭破坏。

通过某些仪式或是其他怪异的魔法，活物物体有着诸多形态和多种用途。这类生物中有很大一部分都被作为守卫，对那些毫无戒心的冒险者发起突然袭击。剩下的则是作为土豪们的玩物，被用于处理一些零活，诸如此类。

Construct Armor (Hardness 6).name: 构装护甲（硬度6） Construct Armor (Hardness 6)
Construct Armor (Hardness 6).description: 与普通的物体一样，活化雕像同样拥有硬度。硬度可以减少其所受到的任何伤害，其数值等同于硬度的数值。一旦活化雕像的生命值降低至一半以下，或是受到重击伤害后，其构装护甲将会破损，其AC降低至15。

Orc Scrapper.publicNotes:
Acting as the most common orc combat unit, orc scrappers are ferocious fighters who rely on unrelenting strength, rather than combat experience, to prove their mettle and attempt to rise in the hold's standing.

Many orcs are forged in the fires of violence and conflict, often from the moment they're born. As they live lives that are frequently cut brutally short, orcs revel in testing their strength against worthy foes, whether by challenging a higher-ranking member of their community for dominance, taming a powerful beast, or slaying a fearsome monster.

Tall and powerful, with long arms and thickly muscled legs, many orcs top 7 feet in height. Their heavy limbs and broad, almost bow-legged stances combine with a tendency to slouch forward to create an almost contradictory set of circumstances where an orc can tower over other humanoids while simultaneously staring them in the eye. These features, alongside a tendency to scar easily, can make them seem quite intimidating.

The half-orc dromaars, most commonly born of unions between orcs and humans, are often tested even more harshly than their full orc kin, but those who endure these tests can rise to positions of authority. "An orc can have what an orc can hold" is a saying that not only applies to an individual's ability to secure their own destiny and position, but is also likely the root of orcs referring to their communities as holds.
Orc Scrapper.name: Orc Scrapper

Rune Giant.publicNotes:
Rune giants are tyrants among their own kind, given power to command and magically control other giants. They once served even more powerful masters—potent wizards known as runelords—and in so doing, commanded entire armies of giants in service to the runelords' empires.

In the eons since these empires collapsed, rune giants have persisted, though to the outside world they're little more than fabled horrors. Rune giants usually dwell in the most remote and rugged of towering mountain ranges, but they can also be found in immense ruins atop lost islands, glacial valleys, or even more remote or magical regions.

Dozens of runes decorate rune giants’ striking charcoal flesh. They are towering creatures, averaging at 40 feet in height and weighing 25,000 pounds.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

Reactive Strike (Special).name: Reactive Strike (Special)
Reactive Strike (Special).description:
The rune giant gains an additional reaction at the beginning of each of their turns that they can use only for a Reactive Strike.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Command Giants.name: Command Giants
Command Giants.description: When a rune giant casts a mental spell against another giant, the DC is 39, rather than 35

Demand.name: Demand
Demand.description: When a rune giant casts their innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R9xqCBblkS5KE4y7]{Sending} spell, they can also cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} on the target.

Flashing Runes.name: Flashing Runes
Flashing Runes.description:
Trigger The rune giant uses an arcane ability or casts an arcane spell

Effect The runes on the giant's body flash with magical energy. Each creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Invoke Rune.description:
The rune giant invokes one of the runes on their body, causing the rune to spray forth a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of sparks that deals @Damage[6d12[electricity]] damage to all creatures in the cone (@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true] save).

The giant can't use Invoke Rune again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Invoke Rune]]{1d4 rounds}.

A glowing copy of the invoked rune appears on a single weapon the giant holds, granting the weapon one effect listed below of the giant's choice. The effect on the weapon lasts for 1 minute. If the giant places a new rune on a weapon, any previously placed rune immediately vanishes, ending its effect.

  • Rune of Destruction The weapon gains the deadly trait with three weapon damage dice of the same die size as for the base weapon, and a creature hit with the weapon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} unless it succeeds at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35] save.
  • Rune of Flames The weapon deals an additional @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage on all attacks.
  • Rune of Smiting When the weapon hits, the giant can Push the target back 10 feet, or 20 feet on a critical hit.
  • Rune of Space During the rune giant's turn, the weapon's reach is increased to 60 feet.
Invoke Rune.name: Invoke Rune

Wide Swing.description: The rune giant makes a single greatsword Strike and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within their reach. This counts as two attacks for the giant’s multiple attack penalty.
Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing

Rune Giant.name: Rune Giant

Weretiger.name: Weretiger

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
• Human
    • Melee fist +14 Damage 1d4+7
  • Animal
    • Speed 30 feet
    • Wrestle

The werecreature changes into its humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true werecreature's natural form is its hybrid shape.

In humanoid shape, the werecreature uses its original humanoid size, loses its jaws and claws Strikes, and gains a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by its claw.

In animal shape, its Speed and size change to that of the animal, it gains any special Strike effects of the animal that it didn't already have (such as Grab), and it loses its weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Curse of the Weretiger.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.
Curse of the Weretiger.name: Curse of the Weretiger

Moon Frenzy.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}
Moon Frenzy.name: Moon Frenzy

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The weretiger Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the weretiger began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, they remain hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Tiger Empathy.name: Tiger Empathy
Tiger Empathy.description:
The weretiger can communicate with felines.

The werecreature can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals of its general kind.

Wrestle (Animal Shape).name: Wrestle (Animal Shape)
Wrestle (Animal Shape).description: The weretiger makes a claw Strike against a creature it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbing}. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Weretiger.publicNotes:
These ferocious werecreatures stalk prey with the cunning and skill of a true apex predator. Weretigers typically view all life as a potential meal. Powerful nocturnal hunters with excellent senses that help them ambush prey, weretigers are adaptable to an extreme range of environments. However, weretigers living in densely populated cities (potentially as courtesans, assassins, or guild leaders) often struggle to suppress their killer instincts, becoming overwhelmed by the urge to hunt.

Werecreatures are humanoids doomed to transform into animals and animalhumanoid hybrids under the light of the full moon. These shapechanging creatures are the result of an ancient primal curse that they can, in turn, transmit through their own bites. Their ability to lurk unseen in the wilds as well as among people, combined with the contagiousness of their condition, makes werecreatures a perennial cause of panicked suspicion.

Hryngar Sharpshooter.name: 地底矮人神射手 Hryngar Sharpshooter
Hryngar Sharpshooter.publicNotes:
地底矮人神射手即是车队的远程支援，又是驻扎在警戒塔上、俯瞰着采石场以及其他地区工人时刻辛苦劳作的狙击手。地底矮人神射手还专精一种非致命的远程作战方法——他们在追踪逃跑的债务人或者那些试图逃避契约债务的对象时，经常被要求使用这种战术。

在地表下方深处，被称为地底矮人的冷酷矮人族群顽强地辛苦劳作，声称其他矮人先祖的地下家园属于自己。很久以前，地底矮人的领袖拒绝与他们的“表亲”一同冒险前往地表，放弃了寻天之旅（Quest for Sky）。名为卓斯卡（Droskar）的被流放的矮人神祇拯救了这些地底矮人，使其摆脱了幽暗地域（Darklands）中困扰他们的恐怖之物，为他们提供了力量、诡计与知识，以此换取对他们永无止境的奴役。许多地底矮人认为通过比他们的同族更加卖力地劳作，就可以建设出比位于太阳之下的那些伟大得多的社会，在没日没夜永不停歇的劳作中从星球的金属矿脉里索取无穷的财富。通过卓斯卡的祝福以及自身那骇人的工作伦理，地底矮人如今统治者上层幽暗地域中纳-沃斯（Nar-Voth）地区的很大一片领土，人们经常能看到地底矮人的商队在巨大甲虫的协作牵引下穿过隧道。地底矮人的领导层通常由卓斯卡的强大神仆所组成，辅以可怖且无人能挡的武艺高超的战士，再加上天生的异能术法，这使得他们能够击败任何能够对地底矮人统治产生直接威胁的存在。地底矮人社会中近乎所有方面都受到严密等级制领导的控制，由监工指导各行各业的下属。
Hryngar Sharpshooter.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+2状态加值

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Bola Bolt.name: 绳球弩失 Bola Bolt
Bola Bolt.description: 这种射击不会造成伤害，但是在命中时，目标必须成功通过@Check[type:reflex|dc:16]豁免，失败则会被击倒@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]，此外还会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]直至成功通过DC 15的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]检定逃离为止。该检定可以由目标或目标相邻的生物进行尝试。

Jah-Tohl.name: 贾-托尔 Jah-Tohl
Jah-Tohl.publicNotes:
形貌怪异的贾-托尔乘着活体飞船降临收割智慧生物的大脑。这些异怪并不从大脑中汲取营养，而是把它们储存起来用于分析，并作为神秘的魔法能量的容器。

集脑怪的外观让人联想起无尾的蝎子，但它背上装载着大脑的水泡闪闪发光，这让它们很难被人误认为成巨大的蛛形纲动物。狰狞的眼睛在它们腿上的关节处怒目而视，它们用心灵感应的方式向那些它们想要捕食的人传播的令人不安的、侵入性的窃窃私语，这可以被解释某种威胁或承诺。

集脑怪对他们到访的任何世界的居民几乎都没有同情心，尽管某些邪教崇拜它们，或崇拜它们所属的黑色支配者，将它们奉若神明。对集脑怪老说，地面物种只是满足它们魔法需求和异能力量的资源。它们对敬神或被人敬拜都没什么兴趣，但它们自有一套奇怪的宗教形式，信仰并恐惧于深空的原始力量。贾-托尔中的哲学家会一次性从多个角度思考这些神秘力量，燃烧无数大脑来寻求洞悉。

黑色支配者是一个深空征服者的联合体，在格拉里昂恒星系最偏远的行星阿克腾（Aucturn）上拥有强大的势力。支配者的秘密前哨遍布整个格拉里昂；它们在这颗星球上大部分成员都是斥候，利用自己的技能来窃取大脑和身份，搜集情报，完全不顾及所有渗透世界的居民。
Jah-Tohl.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Thoughtsense 60 feet.name: 思维感知60尺 Thoughtsense 60 feet
Thoughtsense 60 feet.description: 贾-托尔能用所列范围的精确感官感知到生物的心灵要素；它不能用思维感知来感知到无心智的生物。

Brain Blisters.name: 储脑疱 Brain Blisters
Brain Blisters.description: 贾-托尔背后有7个储脑疱，用来储存收集到的大脑。如果贾-托尔没有全部装满所有7个储脑疱，则会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]状态，状态值与空储脑疱数量相同。

Brain Loss.name: 失脑 Brain Loss
Brain Loss.description: 如果贾-托尔从一次重击中受到30点伤害，或受到25点心灵伤害，它必须成功通过DC 26豁免（重击伤害对应@Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]豁免，心灵伤害对应@Check[type:will|dc:26]豁免），否则一个储脑疱会被摧毁。

Collect Brain.name: 集脑 Collect Brain
Collect Brain.description: 贾-托尔提取一个触及范围内死亡时间不超过1分钟的生物的大脑。它能以一个交互动作把大脑收容进身上其中一个储脑疱内并恢复20生命值。

Mind Snatcher Venom.name: 集脑怪毒 Mind Snatcher Venom
Mind Snatcher Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d6[poison]]且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1} (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[1d6[poison]]，力竭1且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} (1轮)

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[poison]]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2}且缓慢1 (1轮)

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Wrathspawn.name: Wrathspawn
Wrathspawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords—each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today, sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind.

Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, with slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue.

Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold, while envyspawn appear even more gaunt than the rest of their kin.

Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.description:
A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Scent]

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Sinful Bite.name: Sinful Bite
Sinful Bite.description:
A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

Critical Success Unaffected

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure sickened 2 plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Wrathspawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental

Adamantine Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Adamantine Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Adamantine Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
The powerful adamantine dragons are one of several dragons known as skymetal dragons. The innate magic that flows through these dragons causes them to draw particular metals to their bodies like magnets or, in some cases, naturally grow these skymetals on their bodies. Adamantine dragons begin their lives with tough scales that are naturally replaced with thicker and even tougher adamantine plating as they grow older. Adamantine dragons are typically steadfast and loyal. Once they commit to a certain purpose, changing their minds is nigh impossible.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Abandon Armor.name: Abandon Armor
Abandon Armor.description: Once the adamantine dragon is reduced to fewer than half their Hit Points, their resistance is reduced by 10 and they gain a +10 circumstance bonus to their Speeds.

Resilient Form.name: Resilient Form
Resilient Form.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a weapon or unarmed attack;

Effect The dragon's tough scales ward off deadly attacks. The dragon attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:17]. On a success, the triggering attack becomes a normal hit.

Adamantine Body.name: Adamantine Body
Adamantine Body.description: The dragon’s unarmed melee Strikes are adamantine.

Avalanche Breath.name: Avalanche Breath
Avalanche Breath.description:
The dragon belches a mass of boulders that deals @Damage[8d8[bludgeoning]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

They can't use Avalanche Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge use Avalanche Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Burrowing Pounce.name: Burrowing Pounce
Burrowing Pounce.description:
Requirements The dragon is burrowed

Effect The dragon Burrows, then Leaps out of the ground, landing at a point within 25 feet. The dragon makes a melee Strike against a creature within reach when they land. If the Strike is a critical hit, the target is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Rock Tunneler.description: The dragon can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. They can leave a tunnel if they desire, and they usually don’t.
Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler

Adamantine Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs primal

Mountain Oni.name: 山鬼 Mountain Oni
Mountain Oni.publicNotes:
山鬼是最常见的恶鬼，通常也被认为是最不复杂的。其他恶鬼可能与精魂世界的联系更紧密，而山鬼除了满足自己的食欲，对他物丝毫不感兴趣。懒惰和贪吃是山鬼的共同恶习，这使它们可以与附近的村庄共存，只要它们吃得饱，但野心更大的山鬼经常会带领食人魔战帮或策划暴力强盗团伙进行袭击。与世隔绝生存的山鬼很罕见，大部分山鬼都喜欢劫掠乡野，或是剥削村庄，为自己囤积战利品。

恶鬼是一种起源于天夏的大型野蛮生物，它们看上去是拥有鲜艳的皮肤、獠牙和犄角的类人生物。虽然通常被误认为是魔族，但最早的恶鬼最初是神灵，守护自然的精魂。这些神灵遭受了可怕的创伤，因为剧烈的灾难或人们的冷酷无情而失去了它们神圣的护（wards），结果变成了如今的暴力生物。虽然有些人认为恶鬼可以通过适当的祭祀仪式在精神上被安抚，让它们变回神灵，但许多希望成为救世主的人却被恶鬼臭名昭著的野蛮力量，令人毛骨悚然的牙齿和对风暴的掌控所击倒。

恶鬼拥有伪装成其他类人生物的能力。它们的伪装少有创意，通常会选择与其恶鬼形态相似的特定外貌，并坚持使用。这种简单性让许多人认为恶鬼只局限于一种变幻形态，但事实并非如此。

Bean Panic.description: 恶鬼非常害怕豆子，尤其是当季节开始更替之际。如果有生物通过交互动作向恶鬼扔出一把豆子，恶鬼就将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。在以此法陷入惊惧时，其精魂伤害弱点将增加5。恶鬼随后免疫恐豆24小时。
Bean Panic.name: 恐豆 Bean Panic

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
山鬼可以变形成任意中型或大型类人生物。这不会改变其速度，打击的攻击和伤害加值，但可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常变为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Thundering Iron.name: 雷鸣铁 Thundering Iron
Thundering Iron.description:
恶鬼举起手中的狼牙棒，发出震耳欲聋的响声。它进行一次狼牙棒打击。如果成功命中，目标受到额外1d10音波伤害。

目标周围@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]范围内的除了恶鬼外的每个生物，也将受到此伤害，并被推离目标5尺。

Elemental Inferno.name: Elemental Inferno
Elemental Inferno.publicNotes:
Walking conflagrations of unimaginably hot fire, elemental infernos are harbingers of destruction and heedless chaos. More tactical than many elementals, the infernos will set entire cities ablaze to confuse enemies.

Fire elementals are destructive manifestations of the scorching Plane of Fire. Although most fire elementals revel in the chance to experience new kinds of fires away from their home plane, even the most considerate fire elemental can be a danger to humanoids and their property.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The elemental inferno ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Explosion.name: Explosion
Explosion.description: When the elemental inferno dies, it explodes, dealing @Damage[7d6[fire]] damage to each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10|traits:fire,damaging-effect] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true] save).

Blue Flames.name: Blue Flames
Blue Flames.description: When the elemental inferno scores a critical hit, its body surges with blue flames, increasing the damage of its intense heat and Inferno Leap by @Damage[3d6[fire]]{3d6} until the start of its next turn.

Inferno Leap.name: Inferno Leap
Inferno Leap.description:
The elemental inferno jumps horizontally and vertically with a maximum height and distance each equal to its Speed. Its intense heat is suppressed until the end of the jump. Instead, at any point during the jump, flames explode from the elemental in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30], dealing @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true] save).

The elemental inferno can't Inferno @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Inferno Leap]]{1d4 rounds}.

Bottlenose Dolphin.name: 瓶鼻海豚 Bottlenose Dolphin
Bottlenose Dolphin.publicNotes:
瓶鼻海豚是最常见、分布最广的海豚品种。它们是群居的掠食者，以大家族的形式在浅海和河流中捕食。水手们很喜欢瓶鼻海豚，他们经常讲述瓶鼻海豚如何拯救溺水的渔民，或它们如何用强大的吻击杀死鲨鱼的故事。

海豚家族包含了各种各样的水生哺乳动物，它们都是具有社会性且聪明的生物，广泛分布于世界各地的海洋。

Aquatic Echolocation 120 feet.name: 水中回声定位120尺 Aquatic Echolocation 120 feet
Aquatic Echolocation 120 feet.description: 列出的范围内，瓶鼻海豚可以将听觉作为精确感官，但仅限于水下。

Deep Breath.name: 深呼吸 Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: 瓶鼻海豚可以屏住呼吸长达2小时。

Ramming Speed.description:
瓶鼻海豚@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]两次，然后进行一次吻鼻打击。只要它移动至少20尺，它的此次攻击检定获得+1环境加值。

一个大型或更小体型的生物被此攻击命中后还必须通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} ，持续1轮。
Ramming Speed.name: 撞击速度 Ramming Speed

Keketar.name: Keketar
Keketar.publicNotes:
The ruling caste of the proteans, keketars orchestrate attacks against the bastions of law and adjudicate protean disputes confidently and capriciously. A keketar resembles a shimmering, serpentine creature with spines, claws, and a dragon-like head. A keketar's actual appearance is in constant flux, but they generally stay about 18 feet long with a weight of around 1,500 pounds. While their physical forms can vary, two things remain constant: first, a keketar's eyes are always a piercing shade of amber or violet. Second, the keketar's mark of office—a crown of shifting symbols that hovers above their head—never changes. A keketar cannot remove their crown but can suppress it, although most are loath to do so and consider such an act one of cowardice or shame.

Keketars fill a role in protean society of a sort of priesthood, operating as intermediaries between the other proteans and the Speakers of the Depths. All other proteans defer to keketars, treating them in a way similar to how citizens of a mortal city would treat respected nobles; even more powerful proteans defer to the will of the keketars. As with many religions, dogma and theology are prone to interpretation and change, and among the proteans, the situation is even more pronounced. Whatever the nature and desires of the Speakers of the Depths may be, individual keketars often come to dramatically different conclusions as to their will and intent. To the proteans, however, this inherent dissonance is a strength rather than a weakness.

Guardians of disorder and natives of the primal plane of chaos known as the Maelstrom, proteans consider it their calling to spread bedlam and hasten entropic ends. The most powerful proteans are demigods known collectively as the protean lords, although they are mysterious entities whose cults in the Universe tend to be obscure and secretive.

Proteans divide themselves into a loose caste system and possess a dizzying variety of powers. Most proteans have a serpentine body with the head of a primeval beast. Scholars have long been intrigued by this fact—that scions of dissolution and disorder would share so many features—pointing out that there is some semblance of order even in the purest chaos. Others note that the serpentine form is one of the most primeval shapes, perhaps suggesting that in a reality at the dawn of time, such shapes were all that could exist. The proteans themselves have little to say on the matter, which, perhaps ironically, only adds to the confusion and lack of consensus surrounding their kind. After all, if even chaos cannot be trusted to be chaotic, would that not be the purest form of entropy?
Keketar.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description: A keketar can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants them the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Protean Anatomy.name: Protean Anatomy
Protean Anatomy.description:
A keketar's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the keketar takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, they gain the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case their resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The keketar is immune to polymorph effects unless they're a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the keketar automatically recovers at the end of their next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Spatial Riptide.name: Spatial Riptide
Spatial Riptide.description:
30 feet.

A creature using a teleportation ability within the aura or arriving in it via teleportation must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38] save or wink out of existence for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} before completing the teleport. The creature can't act, sense anything, or be targeted. On a successful save, the creature completes the teleport normally but is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Keketars are immune to this effect.

Change Shape.description:
The keketar can take the appearance of any Huge or smaller creature. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Reshape Reality.name: Reshape Reality
Reshape Reality.description: When the keketar casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage}, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not disbelieve the illusion treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.

Warpwave Strike.name: Warpwave Strike
Warpwave Strike.description: A creature struck by a keketar's jaws or claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36] save or be subject to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.HKFoOZZV4WdjkeeJ]{Warpwave}.

Arboreal Regent.name: 树精王 Arboreal Regent
Arboreal Regent.publicNotes:
树精王——同时也被唤作树人——是一种行动迟缓又独行的生物，负责保护一整座森林。它们看待事物的目光特别长远，从不草率鲁莽行事。他们偶尔会组成称为“林地集会”的小团体，分享彼此的见闻，向新萌芽的树精守望者们传授它们的智慧。在遭遇重大危机的时候，一个地区所有的“林地集会”可能会全部聚在一起，举行长达数月的会议，计划并最终对威胁采取行动。

一般的树精王有30尺高,树干直径2英尺,重4500磅。

树精是森林的守护者和树木的代言者。树精和他们照料的树木寿命几乎一样长，它们把自己当做树木的父母和牧者，而非园丁。虽然树精们平时慢条斯理，但当它们被迫为保护森林而战时，他们能展现出惊人的敏捷。树精们很少会和短命种族做朋友——在它们眼中连精灵都很短命——而且对于新事物有一种与生俱来的偏见。但是树精可以容忍那些前来从它们冗长繁杂的闲言碎语中寻求知识的学习者，尤其是那些明确表示想保护森林的人。对于威胁它们领土的人，比如渴望收获木材的伐木者或旨在开垦树林建立农地、城镇的殖民者，树精的愤怒则是坚定而具有毁灭性的。具有讽刺意味的是，树精具有摧毁建筑的天赋——这一特点对于它们充满复仇欲望的同胞来说非常实用。

Awaken Tree.description: 树精王让180尺内的一棵树木觉醒为自己的仆从来战斗，使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.0Dsy2I3mu86Czjm0]的数据。树精王一次最多可以控制两棵觉醒树木，它可以用一个具有专注和听觉特征的单动作同时指挥两棵树。
Awaken Tree.name: 觉醒树木 Awaken Tree

Sunder Objects.name: 击破物品 Sunder Objects
Sunder Objects.description: 当树精王伤害物品或建筑时，它能造成额外[[/r {2d10}]]伤害。

Cloud Giant.publicNotes:
The graceful and regal cloud giants are fractious, with roughly half their clans believing they should rule over humanoids regardless of their size and the rest shying away from any contact with outsiders. Due to the physical and ideological distance between clans, most rely on giant eagle or roc messengers, to arrange marriages and exchange art without setting foot in each other's territory.

Cloud giants' skin color ranges from milky white to powdery blue. They make their homes anywhere veiled by the clouds, generally mountaintops or isolated valleys, but occasionally fog-shrouded swamps or misty rainforests. Legends persist of floating cities ruled by magically gifted cloud giant queens and kings. While most cloud giants plainly state that such claims are pure fantasy, others are mysteriously tight-lipped or evasive about the matter.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

Crushing Cloud.name: Crushing Cloud
Crushing Cloud.description: The cloud giant solidifies some clouds, including fog or mist, around a creature that's already in a cloud up to 120 feet away. The target takes @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:30|basic:true] save). If it fails its save, it treats clouds as difficult terrain for 1 round.

Wind Strike.description:
The cloud giant Strikes a creature with their ranseur, surrounded in a roar of rushing air. On a hit, the target takes an additional 4d8 bludgeoning damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute. Whether or not the Strike hits, each non-cloud giant within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20], including the target of the Strike, is buffeted by roaring winds and must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d8[sonic]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d8[sonic]] damage and is deafened until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, but double damage and also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
Wind Strike.name: Wind Strike

Cloudsight.name: Cloudsight
Cloudsight.description: Cloud giants ignore concealment from weather conditions, including clouds and rain.

Cloud Giant.name: Cloud Giant

Morrigna.publicNotes:
Bounty hunters and investigators, morrignas seek out creatures who thwart death or interfere with the natural flow of souls. Morrignas dress in flowing spider silk and wear masks reminiscent of webs, as they consider patient and watchful spiders to be their spiritual kin.

Psychopomps are guardians and shepherds of the dead in the Boneyard, the vast plane of graves where mortal souls are judged and sent on to their eternal rewards or damnations. Psychopomps ensure that the dead come to terms with their transition from mortality and are properly sorted into the appropriate afterlife. They also protect souls from being preyed upon by supernatural predators. Nearly all psychopomps wear masks, especially when they're likely to be interacting with mortals, although the types of masks they wear are as varied as the psychopomps themselves. The courts of the Boneyard preside in Requian, a somber yet melodic language spoken slowly with various tonal shifts.

Many psychopomps are intimately involved with the Boneyard's massive bureaucracy. Few pursue mercy, justice, or personal gain; their duties to Pharasma and her Boneyard are supreme. Nevertheless, individual psychopomps interpret their duties in different ways, which might put them in conflict with mortals or even with each other.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Change Shape.description:
A morrigna can take the appearance of any Small or Medium animal or humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal. Unless they choose to manifest their web wrappings in their new form, they cannot make web wrappings Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Shepherd’s Touch.name: Shepherd’s Touch
Shepherd’s Touch.description: A morrigna's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal @Damage[4d6[void]] damage to living creatures or @Damage[4d6[vitality]] damage to undead.

Spider Minions.name: Spider Minions
Spider Minions.description: The morrigna summons a giant tarantula or spider swarm. These spiders have the summoned trait and remain for 10 minutes or until reduced to 0 Hit Points, whichever comes first. The morrigna does not need to Sustain the Spell to direct these summoned creatures, and the morrigna can have any number of summoned spiders in existence at once. The morrigna can see through the eyes of any of their summoned spiders at any time.

Wrappings Lash.name: Wrappings Lash
Wrappings Lash.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the morrigna's web wrappings uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check

Effect The morrigna makes a web wrappings Strike against the triggering creature. If the strike is a critical hit, the triggering action is disrupted.

Morrigna.name: Morrigna
Morrigna.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Triceratops.name: 三角龙 Triceratops
Triceratops.publicNotes:
三角龙是一种肌肉发达的四足动物，腿短而有力，脖子粗，头部周围有一个宽大的骨板褶边。虽然它们的鼻子上有一个大角，额头上各有一个，然而些恐龙是食草动物，它们只用这些突出的骨头来保护自己免受攻击，或者在与其他三角龙激烈的冲突中争夺食物和交配权。三角龙脾气暴躁，固执，不善于在战斗中退让，除非它们无可救药地处于劣势。这种生物以毫无理由地战斗到死亡而闻名遐迩。三角龙经常充当蜥蜴人、半兽人和巨人的坐骑，骑手们可以舒适地骑在三角龙带有保护性的骨褶后面。三角龙通常体长30尺，重达10吨。

这些巨大的爬行动物是世界原始时代的遗留物，现在仍然大量存在于偏僻的荒野中，或者在幽暗地域的地下魔法洞穴中。蜥蜴人、半兽人、巨人和其他人形生物有时会把恐龙当作坐骑、守卫或猎兽。众所周知，人类和其他族裔也收集恐龙，把它们放在动物园里展出，或把它们当作异域宠物或守卫。这通常是富人或怪咖喜欢干的事情，但确实也有一些德鲁伊和其他自然的守护者能与恐龙亲密相处，甚至把它们作为动物伙伴。当恐龙在它们正常栖息地以外的地区安家时，通常可能是因为被圈养的恐龙逃进荒野造成的。

Frill Defense.description:
触发 骑乘者被作为攻击目标

需求 生物必须骑乘在三角龙上

效果 三角龙用脑袋周围的骨板保护骑乘者，骑乘者对触发此能力的攻击，AC获得+2环境加值。
Frill Defense.name: 骨板防护 Frill Defense

Lumbering Charge.name: 笨拙冲锋 Lumbering Charge
Lumbering Charge.description: 三角龙行走至多10尺，然后进行1次打击。

Vicious Gore.name: 猛力戳刺 Vicious Gore
Vicious Gore.description: 三角龙的尖角攻击命中@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]的目标时，造成额外2d6持续流血伤害。

Quetz Coatl.name: Quetz Coatl
Quetz Coatl.publicNotes:
These sacred feathered serpents tirelessly serve the powers of knowledge and justice. Some operate directly as messengers and intermediaries of the deities, while others operate independently in aiding the cause of righteousness. Either way, they watch over mortals and try to influence and aid them from the shadows, shifting from plane to plane to spread wisdom and healing where they are needed. Some quetz coatls are worshipped as divinities in remote or isolated societies, and while they do not encourage such veneration, they use the trust placed in them to foster peace and cooperation with others.

Quetz coatls are typically 10 to 20 feet long and weigh nearly a ton, with iridescent blue and green scales. Their glorious wings of rainbow-hued feathers span 15 feet. They are carnivorous, feeding on birds, mammals, and even the occasional malicious humanoid.

Quetz Couatl Venom.name: Quetz Couatl Venom
Quetz Couatl Venom.description:
To unholy creatures, this is a curse instead of a poison and deals spirit damage instead of poison damage

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29];

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage, enfeebled 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, and off-guard (1 round)

Radiant Wings.name: Radiant Wings
Radiant Wings.description:
The quetz coatl spreads their multicolored wings and radiant plumage. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Radiant Wings for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is dazzled for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, plus if the creature is unholy, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

Wrap in Coils.description:
Requirements The quetz couatl has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its jaws

Effect The quetz couatl moves the creature into its coils, freeing its fangs to make attacks, then uses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.OmV6E3aELvq9CkK1]{Greater Constrict} against the creature. The quetz couatl can hold as many creatures in its coils as will fit in its space.
Wrap in Coils.name: Wrap in Coils

Manticore (Quill Tail).publicNotes:
蝎狮是狮子、龙和人的混合怪物，嗜好人肉。它与众不同的尾巴上点缀着豪猪一样的尖刺，会像甩动鞭子一样甩动尾巴来攻击猎物。这些致命的尖刺赋予它强大的力量，甚至能杀死天空中的装备精良的勇士。

虽然它那似人非人的面孔看起来像具备敏锐的智慧，但其实大部分这种生物都是头脑简单的杀手。然而，它们也是聪明的欺骗者，它们的声音带有一种奇特的音律，能吸引不知情的旅行者进入伏击地点。野蛮无知的类人生物（尤其是那些守序和邪恶的）在发现蝎狮之后会对它顶礼膜拜，在这种情况下蝎狮会变得很懒惰，乐于享受崇拜者带给它的食物和财富，但是当供奉变得缺乏时，它会开始享用这些崇拜者们。更强大的类人生物遇到蝎狮时可以通过威吓和暴力使它屈服，甚至成为坐骑。只要它的肚子被人肉填满，并在主人的领导下获得胜利，它就会对主人无比忠诚。

蝎狮喜欢从猎物的尸体上掠夺战利品，这既能满足它的虚荣心，又能证明它的实力。它对金钱不感兴趣，但有时也接受黄金和珠宝作为贡品。由于蝎狮喜欢在远离人类的荒野中独处，因此它们乐于独自享用战利品，而不愿意向游客炫耀。

Spike Volley.description:
蝎狮能从尾巴上射出两根钉刺，目标可以是两个不同的生物也可以是同一个生物。如果蝎狮以两个不同的生物为目标，这些生物的间距必须在20尺以内，蝎狮分别对他们进行一次打击；该行动计算多重攻击减值时只算作一次，并且在两次打击完成后才会累积。

如果蝎狮针对同一目标发射两根钉刺，它只会进行一次打击，如果攻击命中，它只能造成单个钉刺的伤害，但是目标会被钉在原地，获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]。生物可以通过破拆或逃脱来获得自由；两种选项的DC均为23。

蝎狮在24小时内最多能射出12根钉刺。
Spike Volley.name: 钉刺齐射 Spike Volley

Manticore (Quill Tail).name: 蝎狮（刺尾） Manticore (Quill Tail)

Skulltaker.name: Skulltaker
Skulltaker.publicNotes: Swirling down from misty peaks and through howling mountain passes like an evil wind, the vortex of bones known as a skulltaker is a terrible manifestation of the delirium and agony experienced by doomed climbers and lost trailblazers just before they met their end. In some places, a skulltaker is also known as a saxra.
Skulltaker.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. vitality

Skeletal Lore.name: Skeletal Lore
Skeletal Lore.description:
A skulltaker taps into the memories of the creatures whose bones make up its body. This gives it the Skeletal Lore skill, which it can use to Recall Knowledge of any kind. In addition, it can speak and understand all the languages known by the creatures whose bones make up its body (typically including Common and the regional language of the skulltaker's home region).

The skulltaker can use Skeletal Lore as the primary skill check for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hp6Q64dl7xbdn4gQ]{Collective Memories} ritual, and it can cast collective memories without secondary casters.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

Shard Storm.name: Shard Storm
Shard Storm.description:
10 feet.

A cloud of bone shards surrounds the skulltaker. When a creature moves into the emanation or begins its turn there, shard storm deals @Damage[4d6[slashing],4d6[void]]{4d6 slashing damage and 4d6 void damage} to the creature, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save.

If the creature has resistance or immunity to void damage, or an effect that protects it against death effects, or an effect that protects it against the doomed or drained condition, the creature must first succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:40] save or have all such benefits suppressed for 1 minute.

Bonetaker.description:
Whenever a creature dies within 60 feet of a skulltaker, the skulltaker draws a portion of the creature's bones into its shard storm.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:40] save or rise as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.FH58AcRBZIfrHKvv]{Skeletal Champion} in [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. These skeletal champions are controlled by the skulltaker.
Bonetaker.name: Bonetaker

Splintered Ground.name: Splintered Ground
Splintered Ground.description:
The skulltaker causes splintered bones to erupt from all solid surfaces in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:100], except for surfaces of worked stone. A creature moving through the bones takes @Damage[10[piercing],10[void]]{10 piercing damage and 10 void damage} for every 5 feet of movement.

The first time each round a creature takes piercing damage from these splintered bones, it must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:40] save or take a –10-foot circumstance penalty to all Speeds for 10 minutes, or a –15-foot circumstance penalty for 24 hours on a critical failure.

The bones remain in place until the skulltaker uses this action again or the bones are manually removed, which takes 10 minutes for each 5-foot square.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.86uYNsVXzYWxqLTV]{Effect: Splintered Ground}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.hc7kR6quUE9ryRyj]{Effect: Splintered Ground (Critical Failure)}

Vitality Drain.name: Vitality Drain
Vitality Drain.description: When a skulltaker hits with a melee Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Greater Herexen.name: 高阶叛教尸 Greater Herexen
Greater Herexen.publicNotes:
当一位牧师背叛了他的神明并在渎神之怒的控制下死去时，他们在生前犯下的亵渎之罪会促使他们转变成不死生物叛教尸。叛教尸们试图向他们曾经崇拜的神复仇，玷污庙宇，杀死信徒，聚集次级不死生物和崇拜死亡的邪教徒来协助它们进行不洁的任务。虽然叛教尸的神赐能力大部分都被腐化为卑劣的不死形态，但它们仍然顽固地依靠着它们先前力量的残余，仍然施展并挥舞着他们如此鄙视的神所青睐的魔法和武器。

一群亵渎了同一个神祇的叛教尸有时会联合起来组成一个以嘲弄为目的圣会，以近乎狂喜的方式进行亵渎仪式。这些圣会通常是由一个亵渎神明的邪教（中的成员们）组成，他们生前一起践行他们的异端邪说，并一同赴死。但也有一些是由先前的信仰相同的落单叛教尸聚集到了一起所组成。

Final Blasphemy.description:
当叛教尸被摧毁时，它爆裂成一股虚能，效果等同于3动作版的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]）。

因叛教尸已被摧毁，所以它不会从这个伤害术的效果中获得任何生命值，也不需要保有任何可用的伤害术来发动该技能。
Final Blasphemy.name: 最后的亵渎 Final Blasphemy

Heretic's Smite.description: 当它携带着生前信奉神祇的偏好武器时（对于前法莱斯玛叛教尸来说，是匕首），叛教尸的打击会对具有圣洁（Holy）特征的生物造成额外1d6精魂伤害。
Heretic's Smite.name: 异端斩 Heretic's Smite

Poltergeist.name: Poltergeist
Poltergeist.publicNotes: When a creature dies, and for whatever reason its spirit is unable or unwilling to leave the site of its death, that spirit may manifest as a poltergeist: a restless, invisible spirit that is still able to manipulate physical objects. Many poltergeists perished in a way that resulted from or led to extreme emotional trauma.

Site Bound.name: Site Bound
Site Bound.description: A poltergeist is tied to a location and can't travel more than 120 feet from the place where it was created or formed. Some poltergeists are instead bound to a specific room, building, or similar area

Natural Invisibility.name: Natural Invisibility
Natural Invisibility.description: A poltergeist is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. It becomes visible only when it uses Frighten.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a poltergeist is destroyed, it reforms, fully healed, where it was destroyed after [[/br 2d4 #Rejuvenation]]{2d4 days}. A poltergeist can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

Telekinetic Defense.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of the poltergeist

Effect The poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the triggering creature.
Telekinetic Defense.name: Telekinetic Defense

Frighten.name: Frighten
Frighten.description:
Requirements The poltergeist must be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}

Effect The poltergeist becomes visible, appearing as a skeletal, ghostlike humanoid. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a failure. On a critical failure, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as it's frightened. On a success, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

At the start of its next turn, the poltergeist becomes invisible again.

Telekinetic Storm.name: Telekinetic Storm
Telekinetic Storm.description:
The poltergeist telekinetically throws numerous small objects, such as dozens of pieces of silverware or books, either spreading them out among multiple foes or directing them at one target.

  • When this effect is spread out among multiple foes, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike at a -2 penalty against each creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet}. These count as one attack for the poltergeist's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.
  • When this effect has only one target, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the target, and the damage increases to 3d12. It deals @Damage[1d12[untyped]] damage on a failure, and no damage on a critical failure.

Deadly Mantis.name: 夺命螳螂 Deadly Mantis
Deadly Mantis.publicNotes:
这些巨大的螳螂在丛林深处或和史前森林里筑巢，在那里它们捕食和自己同样巨大的猎物。

这些体型巨大的可怕昆虫是寂静无声的掠食者，前肢如闪电般敏捷，一咬就能把骨头啃断。

Fling.name: 抛掷 Fling
Fling.description: 夺命螳螂将被它@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]的生物抛向空中，抛到距螳螂最多30尺高30尺远的地方（该生物正常遭受坠落伤害）。如果被抛掷的生物落在另一个生物身上，被砸中的生物将受到等量的钝击伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:31|basic:true]豁免）。

Leaping Grab.description: 夺命螳螂能跳跃（Leaps）最多40尺高、20尺远的距离。在跳跃过程中任意时刻，它可以进行一次镰腿打击。如果命中，则自动@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]目标，并且带着目标洛到跳跃的最终落点。
Leaping Grab.name: 跳跃擒获 Leaping Grab

Rending Mandibles.name: 裂甲之颚 Rending Mandibles
Rending Mandibles.description: 夺命螳螂对被它@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]的生物进行一次虫颚打击，如果打击命中，并且目标生物所穿的护甲硬度为12或更低，此护甲破损。此打击不会对已经破损的护甲造成更多伤害。

Sudden Strike.description: 在战斗第一轮，尚未行动的敌人对夺命螳螂@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。
Sudden Strike.name: 突袭 Sudden Strike

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description:
A sweet hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.JyxTmqjYYn63V5LY]{Honeyed Words}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse} to their coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Betraying Touch.name: Betraying Touch
Betraying Touch.description: The sweet hag touches a creature that doesn't realize the hag is an enemy. The betrayed creature is affected by soporific strike with a –4 circumstance penalty to their saving throw.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The sweet hag can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Poisoned Candy.name: Poisoned Candy
Poisoned Candy.description: The sweet hag casts an innate spell that can normally target 1 creature on a piece of food, typically a sweet treat. The spell is stored in the food. The first creature that eats any of the food is affected by the spell and takes a –4 circumstance penalty to their saving throw against that effect.

Soporific Touch.name: Soporific Touch
Soporific Touch.description:
A creature damaged by a sweet hag's claw must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 day.

If the creature critically fails or fails this save while already enfeebled by soporific strike, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and dreams of eating delicious sweets; this is a mental sleep effect. If not woken up before 1 minute passes, the creature wakes up automatically.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Sweet Hag.name: Sweet Hag
Sweet Hag.publicNotes:
Sweet hags use bright colors, pleasant visages, and sugary treats to draw in children and the young at heart. Their favorite prey is impoverished youngsters who are unlikely to be missed—sweet hags offer them food and a veneer of kindness before devouring the hapless child. Sweet hags also enchant their food to magically charm others, often using these bespelled servitors to handle all of their busywork. Though they present a lovely and generous face to the world, they turn vicious when insulted or defied. A sweet hag's true form is a dribbling mass of flesh with gumdrop eyes, often resembling melting taffy.

Hags are malevolent predators who use magic and manipulation to lure children and young adults into their clutches. Though their true forms are eldritch and horrifying, hags spend much of their lives disguised as ordinary women. They seek out targets who are unhappy, innocent, or otherwise vulnerable, preying on their weaknesses before snatching them up. The typical hag is abusive, controlling, and narcissistic. Though less malicious hags possibly exist, they rarely reveal their true forms, making them nearly impossible to find.

Stone Giant.name: Stone Giant
Stone Giant.publicNotes:
Stone giants are stoic, reclusive herders and artists with a rich history and collection of traditions. They dwell in caves in tall mountains and craggy ranges, where their grayish skin allows them to blend in with their surroundings and go unnoticed, despite being around 12 feet tall. Benign travelers who come across a clan of stone giants need not worry, however, for stone giants do not actively invite confrontation or strife. They are, by and large, peaceful people who seek wisdom through exploration of nature and long meditations on the elements of the natural world. Their elders are among the wisest of giants, using their charisma and druidic magic to lead their clans to prosperity and harmony with nature.

A stone giant clan will usually raise a number of animals as pets, favoring cave bears, elephants, or dinosaurs depending on the environment. Many clans also accept allies, considering arboreals, elementals, and even gargoyles as kin through their shared connection with the earth.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

Big Swing.description:
The stone giant makes a greatclub Strike. The target is Pushed up to 10 feet on a hit or up to 20 feet on a critical hit.

If the target collides with a solid object, it takes bludgeoning damage as though it had fallen the distance it moved.
Big Swing.name: Big Swing

Create Boulder.name: Create Boulder
Create Boulder.description: The stone giant molds a boulder from primal earth and throws it as a rock Strike. A creature hit by the Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Swat Projectile.name: Swat Projectile
Swat Projectile.description:
Requirements The stone giant must have a free hand but can Release anything as part of this reaction

Trigger The giant is targeted by a physical ranged attack

Effect The stone giant gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses and the projectile was made of stone, the giant can throw it back at the attacker as a rock ranged Strike.

Velociraptor.name: 伶盗龙 Velociraptor
Velociraptor.publicNotes:
伶盗龙是恐爪龙的近亲，是一种敏捷而狡猾的群体猎手。它不畏惧体型更大的生物，一群恐龙会毫不犹豫地攻击马匹大小的生物。伶盗龙是一种群居动物，通常以十多只为一群生活。它们身上复有羽毛，从背上延伸到胳膊、腿和尾巴的两侧，而它们的腹部和侧翼则是有鳞的。这些羽毛让它们能够轻松地融入自然地形，但当它们兴奋、试图恐吓或寻求配偶时，伶盗龙可以将羽毛蓬松起来，露出通常位于较长羽毛复盖之下的更鲜艳的颜色。普通的伶盗龙有1-1.5英尺高，7英尺长，35磅重。

这些巨大的爬行动物是世界原始时代的遗留物，现在仍然大量存在于偏僻的荒野中，或者在幽暗地域的地下魔法洞穴中。蜥蜴人、半兽人、巨人和其他人形生物有时会把恐龙当作坐骑、守卫或猎兽。众所周知，人类和其他族裔也收集恐龙，把它们放在动物园里展出，或把它们当作异域宠物或守卫。这通常是富人或怪咖喜欢干的事情，但确实也有一些德鲁伊和其他自然的守护者能与恐龙亲密相处，甚至把它们作为动物伙伴。当恐龙在它们正常栖息地以外的地区安家时，通常可能是因为被圈养的恐龙逃进荒野造成的。

Leaping Charge.name: 跳跃冲锋 Leaping Charge
Leaping Charge.description: 伶盗龙行走至多10尺，跃过障碍物，无视困难地形，然后发起一次利爪打击，此打击攻击检定有+1环境加值。

Pack Attack.name: 群起攻之 Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: 如果生物处于伶盗龙另外两个盟友的触及范围内，则伶盗龙对目标造成1d4额外伤害。

Azarketi Crab Catcher.name: Azarketi Crab Catcher
Azarketi Crab Catcher.publicNotes:
The average azarketi citizen in Absalom makes a living fishing or catching crabs.

Azarketis, also known as gillmen, can be found all over Golarion, with a particularly high concentration around Absalom and the Inner Sea. Descendants of the ancient Azlanti, the azarketis survived the cataclysm of Earthfall by fleeing into the ocean, where they were warped into amphibious forms by the alghollthu.

Hydration.name: Hydration
Hydration.description: Azarketi must regularly submerge themselves in water to rehydrate their water-acclimated skin. After the first 24 hours outside of water, they gain a –1 status penalty to Fortitude saves as their skin cracks and their gills become painful. After 48 hours, they begin to suffocate until returned to water.

Swim Away.name: Swim Away
Swim Away.description:
Requirements The azarketi crab catcher is swimming

Trigger The azarketi crab catcher is targeted with an attack and can see the attacker

Effect The azarketi crab catcher gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack, they Swim 5 feet.

Wyvern.name: Wyvern
Wyvern.publicNotes:
A wyvern is a venomous drake with a well-earned reputation for impatience and aggression. As much as 15 feet long and weighing up to 1,000 pounds, a wyvern's resilient body allows them to crash talons-first into large prey without serious risk to themself. A wyvern uses their momentum to stun their target before injecting it with searing venom or carrying it over the side of a nearby cliff. Because a wyvern lacks the strength to haul their prey all the way to their nest intact, they're far more likely to lift and drop their victim over a gully or canyon and let gravity do its work before they descend to pick apart the carcass.

Conversation is of little interest to a wyvern, as the creature typically speaks only to taunt their prey, issue territorial claims, or demand tribute. Even so, many wyverns enjoy grim humor and tales of violent acts, particularly if those acts were committed by the storyteller. A wyvern properly appeased with meat, entertainment, and treasure sometimes agrees to provide assistance ranging from giving directions to serving as a mount for a powerful humanoid. However, these arrangements rarely last more than a few weeks before the wyvern's pride, malice, or insolence inspires them to flee or even betray their allies. Only the truly cruel can cow a wyvern into servitude for an extended period, as most wyverns are so self-interested that they go out of their way to avoid helping others.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct, drakes are draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of the primal dragons they share evolutionary roots with. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties—small social groups fittingly called "rampages"—makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them with their formidable jaws and thickscaled tails to use in close combat. Most drakes would rather avoid this, however, preferring to use their magical breath to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

Different species of drakes rarely come into conflict. Part of this is their distinct habitats, but drakes are open to negotiating simple agreements between rampages. This courtesy does not extend to dragonets, which drakes happily take as prey. Solitary tamed drakes are also excluded from such agreements and considered free game if their tamer isn't strong enough to protect them.

Drake Eggs

While drake hides aren't any more valuable than those of similarly sized creatures, drake eggs are prized commodities. They are used as components in powerful spells as well as eaten by various cultures, but the most common use for drake eggs is hatching and rearing drakes to serve as mounts and guardians.

A typical drake lays a clutch of 2d4 eggs every 5 years. Eggs hatch within 3 to 6 weeks, during which time they must be kept in conditions appropriate to their natural environment, perhaps the most difficult aspect of drake husbandry. While it is generally easy for breeders to incubate the eggs of desert or jungle drakes (which require mildly warm temperatures to hatch) or river drakes (which must be submerged in running water), the eggs of flame and frost drakes require extreme temperatures in order to hatch, which can be difficult to replicate safely.

A drake egg is an object with Hardness 3, 5 HP, and no Broken Threshold. The coloration of drake eggs varies only slightly from one species to the next. A creature must succeed at a @Check[type:nature|dc:20] check, or a relevant DC 20 Lore check, to identify the drake species of a specific egg.

Once a drake hatches, they imprint on the first creature that they see. A creature imprinted on in this way can use Nature to Train and Command that drake. The market price of a drake egg varies depending on the type of drake and the exact legal situation. Because drakes are dangerous and intelligent creatures, many societies do not condone the trade of drake eggs and criminalize those who engage in it.

It takes 2 years for a drake hatchling to grow to full size. A well-trained drake can make a fearsome mount or guardian, but many careless would-be drake trainers are devoured by their charges.

Savage.name: Savage
Savage.description:
Trigger A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the wyvern critically fails a skill check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}

Effect The wyvern makes a stinger Strike against the triggering creature.

Powerful Dive.name: Powerful Dive
Powerful Dive.description: The wyvern Flies up to their fly Speed and must both move forward at least 20 feet and descend at least 10 feet. If they end the movement within melee reach of at least one enemy their size or smaller, they can make a claw Strike against that enemy. If the claw hits, as a free action, the wyvern can either automatically Grab the target or knock it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Wyvern Venom.name: Wyvern Venom
Wyvern Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Punishing Momentum.name: Punishing Momentum
Punishing Momentum.description:
